reviews.review: One of the "Must See" museums of Paris. The museum is well laid out and it is possible to see Rodin's work close up. There is no body rushing one through, unlike so many museums, which makes the experience so much more enjoyable
beautifully conceived museum. Great mix of outdoor garden and indoor museum. Even the cafe offers above-average food and drink. Quite heavy on the bourgeois statues.

Great place to visit!. Especially on a sunny day, a nice place to visit inside the museum and the gardens. So much history and always impressed by Rodin's work. It is not the first time I visit but love to come back with friends or family

Gardens are lovely, skip the indoor museum. The gardens are great to stroll through with several of the sculptures on display. The indoor museum is not very well curated. There does not appear to be any organization such as chronology and several of the pieces appear to be models for future sculptures or original casts for bronzes that were not at the museum. It would have been...


More

Relaxing afternoon. Go inside his magnificent mansion and view many of his works. Take a leisurely stroll through the beautiful gardens and admire many of Rodin's life size sculptures. Go to the snack bar and get a bite to eat under the expansive trees. Go in the back and lay on the lounge chairs and talk or take a nap. What a...


More

wonderful museum. Musee Rodin is a wonderful small museum to spend some time in. When we visited it was uncrowded and the ability to get close to the works and really admire the craftsmanship was wonderful. The surrounding gardens are a pleasant place to spend some time as well and with a small cafe on site I would highly recommend a visit.

So educational!. First time here but was so amazed to see everything outside instead of in a building. Of course, some were inside but the Thinker is in the garden as well as the Gates of Hell. So interesting to understand the entire piece and exactly what he is thinking of...

What an artist!. Enjoy Rodin's sculptures outside and inside the mansion. It is a lovely thing to do. There are more tha lifesize sculptures of Balzac, French philosophers and politicians, and, of course, the Thinker. I wish I lived nearby so I could spend hours in the garden admiring these masterpieces.

Great mansion, great garden. Lovers of the work of Rodin need no encouragement to visit this museum, but others should also visit it. Not only does it give an excellent view of the work of one of the greatest of nineteenth-century sculptors, but it offers as a bonus several fine paintings by Van Gogh, Renoir and Monet. Highly recommended

Fabulous Gardens. This museum is wonderful. Not only is the inside of the museum quite good, but the outside gardens are beyond belief soothing and quiet and lovely. Again, This is a must in enjoying time in Paris.

One of our favorites. If you like Rodin, you must see this museum, especially the gardens. In early October, though, much of the garden space was covered by tents, with workmen coming and going. We couldn't tell if it was all renovation or if some event was soon to take place. You can still see most of the outdoor sculptures and all of the museum, so it's worth going.

Disappointed this time. This is one of my favorite museums to visit in Paris. I was disappointed recently, as I brought some first time visitors, to find a large part of the grounds closed for construction. It still is a pleasant place to spend some time and see some fabulous works of art in an unusual setting. We will return again, hoping to see the improvements.

Fantastique!. I have been to Paris many times, but never knew about this wonderful museum and garden created almost 100 years ago in the house where Rodin lived. No need to understand art history to appreciate Rodin's works and collection (incl. his contemporaries Renoir and Van Gogh). The cafe offers an exellent lunch in the gardens. If you want to save money, for 4 Euros, you can already see famous statues in the gardens.
Interesting as an art museum can be. Neat to see the thinker and walk the gardens. Sculptures were all amazing and well placed. Don't plan to eat at the cafe.

Beautiful sculptures and gardens.. This is well worth a visit, beautiful gardens and amazing house to see all the sculptures and the famous kiss. Very relaxing and beautiful gardens to wonder around and see the amazing pieces. The highlight was the gates of hell in the garden. Nice onsite cafe for lunch with lovely salads and quiches.

Stunning sculptures!. Very intrigued by Rodin and his works. The works of art in the garden are profound! What a story they tell. The Gates of Hades is a must see. Be sure to get an audio guide or research in advance. Fascinating history.

Powerfull and furious. This Rodin Museum is very special with all the sculptures and pictures, extremely intense and pretentious for each visitor. The most we love is "THE KISS" - what an impression! Rodin was a workaholic. His life work is immense. And it needed physical power with the hammer, chisel and spatulas. The house itself and the garden are beautiful. After three hours we were so imposed about the diversity of Rodin's work that we had to stop and we decided to visit the museum again at another time.

Beautiful gardens, architecture and sculptures. A lot of friends had recommended the Rodin Musee to me, and i was not let down. The house in itself is amazing if you are interested in architecture or interiors! The grades are really lovely with a cafe under the trees where you can by something to eat or drink.Really nice to do on a sunny day, and it doesn't have to take that long. Afterwards its great to walk around in St. Germain de Pres which is just a few minutes away.

Peaceful! Beautiful fall garden. Second visit. The museum itself is quite overwhelming with many many sculptures and paintings by Rodin and others exhibited consecutively in adjoining rooms. However, outside in the wonderful gardens you can better enjoy some of his masterpieces. You can actually study them from all angles and in many cases sit among the greenery and actually think about what you are viewing. Everyone who visits Paris should experience this .
Great museum and garden. This small museum is worth a visit. Easy to get around.The gardens are lovely. If you love sculpture and like Rodindon't miss this one.
Great garden that showcases Rodin's work. We just toured the garden and saw enough of Rodin's amazing work outside to satisfy us. The Thinker and the Gates of Hell were the highlights.

The most beautiful rose gardens. Along with the sculptures and the famous Thinker. It is close to the Eiffel Tower and Invalides and in September there were no lines at all. Highly recommend a museum pass while in Paris to cut any lines that may exist in all the participating museums.

Check the hours and special events before going!. We recently tired to visit just the gardens. I had checked the hours before we left and it stated that the gardens would be open, however when we arrived we were told they were closed for a special event. Very disappointing!

Peaceful relaxing way to enjoy Paris. The Rodin museum is housed in the original mansion that Rodin occupied. He would invite his guests and models to visit, where he created a lot of his bronze and marble statues. Some rooms have the items displayed where he left them on top of crates. The gardens are very peaceful and beautiful with his statues. A great to spend a couple of hours away from the hustle and bustle of Paris.

Loved It!. It was great to see the studies of the famous statues! Just amazingly powerful and moving. The building and the grounds are the perfect setting. Lunch in the garden makes for a perfect afternoon!
a musee not to be missed. Seeing Rodin's work in one place is a reward, with many pieces to be enjoyed. The Setting is perfect and best enjoyed early in the day before crowds develop.

World Treasure. One runs out of superlatives. Astonishing. Awesome. Overwhelming. Mind blowing. An unequaled repository of works of genius. A testament to the genius of arguably the best sculptor of the modern age. The gardens and buildings alone are worth the visit.

One of the Best Museums I have Viewed. A must to See while in Paris. "The Thinker.". WOW. Buy the headset for the tour - it is worth the fare. I suggest starting outside first, and then go into the Villa. The auditor tour takes 2 hours+. I didn't know a whole lot about Rodin before the visit, but was so impressed about his life and sculptures after the visit.

Just right for a short visit.. This is a great museum if you just want to spend 1 1/2 to 2 hours in a museum.Great collection of Rodin's work, not to big , not to small in a house he lived in and worked from.With all his famous works on display and you can take a nice stroll through the gardens as well.

Merci and thank you, Monsier Rodin!. We just left an exceptional experience in the garden and museum of the Musee Rodin! Our thanks to Mr. Rodin for giving his work to the country for all to share! Best arrive early, especially on the free first Sunday of the month from October thru March. Peaceful garden. Beautiful setting inside to walk thru his life and where he worked in the latter stages.
A great body of work. This has a great collection, displayed both inside and in a beautiful garden. It will only take a bit more than a \n hour but it ts time very well spent.
Great. An under rated attraction. One of the "must see" highlights of Paris. The sculptures are stunning and many are located in a wonderful garden setting.

Rodin artcollection. Beautiful large park with the most famous Rodin sculptures.
Big exhibit inside the 2atory main building with more of the artists works

Love Rodin's Museum!. If the Louvre is too daunting a task for you on your trip to Paris I highly recommend Rodin's museum. It houses a wonderful collection of his and his students' works and is home to a wonderful garden with many sculptures (the Thiinker, the Bergers of Calais and the Gates of Hell can all be found here).

Disappointed But Only because. The gardens are undergoing some kind of reconstruction and I had told my friend they were the most beautiful in Paris. So disappointment here. Lots of reconstruction going on around Paris while we were there the week of Sept 20 thru 28th. If you are interested in the work, It is superior as always. Rodin is the best! So were his assistants.
Relax in the gardens on a spring day. Although the sculptures in the museum are great to see, the larger statues in the garden area are not to be missed.

Pleasantly surprised. This was really interesting not only in the sculpture but also in the museum itself. It is a beautiful old mansion with wonderful grounds to walk through and look at sculpture. I would include this on my must see to experience the culture of the area as well as the art of Rodin
Just go, you won't regret it.. Rodin was a master. All his stuff is here in the house where he lived and worked. Nothing else to say.

If you like sculpture . . . .. . . . . then visit the Rodin Museum. The Thinker and other of his sculptures are in the outside gardens. The mansion houses many more of Rodin's works. Plan on a couple of hours.
SERENE. The Rodin sculpture is a "don't miss" when visiting Paris. Walking thru the sculpture the feeling of pure serenity while marveling at the artistry of Rodin.

Extensive collection of Rodin works. This is an amazing museum located in the mansion where Rodin eventually lived & worked. It is arranged chronologically byRodin's various art periods, paintings & sculptures . Of course the gardens are beautiful and pleasant to stroll in and there's a nice cafe outside too to enjoylunch. Extensive remodeling of the gardens is nearing completion but still what is open to foot traffic is marvelous with his most well known pieces placed along the walks.Very enjoyable day !

Rodin museum. This is a great museum, especially if you love sculpture. Rodin's work as well as some of his assistant's work, is displayed throughout the grounds and inside the museum. An audio guided tour is available but not absolutely necessary. The inside of the museum has been restored to the time of Rodin and the views and light through the windows is terrific, while strolling through the garden you can stop for a bite to eat in the small cafe. Very nice. We had to eat inside because of the bees but still had an enjoyable meal.

The best 10 euros you can spend in Paris.. The newly refurbished Musee Rodin near Les Invalides is a peaceful and stimulating treat for those interested in sculptor Rodin. Famous for The Kiss , the Thinker etc but set in the gardens of his later home these works of art deserve some time. We went early and had the place without too many crowds.

My Favorite Musee. Rodin was a genius. It was really something to see the same sculpture using different mediums to understand more about the art form. Although this is a smaller museum, I would put this as a must see on your itinerary.
good. Interesting museum which doea not have the usual long queues! Building and garden of interest as well as the sculptures. Also interesting work by Camille as well as Rodin.
Garden is especially lovely. Love this little museum, the garden is wonderful so try for a sunny day. Free with Museum Pass.The details on the Gates of Hell will keep you busy for hours!
Museum. You might need to know Rodin to visit this museum, the Thinker sculture is the masterpiece of the outdoor museum.

Wonderful restoration of museum.. I spent so much time just looking at the beautifully restored ceilings, walls, floors. Of course the collection of Rodin's works is supurb, and now shown to best advantage in the newly restored Museum. The grounds are lovely and one can easily spend a few hours here, although if you only have an hour, you can still see just about everything. The coach house has special exhibits.
Fantastic museum in the heart of Parie. The statues are fantastic. Be sure to take time to walk thru the entire garden. That's where most of the well known statues are. It is a photographers dream.

An exciting place to visit. Well worth the visit if you are in Paris. I t was great to see "The Thinker" and "The Kiss" , two of many sculptures by Rodin. The gardens are lovely with a very nice café. The actual Museum was originally a private mansion and the rooms are just beautiful. There have been many residents throughout the years. Rodin moved in in 1908, renting four rooms on the ground floor but by 1911 was the sole resident. If only the walls could talk!

excellent Museum. We had previously visited this Museum in 2012. Since then the Museum has had work done, and it really has improved the whole experience. The exhibition of Rodin's works was really well displayed and very interesting. The gardens are also beautiful to wander and relax in. We had a very nice light lunch at the Cafe also, which offers a full meals to Baguettes.

Well worth a visit. This place is worth a visit if you are in Paris, it isn't up there on the list of must dos but I am so glad we made time to visit. The house itself is beautiful and you can imagine creativeness being in abundance here as the Parisian sunlight streams into the shuttered windows. It is a really inspiring place, add it to your list of things to do in Paris!!

Masterpieces. It was so fabulous to see "The Thinker" and "The Kiss" in person! I was amazed that you could get so close! The temptation to touch the statues is almost overwhelming! Fortunately, "The Thinker" is raised so everyone can look at it for as long as they like without blocking everyone else's view.It was only €4 to get in, but be aware the museum is closed on Mondays. The grounds look lovely in the promotions but when we were there, they were installing a large marque and most of the back section was closed off. This did not detract from the excitement of seeing these famous statues. There is a cafe on site though we didn't visit it.
A must see. If in Paris this is one attraction that must not be missed. Plan for 2 hours , you will not regret this tour. Take the audio plan.

Exceptional Rodin Museum and Gardens. The Rodin Museum and Gardens are exceptional and showcase many of Rodin's most impressive sculptures. Rodin had saved the mansion home, that houses the museum, from demolition in the early 1900's. Later when the French government acquired the property, Rodin agreed to donate his own sculptures, photographs and drawings, as well has his extensive art collection, so that the mansion home could be turned into an art museum.The grounds of the Rodin Museum are beautiful and serene. Many of Rodin's sculptures are displayed on the extensive grounds. Most noteworthy is 'The Thinker' which has its own special alcove within the garden. The artwork and sculptures showcased within the museum are also impressive, including Monet, Renoir and Van Gogh! The Rodin Museum is also centrally located within Paris. The Varenne Metro stop is close by, and it features some of Rodin's sculptures on the platform. We definitely highly recommend the Musee Rodin when visiting Paris!

As much rodin as you can handle. First for tickets: you can combine with d'Orsay and save €4. Also queues are often shorter on Rodin so go there first and get your ticket and walk straight into d'orsay.You can also get a combined ticket to muses Rodin meudon for a little extra.The sculpture gardens are a delight to ramble around. For me the highlight was the gates of hell. Unfortunately never installed as the project never got built.Then inside the house is a selection of Rodin's carvings, castings and painting.It is well laid out and easy to view.

Me gustó mucho!. Great to see! I liked very much the sculptures outside.Inside the museum was also great but it was to hot and they didn't have air conditioning, to many people and was not a nice combination. Me gustaron mucho las esculturas de afuera en el jardín. Adentro hacia demasiado calor y no habia aire acondicionado. Tiene un poco de todo de Rodin, el edificio super frances!

Nice but Hot. Nice garden with Rodin's and inside. Only issue inside was it was so hot in the upstairs. No windows open or even though fans were in many rooms were not turned on. It wasn't even a hot day outside. Great collection and on the paris museum pass.

Beautiful setting for Rodin's sculptures. We visited the Musee Rodin on a Thursday at 3pm. A very short wait to buy tickets for the garden & museum at 10 euro each. A lesser fee just for the gardens. The grounds have a beautiful sculpture garden showcasing several of Rodin's famous pieces that wrap around the gorgeous 17th century Hotel Biron. The mansion is stunning & holds 300 of his works & paintings he aquired for his own personal collection. We really enjoyed the peace & tranquility of the gardens as they wrap all the way around the building, We noticed the Invalides Gold Dome was visible from the gardens. We relaxed in the outdoor seating outside the cafe with a nice glass of wine. Food is available as well. Many of Rodin's more famous sculptures we have seen in Philadelphia but this museum showcases so much more. The museum opens at 10am daily with a late closing on Wednesdays.
Wonderful museum. I highly recommend going to the Rodin Museum. The gardens are beautiful. Seeing Rodin's work is really spectacular.

Love visiting the gardens. I've been here a few times - into the museum - but with our children we decided to only visit the gardens. What a wonderful time they had - especially examining The Thinker, and the many other sculptures. They also loved hiding in the bushes and playing in the gardens.

Small but good musem (the garden area). We only visited the garden but the most famous statues were also in this area. The museum is additionally the only museum in paris which is completely privately financed .

A quiet escape!. This is one of the best museums in Paris. The court yard and gardens are beautiful and the collection is so well displayed. It's off the main path so overlooked by many which makes it a wonderful retreat from the tourist overrun places.

Away from the madding crowd. Having experienced several days of Paris @ 30degrees we needed somewhere cool and green and shady.I had been into the museum several years ago so sent husband on a quick tour while I pottered round the garden. He soon caught up .... the inside was hotter than the shade in which I was enjoying the sculptures outside.While Rodin isn't a favourite one has to admire the life and movement he achieves in these beautifully presented outdoor exhibitsMost of all though was the cool elegant sophisticated garden layout. A little traffic noise was no problem at the average priced little cafe with cold beer or wine available and an ice cream kiosk too. No fumes !I just upped this review to 5 stars remembering how very restorative this experience was. There were chaise longues at the far end past the pond !

A Moving Experience. I admit I didn't know much about Rodin before visiting Paris, but like sculpture so decided to see the museum. The museum has sculptures both outside in the beautifully structured gardens as well as inside so it's best to go when the weather is nice. I was surprised by how much Rodin's work moved me. He was incredibly talented at capturing emotion in his work. This museum doesn't seem to be as popular as the Louvre or Orsay but I recommend adding it to your itinerary.
Beautiful location. The museum is in a beautiful location by the lake with a large garden. The collection is very interesting and the gift store has a number of art books about Rodin.

Peaceful & beautiful. The beauty of this took us by surprise. The grounds and display of Rodins sculptures defies words if you like his work. The Thinker isimposing and one of the first of his works to be seen. The grounds are lush and full of flowers and as you wander the grounds you see his works placed throughout. You never feel crowded or unable to get up close to his work. Nice outdoor cafe to rest and have something to eat or drink. Glad we didn't miss this treasure.

Very intresting to learn about sculpting. Very nice museum. There is an indoor and outdoor section. So its nice to visit. Obviously some of Rodin's best known sculptures are located here which are cool to see. But he has such an immense amount of work I was surprised. Definitely visit here. It was a little confusing getting in if you have the Paris museum pass since there is not a separate line that directs you. If you have the museum pass just skip the long line and walk straight up to the security tent.

See The Gates of Hell. "You are now in front of the gates of hell," says the soothing, English female voice after I pushed #211 on the audio tour. Interesting thought! Across from the Gates of Hell, which by the way succinctly describes arriving at Charles de Gaulle airport, you can see Rodin's best known work The Thinker in a beautifully landscaped garden with the The Eiffel Tower in the distant background. Does it get any better? The museum and gardens are wonderful and I do recommend the audio tour. This is a "must see" on your Paris visit.

The Thinker. . We are not normally ones to spend much time at Museums but this one was much better than anticipated. We took only the 'Garden Tour' which allowed us to wander the various gardens and see all the statues including the 'Thinker'... There's also an audio version available for the more serious art crowd.
Amazing collection. We enjoyed the tour of the gardens and the house. Diverse collection of sculpture and paintings. Lovely escape in a central location
Garden!. The statues in the garden were the highlight for me. Go on a nice day, take your time, have a snack, relax and enjoy. If your a real Rodin fan, the inside is full of interesting stuff too.

If you love Rodin go here!. This museum has an amazing collection of Rodin's sculpture work, even some pieces I had never even seen before. There was a lovely garden area here too where I just laid down on one of the benches while my friend sketched some of the sculptures. When we went it was a pretty hot day and this museum does not have ac, so just keep that in mind when going.It is not a super big museum but expect to spend a good 2-3 hours here.
Kind of a hidden gem!. For those who love sculpture this is the place to go! A beautiful museum in a beautiful location on the rive gauche.The garden is amazing as well

Beautiful grounds. Maybe I was lucky to be there on a sunny day yesterday, but I thoroughly enjoyed the gardens and outdoor exhibits. It was very warm inside the museum because there was no air conditioning. It's worthwhile getting the audio guide which has clear, detailed explanations of the life of Rodin and his works. Definitely worth a visit, especially for those who are close to Les Invalides and the Eiffel Tower.

Rodin. Wonderful museum. The sculptures and the way they organized just great. Start with the museum and have a Rodin journey chronologically. After getting the context walk the garden.It is impressive to see how much work and effort Rodin spent for each his sculptures. Considering wast number of them he made one can image how a life is devotedto art.Definitely a must see at Paris. Go to the museum early before the line gets increase. And do not forget to buy the audio guide. Compliments to the curator.

A must see in Paris. Very impressive sculptures and work by Rodin. Museum exhibitions are not so many, but nice and charming. Garden is fantastic with beautiful flowers, tress and sculptures around. Very convenient by public transport, just 3-4 minutes walk from metro station Varenne, or 10 minutes from Metro/RAR station Invalides. Not very crowded, really lovely place to visit for 2-3 hours. You can combine several tours together: Invalides, Musee d'histoire, Musee de l'Armee and Rodin Museum. 1 day all together.

One of my favorite museum visits in Paris, picnic in the parc with Rodin's works of art!. Absolutely love this museum. Gorgeous sculptures throughout the beautiful garden grounds, and the hotel is filled with Rodin's works as well as some fine pieces of his apprenticed students. This is where Rodin worked and taught and collected his works for many years and he donated his art on the premise that they continue to house them provide such a tasteful display for the public. I visited with my wife and 9 year old daughter and we spent the entire afternoon there. They have a very nice cafeteria in the garden that made for a lovely picnic before our stroll around the fountain and wooded area where you will discover many fine Rodin sculptures outdoor year round.
Shockingly good. Great for art history and sculpture buffs, you get to see some of Rodin's most famous sculptures, including the thinker.

A Unique View of Rodin's Work. First, the museum is filled with impressive works by Rodin, which you will enjoy whether you are a fan of Rodin or not. His famous Gates of Hell is impressive in its own right, but the many full size versions of parts of the Gates of Hell are spread throughout the garden, including The Thinker, The Three Shades, and Ugolino and His Children. What I love most about Rodin, that you can see in many of his works in this museum is his ability to make his figures "come out" of the marble, by leaving parts of the marble rough hewn and still connected to the figures. Examples of this include "The Kiss" which exists in several materials in this museum, or "Fall of Illusion: Sister of Icarus" where the figure is carved partly into the underside of part of the marble with incredible detail.But, beyond that there is something unique that I appreciate most about this museum. For the most part, Rodin's work displayed elsewhere is mostly finished pieces. I've seen great works of his from the Hermitage in St. Petersburg to the Met in New York - finished pieces. What is especially compelling about this museum is the number of partially finished, unfinished or "rough draft" pieces. In the garden, there is a marvellous pair of bronze castings that were used in the build up to the famous "Burghers of Calais." One is of a figure in the nude, where Rodin figured out the muscle, sinew and posture. Then the same figure was cast with clothing on. The final figure can be found in the full casting of all the Burghers. You will find similar progressions of busts or early versions of some of his best work (watch for Victor Hugo versions in particular). This gives a unique insight into the process of Rodin's art and is particularly compelling.

Beautiful location. The Musee Rodin is incredibly charming. Slightly less crowded than some of the other museums, it is a lovely place to visit. Explore the gardens where you will see Rodin's famous "Le Penseur," The Thinker. Inside the grand house you will see other sculptures, drawings and painting. The thing I really wanted to see here was The Kiss and it didn't disappoint! A very enjoyable visit.

Wonderful gardens - Book ahead if coming on a weekend. First and foremost, buy a ticket online before coming to the Rodin museum on a weekend day. We waited about 1/2 an hour in line to buy a ticket. If you had one already, you could walk right in.It was hot the Sunday afternoon we went to the Rodin. We only saw the gardens. You can buy tickets for just the gardens. It is a lovely stroll, obviously amazing sculpture, but also wonderful trees and fountains. We bought the audioguide but found the commentary disappointing. I suggest a drink at the cafe in the garden. There were pastries and other things, we had coffee and a coke. The gardens were not crowded and it was easy to all the statues, walk around them and spend some time with each. The Thinker was the only one with a large group around it. As in most French museums, we were unimpressed by the museum shop. Restrooms were clean and large. We had a lovely visit and enjoyed the museum immensely

They're Working On It. This was at least our third visit. Normally we enjoy the gardens and Rodin statues but things were pretty torn up. The Main entrance was closed for some reason so we passed thru a makeshift tent with a friendly but somewhat worthless security guard trying wave a wand to detect something unknown and looking into ladies bags for something. The grounds were fenced off and cordoned off. What gives?

One of Paris' finest. This museum is one of my favorite ones in Paris. Rodin's work is beautifully displayed and very interesting. The garden is of course a must, while visiting. You can take a walk while admiring different works of art and enjoy a little bit of "campagne flair" right inside a buzzing city.

Better than expected . I knew Rodin from his sculpture of the Thinker and we wondered what else had he done. Trust me he has done a lot of beautiful sculptures you would know. The museum is more like a lovely country estate in the heart of Paris. The grounds are beautiful, large, well looked after and in my opinion a bit of an oasis from the city. It's very relaxing to wander about the grounds where you'll find many of his sculptures and a history about them. When you enter the museum it's well laid out as you'll learn more about the man, his life, the friends and contemporaries that inspired him and who he inspired. You'll find many of their beautiful and well known works of art inside as well.We used the Paris museum pass, it was worth it as it's also good for free entrance to many other well known museums in Paris. If you are looking for an easygoing relaxing afternoon, I would recommend the Musee Rodin it will pleasantly please you.

Marvelous restoration of the Rodin Musee .... In later August 2016 we spent an afternoon in the museum and in its gardens: delightful! We slowly went through the museum to enjoy the restoration watching video and studying details. Also the new arrangements and juxtapositions of paintings and sculptures are striking, enabling the viewer to see the work of Rodin in different ways. One of the high points of our 10-day Paris visit: highly recommended!
Had always wanted to see The Thinker. Statue buffs will be blown away so many of Rodin's works in the garden and inside busts just everywhere along with many fine paintings

The Rodin Museum is breathtaking. The sculptures and paintings of Auguste Rodin are simply amazing. The vast number of sculptures are highlighted by The Thinker, The Kiss and the Gates of Hell. Upon exiting the museum, we took a stroll through the gardens onsite, where many sculptures are set in lush vegetation. One caution is to avoid days when the temperature is above 90 degrees F. It can be very hot in the museum.

Memorable. This is a great little museum. It is exceptional In that it provides two ways of displaying the impressive works of Rodin. There's outside displays that are enhanced by the gardens and traditional displays in the rooms of this wonderful restored building. There is an amazing amount of art, I didn't realise how prolific he was. Of course The Thinker and The Kiss are amazing but there's so many other exhibits that are their equal. Unlike other exhibits in Paris, there was hardly any waiting for tickets. So it's good if you make a last minute decision to go like we did.
Beautiful garden. Huge Rodin collection in the stunning 'hotel' he worked in. Refreshment stand in sculpture garden. Quiet streets.

Rodin Museum. Just go, you won't be disappointed. We arrived mid-morning. The sun was glowing over the Thinker. As we walked the grounds it was awe inspiring to see each of the bronze statues. The walk through Rodin's house was interesting and I was just as impressed with his paintings as his sculptures.

Wonderful collection of a master. This is a must. The grounds are great - beautiful and peaceful. And the statures are amazing. One gets a much better appreciation for the work of this great artist. Well worth a trip. A little reading up about Rodin will add much more understanding and appreciation for what you'll see.
Peaceful visit in Paris. We enjoyed so much. Peaceful and beautiful piece of history and art of whole Europe. Lovely garden and excellent cafe.

Lovely sculpture garden and cafe. Funds were running low by the time I got here so paid €4 to visit the garden only. Very pleasant. Beautifully maintained. The cafe served a good range of food and drink and prices were reasonable. There are two free telescopes in front of the Gates of Hell so you could zero in on the detail. Plenty of benches so you could sit and enjoy the garden.
great visit. elegant museum, and shows the range of Rodin beyond what you already know. Lovely grounds, relaxing.
Most beautiful small museum. Private Ducal house now Rodins Paris museum. Wonderful on many levels not just the sculpture. Interesting paintings from Rodins own collectionLarge formal garden
Exquisite presentation!. The pieces are amazing & the presentation is just as impressive. The hotel restoration is brilliant. A must see without a doubt. Easy to get to as most things are in Paris.

Forget the others - Musee Rodin is perfectly charming. If you're anything like me, and can't even stand the thought of lining up outside on hot European, summer days - skip the Louvre and head over to Musee Rodin. Absolutely charming gardens, a lovely cafe, and of course, stunning sculpture art.

Very nice. The thinker and the kids are the highlights of this mostly outdoor museum. The gardens are nice and well maintained. Not nearly as popular as the Louvre or Museum d'Orsay, but definitely worth the time.

Be sure to allow enough time here. We'd been to this museum in the past. So at the end of a long day of walking and sightseeing, we decided to pop in shortly before closing time. We enjoyed walking thru the grounds and viewing the sculptures on display outside. But it was not enough time to really appreciate the museum. So if you go (and you should) be sure to allow at least a couple of hours.

The most enjoyable visit to the Gates of Hell one is ever likely to experience. In general, I would advise most people to try to live their lives in such a way as to avoid The Gates of Hell, but Rodin's sculpture of this portal is enthralling. Fortunately, one does not have to trebuchet a flaming kitten at a nun to gain admittance, but merely hand over a few Euros. Rodin also did a fantastic sculpture of a boy band called Les Trois Ombres. The museum also gives some insight into how the he lived and worked and has a sculptures and insight into Camille Claudel, his student, muse, and lover. She, herself, was also a brilliant artist and fascinating character. Also, as a museum it is exactly the right size. It has lots of great art and information and a clear focus, but isn't overwhelming. Another plus is that much of it is outside and has a lovely little area to have a cup of tea.

Spectacular museum, and champage in the sculpture garden!. The Musee Rodin is a must-see. It may not be on everyone's list, but it should be. While highlighting the sculptor's creations and molds, there was a special surprise upstairs - The Harvester by Van Gogh! The Sculpture Garden should be enjoyed on a sunny day, and don't skip sipping champagne from the café!

Tranquility in central Paris. Not the first time I have visited this museum and likely won't be the last. The sculptures are quite beautiful and the setting is a great place to have some time to relax from the hustle and bustle of the city.

A Must when in Paris. In the heart of the seventh arrondissement is this wonderful Museum where yo can enjoy Rodin's unique sculptures and also those of his student and muse Camille Claudel. An emotive experience impossible to forget.

Lovely setting. Peace.. The gardens are simply gorgeous, punctuated by sculptures, and Paris views. Not as popular with the mass tourist market so makes for a more relaxing attraction. A peaceful place in a lovely setting.

Intimate insights in magnificent surroundings.. Not far from the magnificence of Les Invalides and Napoleon's tomb, the Hotel Biron and its gardens house this great collection illustrating the life, working methods and amazing output of Rodin. On a sunny day it was especially good to wander through the sculpture garden, and get close to some famous sculptures, and to take coffee in those surroundings. Inside, the exhibition is beautifully laid out through the rooms of the mansion,; and you come out with a greater understanding of Rodin's genius. Incidentally, Rodin believed that sculpture was a tactile art, and encouraged people to touch his works. I saw only one "do not touch" notice. It was on a statue in the garden of a naked man. One part of his anatomy was very shiny - I could see the reasoning behind the request!

Beautiful grounds and sculptures. Included with the museum pass and near the army museum. If you are a sculpture fan this is a must. Beautiful grounds. Amazing sculptures. Including The Thinker. About an hour visit.

A true villa in the centre of Paris. Beautiful garden full of sculptures. An interesting atelier and a beautiful villa that represent the work and life if this inspired artist. A really good visit for a Sunday morning.
Gardens were beautiful . We just went through the gardens and had a rest down the back after a busy day sightseeing elsewhere. It was very peaceful in the walled gardens and the roses were beautiful

Wonderful sculptures and beautiful gardens.. I had wanted to visit this museum and was not disappointed. Rodin captured the pain of his subjects so very dramatically, especially in The Gates of Hell, simply stunning. Living on Ave Victor Hugo, it was nice to see sculptures of the great man too. The grounds are beautifully kept with further sculptures in every twist and turn - especially liked Orpheus in the underworld placing.

Excellent Museum. I wanted to see Rodin's sculptures firsthand for a long time and this was the the day my dream came true. We first went to the open air part. We kept enjoying the sculptures while the kids loved playing in the gardens. Then we went inside the museum - it was mind blowing yet not overwhelming! If you want to visit Orsay museum then buy the combined tickets here. Queues here are much shorter than in Orsay.
Wrth a visit. Very pretty house and gardens and some great sculptures. Not too crowded, lovely place to spent the afternoon. About 10 min walk from the Orsay museum.

Famous Sculptures . You can quickly see "The Thinker" in the garden for a great free photo op. Inside the museum are several iconic ones including "The Kiss". The museum is not air-conditioned and on a 90 degree day it made it not so comfortable to linger.

A Lesson in Art and Life. A museum dedicated primarily to the work of Rodin. I appreciated the audio guide which revealed that Rodin was not only a great artist, but also a thinker. The museum is fantastic, but I enjoyed the ground. Its a great place to relax with elegant grounds and beautiful sculpture. Take food from the cafe and enjoy the grounds.

Visited the gardens only for the sculptures.. We went here purely to go in the gardens to see all the sculptures. Beautiful gardens and the first sculpture was the Thinker which is such an iconic one. Got some amazing photos with the gold gilded dome of Les Invalides, Eiffel Tower and the Thinker statue in.

Favorite garden. Didn't go in to the main museum but as weather allows this is perhaps the most appealing garden and group of statues in town. Rodin's major works are spread across the landscape and the crowds are solid but solemn, too. Absolutely worth the trip, and a return.
Great art work in a beautiful setting. Lovely to escape the busy city and walk around the peaceful gardens looking at the art. Definitely worth a visit
A gem! . A perfect indoor/outdoor museum to visit! Musee Rodin is not too large and the grounds are unbelievable. A gem of a museum!!

Easy way to spend time. This is a small museum so it doesn't take too long to finish a tour. It's quiet and peaceful and the beautiful gardens are rally the highlight of the visit; the gardens can take up as much time as the inside exhibition.

Beautiful!. My favorite museum in Paris! Spend the afternoon in the gardens and if it gets too warm or rains, head inside to view magnificent works of art! An expansive collection of Rodin works (drawings, bronze statues and marble mostly) and also other artists (Van Gough). Plan to be there for 2+ hours.

surprise. We visit this museum and was a very big surprise, is interesting Museum and beautifuls landscaped gardens with sculptures.. We visit in Summer and was a pleasure to walk in t he garden and enjoy and admimiring Rodin monumental sculptures.

Small But Very Lovely Museum. I love this museum..it is very small, quite and LOVELY!!! We spent first two hours walking around the whole place and then ate Lunch which is also very nice and healthy. Then we went back and do it all over again. If you love sculptures, this museum is for you!!! and Rodin is so prolific:-) We love it!!! Kid under 12 is FREE, adult is 10 Euros. The ground is so lovely and very relaxing to sit there after walking inside the museum. A must place to visit when you're in Paris!!!

A Must for Rodin Fans. This is a very nice museum. It was included in the Paris Museum Pass and definitely a must-see for Rodin fans. We were disappointed that The Thinker was under renovation in the garden and had scaffolding around it during our visit. The Gates of Hell was magnificent and interesting to compare it with the one in the Musee d'Orsay.

Amazing sculptures in wonderful gardens. Make this your first museum visit in Paris! It is not huge, and can be enjoyed completely in a few hours at a relaxed pace. The main attraction is the garden, with Rodin's amazing bronzes integrated into the landscape where you can view and even touch them. Before the museum, I was only familiar with Rodin's most familiar "Thinker", but I found it less interesting than many of his others, especially the "Gates of Hell" series with their contorted sinews and tortured emotionality. The indoor exhibits were interesting as well, showing many smaller studies for the larger works, including a stunning set of hands.

Renovations Finally Complete. Now that the renos are done, this is a great spot to see Rodin shine. So many great pieces, the museum shows well indoors and outdoors. And Rodin even owned a couple of van Goughs which are on display. Great left bank ToDo.

You might be tempted to skip Rodin for a larger museum. .don't!. Rodin is the master and the museum it set up perfectly to digest his genius. The gardens on which many of his works are displayed are beautiful. Take your time and really move around the works. There is no rush and since the works are so spread out it is far less overwhelming than the Louvre. Take a couple of hours and enjoy this one with some ice cream. This was my favorite Musee in Paris.
Worth the visit. Great part of our trip. Went shortly after they opened and wasn't busy. Definitely worth a visit. The gardens alone are worth it.

Remarkable museum in a garden setting. We were able to view the many statues in the glorious garden prior to entering the building. The atmosphere was lovely. The exhibits inside were equally impressive. We were very glad we saw this.

A must see in Paris. Went back recently. First visit was 18 years ago. Renovations since have greatly improved the visitor experience. Many large sculptures displayed in beautiful garden, while smaller sculptures & paintings displayed indoors. Best part was a casual and inexpensive salad or sandwich lunch in the garden cafe--a perfect to eat and stay cool on a hot summer day.

Small and has the world famous sculpture, 'The Thinker'. We loved the Rodin museum. All our life we have heard and seen pictures of the famous sculpture, The Thinker. To see it in real life along with the other sculptures of Rodin was really very interesting if you like that sort of thing. They also have a bust of the Thinker is a much larger size outside the museum. You can spend maybe an hour here.
A terrific museum. Strongly recommended.. First of all, we love Rodin's works. This museum is well worth a visit when you're in Paris. Just the right size for a couple of hours.

Garden sculptures plus a thorough view into Rodin's work. The outdoor component has many impressive statues, though their name plates tend to be far away (perhaps to avoid having readers in pictures of the sculptures). There's a cafe in the outdoor part as well, but it has a fairly limited selection.The indoor component is quite impressive, and I would urge visitors to watch the 2 videos near the beginning to show how Rodin prepared his sculptures and casts, and how he managed to scale to larger sculptures (for those who do not know). The remainder of the museum has an impressive collection of not only Rodin's work (and various steps of his process), but also some of the art he collected, including an impressive set of ancient sculptures. This museum isn't as busy as some of the more popular Paris attractions, and takes a couple hours to see.

Rain , Rain Go Away. When we were in Paris end of May beginning of June they were having monumental rainy weather. Paris is lovely even in the rain . When we went to the Rodin Museum it was drizzle, not pouring . The gardens are lovely & I was excited to see "The Thinker" This Museum is easy , because it is not too big nor too small . You can move through fairly fast, it was crowded inside but didn't really feel it. They have a nice little cafe in the garden area where we had coffee. I hope to go back to the garden on a sunny day on my next trip to Paris.

A Wonderful Tribute to Rodin. We were very surprised at how many Rodin pieces were in the house and on the grounds. The gardens can be a great afternoon rest after seeing the museum (house). Greta examples of the same or similar pieces in different stages or mediums. You can kiss in front of The Kiss. You can think at the base of The Thinker. This is one of our favorite smaller Paris museums.

Wonderful Museum and Gardens. This is a wonderful museum and fantastic gardens. Plan on having a nice lunch there (buy your baguette sandwich at their small outdoor cafe sit outside). The Rodin works are lovely of course as are the works by Camille Claudel.

A gem garden in the middle of Paris . A wonderful garden just made for enjoying and relaxing away from the traffic and everyday chaos and yet in downtown Paris, full of sculptures. The museum shows a very interesting collection of Rodin's sculptures in bronze, marble etc. Be sure to have your backpack on your front side or keep it in your hand, as the sculptures are on pedestals, and it's better to be safe than sorry. Included in Paris Museum Pass
A quiet sanctuary in the city. This is a review just for the gardens of the museum. An oasis of calm in a busy city- worth the 4 euros for that alone! Well worth a couple of hours.

Peaceful gardens with Rodin sculptures. We spent a very enjoyable time meandering through the gardens and enjoying the Rodin bronze sculptures and had a tasty lunch outside in the gardens. Aslo visited the gallery shop which was quite overpriced - the small replicas are much cheaper at the Printemps Department store. This is a more affordable and less crowded option to see the sculptures than the indoor museum.

Lovely Visit. I got a ticket to the gardens only and it was the best deal in Paris. The outdoor gardens were large, full of beautiful statues and flowers, and the bonus was that is wasn't crowded! I was traveling kid free but I did note that it would be a good spot to bring kids and there was even a kid play area. Also could be a nice spot for a picnic :)

Make sure to give yourself enough time!. The museum goes on and on and on, and you don't realize how large it is until you figure out how long you've been there! So many wonderful sculptures, including many studies and refinements. Make sure you have enough time to also wander and enjoy the garden exhibit. They close very promptly and clear the grounds.

Beautiful and stately. Have visited many times and each time something new is found. The tour of the house is easy and most of the paintings are downstairs. The fun is walking the gardens where many of the sculptures are so familiar and invite contemplation. Don't miss.
surprise. after the renovation the sculptures are in better evidence, always happy to visit this special museum

Underrated but gorgeous museum. A little tucked away behind Les Invalides, the Musée Rodin is nonetheless infinitely worth your while. Rodin's sculptures are incredible and the museum is very well laid out - many of the small scale studies inside an then also be found in the gardens at the full scale size. The ground are a beautiful place to relax and enjoy the art, if only you were allowed on the grass!

Amazing. A must for sculpture and Rodin fans. This was a great experience, the art works are set up in a large mansion and through out an amazing garden. Lovely to walk around for a couple of hours and see some of the greatest sculptures ever created. Inspirational. I think this was about 10euro for entry and well worth it.

An oasis in the heart of Paris. A really lovely museum. Sculptures are displayed in a beautiful garden. The big attractions are The Thinker and The Gates of Hell. I wish I had had more time there. I will definitely return.
Fantastic. Of you like Rodin then you are in for a treat. Lovely house. Great gardens. Nice cafe in the gardens. Just a lovely small compact museum. Loved it.

Great museum to spend an afternoon. Great museum because it offers both the garden statues, as well as the artwork in the chateau. Its a perfect 1-2 hour visit..... and local places to drink and eat are only a few meters away. Highly recommended.

Great Small Museam. I can't really call this a hidden gem, since when I got there the line was pretty big and thankfully we had a museum pass that let us jump ahead of everyone.I spent a few hours here looking at the art as well as enjoying the gardens and reading, its few key pieces such as a the Thinker make it a really big draw in my opinion.

Beautiful gardens and house with amazing display. This was my personal favorite museum in Paris. The gardens are spectacular with amazing roses. It was a great place to see art with kids because of the large spaces to move around. The house was also amazing and the sculpture inside beautiful. It is not air conditioned and poorly ventilated on a hot sunny summer day, but worth the stuffy trip through.
A very relaxing place. If you're looking for a museum that boasts of original works that has a picturesque garden to go with it, then this museum is the place to visit.

A pleasure ! A must see.. I would not miss this for anything - a must see for Art lovers anywhere!
Well thought out exhibits and beautiful restored architecture

A Must see. I visited this museum 20 years ago and it was beautiful but aging then. But after its recent renovation its perfect! The home is beautiful and a perfect setting for Rodin's masterpieces. We went early and there was no line. The garden is perfectly manicured and plan to spend some time there.
A little museum with big gardens. It has the most well know operas of Rodin It has a great garden where you can spend some nice and quiet time admiring also the sculptures.

Sculpture in a Garden. Rodin evokes the greatest in sculpture and visiting the House and extensive Garden is pure joy. The garden offers a peaceful heaven with magnificent works such as the Burghers of Calais, the Gates of Hell and the Thinker. Refreshment facilities are available in the shade and provide an ideal stop to pause and reflect. Allow plenty of time for the visit ( 2 hours to fully appreciate the beauty of the place) and do not forget that queues are also likely in the Summer. The House also provides lead up modelling to his main works, view the Kiss and his own collection of paintings which include Renoir, Monet and Van Gogh.

Best museum in Paris. This museum is home to THE Rodin sculpture "The Thinker" and many more excellent works of art including several Van Goghs. The place is amazing and the museum includes a garden which is fabulous with outside art. Wonderful cafe with good food and drinks. It is easily accessible by Metro and uncrowded. If you only have time for one museum, skip the Louvre and see Musee Rodin. Worth it.
GORGEOUS. Beautiful homes and gardens with lovely sculptures and perfectly manicured grounds. Expect a long wait in line unless you have a museum pass.

A must!. The gardens are beautiful, with statues throughout - and the Thinker is right there to see in its grandeur. Inside the museum are those most famous works of art: the Kiss and also the Hands. Memorable and inspiring.

A gem. Very well displayed works of Rodin, in his home. The works in the gardens are the highlight. The Thinker, The Kiss, and his Gates of Hell, plus many, many more.Walk the gardens, tour the house. A nice cafe in the garden ( no credit cards, just cash), and a nice gift shop.It was a nice way to spend a few hours.

Must see garden. Rodin museum is one of the must-see places in Paris for art lovers. One of the finest gardens in Paris you can also buy just garden ticket and enjoy your time on benches around. I was the first time that I liked the audioguide. It had many information (which you can always skip), but the numeration was great and had a list of audioguided sculptures. Rodin had lived an interesting life and his works are the works of a genius! His number 1 fascination was Dante's Divine Comedy- and the sculptures I saw at the museum encouraged me to go back and reread it! The famous Kiss and Thinker are actually the parts of Gates of Hell masterpiece that he worked on for most of his life. His sculptures have the emotions and convincing nature. Though people were critical about his Balzac statue, now it seems as a masterpiece too. The rooms in the museum are divided into his life periods and this case it is very easy and interesting to see him grow from small works to big ones.

Even better than expected. The museum is amazing. Everybody should go to the Musée d'Orsay & the Musee Rodin when they visit Paris. I recommend to make the whole visit (inside and outside). And it is a good experience with kids because they enjoy it more than others museums

Sculpting at its best. Coming to Musee Rodin is like going to a labyrinth. You find sculptures that very few artists in the history of the world has done. From the "Thinker" to the "kiss" and ending at Dante's gate to the inferno. These are masterpieces of sculpture that are breathtaking.
This museum is a must see for anyone into this kind of art.

God does not exist, if he did birds wouldn't poop on Rodin's statues. This is an amazing place. In high school I saw the movie Camille Claudel in a humanities class, and since that time I have wanted to see the Gates of Hell. The works in the garden are so powerful and often haunting enough, to be forced to look away. This is juxtaposed by my memory of Michelangelo's work, which wasn’t so haunting but just incredible. For instance, how a vein would rise out of the forearm. It seems that Rodin’s work, although not always as polished as Michelangelo’s, conveys a sense of movement by not polishing every sculpting mark. I have no basis to make such comments, but the point is that this museum is one of the greats and should not be overlooked!

Great Museum and Gardens!. Visited in July of 2016. Really impressive sculptures and garden areas. It's further away from some of the other sites but worth the trip. Nice gift shop as well - you can purchase a bronze mini version of "the thinker".

Recently Renovated and Stunning. Easy to get to right off the bat. Stepping out in the garden was mind blowing, the setting is beautifully kept,with Rodin's works fitting so easily into the grounds. Inside was no different and filled with marbles, bronzes and paintings. Do not miss.

A highlight of Paris. Do not stumble on this by accident like I did. Make a point to come for 2 hours or so. Close to public transportation and across the street from Dôme des Invalides, tomb of Napoleon. Unhurried, and perfectly executed.

wow!. The Musée Rodin in Paris, France, is a museum that was opened in 1919, dedicated to the works of the French sculptor Auguste Rodin. It has two sites, at the Hôtel Biron and surrounding grounds in central Paris, and just outside Paris at Rodin's old home, the Villa des Brillants at Meudon (Hauts-de-Seine). The collection includes 6,600 sculptures, 8,000 drawings, 8,000 old photographs and 7,000 objets d’art. The museum receives 700,000 visitors annually.While living in the Villa des Brillants, Rodin used the Hôtel Biron as his workshop from 1908, and subsequently donated his entire collection of sculptures (along with paintings by Vincent van Gogh and Pierre-Auguste Renoir that he had acquired) to the French State on the condition that they turn the buildings into a museum dedicated to his works.The Musée Rodin contains most of Rodin's significant creations, including The Thinker, The Kiss and The Gates of Hell. Many of his sculptures are displayed in the museum's extensive garden. The museum is one of the most accessible museums in Paris. It is located near a Metro stop, Varenne, in a central neighborhood and the entrance fee is very reasonable. The gardens around the museum building contain many of the famous sculptures in natural settings. Behind the museum building is a small lake and casual restaurant.
Enchanting.. I love Rodin. There's no other sculptor who managed to transmit profound emotions through sculptures as him. His works seems to dance, move, speak and reach my soul.

Put this on your "must-do".list. One of the best surprises on my Paris holiday. Very interesting to see different variations and details of those many statues you see outside in the garden (and seen on so many books and papers). Very beautiful garden with blooming flowers and bushes.The location is so central so very easy to add on your holiday agenda. It is worth it
Amazing!. Such a beautiful place. A museum full of wonderful sculptures and artwork set in a beautiful garden.Well worth a visit!

Amazingly beautiful. You read about this in history books, learn about it in school. But until you are *there* you simply cannot grasp the beauty of it all. My husband and I visited the Rodin Museum in 2009 and the experience lives on with us still today. To see the artwork and statues first hand made them all the more impressive and the grounds were completely awe-inspiring. If we had not had other places on our list to visit in Paris, we would have spent more time here. As it is, I believe we were in the museum close to three hours.Visited August 2009

Amazing (but then I'm biased). I have been coming to this museum for nearly 30 years, on every visit to Paris, even if I have only 30 minutes.The opportunity to experience the sculpture up close, so close you can touch it (but don't) is simply unique in our world.The grounds and infrastructure have been improved over the years; I can remember drafty cold rooms in the winter, and hot humid rooms in the summer... and no bathrooms (or at least not clean ones). Now you can even get lunch at the delightful cafe!Aim for early in the day, and you'll miss some (most?) of the other guests, which is definitely a better experience. It is also quite fine on a stormy day.

Romantic noon at this château and garden.. Auguste Rodin lets you fall in love with his sculptures. The exposition continues in the lovely garden, with many big statues of the master. I arrived there at about 11:50 a.m., so I had a warm plate from the open-air restaurant in the garden before I started my visit to the exposition. Quality at very moderate expense. A tip: measure the garden in good manner! I thought I had seen it all, but then I had another fifteen minute walk with other discoveries. Including an elder couple embracing each other (live!), in a quiet corner. Touching.
Beautiful museum. Lots of beautiful sculptures outdoors in a elegant garden. It was so nice to enjoy the artwork then have some time to relax outside. We had some delicious ice cream as well!!!

remarkable both inside and out. We spent far longer than expected here - the gardens are lovely and much larger than we imagined, and the range of his work as well as some contemporary artists made this well worth the visit. And the crowds were not nearly as bad as the Louvre, the overall size very manageable for a few hours.

Simply amazing.. I have been to this museum every time I go to Paris. The figures look like they will just walk off. Rodin was simply a master of his art. It is also a lovely place to get away from the hustle of the city. After going through the house take half an hour to wander through the garden. Well worth every cent.

Impressive Setting. We last went to the Musee Rodin before its extensive renovation. The exhibition itself had not changed much and is, of course wonderful. The work on the gardens and flooring helped make the museum more impressive
Glad I Went. A beautiful mansion with beautiful gardens. Less crowded than most museums and very well curated. Lots of beautiful statues in the garden.

Small, intimate and gorgeous!. I just LOVE this museum. You must go on a beautiful day as the gardens here are to-die-for! And, definitely eat at the Bistro in the gardens! It is NOT just "museum food." It's truly one of the best meals we had in Paris. There are two entry fees. One for just the gardens, and more for the gardens and the interior mansion museum... My opinion... YOU HAVE TO DO BOTH! Anyway... the outside gardens are just incredibly gorgeous, with the most rose gardens I've seen anywhere. Of course, the huge Rodin sculptures keep you breathless. The interior mansion has two floors of Rodin sculptures and some paintings, even some from Van Gough. Again, just beautiful. Don't miss this. Really.. don't! My favorite place!
Charming attraction.. Not on the top ten list but do not miss it. Great exhibition and gardens with a charming café for lunch. Get there early for best photo opportunities. Thinker etc.
Amazing. Beautiful exhibit spread through out his house and gardens. Spectacular range of pieces, house itself is beautiful piece of history. Kids could run around outside in the gardens.
Lovely relaxing visit. Great exhibitions in the house. The garden has plenty of seating areas with shade and full sun. The cafe is lovely for lunch. You can spen a great afternoon her

Ultimate and quiet. Enjoy reading a book in the stupendous garden of Musée Rodin while staring at the famous statues.... Located in the 7th arrondissement of Paris, this Mansion is an ideal spot to rest among the crowd...

Lovely museum. Small enough to do in an afternoon. Lovely house tour and gardens with so many beautiful sculptures. Nice gift shop but a little overpriced compared to other museum shops I've visited. Very close to metro

A beautiful spot to contemplate the works of the great artist. This is the only park within Paris to see his works. There is also his home outside the city. The grounds are beautifully and meticulously manicured and provide the perfect setting for his massive sculptures. Each has a plaque describing its background and history. Rodin was quite the iconoclast of his time - I hadn't realized. Take your time and you'll find it a very moving experience.

Beautiful Museum!. If you love sculptures this the museum to visit! Rodin's sculptures come to life! The museum has a wonderful collection. The garden is a nice relaxing way to enjoy the art. This museum is less crowded than the other big museums in Paris. A great place to visit!

Phenomenal grounds, great house and sculptures! . This is a more nice weather museum as a nice part of its outside and would not be great in rain or extreme cold. With that said its a great small museum with great work from Rodin. It's in a huge old house with beautiful gardens and his sculptures all over the place. Smaller and less crowded than other museums is the best part along with the grounds and his ideas and art. The audio guide is great and really tells a story about him, the history of the grounds and house and select pieces of his art. Unless you have a great guidebook with photos I'd rent the audio guide. Worth doing even though it's not in the center of town. Famous artwork in a small setting with less people is great. You can even get food if you want. Do the gardens and the house so you get the real feel of his lifestyle and art. Enjoy!

Absolutely marvellous. Absolutely marvellous museum. We spent several hours inside the museum building and then some more time outside in the garden. We just could not get enough. We loved every minute of it. Rodin is one of our favourites and his art is timeless. He produced so much work, numerous sculptures, and every single one is amazing in its beauty. This collection has to be seen. Whether you are an art lover or not, you can not fail to appreciate beauty in all its splendour when you come face to face with Rodin's work.

Rodin Museum. We visited the Rodin Museum recently and it was a fun experience.First let me say we walked to the museum from Notre Dame. And. Th en ba ck along. The Seine River. The nice thing about Paris is you can walk to almost any major attraction which helps burn off the glorious food calories.The Museum consists of Rodins home and the beautiful gardens surrounding it. The parquet floors are beautiful and Rodin's sculptures are located throughout the house. Many times you see his clay work next to his marble finished products. There are signs in English and French describing each peace and you can rent a tape at the front desk to get more information on each sculpture.You have more sculptures throughout the garden as well as a nice cafe for a break.The 20 euros it cost my wife and I for the visit was well worth the price.A plus is no sign of pick pockets anywhere in the museum or grounds.Enjoy your visit!!!
Beautiful. Lovely place to visit on a sunny day as the grounds are beautiful.Inside is lovely but my favourite is the garden

Amazing art work and beautiful house. Good thing to do if the weather is either rainy or too hot!The art work is staggering. Didn't know Rodin was so prolific. It goes on and on with such variety. We'll worth a visit and not too expensive either.

What a lovely place!. We visited on a grey August day. As we walked around the peaceful haven of the gardens the sun came out! Perfect place with lots of seats where you can perch to admire the great works of Rodin. Beautiful roses and hydrangeas in flower. Rodin's most famous sculptures eg The Thinker and Eve, can be seen by just purchasing a garden ticket for €4 rather than the museum entry ticket which was €10.

Charming small museum. Beauty has no size. The level of sheer loveliness contained in this grand old house is surprising. A very intimate experience, with sculptures standing free, at the most a few smaller ones in cases. The house itself is part of the story, being also a beauty. One of the things I most liked was understanding at last the size and volume of Rodin's sculptures, which cannot be appreciated in 2 dimensions, at all. Also, how much the women around him contributed to the work they did.
A must see. If the amazing sculptures of Rodin are not enough for you. The historic house and grounds will surely be. We had one of our favorite meals in Paris in the cafe in the garden there.

Incredible, not to be missed!. Musee Rodin is by far, one of the most incredible places I have ever visited. Accessible my foot, Metro, bike, or cab, it is well worth your time. The grounds, the world famous sculptures, history, art work, you really get a feeling of Rodin's work space, as if you could step back in time and see him chiseling away. It's an extraordinarily peaceful and meditative place, close to other museums and landmarks, including the Eiffel which you can see towering over from certain vantage points in the sculpture garden.

A fabulous place to visit for the sculptures, the gardens and the architechture. Combining so much, this was one of the best things I have visited in Paris. From the wonderful setting in the newly renovated 18th century Hotel Biron with its wonderful gardens, the pleasing symmetry and honey coloured stone to the fantastic collection of Rodin sculptures (and paintings) it was a joy. The audio guide added much to the visit so I recommend this as well.Rodin's sculptures are extraordinary - transmitting emotion and vibrancy - what a genius he was. So interesting to learn about his own feelings about his sculptures which changed considerably during his lifetime, his statue of Balzac being the culmination of his life's work, his legacy, capturing the essence of the man, not just a physical likeness.

Wonderful Museum. Hopeless Organisation. We visited this Museum and very much enjoyed the exhibits which are shown inside a beautiful house and in the beautiful gardens.However, we went on a Saturday when the temperature was hovering around 30 degrees C and joined a queue in full sun that barely moved in almost 3/4 hour.When we finally got into the foyer we discovered that although 6 or 7 people were working, only one was selling tickets, one standing nearby was checking that you had a ticket and the ticket was checked again at the entry to the first room of the exhibit. Three others were standing watching.Needless to say, a number of people decided to go elsewhere.I hope that this is not the usual way that a visit would begin.
Quaint. A lesser known museum but well worth the visit. After visiting the larger more well known museums this smaller more quaint museum was s breath of fresh air.

A time to reflect on great masterpieces. Tired of long lines to get into a museum? A walking distance from Les Invalides, you come to Musee Rodin, a house that was lived be one of the greatest sculptures. The walk in the garden is the setting for the work of art. You can follow each of the statues and "feel" the life streaming through them: notice the veins and muscles, sense the expressions of defeat on the faces, the lost hands, the hollow looks. Each one has a story to tell and the walk through the garden reflects many of the thoughts. The garden itself is beautiful and allows for children to become familiar with the artist. There is room to move around, sit on the benches, look and the ducks in the pond and try a gelato while admiring the work of art.

Another great Paris attraction. An often forgotten museum in Paris, this is well worth a visit as it combines some world famous sculptures with a fine garden and restaurant. The gardens have been updated since our last visit and you can see Rodin's famous "The thinker" and the "Burghers of Calais" in the garden setting. Please put this museum on your list of attractions to see in Paris.

Museum of the Greatest Sculptor since the Rennaissance.. This Museum in the Hotel Biron mansion is set in beautiful grounds that are worth a visit on their own and overlooked by the gilded dome of the Invalides Church. I'd suggest that Rodin wasthe greatest sculptor since the likes of Bernini & Michelangelo.When you walk close to his masterpieces such as "The Kiss"you're simply in awe of what looks like the human form growing out of a block of marble. Outside in the gardens on the entrance side are several bronzes including the "Gates of Hell" and in 90deg heat it feels just like it! What makes this collection so special is that it truly belongs here, unlike most of the Louvre's contents it was not plundered by Napoleon from around Europe! In the grounds you'll find more than adequate ice cream stalls and a large cafe but of course being a high culture venue, prices to match. However all the proceeds help to keep this wonderfulplace financially self-reliant.

A favorite. If you like sculptures this is a must. It is situated in Rodin's old house and is home to many fine works as well as beginning pieces that you may not otherwise get to see. The Gardens on the property are breathtaking as well. Go in the Spring or summer.

Beautiful use of space and ideal way to experience Rodin.. Like many of the museums that focus on a single artist, the Musee Rodin does require some knowledge of his work & genre. But the building and surrounding landscape are sure to appeal to anyone that appreciates beauty.
The tour is much more interesting with the audio guide. Don't skip it.

Well designed!. Great design with Rodin sculptures in beautiful gardens and a well designed museum.
Free for 18-25 year old students from the EU which is great.
No English guides. Out of all guides in English. Really? One would think that with the drop in tourism, this wouldn't be an issue. Otherwise fine.

Be sure to allow enough time. Many people just head for the garden to see the Thinker and The Gates of Hell. But it is a mistake to overlook the inside collection which provides the history of Rodin's life, his early works, and his liaisons, including Rose and Camille. You can easily spend a couple of hours inside before you head to the garden. There is also a casual cafe in the garden where you can sit down and grab a quick bite. Don't miss this one.

Think Hungry. This was one of the best lunch I ever had in my lifetime - from the wide variety in the menu when I opted for this salad after a long walk in the sculptures - I didn't hope much as I was there for art not food but the taste of this summer salad with the melting mozzarella and the bacon with the fresh baby spinach is still so fresh in my mind. That I decided to write this review almost after a year. Amidst sculptures and peace his a place so beautiful and has the best of aromas and flavours to take the mind and body in trance. Complete Indulgence!!!

Rodin Pose off. This exhibit was quite a bit larger than expected. We had a great time in the garden doing our "pose off" with the statues. We were a little disappointed the Thinker was under repair, but there was also a smaller version inside.

Must see the Rodin museum!. The Rodin museum is such a wonderful experience! Stroll through the gardens looking at wonderful sculptures while eating a gelato. The museum has all of his famous works such as The Thinker, The Gates of Hell, and the Citizens of Calais. And there are no crowds, because it is an often overlooked museum. I recommend making the time to see it.
Fantastic. We loved walking through the gardens and the house seeing very famous works of art like The Thinker and The Kiss. This was the first attraction we saw in Paris and the bar was set high.

Beautiful Museum and Park. I had just walked here from the Branly on my way to Musee d'Orsay and was so hot I decided to enter, and am I glad I did! There was a line, like all Paris museums in July, but nothing like the lines at the Louvre or Musee d'Orsay. I was inside in less than 10 minutes. One reason I stopped is because I heard the the gardens were lovely. It was the hottest July day in Paris, and I needed some respite from the hot sun and pavement, so I ducked in here and visited with the Burghers of Callais in the cool, beautifully sculpted gardens. It also offered a place for museum goers to spread out and also has a nice shady cafe, perfect for a cold beer or soda. The metro stop is conveniently just steps away!

historical . we go to Rodin museum to see Rodin creations. this is very near to metro stop
(varenne) we also saw his cre-
gates of hell. .museum garden also very nice
Always a good visit. Stick to the outside gardens. The Thinker, Gates of Hell, and more are located in the gardens. You can buy an ice cream and wander in the beautiful sculpture garden.

Worth a visit. I was in Paris for business this month and had to stay over weekend there. Decided to check out the Musee Rodin and I wasn't disappointed. If you are a fan of Rodin then this is a must see.

small but beautiful. The Musee Rodin is covered by the Paris Museum Pass. Even if you don't have the pass, the admission is affordable and this museum and the gardens are well worth it. The museum store has some lovely pieces, too. We visited on a hot July day, and the gardens were a beautiful break. Some of Paris's best coffee (espresso-based) is available from the nearby Coutume on Rue de Babylone.

Fascinating Artist's Studio & Garden. The Musée Rodin is worth a visit if you enjoy his sculptures and sketches. The setting is impressive, with a large park-like garden and 19th century house-studio. There's a cafe in the garden, so plan on spending time viewing the collection and relaxing in the green space.

Absolutely beautiful!. Our group of seniors had an amazing tour and the Rodin museum was one of our photo ops. We did not have the opportunity to tour the museum but one picture says a millions words. Absolutely beautiful! Enjoyed by all!

Galtips. Grate collection of works of Rodin, it is located very closed to gare'orse.It is a pettite palace with a beautiful gardens with his sculpture. You can spend a full morning or afternoon there, relaxin in the gardens, an visiting the company collections Tip: look for works of camile claudel His estudent, may be lover, an for sure de has influence in his work, but at the time it was not well seen a woman artist.
Great Collection!. This is a must-see museum you need to visit while in Paris... you will admire somelovely pieces in the garden too!

Beautiful & interesting . Loved both museum and gardens. We got there soon after they opened, so not crowded, but by time we left there was a line for tickets.
