beatifull building. its not only a lovely building to see but the surrounding grounds are lovely to sit in and have a spot of something to eat plenty of areas to sit and people watch

Beautiful grounds and sculpture garden. We had a lovely day to explore the museum and the gardens. If it's a sunny day sit on the benches and enjoy the sculpture gardens while people watching. The interior art us also worth the visit. Crowded but try going on an off hour or upon opening.

Hide from tourists here.. This is a wonderful museum and you will learn a great deal about Rodin. Go in the late afternoon as the light gets perfect to view the sculpture. Not on the selfie seeking tourist horde list of to dos.

Lovely garden. I didn't actually go inside the museum but i spent a few hours strolling the gardens and had lunch in their cafe.Overall its a magnificent garden, especially if you like everything manicured like i do! There are a number of sculptures to see out in the garden too so you don't necessarily need to pay for the museum. Having said that keep in mind the garden visit costs 4 Euros while both the garden and museum cost 10 euros.
Enjoyable. We enjoyed seeing all the sculptures as well as the paintings. They were paintings and sculptures by Rodan and some other famous artists. The rooms were very hot. The garden is wonderful.

The Museum Showcases Rodin's Genius. Rodin is an artistic genius who was very prolific. This museum even had my 12-year old daughter wanting to stay longer. The permanent exhibits is housed in the building separate from where you buy tickets. There are 18 rooms on two floors. Where you buy tickets is a small, multi-room with temporary exhibitions of modern sculptors. The outside garden houses The Thinker and the Doors to Hell, among others.
Surprising. Beyond the Thinker and the Kiss, the Rodin's here are amazing. It becomes quite clear why he is so celebrated as revolutionizing sculpture. Wonderful paintings, gardens, too.

Must-see. When I visited (April 2015) the main house/building was being renovated. Yet still, it was a very impressive collection! But it was overshadowed by the lovely garden filled with various sculptures -- some famous, some that aren't famous but should be. (visited April 2015)

Iris still displayed after remodeling of L'Hotel Biron. The remodeling was terrific and the newer display seem focused more on the plaster stage than Bronz. Nevertheless, Iris is still prominent yet less so than before the rearrangement of the works. The best managed Musee in all of Paris exactly as Rodin would have wanted and expected.
Beautiful. The Musee Rodin is beautiful and intimate. There is a lovely garden, many recognize able sculptures and a nice outdoor cafe.

Magnificent collection in a lovely setting. The Rodin Museum has recently reopened, having been closed for needed renovations. It is strongly advised that you purchase tickets online in advance of your visit. Entering the building you have a real sense of Rodin's time there. The collection of his remarkable work is vast. Be sure to allow time for the gardens as well; they are beautiful and it's easy to forget that you are in the middle of bustling Paris as you stroll around. This museum is nothing short of a real gem.

Great collection Rodin's creations. Great collection on multiple levels inside the museum and outside. You'll come away with a wonderful appreciation of the beauty and diversity of the artist's creations using different techniques and media. I was very impressed by his early bronze sculpture "the Age of Bronze" which was displayed in 1877. It was so good that Rodin was accused of making a body casting!
Peaceful. For the fans of rodin it is simply a must do attraction in paris. The visit is well structured all the history is there.. The hell gate, the cathedral... Simply amazing

Lush Retreat to Enjoy Monumental Art. The gardens of the Rodin Museum are an oasis of tranquility and powerful beauty in the midst of the city, while the sculpture garden and interior exhibition of the works of an artist called the heir to Michelangelo are not to be missed. From the iconic "Thinker", Adam, Eve, The Burghers of Calais and The Gates of Hell to the many busts and figures displaying a robust fascination with all things human, Rodin's works are a marvel of the marriage of materials and the imaginative, passionate mind.
GORGEOUS!. Beautiful museum on lovely grounds. The back garden / pool area is amazing. Outstanding art and of course seeing The Thinker in person is a great experience. Recommend a visit!
The most relaxing spot in paris. A very chill and beautiful gardens and a great collection of Rodin statues. Definitly a place to visit in Paris (but preferebly when the weather is good).
Great museum. The place itself is amazing - beutiful villa in a beautiful parc. Quiet place in the city centre full of wonderful Rodin statues.

Return visit. Lovely gardens and so advanced with roses out. Peaceful display of large statues outside. Interior worth seeing as many smaller sculptures well displayed in themed settings. Restaurant excellent for lunch and afternoon tea and not too pricey.

Excellent museum. I think the musée Rodin should be on any artlovers must see list for Paris.First of all the museum is situated in a beautiful building, the old hôtel Biron.Which used to be Rodin's workshop in Paris. he donated his entire art collection to the French State on the condition that they turn the buildings into a museum dedicated to his works.The exhibition is splitted in different rooms and exposes works starting from the beginning of his career until the very end. You'll also see all his most famous works like the thinker, the kiss, the gate of hell,... There are also paintings from Van Gogh and Renoir and Claudel that Rodin collected. I would recommend to use an audio guide if you want to get as much info as possible because in the museum itself are not so many info panels next to the artworks.After you've completed the visit in the hotel Biron, you can continue in the beautiful gardens and enjoy the sculptures there. Or even enjoy something to eat or drink in the café in the gardens. One tip: come and visit the museum early so you can really enjoy the gardens and sculptures to yourself, as it can get a little loud, especially when groups are getting a tour in the museum later on in the day.Easiest way the get there is to take the metro line 13 and stop at the stop Varenne.

Go on a spring day . Excellent museum inside the Rodin residence that shows the progression of Rodin's work and his assemblage process. However, the gem is the outdoor gardens. Truly magnificent, especially in Spring with flowers in broom and the fragrance of Lilacs permeating the air, all the while surrounded by Rodin masterpieces. Plenty of benches to sit and admire the gardens and sculptures. It is very handicap friendly, both inside and out. There is a pleasant café in the garden for pleasant eating and drinking. A must-do in Spring!

Must see. Awesome collection.. This attraction is well worth 1-1/2+ hours to thoroughly enjoy the beautiful garden with its well-placed sculptures, and to examine the many rooms of the lovely house that display and examine Rodin's work through his career phases. Rodin was brilliant and his works are breathtaking. To see so many masterworks in one place, and to get insight into his fascinating life, is definitely a must-see for all art-loving visitors to Paris.
Great Sculptures . Nice and sort side trip while walking through Paris. There are many famous Rodin sculptures and the house and gardens are also very nice. We saw everything in an hour.
Great works of Rodin.. Located in a Mansion next to Napoleon Bonaparte's Tomb. Has Hundreds of his sculptors in all different materials. It also has his sketches and paintings.
Rodin!!!. Was nice museum with lots of information on how Rodin worked. The sculpture garden was nice to just relax in among Rodin's sculptures.

Beautiful. Wandering in the gardens and admiring the beautiful sculptures of Rodin is a must for every art lver while in Paris. The indoors museum is as good as the gardens if not even better. Strongly recommend it.

Great scale. Ok, so we did all the major attractions (L'Orangerie, Orsay, Le louvre, Eiffel Tower, Versailles) and this was my favourite... Why? It was intimate, descriptive, not too crowded...you could walk around the gardens, get up close and personal to the very powerful sculptures and they were beautiful. I'd highly recommend.
A must for any Rodin lover. The gardens alone are worth a visit. The museum was recently remodeled and it has many of Rodin's important sculptures.

Great Rodin. Wonderful Musee. The best collection of Rodins you can ever expect to see. I last visited here 25 years ago. I don't remember it being near as well presented.. I really enjoyed the afternoon we spent here. The gardens were very nice.

Fabulous Gallery and Garden. I would recommend a visit to this museum just to see the Burghers of Calais if nothing else. Of course there is "The Kiss" and many other beautiful pieces. Don't miss it. Just up the street and over the road to the right is a lovely brasserie about which I will write in another review.

Come For the sculptures but.... Enjoy everything else. The home is beautiful and the garden is lovely. And there is a lot of interesting artwork from the impressionist and post impressionist artists. Specially nice on a nice sunny day.
Very close to Napoleon's grave and the Army Museum. Had lunch at the little café and the gelato is excellent. Try the violet flavor

Not as good as the one in Stanford. I visited the Cantor Arts Center at Stanford University and coming here, I found that the collection of Rodin at Stanford was better in comparison to the one here. This greatly surprised me, but I realized that in fact the collection at Stanford is among the largest in the world and best of all it is free. I found the Paris one less impressive - but the garden was quite beautiful. If you haven't visited Stanford, this one is good to visit - but if you did visit Stanford - you can skip this one.

My favorite. This is my favorite museum in Paris. The store there is great - with wonderful large postcards of sculptures, posters and totes. The gardens and their roses are so beautiful. You can make a day out of just hanging out in the gardens and back by the pond (which was under construction in April 2016 and closed). It's a lovely place for a stroll complete with a little restaurant and outdoor cafe area. The actual sculptures in the Hotel Biron are amazing. They are well arranged on the first floor so you can just take a nice stroll through. Don't miss the Gates of Hell to the left of the gardens when you enter. I highly recommend you take your time to stroll the grounds. They have a beautiful view of the gold dome of les Invalides with is very very close to the museum.

A fair weather museum. This is most definitely a place to visit in the sunshine. As well as a museum showing off the best of Rodin's works, the gardens are a treat on their own. There are some works inside, and whilst we were there, some building work was going on so some exhibits were in temporary accommodation. Can be busy on weekends in particular, but you can still find some quiet spots.

So much to see. With the dome of Les Invalides overlooking the garden this is a wonderful place to wander with statues at every turn, the most famous being "Le Pensuer". Inside the museum the breadth of the collection is vast and complex. We had bought a joint ticket while visiting the Musee d'Orsay making it cheaper to visit.
Captivating. Garden is beautiful....Sculptures are beautiful...I visited as it became dark and the lighting inside the museum was perfect, it gave the art an even more appealing effect❤️

My Favourite Paris Museum. Always love coming here as it's never too busy & easy to walk around enjoying the peace & serenity of these beautiful gardens admiring the statues/art throughout & learning the history. Lovely for romantic strolls, eat an ice team, have a coffee or just sit on a bench admiring the stunning grounds.

Beautiful Garden, House and Collection. The house and garden alone is worth the visit. It's normally not too crowded so its very pleasant. The art is just amazing. This is the most comprehensive Rodin collection in the world.
Rodin. Wow. This guy had a dark side. Very cool to see "The Thinker" and "The Kiss." The gardens are just lovely.
Stunning. A garden of Rodin sculptures...it's like magic. Only in Paris. I can only say, visit, and take your time, and if it is a lovely day you are even more fortunate.

Amazing collection of a master. Not being that familiar with Rodin's work, I was amazed by the number of pieces in the collection which includes The Thinker and The Kiss. Rodin expressed and conveyed human emotion in his sculptures from joy to despair and he did explored the range of emotion in his work. It is so moving that you actually feel it. Take time to visit this wonderful museum and have lunch at the Muse Café on the corner.
The sculptures look like moving!. Very nice sculptures an paintings and there is a beautifull garden in the back! If you are an art lover you ll love it!

Sculpures, sculptures and paiinting. We were pleasantly to see a couple Monet, Van Gogh, Rodin painting and lots of Rodin's sculptures including same sculptures in various scales and materials. The gardens were enjoyable to walk around and were populated with sculptures. The house was also interesting to view with some great woodworks and doors.The modern art at the start, I could do without, but it only took a few minutes.

A pleasure to walk around the garden. GET THE MUSEUM PASS.We visited several museums, even in April the queues (lines) were slow. But with The Museum Pass we had a separate short line and were admitted very quickly.Have visited Musee Rodin several times, one of our favourites. It is never that busy and is just 10 minutes walk from Musee d'Orsay.It is nice to see some of his famous pieces - Thinker, Gates of Hell, Three Shades, Balzac, Burgers of Calais. His variety of work is impressive. A must see.

Romance of Rodin. This was my third visit to the Rodin Museum in Paris. Wanted to visit again after visiting Rodin Museum in Philadelphia at the end of last year. They are similar but Paris is of course much much bigger scale.A wonderful visit yet again.

Stunning gardens and collection. This is a beautiful day out. We went the the rain and it was still amazing. The sculpture garden is well curated and very well maintained. The main collection in doors is just as lovely with great views out over the Invalides competing with the art. The collection is fantastic with the famous The Thinker and The Kiss in residence alongside just as impressive but less famous works by the artist. Top Tip - you can get a "twin ticket" with the Musee D'Orsay to save money.
Life imitating art.... Beautiful sculptures throughout the gardens. My teen daughter had fun imitating the poses. Easy walk. Highly recommend.

Great Smaller Musee'. As many have said a beautiful space with an incredible garden. Can easily be done in an hour but linger in the gardens for a while. They are spectacular even in the the chilly April weather we ran into. While worth it. Can be combined with Le Invalides.

Garden exhibit was worthwhile . My wife and I were pleased with our decision to go with the garden access. The grounds were beautiful and we both learned more about this sculptor, whose most famous pieces were familiar to us but we knew very little about. Worth about an hour.

Go for the sculpture. Stay for the garden.. We have been to the Louvre on several other trips, to Musee d'Orsay several times as well. That made us ready for some smaller and more intimate museums.Two nice surprises here. First, I was unaware of the scope of Rodins work, very impressive. Second, I was expecting this advertised garden to be more like a courtyard (since its in the heart of the city) not a very sizeable walled garden with A CAFE, trimmed hedges, nice landscaping and some important Rodin bronzes. Delightful! Not a lot blooming in April, so lucky you if you'll be there in late spring or summer.Allow maybe two hours if you take a break. Museum 10€ each, includes the garden area although for a song you can buy a ticket for garden only, which would be one of the better hours of your life.In the cafe, we had large luncheon salads plus bread plus drink for about 15€ each.NOTE: Do stop in the entry garden to pose for cheesey photos of yourself looking pensive next to the massive statue of The Thinker. I'm just sayin'...!

Sensational Understated Masterpiece. Most of the Greatest of Rodin's works, including the thinker displayed in a beautiful mansion inside and outside. Relaxed and beautiful environment.Last time we were there, it was closed for repairs... Make sure its open before you go.

A gem in central Paris. A stunning collection of his work set in a very pleasant garden and inside a beautiful house!! So much to admire and taking pictures is permitted. Reasonably priced entrance and a cafe serving delicious proper meals!!
It is amazing!. Have always enjoyed Rodin's work and was very pleased to see more than I expected. There is room after room of beautiful work and the gardens are beautiful.

Musee Rodin Paris. We like seeing these old Hotel Particuliers - in town mansions. Rodin building is beautiful and renovated. The gardens are nicely compact and interesting, including Rodin's sculpture. The approach to the house from the courtyard is elegant. Another museum in Paris we like is the Musee Jacquemart Andre, which was a major scene of parties back in its heyday as a residence. - Jim Red Maps
beautiful museum. We bypassed the house portion of the museum on our last visit to Paris so we returned. The museum inside was wonderful and should not be missed. We enjoyed

The thinker. Great couple of hours in a Manor House that contained one of my favourite works of art. The collection of original brass sculptures and the plaster cast studies of the finished article was a great insight into the vision of the artist.

Where to start?. I can't decide whether to tell you to start inside and end in the lovely gardens, or start in the gardens and end inside with The Kiss. Either way, you'll be satisfied. It was a cold, grey, rainy day when we were there but it didn't stop us from wandering the gardens. There's a metro stop a couple blocks to the north so it's easy to get to. Only drawback was the woman 'guarding' the special exhibition. We've never been there before so didn't know it wasn't the entrance point or that our tickets didn't cover it and she was quite rude about it.

Discovered who created "The Thinker". I only knew Rodin from his statue 'The Thinker'. What a talented artist he was! The museum has an outside garden with remarkable bronze statues and small explanations next to each one. The museum building guides you through rooms from Rodin's early ears to his last years and you can witness the evolution of his art. It is spectacular to see and understand.

Musee plus sculpture gardens. The gardens with sculptures are worth the price of admission. Start there. The building exhibits are also interesting. For me this is a manageable, pleasant museum, not overwhelming

Nice museum. Part of our museum pass tour. Very nice garden. Very good illustrations of how some of the sculptures were created from stone. I.e you could easily visualizethe artist shaping the block.Good informationin multiple languages.

Best museum we visited!. Absolutely wonderful, both the building he lived in that houses the art as well as the beautiful outdoor gardens. The history and stories are great and you get to see some Van Gogh's, Matisse and other artistes he traded his works with.

Worth the visit despite the rain. Allow 2 hours to experience both the sculpture in the mansion itself, as well as the large garden. We got there late, about 4pm, and by 5:30 they were shooing everyone out, garden included. It was drizzling, and still enjoyable, but would be quite lovely in good weather. They have a little outdoor café in the garden.

Nice short excursion. This museum originated from Rodin himself after his death. The garden and the museum are both very pretty, and I, even as someone who does not particularly appreciate art, enjoyed the experience.

Second visit to the Rodin. We toured the museum on our last visit, but returned because the exhibits in the house had changed. It was well-worth returning to see the garden exhibits again. As part of our Paris Pass we did not have to pay for entrance.
lovely setting; exhaustive collection. The museum is in a lovely mansion (Rodin's home) with gardens surrounding. The gardens have lots of seating and many statues.Good English signage in the museum.

Love this museum!. Some reviews say to just visit the garden but I do not agree. The museum itself is amazing. So many gorgeous statues, especially the marble statues (The Kiss!!). And even the building itself is nice. I was very impressed.The garden is nice as well, especially the Gates of Hell. Unfortunately is was raining during my visit but if the sun is shining it must be a peaceful place to sit and enjoy the amazing works of art.They also have an extensive shop with a lot of books and some statues and jewellery.
Grand reopening!. What a splendid job done to this museum. A great Restauration and an awesome impression of Robins work and life. Don't miss the gardens...

Rodin and peaceful garden. Manageable museum where I learned a lot about Rodin and his work. Housed where he actually lived and worked so the building and grounds are as much a part of the experience as are his works. Nice way to spend a spring afternoon!

Beautiful Setting. You don't have to be an art or sculpture expert to appreciate this place. Delightful gardens filled with flowering shrubs and flowers make a spring visit here about the best time to come. The gardens filled with wonderful sculptures are less crowded at this time of year especially midweek making for a more pleasant experience, but what ever the time of year it's worth visiting. Time to wander at leisure, contemplate like the "thinker" and soak it all up......brilliant. Inside the museum there's more sculptures than you can imagine but also some truly great works from the grand masters .....Monet, Renoir, and some stunning Van Gogh's compliment the exhibition.

Gem of an oasis in a busy city. Musee Rodin is a great place to go for a break from hectic Paris. The gardens are enchanting with a mix of Rodin sculptures and gardens. Unfortunately when we went eh main house was closed for renovations but the estate and gardens were open. Could not recommend this place enough.

Love it love it. A lovely visit on a rainy day. The grounds are a gorgeous spot to sit and contemplate. It's a perfect way to dream you live in a mansion in Paris. Use the loo in the entry pavilion. The upstairs toilet inside the museum proper has only one stall and it's hot af waiting in line.

Well known statuary and much not familiar. Musee Rodin always seems to hold something new at each visit. This is the third visit over the years and we still discover a sculpture or painting that we'd not noticed before. La Porte d'Enfer always seems to hold yet another discovery.

A breathtaking museum.. Both the building, the gardens and Rodin's amazing art makes this museum a must see on your trip to Paris. After the museum Go outside and have a snack or a cafe outside in the garden. A wonderful experience.

Worth a visit. Excellent experience to understand the process Rodin used to create his famous works. Examples of different sized models used to create The Thinker help to visualize how it had is workers do the heavy lifting. The Gates of Hell is something to see as well.

One of the most understated gems in Paris. This museum houses not only the great final works of Rodin, but also his working products, taking the visitor on a real journey into what it took to create such beautiful art. There are pieces throughout the grounds and also on the two floors of the museum. The price for entry is 10 euros and is a great deal for all you get.

Statuary in beautiful setting. This is a lovely garden filled with many of Rodin's most famous pieces. Do not miss the inside of the museum either in the house.If going to the D'Osay get a "deluxe comb" ticket and pay Ned save for both, then see the D'Orsay second. It is located across the street from Invalide. Best advice, eat lunch here! Best and cheapest meal in Paris.

The Paradise of Rodin. The large garden is the perfect setting for Rodin's fabulous sculptures. In classic style, the sculptures are scattered through the trees and round the lake. The cafe has a great menu and lovely shade trees. Then wander through the mansion to see many many more of Rodin's works, large and small. Wonderful.
Absolutely amazing. What a wonderful day, getting this close to this incredible work will stay with me for the rest of my life

Beautiful grounds and beautiful art.. I visited this museum in January of 2011. The grounds are absolutely beautiful with lovely greenery. The artwork itself is stunning. Some of the pieces were much larger than I expected. The space itself feels so beautifully historic. I wondered the entire time who else had walked through before me. Overall a very wonderful experience.

Good museum but unfriendly staff. Visited this museum which has a great display of Rodin's work. Museum closed earlier than I expected without any warning. I was not alone in being surprised at how quick everyone was marched to the exit. Didn't get to see the gardens with the works of art as security guards made sure no one got to have a quick look at end. Disappointing.

Wonderful. A very, very talented man left a treasure to the people of France with his work on display for all. The Thinker, The Kiss, and my favorite the Gates to Hell. Magnificent. It was a terrific couple of hours wandering through the former hotel and gardens. His reputation is well deserved

Peaceful gardens. Was not busy at all and its a great museum. Gardens are quite nice with nice display of sculptures, the thinker is the first. Inside was also nice and quiet with a good collection of sculptures and art. Enjoyed this place very much, highly recommend.

Just visit garden if in hurry ( for reduced rate). Was traveling with 17 yr old son...who was OVER museums...visited garden only for low price and even HE recognized The Thinker...and enjoyed other outdoor sculptures as well. Very near Napoleon's tomb...good double visit.

Garden is a good place to relax and picnic. Returned to the garden only, having previously seen the museum when it was still free. Now refurbished and a charge for entry. Can't complain at €4 entry for the garden packed with fantastic, if somewhat depressingly inspired, statues.

Lovely place to spend an afternoon!. This is such a great museum. The outdoor sculpture garden is magical. We paid for the audio tour and I really felt it was worth it. It provides important background for each sculpture that I felt enhanced my experience.

great collection. This is a great little museum dedicated to Rodin with a wonderful garden where you can appreciate the scale of his sculptures. One reviewer complained that there was only Rodin pieces - yes, it is the Rodin museum. There were a few pieces by Camille Claudel to spice up the drama. There was a short line up in March. I bought a combo ticket with the Musee d'Orsay and recommend asking for this if you are planning on visiting both. It saves a line up at the d'Orsay and there is a slight savings. I rented the audio guide but wish I didn't. I had lunch plans and when I asked how long it would take, was told 2 hr. Needless to say, I had hardly finished 3/4 of the house part of the museum by 2hr using the guide. The guide doesn't really tell you more than the excellent labels inside the museum but I do like Rodin. Sadly, the ticket does NOT allow you to re-enter. I therefore had to go back the next day and buy a garden only ticket. I thought this was rather poor on the museum's part but it is their policy.If you're not a big Rodin fan, I suppose you could just do the garden part but the information in the house does help you appreciate his process and his hardships. I would probably go back to this museum. But I recommend NOT to get the audio guide. That way you can go at your own pace and probably 2 but maybe closer to 3 hr would suffice.

Rainy day art. The gardens were mystical in the light drizzle of Paris in winter, the sculptures and art work inside was a treat. I followed a tour around some pieces to catch some stories, and really enjoyed learning the techniques and processes for how these sculptures were made. If your thing is art museums, this is a lovely one.

Amazing statues. Musee Rodin is filled with amazing sculptures. It is definitely worth a visit. The building is full of some of Rodin classic pieces and is absolutely something to be enjoyed. We really loved the garden. The garden is filled with all of his best pieces Gates of Hell, Thinker, Burghers of Calais, and many more. Plus there is a lovely little coffee shop. We visited during a rain storm in February and still enjoyed the garden...
Perfect on a warm sunny day. It's always a great change from the classic museum visit. The gardens are lovely and it's nice to see some of the sculptures outside.

The only museum we feel is worth a revisit in Paris . Wholly underrated, this museum is well worth a visit. Rodin has a way with sculpture to convey real depth of emotion combined with a dynamic sense of movement in his work. The museum offers a formal garden showcasing his larger works in bronze and marvel, including "the thinker" and the sublime "gates of hell". The interior of Rodin's residence offers a good glimpse of his working iterations and inspirations in smaller pieces. Well worth a visit.

Marvellous collection, serene gardens. I wasn't interested in sculpture, but I learned a lot and was surprised at how much I actually enjoyed this museum. There were paintings as well as sculptures by Rodin as well as people in his artistic circle. The Thinker sculpture is in the garden, and The Kiss is in the palace. Rodin's detailed sculpture is amazing, especially how he manages to convey emotion and movement in marble.A stroll in the lovely gardens would be a great activity for when you want to escape the crowds in the more touristy places. Free for EU residents aged 18-25, just show an ID or other document instead of a ticket.
Love the statues. I have always been a fan of Rodin. His work is as sexy as the city of Paris. A definite must do with the museum pass!
Worth a Visit!. The museum had just been renovated when we visited and is very well laid out. The gardens are very pretty and the art is sensational! Don't miss it!

Forget the Lines. Another Parisian jewel. Rodin must have spent all his waking hours sculpting. A marvelous collection and gardens. Within walking distance of other major attractions. It certainly was a relaxing place to visit.

Bring an Umbrella -- Even in the Summer!. Undoubtedly, the highlight of the Musee Rodin are the ample grounds outside, filled with Rodin sculptures. I advise you to bring an umbrella -- many of the bronze statues are set among a grove of trees, which birds are quite fond of. To avoid getting hit by bird droppings, an umbrella can be an excellent defense. The museum is close to a Metro stop but has little parking if you're planning to drive.

Splendid art. This is a must see if you have some time on your hands. This museum's part is in the gardens so do not plan it on the bad weather;) Rodin was a pure genius and his marble ceramics and especially bronze work is admirable! There is also a temporary exhibition in the building besides where you can see some nice Adams' photos at the moment and of course different other artists. The museum is just enough in size so in 2,5 hours you can make it and you won't have the rush feeling. The toilets are clean and do get the audio guide;)

The Thinker!. A pretty park like setting for amazing sculptures including the Thinker and the Gates of hell. Use the Museum Pass, and it was a great afternoon break. We went to the little cafe and had the best hot chocolate Viennois (with whipped cream).
Rodin's work beautifully displayed.. Brilliant! The gardens are beautiful, very good cafe / bar too. Inside, more of Rodin's work is displayed in a wonderful setting. Very good value.
Always a pleasure!. Nice to be in the place where the artist lived and worked. The gardens are charming. Its worth the time to sip a cafe there.

Serenely beautiful. The Musee Rodin is the best laid out museum of all those we visited. The audio guide is a great accompaniment that you can dip in and out of. Of course the sculptures are beautiful too!

More than one mark. After viewing the museum and the gardens everyone would agree the man was a genius, and extremely prolific. We`ve seen his work in three or four countries now and five or six different museums. He left more than his one mark on the world, but several. Even if he isn`t your favorite there is something about his work that seems mesmerizing. Try not to miss it.

Good but not very big. Didn't have to queue much at all to get in which was great! Lots of Rodin's artwork including early works and a variety of sculptures and paintings. The booklet guides were helpful to tell you where the most famous pieces were located in each room. Some of his large scale/most famous works such as the Thinker and Gates of Hell are located in the gardens.

Wonderful place on a sunny afternoon. What a joy to be in Rodin's gardens on a sunny French afternoon. The sculptures you know and love are all there, and you can learn more about them as you able round and take in the ambiance of the entire place. I believe Rodin found this place himself and chose it to represent him after he had left us - and he chose rather well. Take a moment and sit on the bench in front of The Gates of Hell - you'll need to try and take it all in!
Great grounds. Never one of my favorites - however - the gardens and layout are spectacular.- even in cold weather.
It Makes You Think. Rodin is our 2nd favorite museum in Paris. The history, interaction with other artists and works both inside and outside make this a unique venture worth visiting.
Wonderful. Beautiful garden setting for the building. A. Rodin was an incredible artist. His work lasted for many decades. Not to be missed.

Can't beat excellence. This place is stunning. The garden is excellent - it is beautifully laid out with cracking scuplures. There are good of the Eiffel Tower from a distance. The museum itself is also fab. Would encourage anyone to go to Rodin.
Amazing museum. A stroll in the gardens of this museum was one of the highlights of our trip. Beautiful work, amazing artist. It was incredible to see these works in person.

Paris Trip. This museum is a delight. Has many wonderful works of A. Rodin and others. Whether it's paintings, sculptures, or other pieces of art, this museum will hold your interest while you take it all in. It' s not as exhausting as the Louvre and might take you a few hours to take it all in. It is a peaceful setting and easy to relax while admiring Rodin' work.

Small and easy. This is a wonderful museum, well worth a visit even if you are only familiar with Rodin as far as The Thinker or Gates of Hell. The gardens are beautiful. There is much to see inside, and while well-attended it wasn't overwhelmingly crowded. If you are only interested, and not a true Rodin aficionado, you will be able to appreciate the museum in less than two hours. It is close to the Musee del Armee, so those are a good combo, especially if you have children.

Outstanding museum. An outstanding museum portraying the life and works of Rodin. We got there about 11 on a Saturday and very little queue and not too crowded. So worthwhile getting the audio guide. Both the garden and the museum were fabulous and we spent about 4 hours there.

Art lover's dream come true. Musee Rodin was our first stop on our first trip to Paris. Five years ago I wanted to visit the Rodin museum in Philly, but it was closed for renovations. The weather was perfect for looking at the gardens and outside sculpture. The mansion also houses many pieces from Rodin's personal collection.

Iconic. This museum, which was once Rodin's home, is well laid out, set up in a logical fashion and the gardens are a great balance.The Thinker and the Gates of Hell are awesome to see in person. They do not disappoint. The intricacies in the Gates of Hell is amazing. I can now say that I have been to the Gates of Hell and back.You can move quickly through the exhibits if you choose. My one word of advice is to get there early with pre-bought tickets. We arrived around 10ish with pre-bought tickets and were able to walk by the light to moderate line-up. Within an hour there was a significant queue.

Small musuem worth vist. Don't miss a chance to see some beautiful sculptures, by only hitting the better known musuems. I'm glad I stopped in here after visiting Napoleon's tomb. It's a beautiful site.
Great Museum. Interesting and lovely museum to visit. Lots to see and digest. If you are fan of Rodin then you cannot afford to miss a visit.

A little gem in Paris. Had not been back to this museum since it's renovation, what a fabulous job they have done. Beautiful building hosting amazing sculptures, very interesting, gardens are worth also a visit.
unless you really love his works. The works in the museum are worth seeing if you really love his works. go to d'Orsay or Louvre if you just want to kill the time.

Beautiful. This is one of the most beautiful museums in Paris if you'd like a moment out of the crowd and a bit of peace and quiet. Rodin's Thinker is amazing but there are so many beautiful statues here by him that are well worth a look. It's a great place in the city to feel a bit of seclusion and it's quite a nice walk from Napolean's Tomb. There are some of his early work inside as well as walking around the gardens which are beautiful even in winter. I highly recommend it and if you're heading from the Metro station École Militaire, stop off at Rue Cler for a pastry for the walk. I would visit every time I go to Paris for the relaxing atmosphere and great artwork.

Another hidden gem.. Avoid some of the crowds by going to these lesser known, but not less great museums. Seeing how these massive bronze casts were created gives a whole new appreciation of the true genius that was Rodin. Definitely get the audio guide as it really does add to the appreciation. The gardens are beautiful, but only the start, as the interior is tremendous as well. I do think these smaller museums are much more approachable with children rather than the Louvre or D'Orsay, which require so much more time.

Peaceful!. I visited the Musee Rodin with my mother-in-law and 9 year old son. For most of our "excursions" in Paris we hired a private guide but we did not have one for this visit. The Musee Rodin is small and didn't take a lot of time to get through for us. I'm sure some people could easily spend an entire day there though. There is a small indoor section and then the garden section. Most everything is in the garden section. The Gates of Hell, The Kiss, and The Thinker in my opinion were the highlights of the visit. There is a gift shop and a cafe that serves really good food. There was a line to get in to the museum-we arrived in the afternoon and the wait to get in was approximately 30-45 minutes.

Enjoyable. Small yet very informative museum with park. Set in past mansion. Rodin's The Thinker sits large outside - get a great picture with the Eiffel Tower behind him. Enjoyed viewing Rodin's many sketches of his sculptures- gift shop is excellent

My favorite museum in Paris. I love this place. The gardens are amazing, and the fact that the gates to hell and the thinker are out here doesn't hurt. While I love paintings and admittedly there are Matisse and Renoir paintings here, the sculptures are beautiful and it's easier to move around and spread out and enjoy them here.

Very enjoyable museum and grounds. You have seen a number of Rodin's sculptures in magazines and photos, but to see them up close and personal while looking at the in-depth features each one possesses is enlightening and special. The grounds are manicured and the museum itself is inside a former 18th century chateau. Several of the major sculptures are in the gardens outside and offer a great stroll through the grounds while observing the uniqueness. An easy museum to get through and an audio guide highlights Rodin, his works and his life.

Just the garden tour. We really only had a short time and wanted to see Rodin's thinker, so the museum had an option for 4 Euros to just visit the garden. It was a nice walk and we saw a good variety of his sculptures, including the thinker. Mission accomplished.

Peaceful Garden. Price for Museum and Garden: 10 Euros. Prices also available for garden only 4 Euros..The museum is interesting and comprehensive. There are many casts and forms; finished and unfinished. It also has a small gallery of Picasso and Monet on display. But the star of the show is the garden littered with full size casts of Rodin's famous sculptures. It is a quiet and relaxing place to spend an hour or two.There are clean washrooms in the museum and the garden. The museum and garden both appeared to be wheelchair accessible. There is a small gift shop.
Terrific Museum. Recently renovated with masterpieces inside and in the garden. The garden itself is beautiful. Great audioguide.
Charming building and wonderful sculptures. We spent around an hour roaming the garden and also the art indoors. It is a truly peaceful and aesthetically pleasing place to be.

Must see if you are museum goer. Everything in this museum is awesome. The building and the gardens are worth the visit and then the scuptures are the icing on the cake. On this my third visit to Paris made the effort to see this museum and regretted not getting there previously.

Crown jewel in a city of artists. This place is very hard to describe because more than any museum I have ever visited it speaks to the heart. Rodin applied 3 times to the Academy of Arts and was rejected by the conformist selection committee. Let's be thankful for that, because it forced him to find his own unique path to express himself. The inside of the museum shows his development as an artist, his ideas on what he wanted to become a museum, models of his work and many of the smaller miracles that he created, like Paolo and Francesca in the clouds, the dancers and a large version of the famous 'kiss'.Come on a sunny day and enjoy the gardens where large versions of his most famous work can be found: the gates of hell, the thinker and many many more. Although you can see everything in 45 minutes it is very well worth taking at least 3 hours to sit down on some of the many benches and just try to take it in, see how it speaks to you. There is a nice cafe in the garden that serves good coffee and a decent priced lunch, so one can even spend the whole day here.Probably my favorite museum on the planet.

What a sculpture garden and museum!. See many of the hundreds of sculptures of this prolific artist on display inside the museum and then continue outside in the gardens for many more. A great guidebook for Paris museums and other sights is the Paris 2016 by Rick Steves. He guides you through all museums and sights with suggest as to how to do each visit on a limited time schedule.

Great afternoon out. Really good and interesting museum. The gardens are lovely and the restaurant was superb (can not recommend the duck enough!). Museum interesting about Rodin's works and as a self-sustaining museum seeing the business plan in action was very cool.

Incredible train station with incredible pieces of art. Discover Rodin masterpices in this station built in 1900.The location itself is a fine piece of art, what's displayed is even more incredible. Camille Claudel....
Recommended . I'm not very much interested in sculptures but i really enjoyed it, the museum includes also some paintings, i recommend Musee Rodin to everyone visiting Paris.

Paris Paradise. This perfect museum offers a stunning location and a placid pond where statures dot the garden like ornamental trees. The overall effect is a magically tranquil place where art, architecture and garden mesh to form a perfect museum in the heart of Paris.A garden café is a amazing place to rest, enjoy lunch or sketch a view. I would make this a MUST- SEE stop on anyone's Paris vacation.
Small but nice. We were there and we could see all the exibition in less than 4 hours. Very interesting not only Rodin, but also Van Gogh and Rembrant samples. Worth the visit
Spring and Summer Treat. Even if you do not go inside the museum, the gardens and statues are wonderful. Great experience for artists, photographers or just for the pleasure of your eyes.

A beautiful property for art lovers in the middle of Paris. Wonderful Rodin sculptures outside in the gardens and inside, with all manner of other artworks and models inside.
We were delighted with ease with which we accessed this (mid week) and the lack of pressure to keep moving while easily viewing close-up his most famous works.
Excellent refurbishment. The museum and garden have recently been refurbished and and even if you are not a Rodin fanatic, well worth a visit - and a nice contrast to Invalides just next door

Sculpture Vulture?. Im not one. But it was very nice to visit here on a cold overcast day. Great insight into the sculptor and of his work, a few of which can also be seen in other places around Paris. But for the complete Rodin picture this is the only place to go. No tips here except that across the road is the Military Museum and over the river the Grand and Petite Palace.

Delightful. This small museum is located in the centre of Paris and houses beautiful works by Rodin and some of his contemporaries. There are gardens to enjoy as well as a restaurant serving tasty food.

Indispensible if you like Rodin. This museum includes a great many sculptures and paintings by Rodin. If you like his work, you need to visit this museum. If you don't (or aren't sure), go to the Orsay and see what's there -- they have a lot of Rodin's stuff as well. The sculptures in the garden are especially interesting.

Great museum!. I'm a big fan of Rodin so this was definitely in my bucket list during my trip to Paris.There weren't particularly that much people so there wasn't a line to take a picture with The Thinker.I had the Museum Pass so I got in right away!
Long queues!. There are tots of statues in the gardens and more inside. You have to pay extra to see the indoor statues, like the kiss and jion another queue to do so.
The Sculptures <3. Beautiful sculptures everywhere you look. The gardens are very well taken care of.We had broccoli soup in the restaurant, and it was fabulous!!!

Amazed. The man was a genius with a chisel, and at taking away what he didn't need and leaving us with a piece of art that touches the heart. When you look into the eyes of stone you can feel the pain, passion and or love or whatever emotion Rodin wanted to expose he did it quite magically. The gardens and the museum are small and that suits me fine. As a photographer I spent quite a lot of time taking portraits of the statues and annoying others. The photos were a success and worth the annoyance. It was last week and I was lucky with the weather.

Probably best in summer. The statues in the garden provided the most interesting part of this museum and therefore I would recommend you go in the summer months. The inside was fine, although we had to queue for quite a long time to gain access. Plenty of good stuff inside but much of it was smaller scale works of the statues outside, so a trifle repetitive.

Lovely building, garden and sculpture in the city. I really enjoyed this but my 19 year old daughter said she is more a painting person when we were done. The building is lovely as are the gardens. A nice tranquil spot in the middle of the city. The audio guide was good but limited. I would recommend it.
Great. I enjoyed this very much. The sculptures in the gardens. Just the fact that it was his home is very cool.

Spectacular. What a way to send a Sunday afternoon in Paris. Beautiful venue, walking around gardens viewing the sculptures was chilly but so worth it. Musee Rodin was easy to navigate also, map and audio guide easy to follow. Easy access from the Metro.

Small but impressive. On the same street as the famous L`Arpege -3 Michelin star restaurant the museum sheds a light on this famous sculptor that is most known for the " the Thinker " and "the Kiss " and being small is very pleasant to contemplate . Has some other great artists works Like E. Munch`s take on the "Thinker "

Impressive sculptures in a lovely garden. Best to visit this museum on a sunny day in late spring or summer, as the top works are displayed in the garden. The garden is large enough that it doesn´t feel crowded, but that is different for the museum inside, which easily gets crowded although entrance is limited so there might be a queue to get inside. In the garden are displayed the large bronze sculptures, such as the thinker, the gates of hell, Balzac and the citizens of Calais, as well as studies for these sculptures. Inside, as well as in a sealed of glass room in the garden, are displayed mostly plaster and marble sculptures. Rodin reused many of his sculptures again and again, generally to good effect.

Hommage to Rodin. This is a museum inside and out with examples of Rodin's skill that span the years. He is one of my favorites and I was not disappointed in the collection which is where he had worked.

Fantastic museum tucked away near the Invalides. If you are interested in sculptures, this is the place to go to.. with sculptures of the famous Rodin's Thinker and various others in the open and many more inside..

Great museum. They built a great museum out of Rodin's home. Really nice museum and beautiful garden where many sculptures are exposed.I had the chance to visit it after the reopening last November and I recommend it to art lovers.

Third dimension. We are devoted to Rodin,as is easy to be. For an artist to perceive meticulously in three dimensions is a refinement. For him to be prolific in this physical medium is genius. Lighted gallery walls are appropriate for paintings. For large sculptures a garden is just the ticket. Nearby to Napoleon's tomb, this is a can't miss

Lovely gardens. This Musee has a bit of everything so everyone. A beautiful building housing interesting pieces, a beautiful garden containing many statues and a nice looking cafe. We spent a good part of the morning wondering around.
Beautiful Museum !. This museum is stunning! Beautiful garden ! Very good value for money. Excellent restaurant in the garden. Very good salads and cakes!
Great museum. This museum is a must see for those interested in Rodin (obviously) or in sculpture generally. Wonderful museum and beautiful grounds.

Thinking. Museum in the house is great. There is also an amazing sculpture garden. You can pay for both, or just the garden. The garden is great for a relaxing stroll or bring your lunch and enjoy the view.
Favorite Museum in Paris. Do yourself a favor...Spend less time at the Louvre, more time enjoying the gardens and sculpture at this museum!

Beautiful - great stories. Definitely buy the audio guide. The stories of Rodin's early days and his relationships, particularly with Camille Claudel made the sculptures come alive. We went in March, so the gardens weren't blooming, but I've read in the spring and summer they are magnificent. I have to admit that seeing the art and sculptures in the setting of this beautiful house makes it better for some reason.
A great museum.. The sculpture in the gardens is well worth it. The "Thinker" and "Gates to Hell" are spectacular and well-known, but the many other works were great to see.

So many exhibits. Having been recently renovated, it was an excellent opportunity to see the wide range of work accomplished by Rodin and his "associates"; the museum is filled with a variety of works of art accomplished in a variety of media. Being a combination of both internal and external exhibits, it is preferable to visit on a day when it is not raining.

Sculpture Garden!!!. We really enjoyed the sculpture garden and having coffee at the café. The chocolate dessert with a small chocolate on top was fantastic. Very peaceful and relaxing on a Thursday afternoon.

Magic. This is a real must see for sculpture lovers.The house is where Rodin spent most of his final years and reflects his wonderful knack for storytelling through sculpture. You can spend hours in the gardens looking at the statues and discussing the finer points of "The thinker" and its meaning.

Disappointed . I have been to this museum many times and was anxiously awaiting to see the new renovations. There are far too pieces cramped together to get a proper perspective. Before you could stroll through, stop and reflect and was uncrowned. Too bad, Rodin was one of the finest of sculptures, each piece so intricate and unique. If only visiting, ( I live here) take the time but go early and during the week or plan a visit with a guide.

The sculpture gardens are the best part…. We enjoyed our visit to Musee Rodin, especially the sculpture garden which was full of his most famous works. Inside the museum I was delighted to discover several paintings by Van Gogh, Renior and Monet! Sculpture and paintings! Perfect.

A must see when in Paris!. was last here about 5 years ago and glad I went again, they have added different pieces to the collection display. AN amazing display of Rodin's collection of work. Always a great stop for lunch as well, the food is very good at a reasonable price. Visit in the warmer months and eat in the garden. What can be better!

More than Amazing. The work of Rodin was one of my great desires in coming to Paris. What I didn't expect was the whole new perspective that seeing his works, his home and studio, that at its not a simple process, not is every piece of work a single creation. The multiple versions of his works and their transformation from paper to plaster to marble or bronze address beautifully illustrated and presented at the museum. The artist was born playful and serious. He saw the world's the way that he saw it, and created out of that passion and emotion expressing love, passion, beauty. In the context of the home he lived in and the gardens that surround it though get a sense of his love for beauty and his own perspective of what that means. This newly renovated Museum is beautiful and without being teachy gives you not only beautiful art, but a sense of the man and his creative process. Worth the trip.

Disappointment. I've visited the museum several times over the years and was looking forward to its reopening. Not sure where all the money went. Poorly laid out. No explanations in the rooms giving historical or other context. Very crowded with groups despite being the slow season. Sculptures still amazing and garden lovely but a return visit is low on my list.
Disappointed. We had visited the museum years ago and were anxious to see the renovation. Way way too many pieces and so crowded together it was hard to get an all around view

another must for limited time visitors. If the weather is nice especially- this is a magical place to visit. Come early walk around the interior and then take a coffee and see the magnificent sculpture garden. Took me back to Rodin's time. Super special.
Great Visit. Wonderful sculptures by Rodin that gives you great incite to the artist life along with beautiful gardens. This "Hotel Particular" is truly a treasure in Paris and should not be missed.

Garden is great even is you don't want to pay to go round the house. There is a lot of lovely stuff to see in the gardens, even on a bad weather day. We only spent an hour wandering around the garden and it was enough, but lovely.

Lovely in the Spring Sunshine. A very reasonable 10 Euros gets you into to a little gem of a museum with sculptures from Rodin littered all over the grounds. A little oasis amongst the rustle and bustle of some of Paris' other attractions. Very close also to a seriously good restaurant too.

This is the place for scuptures. We bought the combined Musee d'Orsay and Musee Rodin ticket and had a lovely stroll here after lunch. The gardens are quite lovely but this museum is specifically for those who enjoy sculptures. .

of sculptures and gardens. I have always wanted to see 'The Thinker' spring to life. And I have done just that and seen more of his amazing works. Unfortunately, the main museum was under renovation when we visited, but 'The Thinker' and his other great works were available for viewing in the gardens.
Cozy but vast.. The Musee Rodin is a wonderful stop on any Paris trip. While small in size it is huge in inspiration.

Beautiful, Cozy Museum and Gardens. The Musée Rodin is a splendid little museum in the 7th Arrondissement. The collection, housed in The Hôtel Biron and its gardens, is small but lovely. Many come to see The Thinker, and it is certainly worth a stop, but Le Baiser (The Kiss) and other pieces are equally worthwhile.The museum is covered by Museum Pass and is free on Sundays!

Morning visit. The museum is renovated and opened in march 2016. It is beautifull inside the mainbuilding. You defenitely must use the audio-guide. It helps you to understand the sculptures and seroundings better. Its worth the €6 per person

Came for The Thinker but left.... I was quite surprised by this musuem. I came to see The Thinker but left loving The Kiss and moved by . What was really neat is seeing this last piece in the movie Monuments Men!! It touched me that I was able to enjoy this piece because of the sacrifice of those men.

Sculpture Lovers. We went on the free entry Sunday just after the museum opened, and the queue was only 5 minutes to get in. Lovely sunny day so we enjoyed the garden. The house is newly refurbished, muted colours on the walls show off the sculpture. Maybe a few too many of them, as the plaster casks seem to have been included. Also a few impressionist paintings from Rodin's collection. Some interesting photos of him at work, and one amazing video of him chipping away.

Beautiful setting. Well, maybe 3 1/2 stars.I have never really been a Rodin fan and this museum did not change my mind.On the plus side:- the building and grounds are beautiful.- included on the museum pass.- easy to get to by the Metro.Negatives:- tight and crowded in the mansion, even on the off season.- better museum choices if your time is short.

Pay homage to one of the greatest modern sculptors of Europe. Another must-see for art lovers visiting Paris. Rodin's powerful work is displayed brilliantly through the sprawling grounds and buildings of this Museum. The permanent exhibition is a historical narrative of the tumultuous life and times of this Father of modern European sculpture.

Less visited museum . There weren't many people when we went to visit! It was raining a bit so we didn't get to fully enjoy the gardens but did do a quick loop around them. Both my boyfriend and I are in wheelchairs and were extremely pleased at how accessible the gardens and the museum were. There's also a café/restaurant you can visit in the gardens if you please.

Small museum in a large park. This museum houses sculptures and a few paintings by Rodin. Also, there are some artworks by other artists (Monet, van Gogh, etc.), collected by Rodin.The building is small, and it takes only one hour to see all the exhibits inside. If you have some more time, just go around the big park. It is large and pretty, scattered with sculptures by Rodin, one of which is the famous 'thinker'.

More than sculptures. Worth a visit on a first time in Paris or even on a return trip. Lots of interesting display both inside and in the garden. More than sculptures, there are also paintings by Van Gogh, Renoir and Monet on display. The new musée Rodin reopened November 12 ,2015. It provides a great visitor experience, clear & flowing thru the buildings/garden with a great map and details on the sculptures/paintings. Enjoyed our visit & will return.

Nice and small museum . Nice museum, children friendly, but leave the scooter / trottinettes at home. The cafeteria in the garden serves nice food for very decent prices. The museum itself is recently renovated and the collection is unique.

The Rodin museum is recently renovated. The Rodin museum is recently renovated and has a significant Rodin collection,inside and out - not many other artists are represented. It is easy to reach by subway.

Good study of Rodin's pricess. We spent our first morning at this museum. The inside museum shows sculptures of various kinds in many stages of completion. The incomplete marbles give insight into the process of releasing the bodies from the stone. There is also an interesting animation of the bronze casting process. Many if his bronzes started as plaster sculptures done by hand and there were many of those shown. Most (not all) large sculptures were outside in the gardens. The cold clear blue skies made lovely photos.

Fantastic. While Rodin is most famous for "The Thinker" and "The Kiss", both of which are on display, I didn't realize that both of those were inspired by his structure "The Gates of Hell"; also on display. It was interesting to see all the sculpture created as practice or to work out a scheme for a final work. The sculpture in the garden were interesting. I only wish I could see it in the spring when the roses are in bloom.

Wonderful museum..... exhibits, sculpture and pieces of artwork set in the most beautiful grounds of a wonderful house. If you like Rodin's work a visit here is a must. See many famous pieces together in this collection both inside and out. Sit in the garden and enjoy the space whilst at the same time marvelling at the dome of Les Invalides visible over the wall through the trees.
keep it on your list. great small musuem be sure to give it a go, Haven't been in years but planning on going this september with husband who has never seen it

A real treasure, what a treat. The Rodin sculpture gardens are extraordinary. You should try to arrive early to avoid long lines. We arrived at opening time and had a wonderful time strolling through the gardens taking in the art treasures. There is a nice place where you can get something to eat or for us some fine french wine. The Thinker and The Gates of Hell are featured and by themselves would be worth the visit.

Great Museum, great Garden!. I enjoyed allot this museum. They had original and famous art pieces. I liked it much better than Picasso museum, since it has much more of the artist great works.The garden is amazing.

Best appreciated from the garden!. Was keen to visit the newly opened Musee Rodin, very close to Army Museum. The scale and number of sculptures means they are best viewed in their garden situation, with space to walk around each one. The gardens are well laid out in their own right and must be beautiful in the summer when the roses are out. The large Hotel de Borin where Rodin rented rooms has been carefully renovated and updated for the convenience of visitors/tourists and contains interesting exhibits from Rodin's working life as a sculptor and painter as well as paintings by his contemporaries, such as Monet and Van Gogh. However, even at this time of year it felt crowded and slightly cramped - perhaps too many exhibits for the space?

Loved the size of this Musee - quite manageable for a morning visit (inside and out).. with both the gardens and the Musee proper you are spoiled with ample pieces of the masters work. I was there in winter but the garden could be enjoyed more fully in the Summer, perhaps even a picnic as it is a gorgeous environment. Would love to see the trees in full flourish
The Thinker. It's worth seeing some of Rodin's famous master works including The Thinker. Sculptures are spread in the garden as well as inside.

Amazing number of exhibits. I had no idea how prolific Rodin was. Don't know how he found the time! There is a good gift shop. The cafe is worth a visit and serves delicious fare at reasonable prices. Overall a good experience.

WOW - forget the musee, just check out the garden.. If you enjoy art and especially sculpture, or even if you don't you won't regret a visit to the garden. Sculpture after Sculpture here and there, you'll love it trust me.

A must for art lovers. If you like sculpture this museum is like visiting Mecca. The collection is very nicely presented in the beautiful building. After your visit don't forget to step into the gardens to find more treasures as well as a pleasant and well deserved rest.
hidden secret of paris. A charming, inspiring, hidden secret of the 7ieme - the musee ordain contains the worlds ;arrests collection of the master's sculptures set around a magical garden.

Beautiful esthetic and pleasant. You can go to the Rodin MuseumFor the quality of the collectionFor enjoying the garden that is part of the museum and for the beauty and serenityThis place look like so famousThere was an 30 mins wait before to purchase ticket and 30 mins more to enter inside the museumBut it s worth itEven if you are not fan of sculpture

First trip back after November 2015 Re-opening. The Rodin has always been favorite in Paris, if only for the relaxed, garden display of wonderful works. Now the interior matches the exterior gardens. It remains a must visit.. and re-vist.

Museum packed with exquisite pieces. My first visit to this wonderful museum. I hadn't realised Rodin was so prolific. Wonderful to see film footage when Rodin was resident in the property. Highly recommended.

Maybe a bit too much. Recently opened again. The park and the building are beautiful. Rodin has made a number of masterpieces and these are certainly worth seeing. Also interesting to see the process leading to the final piece. However at the end it was a bit too much detail and variations on a theme.

Beautiful Musee!. My visit through this Musee was brief but loved all the gardens and all the Arts has been created in several ages and everyone giving examples of how great ages passed over the time, it was a sunny beautiful day.
don't give it a miss.

Rodin Highlights. The museum consists of a large, well maintained garden with many sculptures throughout the lawns, and also a large mansion with two floors of art and history. "The Thinker" is a highlight - set in the garden in a well manicured area. "The Kiss" is inside the museum, as well as many of Rodin's smaller sculptures. We spent about a total of 3 hours in the gardens and buildings.

Another Perfect Paris Treasure!. We waked to the Rodin from our hotel. They have audio guides in English so you know what you are seeing in the museum and in the garden. The garden is truly special. This is a must see museum.

Musee Rodin. Visited on a beautiful sunny day ,it was cold so not too crowded .Figures /works are placed around the gardens so plenty of space to view from all angles. Walking through the house was a little more difficult especially as I got caught up with 2 guided tours crowding round pieces , no problem moved on to next room then returned when they had moved on .Spent 4 hours there could easily stayed longer ,took a break for lunch in the café ,but think that you can reach a saturation point and cant take on board any more information .Would visit again with fresh eyes. Brought a combined ticket at reduced price D'Orsay and Rodin museums valid for 3 month @18 euros .

Beautiful on a sunny winters day . My teenage children are art freaks and immensely enjoyed this museum. A manicured garden with beautiful sculptured works by Rodin placed throughout the garden. The Mansion has a great collection as well. Thoroughly enjoyed the visit. Also a short walk to the Eiffel Tower if you want to visit afterwards.. You get to see the Eiffel Tower popping up between streets and buildings which gave us great photographs.
A lovely, peaceful, sculpture-stuffed corner of Paris. Who knew how prolific Rodin was? Just chock-full of amazing sculpture, and also his paintings too. The garden and building alone are lovely.

Wonderful sculpture garden and museum. One of our favourite places in Paris. The sculptures are gorgeous, both the large pieces outside and the smaller ones in the house. There are also some amazing exhibitions like Rodin/Mapplethorpe last year!

Beautiful Gardens and unbelievable art. This place is certainly worth visiting, but I would not go in winter as the garden will not be quite as spectacular. It is a great place you want to relax, view architecture or you are there with children 6+ years old.

More than I expected. Rodin was a commercial artist-- he re-used a lot of his ideas. Happily, this museum shows more than the dozen or so familiar images. Yes, you will learn a lot about the Burghers of Calais/ Gates of Hell/ Balzac, but I saw unfamiliar pieces, and learned a great deal about Rodin's working process. The house itself was beautiful, and the gardens were enjoyable even in the middle of winter.

A Must See When In Paris!. We ended up seeing this on a rain day and wish we had done on a sunny day to see the gardens. The museum is very well laid out and the audio guide is excellent to follow along. His works were amazing and a not miss while in Paris.
Famous artist great art. A very special small museum and sculpture garden . Don't miss the Homo sapience famous sculpture . Main building maybe still under renovation. A must in Paris .
Spectacular. So many wonderful sculptures were in this museum! We enjoyed each and everyone. Rodin sculpted so beautifully, wonderful romantic positions of the male and female figure.

Rodin Rocks. Favorite museum in all of the world. Gives you an opportunity to experience the full range of Rodin's creative genius. The interior of the museum has been improved greatly. The grounds are fantastic. Been rated as the most romantic museum in the world, with which I would agree.

Do not miss this Museum on any trip to Paris. Recently reopened this museum is a must see not only for the lovely gardens but for the sculptures in the gardens themselves but the exhibits in the main space.
Checkout the Gardens. The museum just recently re opened after renovations and is better than ever. If you mainly want to see Rodin's sculptures just pay the 2 euros to see just the garden. Fabulous.

Think about it first. Like all museums and galleries in Paris this isn't cheap to get in and it really has only the one big draw card.The gardens are lovely and the house contains a few other interesting pieces but if you're not really an art or sculpture fan I would suggest you save your entrance fee for a bigger museum with more to see.

A museum focused on the artist Rodin.. Fans of Rodin will appreciate this museum. For me, it was a little anti-climatic after visiting Musee du Louvre, but on a nice day the grounds outside are very nice to stroll around as well as a break in the café. The sculpted shrubs brought to mind a scene in "Midnight in Paris".

More interesting than you first think. I thought I'd kill an hour or two here on a hot day - the gardens looked to be a green and cool sanctuary from a bustling morning peak-hour. But my "hour or two" became three and finally four ! I'm not a sculpture lover per se, but this fella Rodin (and his contemporaries) were pretty clever and gifted. House was still under wraps when I was there , but the gardens were full of interest for me (House now open based on more recent reviews). Nice cafe spot under the trees inside, and a lively slower pace of life once inside the compound walls of this attractive and informative museum.

One of my favorite Museums in Paris!. As a lesser known museum, this felt like a treasure to behold. Rodin's sculptures are scattered throughout a french garden, making them even more beautiful than they already were.
More than the garden. Most of the reviews and guide books on this were about the sculpture garden but I enjoyed the art in the house even more. Don't miss out by only seeing the garden.
Great for Rodin fans. You know all I really wanted to do here was take a picture with the thinker and that's just what I did. Awesome that the Parisians have kept this place up. It's beautiful.
Well worth a visit. A nice sculpture park (even it was winter) and a museum well worth visiting. In addition to sculptures, the museum also have other art. It can be crowded.

Sleeping in a garden. This place has two parts to visit: the museum and the garden. During the summertime it's lovely sitting and reading on a bench in the garden while you can look at Rodin's statues, like "The thinker"... and it's really easy to fall asleep! Then there is still the museum with Rodin's work, it's not crowded at all and it doesn't take too long. If you have some time to spend, I suggest you to stop here!

But you do have to like Rodin. ... because there ain't much else. Fortunately Rodin is easy to like, and a better sculptor than he's given credit for being. The museum, to its great credit, has included works by Camille Claudel, his mentally unstable pupil, who was so gifted that Rodin wasn't above claiming some of her work as his own. All your favourites are here: The Kiss, the Burghers of Calais, The Thinker, and loads of surprises too.

A must see for any sculpture enthusiast!. A great museum of a great artist. All of the Rodin's pieces are magically incorporated with architecture of the building, creating unique atmosphere and unforgettable experience.

After years of renovation- a disappointment. After being closed for years, I went here full of expectations that it would really be special. The renovation had more to do with fixing the physical structure than making a good museum. It is very crowded, they do not provide anywhere to sit, except on window sills, and the whole feeling inside is very stilted, even on a winter's day when there weren't that many people. I can't even imagine what it would be like in summer. There is also the severe problem of toilets: one in a basement, one on the second floor. The second floor has only one cubicle(!!) and endless numbers of women waiting to get in. Unfortunately, the day I was there the garden and cafe were closed because of a storm.There is no place inside the museum to eat or drink anything.Very poorly thought out, and it does a great disservice to Rodin's beautiful sculptures.They simply cannot be seen as well as they should be.

A must if you love Rodin!. Very interesting collection of Rodin's art pieces. The "Portes de l'enfer" is a must to see and so interesting. I was a little disappointed that there was only one sculpture from Camille but nevertheless, very interesting.

Arty Afternoon. You only need 1-2 hours to see this museum and the sculptures are bloody brilliant. The weather was not great when we went so there wasn't much chance for mulling around the garden and as a result the actual chateau was a bit crowded. Nevertheless this is a special place and well worth a visit if you enjoy Rodin.

Peaceful with great works of art. I got here about 1.30pm two days before Christmas, and there wasn't really a queue to get in. I'd spent the morning at the nearby Musée de l'Armée so thought I'd head here. Had to go through the now obligatory security, but this was more a check of what was in my rucksack than anything else. Buying a ticket was fairly easy too in the modern ticket hall - there are free maps to pick up there too as well as toilets and the usual gift shop.You can then head through the gardens to see an outdoor replica of The Thinker. Inside, you have to check your bag in (for free) and then head around the museum. I'm not a huge sculpture person but found it really interesting. The Kiss is about half way around, along with The Thinker (they're in the room straight in front of you as you walk in, but you can't get there until you walk around). The gardens are also worth a look around too and would be ideal if you wanted to eat a picnic in (or visit the cafe). Whether sculpture is your bag or not, this place is definitely worth a visit if you want a bit of peace and quiet in the city.

Five stars if you love Rodin. The museum was being renovated during my trip, so we spent the afternoon in the garden, wandering among the sculptures. The setting is the hotel and gardens where Rodin worked for some of his time in Paris. The beautifully landscaped grounds set off the statues perfectly. I think you can bring a picnic, but if not, the cafe had some nice selections. My favorite sculptures were the Thinker, because of its position, and Eve, because, well, she's my favorite. You can examine the sculptures up close and see the detail. It's a different experience than you get in a museum.
Beautiful. A much more calming experience than many of the chaotic museums of Paris. The gardens are beautiful and serene, with a great view of Invalides and the Eiffel Tower.

An Oasis in the middle of Paris. This museum is a welcome, quiet oasis in the middle of Paris. Even though we went before the new building opened, we still thoroughly enjoyed our walk through the sculpture garden.
Highly recommend grabbing a quick lunch or snack at the cafeteria in the gardens and eating al-fresco on a nice summer day.
Amazing works. Go late just before closing and you get the building to yourself. Wander around the gardens first.malso use a museum pass to beat the queues.
Average visit. The only place we visited that was not exactly a wow. But i do feel the rain in the morning dampened our visit.
Here is The thinker!. It was something to see the famous sculpture so closely, even in the rain. There are a number of other ones but nothing compared to the thinker.

Deserve so much more reputation. Beautiful little atelier of Rodin.
I was even able to understand camille claudel after visiting here..
You can enjoy masterpieces of centuries!

Interesting and different. I'm in Paris, expect to be seeing paintings galore. Forgot about sculptors for a moment. Very interesting change of pace from the larger museums plus the building is interesting in its own right as its not like the more well known huge museums

The Greatest Sculptor's Best Museum. In my opinion, Auguste Rodin is the greatest sculptor. His museum in Philadelphia is superb, but the Musee Rodin in Paris gets the nod for beauty and the comprehensiveness of the collection. It is all here: "The Thinker", "The Kiss", and other favorites. Make this a "must-stop" while visiting Paris.
Must see!. Artists will find inspiration for a lifetime here! Must listen to the commentary (audio guide) to appreciate the full impact of Rodin's dedication, struggle and success.

Rodin`s monumental sculptures in the garden. We stopped by the Rodin Museum for an hour stroll before visiting Les Invalides on a Saturday afternoon. As in August the museum`s door were closed due to restoration works we took a walk through the wonderful gardens surrounding it, where many of the representative works of Rodin are displayed.
