Lots of amazing sculpures by differnt artists through out the garden, though Rodin is most prominent. Paintings and sculptures in the single two-story building. Can have long lines to get in, so go early in the day.
Beautiful place on a fine day!. Loved the gardens and the wonderful sculpture. Not so good on a wet day, but there is art inside as well as outside. Definitely worth visiting and more than once.

A Warm and Wonderful Place to Visit. I visited all of the sights and art museums in Paris so the only place left was the Rodin Museum. I wasn't all that anxious to go there -- I had seen "The Thinker" more times than I care to mention -- but I went anyway. Was I ever surprised and delighted! There are numerous sculptures on display there, each one perfectly crafted. If I ever return to Paris, I will certainly visit the Rodin Museum again.

Christmas Market. A second visit to the Musee Rodin because I love walking around the gardens even in the cold weather as long as it's not raining. What a wonderful gift Rodin made to the city. This is a must see if you enjoy sculpture.

Definitely worth a trip. This museum is a very pleasant experience - with both inside and outside hosting displays. I particularly enjoyed the garden. Worthy of note is the excellent cafe/restaurant in the garden - fabulous coffee and amazing Patisserie selection! (They also do full lunches and wines etc...)

You must, Must, MUST visit this museum when in Paris. While away a few hours in a truly pleasant oasis in Paris. Visit this house (beautiful) and wander through the extensive gardens that are truly beautiful and a true delight. As you wander through the gardens you will see scattered throughout sculpture from a true genius at the art, be inspired by some of the most well known works of Rodin - the Thinker, The Kiss, The burghers of Calais, The Gates of Hell.. it is a true delight. The curator is also amazingly creative, when I visited there was an exhibition comparing the work of Rodin to Robert Maplethorpe - who would have thought that they had a style that was in sympathy. A beautiful, creative and inspiring place to visit and contemplate - just as Rodin's 'The Thinker' does in the amazing gardens of this beautiful museum.
Well worth a visit. Excellent temporary exhibition explaining background to the most famous sculptures, which can then be viewed in the extensive gardens
Love the sculpture!!!!!. really love all the sculptures there, amazing collection. i would love to stay there all day and take a good look in the detail of all sculptures.
Small and great!. You can't miss it!Easy to access via Metro, not that expensive (EUR 9,00 full fare) and really beautiful as a place.The gardens are well maintained and the interior is quite nice.

Fantastic if you like sculpture.. A 'must do' for art lovers and 'go if you can' if you are not! There is also the lovely garden to occupy the gardening types.I adore Rodin so I was quite happy sketching away or if it is raining, take lots of photographs and sketch at home in the dry and warm!Well worth a visit.

Badly managed museum despite nice sculpture display. We went in at 4:30pm, was told when buying the tickets that the museum/garden would close at 5:45pm (official hour till 6 pm). we were fine with it. But then, after we swiftly visited the museum and was proceeding to the garden to see the sculpture there at 5:25pm, we were asked by the security guard to leave! How could they just close the garden early as they wish?? If we had known earlier, we would not go inside the museum to start with.

beautiful garden. You got enough just visiting the garden. You can spend more than 2 hours just with the garden itself, and there are a lot of pieces showing there. You can enjoy a coffee or a hot tea or soup at the cafe that is in the garden and you have your day done! I totally recommend it, the walk through the garden will give you that moment of inner peace that you need to keep going in the parisine turmoil...

a Place to remember. Standing in the midst of authentic parisian streets, in this bourgeois builduing nice and cosy..nota to mention the obvious, the pieces exposed. Not a fatigating source of contemplation as most of museums. Worth visiting
Lovely place. For all the sculpture lovers, a wonderful place to go - it's not too big and it has a lovely park around - recommend it ;)

Beautiful Peaceful Garden and Home. If you are visiting Paris you owe it to yourself to visit Robins house and garden. The gardens are amazingly quiet behind 3 meter high walls. The house is located North of Les Invalides and when we visited the gardens were filled with sculptures on exhibition from a nearby gallery. This is a consistent attraction for all our visitors and highly recommended. You can buy tickets online which I recommend to avoid the long lines, and there are some discounts if you buy a pass featuring both Rodin and Musee d'Orsay. http://www.musee-rodin.fr/
Peaceful gardens. The gardens are even better than the museum. The Thinker is really well worth the admission price alone, and the Gates of Hell is really impressive.

My new favorite Paris museum!. A museum primarily dedicated to the life and works of Auguste Rodin, the exhibit also contains works by Van Gogh, Renoir and Camille Claudel. Well attended without being crowded, we were able to take our time and leisurely walk through both the main house and the gardens. Many, if not most, of Rodin's works are displayed, and the audio guide had "added features" which gave additional information on topics such as Rodin's technique and turn-of-the-century exhibitions. The garden, while quite beautiful on its own, was enhanced with sculptural displays throughout. There is also a cafe on the grounds. This museum can easily be seen in a morning or an afternoon--or on a beautiful day, why not take more time and make a leisurely day of it?

Easily the best museum.. Delightfull park, bourgeoise house, very nice sculptures, le vieux paris, madame, in it's glory.Go there with some paper and a pen, be Auguste yourself, very inspiring, and authentic place.A place you'll have NOT to miss in Paris ( with the Dina Vierny fundation )

best thing in paris. We loved this because it was about his work, without any pretentiousness. The museum gardens are the most relaxing place we found in Paris, while other museums might have a lot of 'stuff' this was insightful and enjoyable. If the weather is nice then I would say take your time, have a sit down and just enjoy his work!
More than worthy of a visit. For those who want a better understanding of Rodin's work and sculpture in general. The setting alone merits a stop.

Interesting place. This museum is worth the visit for 3 of many eloquent creations of Auguste Rodin, which are "The Thinker", "the kiss" & "The gates of Hell". It is situated close to metro line 13(stop Varenne). The best part is the garden, full of sculptures. Inside the museum,one can find the ceramics and the paintings (Rodin's collections).
informative. I have visited this museum a while ago. I knew little about the sculptor prior to my visit there and I remember the exhibit as being very instructive about Rodin's work.
I loved it!. Several floors plus the gardens were littered with Rodin's work. It was well explained, well set out with room to move around.

Worth it even if only to see the thinker. While we only visited this Museum because it was free since we had already purchased the museum pass it was still worth it. We only stayed for a little while and spent the majority of the time viewing the thinker which is one of the greatest sculptures ever created. So it is worth it even if only to spend a couple of minutes looking at the thinker.

For the art lovers. This is more of an art gallery than a museum and you didn't really get to see anything much of his life. No real insight into the artist as such but I guess I can Google that.Having said that it was still a lovely experience and some of the sculptures were fascinating. I didn't know much about his work other than the Thinker, however, I thought some of the other works were much more interesting.The grounds of the museum are also lovely to stroll around.

Statues. Enjoyed seeing some of Rodin's famous works. Part of Museum was under a much needed reconstruction. Thought the display notices were poor as some had English translations missing and some were obviously in wrong place! Our guide book helped us out!

Living Rodin. Rodin great works of art, including "Le Penseur". It has a beautiful garden full of larger size sculptures and Inside the house, you can see earlier works, including his debut paintings and sculptures. A ten minute walk from Hotel des Invalides, you can visit both in a day.
Always my favorite. Every visit to Paris I always take time to visit this beautiful house full of sculpture and the beautiful gardens. Never as crowded as the other big museums, it's a must see.

A Lovely Museum, Even for Only Moderate Museum Lovers. Really beautiful grounds completely congruous with the sculptures. Fun to see where Rodin lived and sculpted. A beautiful chateau as well. Also, an impressive personal collection of Rodin's impressionist painter friends' works.

Gorgeous Collection, Chateau and Grounds. What an absolutely gorgeous museum. I love Rodin anyway. But the way in which the sculptures are displayed in the garden is fantastic - and the well-manicured grounds are beautiful. The collection inside the Chateau is nice though a bit crowded - and I found the version of "The Kiss" to be underwhelming because I've seen larger-than-life versions. But the whole museum is fantastic. Also, his personal collection of paintings from contemporaries/friends such as Van Gogh is simply amazing. A wonderful museum!!

tea in the garden. At last a bit of peace and quiet in Paris This was the most relaxed place on our entire stay . The house is lovely but the gardens are a welcome relief to all the noise and ques in this city. The tearoom come restaurant in the garden offers food and wine as well as cakes in the most pleasant surroundings.

The best sculptor since Michelangelo!. Rodin's museum is a must see for anyone interested in sculpture, or art in general. It's a beautiful and peaceful museum. Not very big, it comprises of a house (albeit a large one) and the gardens. You won't get lost here like you will in the Louvre or Versailles. Rodin's masterpieces are all here. The Cathedral of hands, the Thinker, the Gates of Hell, John the Baptist, the Kiss, etc. They're all here, and seeing them in person is quite remarkable. It's a very laid back museum. It's not large, I went in the evening and there were not many people there. I was able to really look at the art and think about it without being pressured by a crowd to move on.

A Wonderful Place to Visit. Sometimes you visit a place and it remains with you for ever; this is one of those special places. The gardens are beautiful and a peaceful oasis. The statues are incredible and very inspiring; the cafe is very good too.
A little dated but when in Paris you have got to do it!. The show is worth the price of admission. But, they pack you in like sardines so go early to get a seat closer to the stage.

Excellent!. We actually overlooked this museum during our first trip to Paris. When we got home, we were asked by almost everyone if we had made it to the Rodin Museum. Needless to say, it was on the top of our list this visit. It is wonderfully laid out with the inside house/museum and then the lovely outdoor gardens providing a wonderful place to contemplate this artist's genius. Do not miss.

Garden of fabulous sculpture. The indoor part of Musee Rodin is nice, but my favorite area is the garden. Between trees and flowers, you see magnificent sculptures like "The Thinker" sitting out there in the open. He looked so real I imagined him getting up and strolling through the garden. I recently learned that behind the museum is a path that leads to a small lake, fountain and flowers. Can't wait to visit it on my next trip!

Very good museum. My wife and I went to the Rodin Museum soon after it had opened on a Tuesday morning. It was not busy and going around the garden was a delight. To be in the centre of Paris and yet be going round such a peaceful garden looking at Rodin’s masterpieces was a perfect trip. The inside is equally as good and again you don’t feel crowded or rushed. There is also a nice and inexpensive (for Paris) café in the garden that is good for a mid day snack.

Intimate Parisian experience. The Musee Rodin is somewhat off the beaten tourist path, but on the Left Bank in a location where you might find yourself wandering if you are in Paris. Stop at the museum, and if you are a fan of Rodin, or if you are not, you will have a better understanding of his work and life after the visit. Plan to go on a nice day because the garden is lovely. And the little restaurant is definitely worth a visit as well.

Art in the nature. A former house where lived and worked Rodin. Lot of his sculptures are displayed in the garden surrounded by the wall. The idea comes from Rodin himself. Also in the garden you feel like not in Paris. Inside of the hoouse - which more like a small castle ,you can see his famous sculptures in plaster among which "The Kiss" so much lighter and delicate than the bronze cast.
Beautiful garden for a 1€!. Nice garden and sculptures. One can choose to visit just the garden or both garden and the main building. Worth a visit.

Loved this museum. I absolutely loved the Musee Rodin. Wandering through the gardens and seeing so many of Rodin's sculptures/statues was amazing. Seeing the Thinker in person was a highlight. I loved everything about the museum including the fact that Rodin had lived in the mansion. It's a must see.

A beautiful experience. The museum is a beautiful building with lots of light streaming in to display Rodin's sculptures. Don't miss the gardens just outside the building are large and have sculpture dispersed throughout the grounds. It was quite an experience to see Rodin's famous work displayed. An exhibit of Mapplethorpe and Rodin's influence on his work was presented in an interesting and provocative manner.

Beautiful sculpture inside& out.. The beauty of this museum goes far beyond Rodin's evocative sculpture. It's small and fairly intimate inside the two buildings, and the grounds are a sculpture garden that combines nature & art in a wonderful way. There's a cafe in the garden (and clean accessible restrooms as well). Whole families can enjoy this place (as long as parents are cool with the beauty of the human body). My parents brought me here when I was young and it was the most memorable place we visited, which is why I returned on this trip. Presently there's a show about the artist's process, which I hope will become permanent.
Nice little museum. Nice garden and up close chance to see the work of Rodin. Not. At all busy in December. Under renovation until 2015. Museum is in Rodin'sformer studio.

Something different. This was fun, small museum that was both indoor and outdoor. It was accessible via the museum pass and was not crowded. The outdoor gardens were lovely. If you have time, you should see this museum.

The Thinker. Since we were in Paris in January the weather was slightly wet. We walked the grounds to look at the statues (mainly to see the Thinker and The Gates of Hell) but didn't take the time to sit since it was also quite cold. It's a must see though! With our museum pass we didn't mind that we didn't stay much longer. We had other places to visit!

Small But Intimate Museum. Starting with your approach to the museum, it is intimate, then cross the garden and enter the museum and be prepared to just wonder how Rodin could achieve the smoothness that he did to the sculptures.
Rose garden. Beautiful, small garden with roses and sculptures. There is a small cafe in it. Nice to have a llight lunch with a glass of white at the garden in the afternoon.

When done with Louvre, D'Orsay, and Picasso- go here!. Wow! August Rodin did a lotta carving!!! Have Been a fan of his since I was young, but had no idea the extent of his works. There are countless works displayed in clay, plaster, marble, and bronze. Take the full pass (only 3-4 euros more to add the temporary exhibit) and make sure you visit the gardens with the giant size "gates of hell" and "the thinker" both in bronze displayed in the park! Beautiful grounds- like a mini Versailles! It can all be done in 60-90 minutes- unless you're a real fan of sculpture and there to really study his work/ if so plan 2.5-3 hours!

Best of Rodin. To whom is interested in sculpture, this is a museum dedicated to one of its masters (Rodin).With a nice and large garden where sculptures are displayed make it pleasant also for a visit in family.

You've got to visit the Thinker. We went on a rainy day (which could have been any day on this trip). After going through the turnstile, we dutifully waited in line outside in the rain for our turn, because they were only letting a few people in at a time. Then my wife say, "Wait. Is this line to go into the house, because we just want to go around the grounds." So we figured out that we could bust out of the line and wander about the grounds to our heart's content. Our mood improved after that. I can't say what we missed inside the actual museum, but from my wife's research, the main attractions are outside, and I think she's right. There were a lot of Rodin's most famous works all around the massive grounds, and we could enjoy them in the kind of atmosphere where they were intended to be seen. The path eventually led to the highlight: the courtyard with The Thinker. So we sat and admired it for a while, and then I took the requisite photo of my daughter in a thoughtful pose (had to stand in line behind other people with the same idea).

4-5 stars only if you like statues. I have never really had an appreciate for statues and still don't after visiting this museum. The highlight of my visit was seeing 3 Van Gogh's on the top floor of the museum. I am glad that I visited but because so many copies of Rodin's work have been 'reproduced' I am not really sure what I saw. I really wanted to see the 'original' Thinker. I saw 2-3 variant copies in various sizes.If you go, make sure it is a nice day so you can take in the park behind the museum where many of his works are displayed.

Thinker's Garden. Muse Rodin is just 10 minutes down the road from Musee d'Orsay. It would be a good idea to combine the two, with a lunch or coffee break at one of the street side cafes, watching Paris go by, while you sip a cafe au lait and enjoy a croque Monsieur.The museum now includes a studio which contains the original studies and sketches made by Rodin before he started the final sculptures. The sculptor did painstaking research and reworked his sketches and wax models several times before embarking on the final.The Garden has large original bronzes, although the Thinker is a replica, the original one being in Rodin Museum in Philadelphia.There is also a regular museum with the artists work. Currently the museum is being upgraded. Definitely worth a visit.
Rodin in September. The weather was perfect! The garden cafe was wonderful! Glad we took time to stop here. Wish we had more time to spend here.

Beautiful museum & gardens. Rodin sculptures are a must see. It was a nice change from the other typical site seeing places. There are nice grounds behind the Rodin Museum with several sculptures. This is a great area to sit and relax. Reasonable entry fee.

Amazing collection of Rodin sculptures. This museum is well worth a visit, even if just to see the Thinker. There is an inside exhibit. However, most of the sculptures are in the garden, and they only charge 2 Euros to visit the gardens. The inside collection does really not add much, although it was worth seeing.

Love it. The gardens are so beautiful and you can just sit there to enjoy the sunny days of Paris. The museum itself it's very interesting and there is a lot of see. The Gates of Hell are definitly worth seeing
Rodin sculptures. Lovely gardens. Great sculptures. It is a good museum if have the extra time. I wasn't such a big fan of Rodin until I visited this museum. His sculptures are amazing.
Oasis in the City. The Musee Rodin is a beautiful museum and garden experience. With the busy Paris outside the walls, you can relax and be impressed the talent and genius of Rodin.
Rodin Garden a gem. This is one of our favourite places in Paris.You can see the garden alone for 2E if you don't have time for the whole museum.

Fascinating place!. Glad we made time to visit this museum which offered such insight into the personal life of Rodin and the history of the property that he came to acquire and later bequeathed to the City of Paris. You feel as though you were walking through his life, room by room. The grounds are surprisingly large too. Does not take much more than one hour to tour the house and stroll the grounds and well worth the time.
Rodin sculptures by the dozen. Some absolutely stunning sculptures and pictures. The museum is set in stunning grounds and in a wonderful stately home.Highly recommended.
Musee Rodin. The sculpture garden and house itself are well worth a visit. An oasis from the hustle of the other tourist places.
good collection. i have visited musee rodin after musee de louvre so it was not such excellent exprience becuse we have seen most of the things in other museum

Little Gem of Paris. I wouldn't say this is on my top 5 things of places to visit, but after being there, you will be soooo glad to have gotten away from the crowds and see all the fine sculpture. It's a little off the beaten path, but not really. If you're in the neighborhood, definitely go!
Musee Rodin. The sculptures are absolutely divine. The building and grounds are a little run down, but the visitor centre is well maintained.

Nice on a summery day. Since we already had the museum pass, purchased to go see Versailles, we could walk right into the Rodin museum and skip the line. The line is always to BUY tickets, if you have tickets or the pass, you don't have wait. The gardens were the hit - it was still warm, and the gardens were shady. All the way in the back there were a couple of sandboxes, and some chaises that were already all already occupied.

Tranquility in the heart of Paris. This museum is so much more than a museum of sculpture - although the sculpture is truly amazing! The gardens of the grand old house are an absoloute joy to walk around (even in the rain) and you feel yourself transported into a bygone era.There are regular exhibitions which are really well put together...we saw a photographic exhibition of Robert Maplethorpe .... truly amazing. Top Tip - for me the most impressive pieces of sculpture are in and around the gardens (make sure you see 'Gates of Hell') and you can buy a garden only ticket for a few euros.

wonderful. We hired the audio guides, it was well worth it. When we had finished touring the beautiful building we then moved onto the gardens, a fabulous setting for all the sculptures, thoroughly enjoyed our visit, it was good value considering the many hours we spent there

Visited the gardens only. I went with a couple of friends to Musee Rodin, however we only visited the properties gardens. The gardens are very pretty and a nice place and sit and chill for a bit. We brought a picnic with us and sat and ate.

Small. This is a small basically sculpture museum. It was fine and we were in an out in about 75 minutes, however, it was raining outside, so we did not really explore the gardens, except for viewing "The Thinker". It was on our Museum Pass.

For lovers of suclptures and art. Just a short stroll from the Metro - a must see icon of Paris. The magnificent mansion - how an art gallery - surrounded by gardens and sculptures. Even the coffee shop was good - with a selection of sandwiches, cakes and beverages.

Beautiful Museum. It's a joy to come to this museum, even though there are parts of it that are apparently still under renovation.The gardens are particularly beautiful--you'll be able to count how many times you've seen someone take the pose of "The Thinker" to be photographed by the sculpture--and it is worth lingering there if the weather permits. (The sandwich my husband and I shared at the cafe provided a welcome respite after our long walk.)The work itself is both interesting and informative--not only, of course, because of Rodin's sculptures, but also with several landscape paintings of his and several paintings by Van Gogh. We particularly enjoyed the special exhibit that explained the context of several of Rodin's works and their reception, along with photographic documentation. Worth your time.

Incredible. Visited on a sunny day, the sculpture gardens and the views of Paris are extraordinary even in winter. Very informative exhibition detailing Rodin's work, the sculptures magnificent and beautiful.
ok. It was interesting to visit the house that the museum was in but I'm glad it was included in the museum pass because it wasn't worth paying extra. The walk to it was the best part.

Lovely. Beautiful setting and easy walk from Musee DeOrsay, the house has been beautifully restored and the sculptures in the grounds great. It was a delight to discover a couple of Van Goghs on the walls
What is there not to LOVE ??. Lie down at the base under the Eiffel Tower with a Toblerone and gaze upwards.No matter which way you look at it the Tower wis a MARVEL!!!!
Good cafe. Were there for lunch, after visiting the Museum. Both food and wine were decent though a bit overpriced, which was expected at such a location.

The gardens are perfect for a rendezvous!. I've visited in April to watch the BCBG dads meet their wives and children on the way home from work. 1600-1800. In February in the snow, and watched the lovers ( includining one of my children) kissing in public. And in October just to watch the leaves fall in the sunshine while children run through them. A great spot to watch family time with French dads on the week end. AND the museum isn't bad either!

Under construction but worth a visit. Although under construction for another year, they have moved many important pieces to a protected area outside. Well organized and great guide to help you find all the sculptures.
Very nice museum. This museum is easy to navigate through, there was not a large crowd, you can cover the museum easily in one-two hours. Well worth the visit.

Excellent Museum. We really enjoyed the Rodin Museum. The garden was a pleasant surprise with many statues, including The Thinker, of course. the house was very interesting was a wide variety of art work and sculptures. We ate at the garden cafe and had an enjoyable lunch outside (even in mid-November.

Only if you love Rodin's Sculptures. Rodin did some nice pieces, but his most famous works are based on Dante's Inferno (aka Hell) and are pretty depressing. Yes, the Thinker and the Kiss are great, but the audiotour was more of a history lesson than an answer to "Why are these awesome?" and I got bored within 30 minutes. Pleasant grounds to stroll.Personally, I prefer the Sculptures at the Louvre, Notre Dame, and d'Orsay.

Well worth the trip. We love Rodin and were staying just up the street so we decided to visit one morning. I was glad we got in before the crowds. The main building was under renovation and there was no air movement. There was a handicapped elevator which is rare. The garden was lovely and a nice place to rest and have coffee before going out again. Suggest you get the museum passes beforehand. We next went to the Orange Museum and the line was very long, but we sailed past. And by the time we came out of the Rodin Museum, the line for tickets was down the block.

Tranquil, charming and cultural.. I came here with my mum and this was a lovely sight to see. NO queues and good value.The house is gorgeous and you can really see how they lived at the time. We were lucky to see the garden in good weather. Great experience seeing Rodin's work, so extensive, also the Thinker!Great attraction in Paris.

Beautiful Restoration. Went here two years ago and thought the place was looking a little worse for wear. They have been closed for an extended period to do major over haul. They have reopened and the great restoration has made a huge difference.

Fascinating Museum. If you like Rodin, this is the place to visit. You get close to the exhibits in the house and garden. There is a cafe in the garden. We love the garden as you can ponder the exhibits.

One of the loveliest museums in Paris. Rodin negotiated with the French government to turn over this lovely mansion (in which he lived in his later years, located right next to Hotel des Invalides / Napoleon's Tomb) to become a museum if he donated most of his stunning sculptures and other personal collection (including a Van Gogh and some of his own paintings). The result is a gem of a museum with a reasonable entry fee (6 Euro if you want to see the sculptures on the inside of the mansion, even less if you just want to stroll the gardens - which house larger versions of many of the same sculptures). However if you want to really learn more and understand his works, get the Audio Guide (4 Euro) and go inside to see the progression of his masterpieces, including The Thinker, The Kiss, and the origins of his greatest work (located outside in breathtaking full-on beauty) - the Gates of Hell. The gardens themselves are worth a stroll, and on leaving you will have a sense of this great artist and the scope of his work - plus the context in which he created them. Definitely a must see if you have a few days in Paris.
Lovely inside & out. Small museum with an extensive collection. Try to visit when the weather is cooperating, so you can enjoy the garden sculpture and landscape design.

Unexpected charm. We loved the sculptures, both in the house and in the garden. It was also fascinating to see one of the houses which would have been lived in by nobility during the time of Marie Antoinette.

Rodin Rules. If you only have time to go one museum in Paris then make this it. I've been here about five times and even though I try not to redo things in Paris that I've done this stays on the must-do list. It's superb. I prefer the outside to the inside but you've got to do both before making that call. Go! And go now!
Walk Back in Time. Cliché, but in Paris every cliché is a true romantic moment. The museum is small but will envelope you in the past.

The gardens and sculptures make for an impressive visit.. The gardens can be visited for 1 euro( or are part of the Museum pass). We also visited the Museum and felt that the gardens and their sculptures where the highlight of our visit.

An Unforgetable afternoon combination.. Having found the Musee Rodin closed last time we were in Paris, we were pleased to find it open and more beautiful than ever. It was a huge bonus to stop at their new (to us) restaurant for the best vegetable soup I have ever tasted. The thick cream and spices were perfection. Try it for a perfect afternoon outing in Paris.

Beautiful sculpture and gardens!. Visited Musee Rodin in September 2014 - the Rodin Museum is easy walking distance from Les Invalides. Paris Museum Pass offers free entry - the museum consists of the collection in the 18th century Hotel Biron, BEAUTIFUL grounds, gardens and a temporary exhibition hall. We did not have sufficient time to visit the temporary exhibition as we spent a lot of time at Musee de l'Armee at Les Invalides. In addition to the beautiful sculptures displayed in Hotel Biron, one is also treated to three beautiful Van Gogh paintings! The gardens are beautiful and also reminded me of the grounds of Hellbrunn palace in Salzburg. During our visit, contemporary sculptures of Daniel Dewar and Gregory Gicquel were also on display! I really enjoyed the ten contemporary sculptures on display - Pied (Foot), L'idée (Idea) and Buste (Chest) were among the favourites. I bought a Rodin Flesh and Marble (8€) guide at the bookshop to study further at home. We used the Varenne Metro stop that is very close to the museum to go home. I will definitely visit Musee Rodin again on a next visit to Paris, but will allow enough time to relax in the beautiful gardens! Also consider the late opening on a Wednesday until 8:45pm.
LOvely Spot. Enjoyd walking in the gardens and the interesting sculptures.Also very impressed with the cafe that had delicious food and reasonable prices.A good spot to relax and enjoy the day.

Great Sculptures. Musee Rodin is one of my favorite smaller museums in Paris. I especially love the beautiful garden with all the marvelous and famous statues by Rodin like The Thinker. I always love to stop here while in Paris.
A joy. Its a great Museum to spend a couple of hours enjoying the art pieces, as well as, the garden. You could even take a book and enjoy reading sitting on a bench at the garden.

A lovely visit. The large sculptures of Rodin are situated in beautiful gardens, including 'The Thinker' and 'The Gates of Hell' (that The Thinker is a part of before becoming a stand-alone sculpture). The building, the Hotel Biron, houses a excellent collection of marble and bronzes in a number of room over two floors. Musee Rodin isn't as jam-packed as the larger museums, but it is a lovely visit.
Small but important. This was an unplanned but great visit as we left Napolean's Tomb. The Thinker was impressive. Use your Paris Pass!

Gorgeous sculpture and gardens but inside was only partially open (Nov2014). You may want to check before you go to see if the museum re-design is complete. Either way it is worth a trip. The sculptures are worth seeing up close and the beautiful garden setting is a lovely bonus (especially if you've inside too much at other museums). Even the museum building is gorgeous but with several rooms closed-off the experience felt a bit truncated. One surprise for me was getting to see several early versions of the Burghers of Calais and its evolution.

Don't miss out on Camille Claudel. The Musee Rodin is certainly worth a visit. The gardens are dotted with his sculptures and on a nice day, one can spend hours wandering about, studying the nuances of a hand or foot or frown. My favourites included The Burghers of Calais, a Portrait of Pere Tanguy by Van Gogh (upstairs) and the amazing Waltz by Camille Claudel. Also loved The Gossips and The Wave by her. I think she may have been more talented than him!
Beautiful grounds. Worth a trip. Reasonably priced. Headphones are $4 eu extra. Gardens with sculptures very nice.Museum very nice also.
Worth a visit-but NOT a top attraction. Needed more printed info at some of the displays which would have enhanced the visit. Gardens a bonus!
Beautiful garden. The grounds were beautiful, but if you don't have a lot of time, I'd skip this one. If you are planning to go, buy the Musuem Pass ahead of time and skip the lines.
Not really worth a detour. Nice gardens for lunch, however. But museum time is better spent elsewhere. Not a problem getting in except in high season.

Must see musee in Paris. This museum was renovated a few years ago, but the charm of the original home is still prevalent. Sculptures by Rodin and Camille Claudel are inside as well as in the garden. Watch the movie "Camille Claudel" before your visit!

Gardens. It provides a great resting point if you're running like mad in btwn every museum in the vicinity. The Thinking Man is the center piece of the gardens and you get to enjoy different type of art.
My favorite place ever!. When I came here, I was thinking about The Thinker, only. But the house, the garden and everything about Rodin, his job, his family, his lover was worth the visit
Very good. Pretty nice visit during November. Save more than one hour for this visit. The work is impressive and had a lot of fun. Prices are fair. Be ready for stairs of Montmartre

a must see. Many of Rodin most famous sculptures. Easy entrance . No lines.
Worth at least one hour on a visit to paris. You will not be disappointed.

Lovely suburban mansion and garden with sculptures. Anywhere else it would be a major attraction, but hidden away here, this rather austere house and semi-formal garden is a lovely diversion from the main city-centre galleries. Worth the walk if the weather's fine.

It's finally open!. The Rodin Museum was closed the last time I visited Paris in 2013 (renovation 2012-2014) so I was very pleased to be able to catch an exhibition at the Hotel Biron in 2014 after its reopening.To make the most of your visit, look at the weather forecast and pick a sunny day. If it rains, more than half of your museum coverage will be dampened by the weather (sorry for the pun) as many sculptures and statues are located outdoors (ie. bronze cast of The Gates of Hell).After seeing so much art inspired by The Thinker and The Kiss I was really awed to see the real thing.
Camille Claudele is heart of this exhibit. Who knew Rodin was such a philanderer. The ever-moving, dramatic sculpture of his erstwhile lover Camille Claudel rivals if not exceeds the work of Rodin.

A beautiful museum of a great artist . The garden is beautiful. Take extra time to just sit and read, in addition to watching the Bronze statues. The museum is just right. Take the audioguide. The explanations are excellent.
Lovely Oasis. A small oasis in a very busy city. Even though it was busy it still felt tranquil.Amazing statues in a beautiful garden setting.

One place not to miss. I loved every moment I spent here. I'm not a very arty person and had no expectations. I completely lost myself here, enamoured by everything I saw from the gardens, the house and spectacular sculptures. A place not to miss if visiting Paris.
Stop in to see Rodin's the Kiss. Very nice museum, it does not take long to walk through. Get a museum pass to see this location for free.

great. I dont like much museums or picture galleries-I usually get bored quickly and run away( as it happened in Tretyakovka:) But if some piece of art has an interesting story i can be fascinated.Sculptures are not exactly my piece of cake,but some of Roden`s work are majestic-like ,, kiss,, or ,,balzak,,.Gardens are really lovely,especially in sunny weather

Very nice exhibits, aging buildings. We didn't do the museum pass so we had to wait in a long line for a bit to get in. The line had nothing to do with overflow and more to do with only one person taking money for the tickets. That being said, when we got in, it was a nicely set of exhibits that showcase the artist's distinct periods of his life. Carry the brochure around that describes the different rooms so you can correlate the pieces to the periods. (no one gives you the brochure - you just have to find it in the main house.) There are sculptures outside as well, and the garden must have been lovely in the spring (we went in the fall). We read that they are going to renovate the buildings, which is much needed. But it's a nice collection of his work, of course mostly given by the artist himself, and the museum was a former hotel that he favored, so it is a nice place to visit.

What a gem!. First off, the gardens surrounding the museum are so beautiful and relaxing. Then you find yourself in the company of Rodin's impressive sculptures as you walk through! The museum boasts also of an impressive collection of sculptures and paintings. What a treat to see 3 Van Gogh paintings, as well!

Wonderful gardens and more. We actually visited the grounds and museum several times at different times of the year and the grounds and art are wonderful. If you like Rodin then a visit is a must for the family

If you are a fan of Rodin - this is the place to go.. Our family visited the Rodin museum. We found his works to be a bit dark which we do not really like. However we certainly do not represent the majority of sculpture admirers. Rodin has a unique style, that unfortunately is not to our liking.

A back to the past Museum with nice garden. The building is in perfect condition. A lot of artistry there and history too !!! The Museum is absolutely a must see, and it can be done it two hours. I would have liked to visit the extra building in the garden, as there were some monumental works of Rodin outside.
Small but Beautiful. A small beautiful museum full of the works of Rodin. There is also a lovely garden to stroll around and cafe under the trees perfect!

Nice Quick Visit To See Famous Pieces. We had a Museum Pass and were able to visit the Museum and see the three key pieces outside within a half hour. The Gates of Hell, The Thinker, and Tres Hommes. Worth the visit on the Left Bank. More tto see with more time for those who want more Rodin.

Beautiful Quaint Museum with lovely gardens. The Rodin has largely Rodin's sculptures with a few impressionist works. The gardens were a great place to sit and relax with a beautiful view of the golden dome with Napoleon's tomb. Definitely worth a stop with a museum pass. Allow about 1 hour.

Relax at Musée Rodin. This museum seems like a little oasis in the city! You step out of Parisian traffic into a beautiful garden which surrounds a lovely historic home. The gardens are refreshing and allow for a pensive mood. The statues are placed amongst greenery and a small pond.The former estate now holds a collection of Rodin's art and is wonderful to walk through, although not very expansive.
stunning!. Rodin, Rodin, Rodin. It's just amazing. Great place to enjoy breathtaking works of art minus the crazy crowds.

LOVE! Perfect afternoon.. If it's a sunny day and the weather is nice there's just not a better spot in Paris. The art, the roses, and the food! It's memorable and romantic. The aroma from the flowers and seeing some of the world's best sculptures while sipping a cafe au lait. Life just doesn't get much better than that!
Lovely Museum. Went to Musee Rodin for the first time and fell in love. Hotel Biron is exquisite and the gardens are magnificent. Rain or shine it is absolutely worth the trip.
Awesome. The gardens are lovely and we enjoyed a delightful dessert in the garden restaurant. The statutes are breathtaking; especially 'The Kiss.'

An unexpected gem. I know Paris well and was looking for somewhere new. This museum was free on the Sunday I visited which was an unexpected bonus. To be honest, I was drawn by the prospect of the gardens and was not disappointed as they were lovely on such a glorious Autumn day. Beautifully laid out and with the wonderful Rodin sculptures in strategic places. The autumnal colours made for some great photos. In addition, this was not too crowded on a Sunday. I found it to be one of the highlights of my trip and, while I confess I spent less time in the indoor museum, it was still very worthwhile visiting, even if you are not terribly interested in sculpture!

A relaxing museum. One of the most magnificent museums of Rodin sculpture, in less than couple of hours you can enjoy hanging between the different sculpture pieces of Rodin indoors and outdoors in the garden.

Genius and perfection in architecture & sculpture. The Hotel Biron alone is worth the price of admission and Rodins embellishments are the icing on this delicious cake. A tour de force inside and out, with recent restorations and welcome center adding to its enjoyability.

Easy Museum with Beautiful Gardens. I enjoyed this museum very much. The gardens had the sculptures of the Gates of Hell, Balzac, the Burghers of Calais, the Thinker and the three Shades. The gardens were a perfect venue for these sculptures, and are truly beautiful. The museum is covered by the Museum Pass and it is worth it to pay the extra money for the audio guide. The audio guide covers how the various pieces of art were developed over time. There was no line when I was there. The artwork in the mansion is placed in order of when the work was done. You can see how Rodin developed his work over time and reused themes he developed while working on the Gates of Hell. An extra bonus for this museum are the paintings by Monet, Renoir and Van Gogh, which were in Rodin's personal collections. The museum can easily be reached by the Metro with the Varenne stop being the closest. It is also close to the Army Museum and Napoleon's tomb if you wish to do more than one museum in the day.

Forget the Louvre, here are the real masterpieces. Really enjoyed the Rodin. Wonderful atmospheric gardens especially with the autumn leaves and more art you will actually recognize and enjoy being near to than the world's most visited gallery nearby. I think Rodin had a man crush on Balzac by the amount of statues of him there!
Peaceful gardens. all i could think of after going through the house was how peaceful the gardens were. it is amazing to see such famous works just sitting around.

One of the most pleasant small museum in Paris. A small bijoux of a museum, with very little queuingHave also a walk in the museum's unique historical gardenIdeal for a romantic visit, thanks to Rodin sensual sculptures and capable insights

Relaxing, fascinating.. Our main aim was to see 'Le Penseur' and we really had no other expectations about the museum or garden. We were surprised in a really good way by the whole experience. The sculptures were fascinating…and the garden so relaxing. A small fee, but worth it. (And it was the only place we visited with no queue!).
Do not miss it.. This is my favorite place for a beautiful quiet place in Paris for a picnic in park, plus it so cheap to enter too.

Small charming museum. Musée Rodin is one of my favorite museums. It is small and you can really appreciate each piece. it has a lovely garden with a place to have refreshments outside that is extremely pleasant in the summer. The sculptures are, of course, amazing. This museum can be visited repeatedly practically when the weather is pleasant.

The place to go if you enjoy sclupture. Spring or summer are the best periods of time to visit the Rodin museum because of the garden. Of course you should have a long look at the Waltz by Camille Claudel. It seems like the 2 characters are really going to start dancing, the movement is just fabulous ! Or the Kiss by Rodin, so tender. But also try to spend some time looking at all the sculptures outside. The famous one is of course the Thinker but also the Burghers of Calais. After the tour, sit down at the café in the garden and just enjoy being there !
Expansive collection of Rodin's work. Fantastic! We didn't spend too much time in here but it was well worth the stop. Right across from the Army museum (Les Invalides).

Lovely building, beautiful art.. With so many museums and art galleries in Paris, it is difficult to choose which one's to visit. Musee Rodin is certainly worthwhile.An excellent selection of the artist's work, along with some of his contemporaries is on display. Also may of his sculptures are in the garden.
sublime. Best euro you can spend in Paris is to visit the garden of the museum. Beautiful setting and excellent atmosphere.

A great authentic revamp. The top floor has been very sympathetically re-modelled. Most of the downstairs has also been done. Great to see the museum back to its best. Very romantic setting. One of the best places to visit in Paris. The garden is also beautiful.
A great walk in the garden. This is the cheapest museum in the city at 6euros and it's a lovely walk in the garden as well as a look inside the hotel for the smaller art pieces.
Nice museum downtown Paris. Rather small, that museum is nicely arranged in a building surrounded by gardens you can visit. You can even arrange a light lunch or dinner near the garden.
Genious Rodin. Discover beautiful Rodin's sculpture, enjoy garden and explore modern technics of this genious.A must see in Paris

A MUST for sculpture fans!. This exceptional museum is housed in a historic mansion on the left bank. It is literally packed with sculptures by the remarkable Auguste Rodin. There is also a room devoted to the sculptures by his talented mistress Camille Claudel. You need plenty of time to explore the house plus the garden which also has many of Rodins' works including the Gates of Paradise.

If you like Rodin, go.. Great exhibits of Auguste Rodin's works so if you are into sculpture and the artist's life this is a must see. It's right across from Les Invalides (Napoléon's tomb) so you can't miss it.
Incredible Statues. This is a great display of Rodin's statutes and other art. The gardens are beautiful and compliment the art.

Think about the Penseur. Get a tea on the go, hide yourself in the bohemian chic atmosphere of the étonnant palazzo and wearing a tailored coat, feel like an art critic admiring the sensual surfaces of the sculpture's modellato by the Maestro. The Penseur and the garden it's worth the trip to Paris!

A great little gem!. A great museum that has so many amazing pieces but only takes about an hour so it's not to be missed no matter how short your time in Paris is. A large part of the museum is outside in a beautiful garden so that part alone is a real treat!

Unique, special museum. I love Rodin so to visit his museum, which is a privately owned and funded house was so special, you can get very close to all the exhibits and it doesn't have that 'stuffy' museum feel. There is a lovely cafe for lunches and a drink and beautiful gardens, a must if you're in Paris
A must see. This is also a must see museum...incredible sculptures! We went on a beautiful day which is good because most of the important works are outside in he most amazing gardens.
Worth seeing once. Everyone has seen pictures of "the thinker" so if you are in Paris you should see it in person as well as some other wonderful sculptures.

Absolutely gorgeous museum. It many visits to Paris, this was my first time visiting the Rodin. I loved it. The gardens are spectacular. I sat there for several hours enjoying the most glorious September weather ever this year, just like summer. Inside is really fabulous too. Do not miss this museum on a trip to Paris. You will not be sorry!

Beautiful Museum and Garden. We happened upon this museum as it was near our hotel. From the outside, it doesn't look like much, but once you enter you realize you have stumbled upon a gem. The gardens are a beautiful, quite oasis filled with sculptures. The house where Rodin rented rooms is not to be missed as his work (and a couple of Van Gogh paintings he owned) are displayed. To be able to view his work in some of the very rooms he created them is wonderful. The house is well maintained and the colors chosen for the display rooms are beautiful and serene. Another plus is that this museum isn't crowded as the larger museums, so we found it very relaxing.
A must see. Also a must see; I've been there several times. I love Rodin and always love seeing his sculptures. And as an added attraction the chateau and the grounds are beautiful!

A must visit. Have visited a few times in the last 20 years. Beautiful sculptures . Beautiful gardens. A good smaller sized museum to loose yourself for a couple of hours. On a sunny day the gardens very inviting.
Nice ,quiet place to reflect. We enjoyed the Musee Rodin very much , many areas to enjoy the beauty and fresh air walking paths .. Also Art by other masters .
Great work. Loved the sculptures set in the garden. It was nice to walk around outside to see them rather than in a building. This would not have been so great if the weather had not cooperated.

for Rodin admirers. Small museum with large garden for outdoor sculptures.
It's worthwhile visiting just to see his "Thinker" .Not very time consuming.
Beautiful Gardens!. The small cafe in the gardens (in the rear of the museum) was a perfect escape from the crowds. The museum itself was small, but very beautiful and a nice experience.

Amazing Rodin Gardens & Museum. for the price we paid to get in this place is well worth it, the gardens and Rodin Sculptures alone would of done me, we where lucky that it was not raining and got to walk around for almost an hour, a fair bit of time spent at the gates of hell a monumental piece that is just breathe taking to be able to see it in person. We headed to the internal building and smaller works. if you dont know who Rodin is just remember The Thinker. and thats him.
One of the best. What can I say... one of the best artists ever lived. His work displayed beautifully in lovely building and stunning garden. Don't miss it!
Rodin. this was a beautiful museum. We spent all of our time strolling in the gardens. Definitely a must see on a gorgeous day.
Great Museum that is not too crowded. Very peaceful walking around looking at Rodin's sculptures...backyard is filled with sculptures located the property.

Magnificient along with relaxing gardens. If you enjoy Rodin then you must visit his museum while in Paris....a small museum that not only has beautiful artistry of a single extremely talented artist but it also had a walking garden area that displays much of his works throughout....seeing the works of only one artist allowed me to see his growth & personality in his varied exhibits....prior to this visit I only knew him as the creator of the statue of the "Thinker"...

Don't miss. I've been to the Musee Rodin on two occasions and would happily go on every visit to Paris. The history of Rodin and his companions and the collections of sculptures both inside and out are displayed in a way that allows one to explore and be near the artwork in an intimate and peaceful setting. One one trip, I brought my kids and there was an exhibit comparing the work of Rodin to that of Robert Mapplethorpe, which was a little too erotic for children, so I quickly ushered them through that gallery! Other than that, the kids all enjoyed the sculpture garden and appreciated seeing the art in a setting that wasn't stuffy or crammed full of people. The sculptures are interesting as well as the history surrounding them. On my next visit I will go to the Rodin Museum in Meudon.

Really beautiful, well worth a visit!. Down a quiet street - it would be easy to miss it! Book tickets online as unless there very early, as with most museums, etc, you could be met with long lines. Beautiful gardens, sculptures in the gardens and pieces inside the house. You could spend an hour or two here or if you didn't have a lot of time you can easily see everything. Well worth a visit - we thought it was just gorgeous.

A great museum. I surprised myself with how much I actually enjoyed this! Lots of sculptures to look at the famous Gates Of Hell and The Thinker! There is also a room not really for children as most of the photographs leaves nothing for the imagination! However me and my boyfriend found this interesting and fun! Would highly recommend a visit to the muse Rodin!

A Necessary Stop in Paris. Whether you care much for sculpture, this is an important collection of an important artist, presented appealingly in a large and beautifully-kept garden as well as a building where Rodin worked. The indoor part is apt to get crowded, but the gardens are huge (considering they're a private yard inside Paris).You can buy a "passport" admission ticket, which also lets you enter the Musee d'Orsay, skipping the main queue there. If you didn't reserve your Orsay admission, this could save you 1-2 hours of time wasted standing in line. You can walk to the Orsay from the Rodin in about 20 minutes; go back down Varenne, and turn left at Bellechasse; just keep going, even if it looks unpromising, and at the end of the street you'll be there.

One of the best charming museum in Paris. I like the way they displayed the sculptures inside and outside.. The intimacy and the beauty ofthe place ! I am not sure of the pseudo restaurant in the Parc...

Worth the visit. This collection is worth seeing, however it does appear to be works which Rodin gave up from a collection he was not overly in love with. Of course there is the thinker and a couple other pieces which should not be a missed but overall nothing extraordinary. I would definitely suggest checking out the garden wall with the historic background on the artist and the hotel.
Surprisingly great. The gardens, mansion were a surprise. The sheer genius of Rodin was not. I thought this museum was a hidden gem

Inspiring !. I first experienced Rodin's works in a traveling exhibit in Salt Lake City.Seeing his museum on my Birthday in Paris was the thrill of a lifetime !It is a wonderful place and do get the audio tour, which is inspiring and very enlightening.

Rodin--Alive. This small intimate museum is not to be missed. The grounds/gardens are lovely and peaceful. The history of Rodin's time in this home is skillfully presented. I have been twice and will go again.

Awe-inspiring works, beautifully presented.. The underlying concept works brilliantly: present many of Rodin's major bronzes in a beautiful garden surrounding an elegant ex private hotel which houses many of his models, studies, marble sculptures and even a range of his paintings. Read the story of the burghers of Calais before you visit and compare Rodin's depiction of real heroism with the numerous examples of traditional treatments that cover Paris. Truly, he broke the mold. The garden cafe's plat du jour was good. While there are steps in the building, there is a lift if you ask. Buy a combined passport ticket for the Musee D'Orsay on the same day - it's easy walking distance.

When all the famous musea have been visited. Nice collection artworks of Rodin and his partner Camiile Claudel. Museum is an old hotel where Rodin lived his last years.Garden with many famous statues of Rodin.

C'est v'rai! C'est bonne! Musee Rodin c'est magnifique!. Pardon, Je n'écris pas bien le français; mais J'écris ce commentaire en Anglais. I loved this beautiful museum which is forward thinking not only in keeping an eye out for its visitors and patrons, but in explicating who Rodin was and organizing his works appropriately. There are two floors; the renovations are to install an elevator and to shore up the building so that it can continually support the weight of the sculptures (some in marble, some in lead, some in bronze.) The works are organized basically in the order of his creative execution. Were you aware that Rodin's genius also extended to paintings and even of famous artists? Yes. Were you aware that his beloved Camille Claudel has a separate section for her works...and that they are absolutely incredible? Yes! Camille Claudel is a genius. In some ways her works exceed Rodin's artistry and conceptualizations. She certainly was a brilliant sculptor in her own right. As time moves on, who she is will come to be appreciated and embraced by women and men globally. She was and continues to be a maverick; her work is breathtaking. I loved "The Wave." It is hard to select a favorite because all of her works are spectacular. The museum gardens are truly lovely and extend from the front and around to back. there is information about the building that is the museum; and there is an explanation as to when Paul Claudel decided to bequeath his sister's works to the museum. Yeah! Interestingly, members of the Claudel family are alive today; thank goodness they are extremely proud...beyond proud and appreciative of their brilliant relative Camille. (There was a terrible time when they were ashamed of her...very sad.) Be sure you take a picture by Rodin's "Gates of Hell," a seminal work. But pray before you do (just joking). I had the great good fortune to receive a private tour by French author and researcher of Rodin and Camille Claudel, Jeanne Fayard. She has written a number of works including those on Rodin and Claudel; she also met Tennessee Williams and gave one of the foremost interviews of Williams (this is in a book that was published in the US) in which Williams felt so comfortable with her, he "let his hair down" and revealed more of his interests because he felt she was NOT judgmental. Anyway, she guided me through the museum which she knows by heart and discussed the history of Camille and Rodin. We did not get to the cafe, unfortunately which was closing. However, I recommend two things. You can spend hours there and people do. After taking a tour or just familiarizing yourself with his and Camille's works, you can stop at the cafe or go into the gardens take pictures and/or enjoy a meditative leisurely time. We went on a weekday. If you can, it's better to go then and avoid what will be crowds, most likely. I would go back in a heartbeat because you cannot get all of it in two visits with an expert like Jeanne Fayard...and this is a place to ruminate (like Le Pensee), and take in the beauty, study both sculptors, if you like, and be yourself. IF YOU DON'T APPRECIATE SCULPTURE, you can appreciate the gardens. But if video games are your thing...stay home. This is not for you. I would take children who are perceptive and have a depth of understanding or those who you want to introduce these eternal artists to...who you are giving an introduction to. If they are artistic...bien sur!
Exceptional. My favorite museum in Paris! Beautiful inside and out. Spectacular art work, amazing gardens, peaceful throughout. Great day to spend a couple of hours or preferably a whole day!
Great way to spend a sunny afternoon. A most worthwhile visit whether a fan of Rodin or not. The gardens are clean and pleasant and the house is packed with his works, including paintings.
Wonderful museum of Rodin's works.. The sculpture garden is a do not miss! And the gardens behind the house are magnificent! The work displayed inside the house is wonderful also.

Rodin Up Close. Rodin up close is a wonderful thing. The surface of his sculptures and the effects he achieves with his materials cannot be communicated through photographs. The incorporating of contemporary works in the sculpture garden by Daniel Dewar and Gregroy Gicquel works really well, and begins an interesting dialogue with rodin´s oeuvre.

Beautiful garden setting for Rodin's sculptures. We were pleased to learn that we could buy a combined ticket for both the Rodin and d'Orsay museums. This is great because the lines at Musee d'Orsay can be long, The gardens are beautiful and well trimmed- a perfect setting for Rodin's sculptures. The Thinker takes center stage in the front yard. The big, rear garden has some interesting pieces. There was one of an old man but with a muscular body. You could almost feel the power in his arms. There was one of Victor Hugo which looked very much like him. The Gates of Hell attracts the most attention in the rear garden.In the house, the famous piece is the Kiss. There are also a few paintings. The interior of the house has lovely details, too.We did proceed to the Musee d'Orsay afterwards. The combination ticket allowed us to follow the shorter line for ticket holders.

The Garden of the museum is a treasure. We loved walking around looking at the sculptures, but also people watching. There were lots of school groups of young children who were being asked to recreate the poses they saw and they were just adorable.

Nice place to take a break and just enjoy the sculptures and gardens. We didn't pay the price to tour the museum, just the gardens. There are plenty of great sculpture pieces in the gardens, and it is a lovely place just to sit and relax and enjoy Paris. There was an interesting 'wall' that outlined Rodin's life and how the area was developed. And there was a cafe so you could purchase a drink or a snack to enjoy, but basically it was just a wonderful place to see famous art and enjoy the outdoors.

lovely museum with wonderful gardens. We went only to the gardens at the Musee Rodin which are an incredible deal at 1-2 Euro per person. There are many wonderful sculptures to be seen in the gardens, including The Thinker and The Gates of Hell. The setting is truly beautiful with a large manicured lawn, fountain, flowers, and many places to relax and take it all in. The house/museum itself looked very nice as well but if you're short on time or have spent too much time at museums, consider going for just the gardens.

Gardens are a must visit!. Definitely visit the gardens that house the many Rodin sculptures. Admission is only 2 Euros and there is a great little cafe for a light snack or lunch, or glass of wine, while sitting among the amazing grounds and sculptures.
Rodin. love this quite garden setting highlighting his great statues adn talent. The thinker a classic but there is a nother deepth to his skill as an artist that is trully viewed here
Nice gardens. Peaceful museum. Love the statues and the outdoor gardens were wonderful. Has a great cafe outside in a seperate building. Would visit again.

always a delight. We usually go to the Musee Rodin each year we visit Paris.I don't believe that you can purchase tickets ahead of time, but the lines are usually quite manageable. I love looking at the outside exhibits and feel that this is a great museum to visit-good for kids as well. alice h

A great museum and wonderful gardens!. I don't know if the Musee Rodin gets overshadowed by the Louvre, but this is really a must-see for any Paris trip! Many great sculptures by the master including The Thinker and The Kiss...along with renditions OF the master by other artists...and the garden is probably even more amazing than the museum itself - a great and important Parisian art institution.

A Must-See. I was thrilled to come upon "The Thinker" - located outside the main building - before seeing any of Rodin's other pieces. The museum's interior spaces are well organized, and not too overwhelming! Musee Rodin was surprisingly uncrowded on the day of my visit, and the guided audio tour proved to be extremely helpful. Enjoyed learning how the "Gates of Hell" was visualized and constructed.

Perfect day for this museum. Weather was perfect (24C) to visit this museum where many of the works are in the gardens. An excellent backdrop for the sculpture and, despite being very popular, it didn't lose the serenity of the place. Really worth the trip out.

Hidden gem. We only had time to explore the garden, but what a find! The tarif was only 2€ for the garden. Totaly valuable. We spend lots of time in the beautiful and romantic garden. Lots of flowers, a bassin and the fantastic sculptures spread all over. Next time we would definately visit the rest of the museum too.

Great Art & Beautiful Gardens. I love Rodin's sculpture so Of course I loved this art museum. I saw it about 10 years ago but it was at the top of my list to revisit on this trip to Paris. And this is the house in which the artist lived. The larger bronzes are displayed in beautiful garden settings behind the house. The entire property is surrounded by a 10 foot high stone wall so it is very peaceful inside the gardens while all the noise of Paris goes on outside. The other treat was seeing 3 fabulous Van Gogh paintings on the wall that were in the artist's personal collection. I just came from Amsterdam where I visited the Van Gogh Museum that had mobs of people and dimly lit their paintings. Trust me, these 3 Van Gogh paintings at this museum are outstanding and you can walk right up to them to examine them. In short, this is one of those small gem art museums that you'll fondly remember from your trip to Paris more than visiting the mega art museums that are mobbed and frequently more annoying than enjoyable.

Great Collection - try to go with good weather. I love the collection of Rodin sculptures here. The highlight being the gates of Hell, in the garden. Try to go when the weather is good because many of the sculptures are on the outside and the park-like gardens are superbly maintained. Suggest start with Musee Rodin in the morning; The café/restaurant outside is helpful, recommend having lunch here and then walk for visit to Musee D'Orsay for the afternoon. Do not miss the small but very beautiful collection of paintings in the main building.

I could spend a day here!. It's part garden and part museum. When I visited it was quiet and not crawling with people. The museum is housed in a historic mansion which is a work of art in itself. The view from the garden back to the house is breathtaking. We enjoyed a nice rest with a glass of wine in the outdoor cafe. Yeah!

Bit dull, not much apart from gardens. I was dragged along to this by a friend. It was a pretty steep entrance price for the quantity of objects on display, with the gardens taking up the bulk of our time as there was so little to do elsewhere. Recommended if you like to immerse yourself in French philosophy and art, however.
Don't Miss this Gem!. TheMusee Rodin is one of the best small museums in Paris. Devoted to Rodin's work, both the house and the gardens are beautiful, filled with his iconic sculptures.

Wonderful gem in the middle of Paris. The Louvre and Orsee get all the attention; this is one you shouldn't miss. Calm, quiet, less crowded than its more famous relatives, the Rodin Museum is such an enjoyable way to spend a few hours that it warrants becoming a calendar event during your visit.
small, beautiful, peaceful. A lovely museum and place to learn about the artist and sculptor.I didn't know the gardens were so beautiful. It's like mini-versail.

Fantastic small museum with garden setting.. i really enjoyed seeing the development of the sculptures inside and then enjoying the larger pieces in the gardens outside. Lovely. Remember free of the first Sunday of the month and in the afternoon there was no line at all.
Let me think..... Just loved every sculpture. I didn´t know much about this artist so next time I´ll make some research to enjoy every other museum.

Rodin's Gardens. We didn't go into the museum but we walked through the gardens where we saw The thinker, Dante's inferno and many other sculptures. It was also a nice place just to sit and relax for a while. Cost 1-2 euros each.

Not to be missed. The Musee Rodin was a real surprise. The museum itself has all of Rodin's most famous sculptures. He lived in this mansion and after the state took it over he arranged for it to become a museum for his works. We were lucky to visit on a beautiful day so the garden was especially lovely and inviting with many of the sculptures conveniently arranged throughout.We bought a ticket for Musee Rodin and the D'Orsay and were fortunate to visit the Rodin first and then we walked to the d"Orsay which had a long line but we were able to visit through a different door..

The gardens are a great discovery!. I knew we'd see great statuary, but there is also an enormous garden out back! Acres! On a stunning fall day it was quite the treat to stroll these quiet shaded paths after a day in the bustle of Paris.

The building alone is amazing!. What an amazing building for a museum! My husband and I wanted to avoid the craziness of the Louvre and we weren't disappointed. Make sure to start at the VERY top first and work your way down...especially if you don't have a lot of time...or love Renoir :)

Amazing Location. The gardens of the Musee Rodin are extensive and it is exciting to see the sculptures outside in the park-like setting. The sculptures inside were also well worth the visit. I am disabled and the 2nd floor of the museum was accessible by elevator. All museums in Paris seem to be free for a handicapped person and their helper but you need to bring your handicapped card/parking pass etc.

One of a kind. The Rodin Museum in Philadelphia is excellent but can't hold a candle to this one in Paris. The grounds are a wonderful park where we go for lunch and relax. There are works of Rodin that can't be seen anywhere else but here. Incroyable !

Quiet and Intimate Rodin delivers. The quiet grounds of the Musee Rodin allow up close and intimate viewing of dozens of his most significant sculpting's while the interior spaces complete his resume with many paintings, drawings and planning sketches. In addition the museum is host to exhibits of other important artists. When we visited there was a show of Mapplethorpe photographs in juxtaposition with the Rodin works that either influenced the pose or had a similar theme. Intriguing. Well worth the time to absorb a little art history and influence in the residential context where so much of it was created.
Fun Activity. This was a really nice afternoon activity. The gardens, sculptures, and house itself are beautiful. Very worth the time and cost.

Gardens Better Than Museum. I went 20 years ago in December, so I only saw the museum, which is a perfectly lovely place to spend some time. Two years ago, I went back to the museum and the gardens. The weather was perfect. We spent about 3 hours relaxing in the gardens, reading, and doing some photography. The perfect place to get out of the chaos of the crowds.

Lovely. This small, beautiful museum was a delight to visit. It takes about an hour to see everything: the gardens are beautiful. Fred, one of the docents, made the experience unforgettable: his knowledge of the artist and the city of Paris was an added treat.

Lovely visit. The Rodin museum is a hidden gem away from the hoards of tourists that occupy the Lourve and all the other major attractions in Paris. Even on a Friday afternoon, it was quiet and nice. We felt there were more locals than tourists. The gardens are the highlight with a flurry of activity by the Thinker. Other than that it is a lovely respite from the busy crowds and well worth a visit. Our hotel (hotel de Varenne) was located 2 min away so it was truly perfect!

Ohh la la. On a recent trip to Paris, France, we had the opportunity to see the Musee Rodin. It was a lovely day and we saw both the beautiful work indoors and the gorgeous gardens and sculptures. We had purchased the six day Museum Pass as we were there a week. This is absolutely the only way to go to see all the treasures of this magnificent city. I loved all the art indoors, but the gardens were a highlight. At every turn, you discovered another Rodin, thoughtfully placed for all to enjoy. The gardens were in bloom which only highlighted the beauty of the sculptures. We had a delightful lunch outdoors from a well priced luncheonette located in the heart of the grounds. I could have spent so much more than the four hours we were there, but it was time to see more treasures which Paris had in abundance.

An absolute delight!. The garden where Rodin's "The Thinker" is located is phenomenal. There are many incredible sculptures in a beautiful peaceful setting that invites you to slowly meander through the garden or simply sit and enjoy the art and surroundings. We visited on a Sunday when they offer free admission so there were quite a few people there. But it never felt crowded. I highly recommend this museum and gardens!

Rodin's home and gallery are an inspiration. Stunning, peaceful, beautiful. I loved visiting here because it wasn't as crowded as so many of the other sites in Paris, and of course because of the incredible sculptures.

Excelent outdoor museum. We spent there 3 hours and was very nice due to most of sculptures of Rodin are located inside the beatiful gardens. You can see there classics of Rodin The Thinker,The Hell Gates and The Burghers of Calois.

Favorite museum! Romance, gorgeous gardens. The art itself mesmerizes me. The emotion emanating from the pieces is surreal. And as if the art was not enough, the gardens are absolutely delightful. The staff working there are sweet and helpful. One gardener cut off some extra roses and handed them to my young daughters. Another staff member bought the kids a box of cookies for being so well behaved. To me, this os better than The Louvre and less crowded too.

Lovely gardens and sculpture. This is a beautiful quiet spot to enjoy the gardens and sculpture, and maybe a cup of coffee. The roses were in bloom in late Sept/first of Oct. Had to wait in line about 15-20 minutes on a Wednesday morning, but once inside there was no crowded feeling at all. The sculptures are (of course) amazing.

Nice Place for a Visit. The grounds are amazing. You can get some quality photos from the top floor of the museum. The inside of the museum is nice also but the outside is spectacular. Walk the grounds and just sit awhile on one of the many benches just enjoying the peace and quite. You also have to see the "Thinker" who is also outside.

Great collection of works by Auguste Rodin. The museum is centered around Hôtel Biron one of Rodin's residences with beautiful gardens and houses a great selection of his works.During our visit there was a complimentary exhibit showing the similarities between Rodin and Robert Mapelthorp. If it were just a tour of the gardens, a visit here would be worth it, but you get more with the exibits and descriptions of each the works on display. I highly recmommend a visit if you the time
Excellent!. The gardens and the house are incredible. What an experience to wander around Rodin's sculptures and tour his home.

Lovely Statue Garden. The Rodin statues are situated in a lovely garden setting. On a summer day it must be a very pleasant place to just hang out. We saw a number of families with children. Rodin must have been a very prolific artist, based on the number of statues at the museum.
Great and free !. A very nice museum where you do not have to pay !Not as popular as Le louvre or Orsay but just as interesting (and much more focused). The garden is very enjoyable.

There is a reason this is listed as a top 10 Paris Museum. The Musee Rodin more than rocks. I was here in 1975 and it was good, but I was a naive student and did not have access to all the information now available. The museum now has a modern entrance (and of course the mandatory book store and place to buy replicas of Rodin sculpture). The highllight of the museum is the garden. All the classic Rodin pieces (the Gates of Hell, the Thinker, the Shades, Balzac, the Burghers of Calais) are out there in a peaceful setting. To the left as you enter in the garden is a setting through glass of dozens of pieces I certainly had not heard of or seen 40 years ago. The day we were there was an early fall day and the leaves were turning and the air was crisp and it was glorious to see all of the studies for major pieces as well as the pieces outside.After the peace of the garden and the history that was conveyed on some displays, we went into the building (hotel) where Rodin kept his studio in his last years. It is not great, but it is good to see the progression of his skills from the inauspicious beginnings to greatness. There are three Van Goghs (one very good) and several other pieces he collected. Not a deep indoor collection, but some of the early models for great works and you can see their development. This is a great museum now and I am sure with the continuing improvements and scholarship it will be even better.

Peaceful haven near Les Invalides. We paid 2 euros for the garden only and would recommend it as a peaceful interlude on a sunny day. The view of the Dome of Les Invalides is spectacular and sculptures look so much better in an open air setting than indoors!
Surprisingly beautiful!. We spend all one day wandering around Musee Rodin and it was great!Musee Rodin is a must if you come to Paris!
