Passionate forceful pieces in a lovely garden. Be sure to get the headset, unless you are a scholar, to understand the intent and history of the pieces. The garden is a fantastic setting for the large works and it is nice to be outdoors!

A fantastic collection of work.. You can spend hours roaming the grounds and take in the sclupture. There is a small cafe in the main garden where you can get a nice salad or sandwich and enjoy it in the gardens. You can spend hours roaming the grounds and take in the sculpture. There is a small cafe in the main garden where you can get a nice salad or sandwich and enjoy it in the peaceful gardens. A wonderful museum , away from the crowds.
Well worth the money!. Wonderful sculptures inside and out, although the beautiful preferred to a number of the pained figures in the gardens.

A Must See. An excellent museum - well laid out, easy to visit, pleasant and courteous staff. Go there, especially if you want a more intimate museum experience than the larger museums in Paris. We saw this before Louvre and Orsay and are glad we did as we were then more able to pick out and appreciate Rodin's work at the others.

Sculpture lovers unite!. The lovely Musée Rodin is in an 18th century mansion, l’Hôtel Biron, in the 7th arrondissement of Paris. It has been a museum showcasing Rodin’s work since 1919. It is interesting to note that Rodin started life out as a decorative bricklayer. I went on a Friday in the early afternoon outside of peak tourist season and thought it would be quiet but there were still quite a few people so I am not sure when the best time to go would be. It is a nice few hours spent. You can do it all in two hours or less unless you really want to hang out in the gardens and/or have lunch or a snack in the restaurant located in the right hand side garden. I highly suggest trying to go on a nice day, i.e. no rain, because there are as many nice sculptures to see outside as there are inside. This is especially true for those who enjoy taking photos. The Thinker is one of the most famous of Rodin’s works and although I appreciate it, it is not one of my favorite works of his. There always seem to be crowds around this sculpture, located outside, in particular. If there are too many people, move on and come back to it later. The Thinker is sitting on a stone and I hate to I say it, but to me it just looks like a guy sitting on a toilet focused on doing his business! One of the bronze sculptures that merits close scrutiny outside is Rodin’s “La porte de l’enfer” (The Gates of Hell), which depicts a scene from Dante’s “The Inferno”. This piece has 180 figures and he worked on it over a span of 37 years. The sculpture was commissioned by the Directorate of Fine Arts and was intended to be the entrance to a planned Decorative Arts Museum, but the museum was never built in the end. I must say that this sculpture needs to be cleaned desperately by the museum because there currently is so much dirt, dust and presumably bird excrement on it, particularly at the upper levels of the piece. In addition to Rodin’s works there are several pieces by Camille Claudel, who was his apprentice, lover and muse. The tragic Camille suffered from mental health issues, ended up destroying much of her work, and was placed in an asylum, where she spent 30 years until her death at age 78 in 1943. There are renovations going onside through 2015 but they do not hinder the visit. The temporary presentation of the collections is well thought out. There is a nice gift shop at the entry/exit. Toilet facilities can easily be found throughout.

A surprise - well worth a visit. This was not originally on our to-do list. After visiting Musee d'Orsay and viewing some of Rodin's work, we decided to include it and were rewarded with a wonderful museum/gallery. Housed in Rodin's actual former residence, it has an amazing collection of work from this immensely talented artist/sculptor. The gardens are beautiful, with many works of art on display. Crowds are much more manageable, which in itself is a bonus. I would highly recommend this to anyone remotely interested in sculpture, and would suggest you allow up to 2 hours if you want to fully immerse yourself in Rodin's work.

Truly a thrill to visit. We were so happy to be able to visit the Musee Rodin. We wandered around the rooms of this grand home. There were finished pieces as well as working models. Later we went outside to see the sculpture in the gardens. Both inside and outside we saw works that were old familiar ones as well as ones new to us. Finally we got to the absolutely astonished Gates of Hell - La Porte de L'Enfer. It combines many of the pieces seen at the museum. We stood and stared at this massive, chilling, gorgeous piece of sculpture formed from many pieces of sculpture. Later we saw a second one at Musee d'Orsay. Rodin Museum a must see.

Beautiful mansion houses rodin's sculpture. Don't miss this old mansion filled with rodin's art - painting, drawings and sculpture that pours into the surrounding gardens. Crowded the day we went, with a line-up.

Gardens and mansion delightful. Rodin's works are displayed beautifully in this 18th century mansion and the surrounding garden. This popular museum was quite crowded, but the garden is so expansive that it still seemed peaceful. Most of Rodin's most famous works are set in the garden where they can be admired a setting with the Eiffel Tower in the background.

A Lovely, Small Museum. On your trip to the Eiffel Tower, don't forget to take a short stroll over to the Musee Rodin. It is a small, uncrowded museum with a huge array of Rodin sculptures, the most famous being The Thinker. There are also some surprise Van Gogh paintings on the second floor for and added treat. It is in the 7th District, and you will love walking the neighborhood. Enjoy!

See some of Rodin's most famous pieces. a lovely setting, garden, park like with a chateau like former convent housing the collection. Just note that the rooms are small and can get crowded and hot. The garden, however, with mant famous pieces, is quiet lovely b
Great. Liked everything, the dancing the food and the position of our table.The costumes were great. We had a good night and everyone must see this show

A surprise in store. The beautiful ex-nunnery school and garden right opposite Les Invalides Museum saved for the nation by Rodin's obstinacy in the face of developers, and now housing his sculptures in the rooms and garden in the setting that was his studio, don't miss.
Peace and beauty. The garden is beatiful and peaceful with a small cafe. The Rodin sculptures are inspiring, It provides a respite from the bustle of Paris.

quiet oasis in Paris. just great place - have been a couple of times now as even though a tourist place to visit - still maintains an air of quietness and cool.you can pay for just gardens or house and gardens and I would recommend you do both. the house itself is not particularly beautiful, but pieces in it are displayed to their maximum and to see the works in progress is amazing.the gardens are beautifully maintained with Rodin's work interspersed on the walkways, in alcove of bushes. The Thinker and Gates of Hell are the main ones that draw the photo-crowds - but a walk to the other end of the garden opens out to a small shaded area that looks back through the garden to the house. thoughtfully placed benched and further back deckchairs make it a place to linger.This time we stopped for coffee in the small café to the side of the garden - I had resisted previous time as I tend to think a captive audience means hiked up prices. we were really surprised coffees were cheaper than in the places we had lunch and dinner!..and all served with a smile.a good way to spend a couple of hours.

Almost perfect. Lovely spot in the suburbs of Paris. The house contained wonderful exhibits nicely laid out. Thereafter into the beautiful gardens for more exhibits including The Thinker. All best viewed I think in good weather when garden at its best as it was in late September. Pure escapism!

Great little place. I wasn't looking for it but walked past so stopped in for half an hour. It has his seminal pieces scattered in a beautiful, peaceful garden. The house has a variety of early works and studies for The Gates of Hell. Fantastic.

Great museum. This museum is not to be missed when you go to Paris. Read up on the story behind some of the sculpture before you go so you'll better appreciate the work. Especially the Burghers of Calais.

Missed opportunity. Went to visit this smaller museum since my wife and I had been to Paris on numerous occasions before and had seen all major museums .Beautiful setting in a former villa with a beautiful garden where one can find an impressive collection of Rodin art works.We however found unfortunate that the museum provides very little details about the art work and the techniques used by the sculptor to create those "bronze".Most visitors have no idea how a "bronze" is created and most think that such sculptures are created by sculpting metal blocks....which is not the case.The museum would add greatly to the visit and experience by explaining the process in creating such monumental pieces.
Lunch and sculpture. We lunched outside at the Rodin Museum with wonderful sculpture all around. We saw The Thinker in all its glory. This how to enjoy life.
One of the best museums in Paris. A beautiful cosy museum in the heart of Paris. Rodin's sculptures can be enjoyed in the garden, the latter which is worth a visit by itself.

Anyone who loves Rodin must see this museum. What is there not to like? The master in all his magnificence.Great location-compact- all of his masterpieces! Run -do not walk to see the greatest master since Michelangelo and Leonardo.KMeloff Toronto

Wondeful place to visit. You can visit the museum or just the garden. Or both!!! I've visited both, but the main part is the garden, no doubt!!! There you can see the works that make Rodin famous, as The Thinker and The Door of Hell

Beautifully set out. Loved to be able to wander the gardens in the sunshine and see the exhibits. With so many museums in the inside only it was the perfect place to take in some culture on a sunny autumn day.

I love it. I went to the museum on the first Sunday of October which allowed free admission. I chose to go to this museum in the morning as it is less popular than Lourve and Orsay. I hired an audio guide that offered good information and interesting stories. Besides sculptures there are a few lovely paintings by Rod in and by Van Gogh! Beautiful garden. Must go.

A perfect sized museum!. We knew there would be some of Rodin's sculptures but the museum or rather Rodin's house also has draft models of some of his key work. The gardens are beautiful and there are also some Van Gough paintings on display. We went when they had the Mapplethorpe exhibition which is well worth paying extra to see.

Nice Museum and Gardens. This is really a very compact museum, which makes a nice contrast to the much larger and more crowded museums of Paris. Try and go during pleasant weather, because strolling through the gardens and looking at the sculptures displayed outside is a major part of the experience. Our ticket included the special exhibit that was on at the time, which compared the works of Robert Mapplethorpe to that of Rodin.
What a treasure!. This musee is a delightfully quiet place and inexpensive to visit, with wonderful sculptures throughout the garden.

The Thinker. One of the most inexpensive museums in Paris (if you just do the gardens), with a terrific cafe and clean (free) washrooms. Many sculptures to see, beautiful gardens. It's virtually right across from Les Invalides, so if you want to visit Napoleon's Tomb you can easily fit a visit to both places into one day. Also close to Rue Cler, with great wine and cheese shops, markets and cafes.

Excellent in all ways. We had been here a number of years ago, but it's much better. Still lovely gardens with superb Rodin sculptures, and in the building, Rodin's sculptures with those of his colleagues, including some great ones by Camille Claudel. When we visited they had an exhibit comparing Robert Mapplethorpe and Rodin and it was one of the best-curated exhibits I had seen.

Lovely gardens. I was fortunate that the weather was beautiful on a recent visit to Musee Rodin. The gardens are beautiful and you can linger around the sculptures at your own pace. For a few Euros more I went inside the museum that held additional art works, which was nice.

Closed, but full price to gain admission. Talk about bonkers. We visited midweek mid-morning in late January. The payment desk lady advised us that the museum was mainly closed for some reason or other. So the Burgers of Calais sculpture in the garden couldnt be seen as the gardens were closed. The "Kiss" was on loan to Italy, but the Thinker was there and available to view IF you pay an extra Euro on top of the full addmission price. She informed us they just had one room open. Full price to enter that room then pay the extra Euro to see the Thinker. I half expected Jeremy Beadle RIP to pop out. It must be a joke! But wasnt. So I told them to shove it and left.
Fantastic!. Loved everything - the gardens, the cafe, the museum, the artwork. When you're in Paris, put the Musee Rodin on your must see list.
Wonderful Attraction.. I'm not an art lover but really did enjoy the sculptures and art work here. we also had lunch here and enjoyed it.

Gorgeous small museum. The Musee Rodin and gardens is wonderful. It is not at all overwhelming with just 6 rooms in the mansion and a small walkable sculpture garden. The must see sculptures are "The Thinker" and "Gates of Hell." There are many people sculptures by Rodin and others and some paintings as well. Learning about the sculpting process and the life of Rodin was very interesting. There are also some lovely benches and chaises to relax in the gardens if desired. As a side note, if you have the museum pass it is of huge benefit here, I bypassed a very large line to get right in. If there is a line outside, I would go to the front to show your pass because I did not see a clear sign when I first got there.

The thinking Man. Came here on a particularly hot day but the gardens were beautiful. The museum itself was lovely, but got a little tired of seeing the same type of art. The building and gardens were beautiful.

Wow, what a suprise. We have visited Paris several times and have never been to the Rodin before. Our bad. This is an outstanding museum and can be seen in a couple of hours. Excellent displays and exhibits. Rodin was so diversified in his art and this museum shows his amazing and varied talents to the fullest.
M...Rodin. Who knew Rodin had so much sculpture? Don't miss it and checkout the statues in the gardens too! Just wonderful!

Rodin and peace and quiet.. Some great pieces of work by Rodin in what was his house and gardens. Lovely to stroll around the gardens looking at the works and the gardens themselves as its so tranquil in there.
Easy to get there by Metro and nice cafe in the grounds for a drink and some nice food.

Real art!. We really enjoyed our visit to this amazing museum.We had a nice walk around the garden and we admire the fabulous pieces of art.The museum itself was very nice but again the garden was so fabulous that we preferred to have a nice walk around the garden!

Artistry, open air. Paintings, sculpture, colorful garden with outdoor artwork. Tour at your own pace with audio guide. No rush. Get there when it opens, though, because tour groups and student groups arrive late morning into midafternoon.

Large collection of the masters works. Really enjoyed this wonderful collection of Rodin's sculptures,both in the museum and in the gardens.Lots of other visitors but they were far from intrusive.To sit in the Autumn sunshine amongst such pieces of art is very special.

Don't miss the Musee Rodin. Paris has a lot of museums, but this one is totally different and SHOULD NOT BE MISSED. If you are looking for a Paris experience that is filled with art, beauty, and great food this is a wonderful place. Rodin's sculptures and the paintings shown within the mansion are just magnificent. You get to see Rodin's "practice" works and what art he liked and chose for his own home. But that's not all...THE GARDENS - just Magnifique! We strolled peacefully, we sat by the beautiful fountains and water, and we had a wonderful lunch surrounded by Rodin's masterpieces and lush gardens. The little luncheonette was not expensive and the food was fresh and good. Just imagine sipping wine with a scrumptious lunch and Rodin. It doesn't get more Parisian than that!The cost is only 7.30 euro - but admission is free for a lot of visitors. Children are free; students are free, handicapped individuals are free, and more. Check the website.
A nice surprise. Rodin's works were exceptional and also the history of the building and gardens his works are housed in was very interesting.

Most excellent!. We were amazed by the character and strength in the creations of Rodin. The whole museum and gardens is outstandingly beautiful on it's own. Add the fabulous art and you have the perfect day in Paris!
Top fun.. An easy walk from the Grand Hotel Leveque. Very comfortable and polite. Plus plenty of pieces from one of the top sculpters in history.

Sanctuary. Knowing the throngs of the Louvre far too well this museum is a haven of tranquillity in manicured and lovingly attended gardens of the house Rodin used as his studios and show room. A picturesque reflecting pool at the end of a formal garden terrace is flanked by more relaxed planting with plenty of opportunity to get really close to some of Rodin's powerful body of work. Cafe is reasonably priced - a bit of a scrum to get an outdoor table for 4! The exhibition in the house is well laid out and informative and the pinnacle of his ouvre must be the passionate embrace of The Kiss which can be found in a circular panelled room - admired and inspires!

So pleasant, especially on a warm day. The Musee Rodin has the inside galleries and displays as well as the outside statue gardens. For one Euro, you can just get an entry to the gardens. Extra to go inside with a combo ticket. We liked the gardens the best. The Thinker is outside and The Kiss is inside. The gardens are lovely and well-shaded. Several little paths under the trees.That is one reason I recommend it for a warm day. Peaceful and cool. We went on a weekday. There is an audio device if you want details on the statues, etc. there is a brochure, but it is not detailed. minimal gift shop. Many art books on Rodin. There are restrooms. There is a fairly comprehensive "snack bar type " restaurant on site. We didn't try it since we were going somewhere else for lunch. It looked like they had salads, sandwiches...

Musee Rodin. My favourite sculptor- I loved this place and was so excited to see his real work. The gardens are beautiful- take some time to enjoy the peace whether strolling along or sitting back to take in the surroundings. Cafe was a nice place for lunch.

three great pieces to see and many others too. Three great Rodin pieces are all in the gardens. The Thinker is his best known piece, but the Burghers of Calais and the Gates of Hell are, in my view, more impressive. The latter was the work of more than 30 years as I understand it. The lovely sculpture garden is more impressive than the works in the house in my view.

A corner of peace. This is a lovely museum with delightful gardens, well worth a stop to visit. There are versions of all his famous sculptures, The Thinker, The Kiss and The Burghers of Calais, but there are also less well known pieces and works by his contemporaries and pupils, including one who went on to become his mistress.In the gardens is a cafe, which, considering its location, serves good snack food at a reasonable price, I had a delicious bowl of soup and a salad followed by a pannacotta for about 12 euro.
Rodin in the Garden. It is a lovely spot full of Rodin sculptures. The garden are beautiful and a wonderful setting for his sculptures.

Good museum - could have used better guidance. There's the gardens and there's the museum in the house. They had run out of English brochures - which sort of forced us to rent the audio guides. Hint: Do the house/museum first, then see "Hell's Gate" in the garden and then do the rest of the garden. Everything will make sense that way. We didn't, and we were a bit confused. But, in general it's a lovely museum. We covered it in about 4 hours.

Delightful stroll through the house and garden. Once you fine the Rodin museum, you are in for a treat. You are able to stroll the gardens and enjoy the sculpture as well as tour the house to see such classics as "the Kiss."

Lovely home with gardens. Even if you are not a big fan of Rodin's work this is worth seeing. It is is home and gardens, which are just beautiful. His work is so large, it can't help but be impressive.
A must for Paris. While the gardens are nice, seeing The Kiss and The Hands was one of the highlights of my latest Paris trip.

Mildly interesting and nice gardens if weather good.. A little disappointed with our visit here. I don't know what we were expecting but we felt the inside museum was just ok. There is no doubt a lot of real skill was needed to craft the sculptures but there was a feeling of wanting to be more wowed. It was interesting to see The Thinker, The Kiss and The Burghers of Calais etc. and also the Van Gogh paintings which we weren't expecting but felt like a stretch to spend more than an hour there. Pleasant little café in the grounds.
Worthwhile visit. Used museum pass to bypass the long line outside. Note that the Museum is closed on Mondays. Museum's offering was interesting and in amount enough for a visit.
Rodin museum. Close to our hotel and Invalides. Pictures allowed. Easy access. Closed on some days so check before going

Most enjoyable museum experience. This is my favorite museum of my trip to Paris this time. The hotel that was home to Rodin with the wonderful collection of his art and history is absolutely delightful. Even the onsite outdoor restaurant was good.
Great Rodin Collection in Paris. Collection housed in a great building (where Rodin actually lived and worked). Also extensive gardens with more sculptures (including "The Thinker").
The cafe is highly recommended. The cafe in the Museum gardens is highly recommended. The food is simply delectable and the desserts are superb. Great setting for an early summer or spring lunch
Thinker & Kiss. Use the Museum Pass to skip the queue. Sights include The Thinker, Gates of Hell and The Kiss, Hotel Biron is 'plastered' with his works.
My favorite museum in Paris. How can you not enjoy those gardens with surrounded by Rodin's masterpieces? And, then...inside...."The Kiss"!
Always a treat. I had been here before but it is always a treat to explore this fabulous indoor and outdoor exhibition of art
The Kiss. This was my favorite statue there.The Thinker is the most popular, but view The Kiss and then you decide. It has lovely grounds and a nice place for lunch.
lovely museum. A perfect place to start your day in Paris. The majority of the sculptures are outside, in a gorgeous setting. Get there early to beat the lines!
Enjoyed our Museum Visit!. Not bad priced, we spent around 2 hours here looking round. Some great history here at the museum and we especially liked "the thinker and the walls of hell" pieces.

Go on a sunny day!. In order to fully enjoy this museum, go on a day where it's not raining or take an umbrella. There is a fair amount to see outside and it's definitely worth walking around out there.

Amazing amazing. such a nice museum such a nice property. Loved the combination of interior and outdoor exhibits as well as the special exhibit. Love it and recommend you spent a few hours here on your trip to Paris
Wonderful gardens. Get the audio and just wander the gardens and be amazed at the sculptures. Tour does not take long. Used the Paris pass and can skip the line.

Rodin - Think about it!. Rodin arranged to have the government convert his favorite hotel/residence into a Museum for his work and personal collection, rather than demolish the building. It is so manageable, small and intimate, the Museum and gardens - where many of his best pieces are displayed - can be comfortably visited in an hour, or longer if you're a Rodin fan!

Very cool museum!!. The artwork was beautiful as was the garden and grounds. There is a cute cafe in the garden (of course overpriced but delicious nonetheless). I had my first french macaroon here :) Make sure to see the thinking man!!
Beautiful sculptures.... ...in a beautiful garden. Forget The Thinker. You just haven't lived until you've seen Rodin's The Gates of Hell.

Spectacular. This was the one museum that I was really looking forward to seeing in Paris. It didn't disappoint! The beauty of Rodin's sculptures is set perfectly in a lovely garden and old building. Spending time admiring his work was a delight, but the surroundings made the experience spectacular.

slightly off the beaten track. We saw the Maplethorpe/Rodin combination exhibit, which may now be over. It was very well done. The gardens are a delight...a place to sit to contemplate The Thinker, a telescope to view details of The Gates of Hell, plus an abundance of roses.

Visit the Garden!. We did not tour the museum itself. Instead, we paid 2 Euro each for admission to the garden only and shared an audiotour for 4 euro. Seeing Rodin's works in a natural setting with the Eiffel Tower and Dome Church in the distance was special. Most impressive were his Les Bourgeois de Calais, The Gates of Hell, and The Thinker, although many other works were scattered throughout the garden. Initially, we thought we'd spend maybe an hour in the garden, but with the bonus of the audiotour and comfortable atmosphere, we were there for hours! This is a Paris highlight!
Aussie travellers. Lots of Rodin sculptures in a building not to large to manage. Great view over the garden from up stairs.

Don't leave Paris without seeing this fabulous museum!. The negative reviewers and I must not have seen the same museum! This museum is nothing short of spectacular. It's located in the Hotel Biron which Rodin used as his workshop. It contains most of his significant works, many in natural settings in the gardens including The Thinker, The Kiss, and The Gates of Hell, a pair of bronze doors intended for a new museum which never came to fruition. It's a stunning piece which took 37 years to complete. Our guide for our Louvre tour, who's getting his Ph.D. in Art History from Harvard , told us that The Gates of Hell was his favorite work and not to miss it. Boy was he correct.The museum is right next to the Varenne stop on the Metro and so is easy to get to. By the way, the garden restaurant at the museum is not only very pretty but it served the best lunch we had on our week-long vacation. The quiche was to die for!
Rodin and Mapplethorpe. It's a lovely place to visit. The Mapplethorpe exhibition was brilliantly curated and the it always nice to wander around the garden here.
Le penseur. I wouldn't miss this museum while in Paris. It may be small but it offers great pieces of art and a beautiful garden.
Nice for strolling!. Beautiful gardens, with Rodin's pieces displayed in a very approachable way. Enjoyed seeing actual Parisians visit on a Sunday afternoon.
A must see. This is a gem of a museum and I gather overlooked by many since its not large. But if you like sculpture, and gardens, you can't miss this one.
Musee Rodin is a "must see" in Paris!. Gardens were fantastic! Amazing collection of Sculptures! The best way to realize his genus! Small collection does not take long to see.

We did this the first day and frankly I was underwhelmed. This was just a so so museum and I would not go back there there are so many better ways to spend your time in Paris that I would not go back there. If you love Rodin though you can go into his bedroom where he died of t.b.
If you like sculpture this is one of the best.. Located in a historic building with well manicured grounds. All of Rodin's most famous pieces are displayed. Not to be missed.
Just the right size.. If you become overwhelmed by large museums then this is the perfect place for you. The gardens and Maison are manageable. Hope you have nice weather.
Lovely gardens set off the sculpture. A haven in the city, with the stunning sculptures of Rodin in his house and gardens. Not to be missed.

Good place for a quiet afternoon.. This is the place to go if you are tired of all the tourists and queues! Just stroll through the garden, have some tea in the tea-garden and continue on into the house for the rest of the exhibition...pure relaxation!
Master. Incredible works of art created out of difficult mediums, so lifelike, so full of expression. A true gem.
Worth a visit and gorgeous gardens. Well worth a visit, a nice small museum. The sculpture and flower gardens plus the grounds are beautiful.

A serene little museum in Paris. This was my favorite museum in Paris due to the proximity to our apartment rental, the spacious peaceful garden, and the small size of the museum with it's incredible collection. It was possible to really relax and enjoy the art here compared to the frenetic Louvre and Musee d'Orsay.

Beautiful gardens but get the audio guide. I love Rodin's work and wanted to see "The Thinker," and I wasn't disappointed but one needs adequate time to linger in the gardens. I highly recommend the audio guide.

Excellent collection of Rodin sculptures. The Musee Rodin is a very good museum that features several first rate Rodin sculptures and works, including The Thinker (what well educated, contemplative academic isn't built like a god?), The Gates of Hell (epic) and Kiss. The museum is centrally located, features very nice grounds and gardens, offers traveling exhibitions (Robert Maplethorpe just finished today), and has a great area with lounge chairs in the far end of the garden for an enjoyable rest. Paris has so many great museums that the competition is high for 5 stars.

Garden and Sculpture in Perfect Harmony. Rodin was the most magnificent sculptor whose work evokes many emotions. His gardens behind his final home that became his named for museum (a formerly run down "Hotel") was magnificently restored after the nuns were forced to abandon the place around 1900.Rodin believed his statues and works were best displayed in a natural setting, so it is befitting of this that many of his best works including The Thinker and the Gates of Hell are beautifully shown here.Definitely a highlight of a Parisian visit.

Beautiful Garden Museum. A quiet, green space in the midst of the city. We only purchased admission to the Garden to see the sculptures including The Thinker and appreciated it thoroughly. Allow 1-2 hours to enjoy the gardens, it has toilettes and café within the garden setting. Gift shop was very busy and a bit small for the number of visitors otherwise would have been fine.

Poorly Organized. I had high hopes for this museum but they were dashed right out of the gate when we were greeted by a security guard at the door demanding our ticket. As we explained; we didn't have a ticket and would like to purchase one, he was shocked, and kept saying "you have nothing??" No Dude, no ticket, no pass, nothing. Can't we buy one? FINALLY made it passed security (with a newly purchase ticket) and were told they were out of English guides. OK we will get an audio guide. No you won't. They don't do audio guides for the garden only. Never mind, we'll get a peek at "The Thinker" and get out of here. So we did.

Amazing Sculpture in Beautiful Surroundings. This is a must when visiting Paris. I had visited the Rodin Museum in Philadelphia years ago as a student but this one is far better. The metro stop is Varenne and the Musee is directly next to this stop. I attended the Robert Mapplethorpe/Rodin Art show first but spent a lot of time viewing the sculptures in the Gardin which is very beautiful. Rodin was a master and this museum showcases his work perfectly.
not quite impressed. worth visiting but dont expect to see much, i mean we are talking about Paris, the competition is too high so sorry about the conservative rating!

One of our favorites. We brought a picnic lunch with us to enjoy a beautiful afternoon in Rodin's sculpture garden. The museum includes a variety of Rodin's works in bronze, marble, and plaster. We were a little disappointed that there wasn't a wider selection on display (which is rotated), but we still had a wonderful time at the museum.

Indoors and out...very nice destination. I'm biased because I love Rodin's work, but even for those who don't, I still think there's much to be enjoyed at this museum. Gardens intrigue me and just having the option to view art inside, then go outside and stroll is attractive. This is one of the less-stressful destinations because it's not super-crowded and there are places to sit and relax. It's also "do-able", meaning you don't feel you have to cover every inch of the place to get a good feeling of what's offered. Wander around the garden for sure, and try your best to enjoy some of the art inside as well. Sometimes it's better to start upstairs and work your way down. I always think it's smart to ask someone who works there how to best navigate the place, with regard to the amount of people there and what's just not to be missed.
Beautiful. A beautiful peaceful park setting and a great way to display the brilliance of the Rodin. It definitely made you think......Get it!

Rodin Rocks!. The Rodin Museum is in the house that he lived in. The house is beautiful. In the house you will find many large and small statues that he created. The grounds are very beautiful and his statues are situated in the gardens also. His works of art are great. He also has some other paintings in his house that were gifts from people like Van Gogh. Very interesting museum.
Great Show - Do not take the kids. The show was wonderful - the dancing, the roller skating act, comedians. However, my wife did not realize that women dance topless - do not bring the kids

A relaxing Museum. The museum is housed where Rodin worked. Many of his pieces are displayed in the gardens around the building. This is a quiet and beautiful place. In the far back of the garden we also found some long lounge chairs and just rested our eyes for about 30 minutes. A refreshing time and place to be. And Rodin's work is accessible to all given his skills in communicating emotion through his sculptures. This place is like a massage for your artistic self.
Worth a visit. you gotta visit the gardens, its a nice visit and doesnt take more than one hour.There is also a museum inside.

Small But Beautiful. Loved the setting - reminded me of the Borghese Gallery. Enjoyed the grounds. Was small enough to squeeze a visit in between other touring, yet peaceful enough to make us want to linger.

Amazing. We were awed by the amount of work Rodin produced. The sculptures are both in a garden setting and in the museum. A beautiful view over the garden from the second floor. The Gates of Hell was quite interesting. Should include this on your visit to Paris.

beautiful!!. Beautiful; if I had to choose three museums to revisit Paris, Rodin would be the first - the works are wonderful, gardens and places where you want to stay all day. By the way, the second museum that I revisit is the L'Orangerie, and the third, the Orsay !! Not necessarily in that order, because all three are simply fantastic!

Gorgeous. This was our third trip to Paris but our first time visiting the Musee Rodin. We loved it and I'm sorry we missed it on our first two visits. The gardens are amazing so make sure to go on a day when you can be outside. We enjoyed the temporary Mapplethorpe exhibit as well. Go and enjoy!

Mapplethorpe-Rodin exhibition at the Rodin Museum, Paris. If you're in Paris between now and Sunday 21st September 2014, DON'T miss the wonderful comparative exhibition of these two wonderful artists at the Musée Rodin, rue de Varenne, Paris. US born photographer Robert Mapplethorpe's black and white photographs are juxtaposed aside August Rodin's sculptures to great effect. Although they lived a century apart, there are many similarities in their work. It is a very sensual and moving exhibition and was one of the highlights of my week's stay in Paris this month.
Perfect Pace. A stroll through his garden on a sunny day is perfect Parisian peace. An oasis full of wonderful art.

Superb even If you don't know sculpture . I love Rodin & his work. Here it is beautifully presented in his home. Great audio tour. Nice spot to check bags so you don't have to lug them. A good rainy day option albeit kinda outta the wayGorgeous gardens even in the fall. Go. Sit. And enjoy. Many museum signs in English
green and stone. Loved the Mapplethorp and Rodin special exhibition and also relaxing on a lounger at the end of the garden.

Gorgeous gardens. Went twice-once for the gardens and then for the museum. Even visited the temporary exhibit of Robert Maplethorpe. All are a definite must see, but if you are short on time, at least see the garden and its fabulous sculptures.

Beautiful Gardens, Beautiful Art. We are so glad we took the time to visit the Rodin Museum. The grounds were just beautiful with sculptures and flowers mixed throughout. The "Thinker" is here, have your picture taken with the sculpture in your own deep thoughts. We walked from here to the Eiffel Tower and found many restaurants and shops in between. I bought tickets for this museum and the d'orsay as a package set. So happy we didn't skip this one.

See The Thinker and the nice gardens in person. Seeing the sculptures in person is worth the visit, and the nice gardens were a pleasant surprise. The café is good. Rodin, given his trade probably had large hands, something he put on many of the figures in his statues, and something I'd not previously known about his work.
Fabulous!!!. Wonderful museum. Fantastic Rodin collection and even a couple Van Gogh paintings. Wonderful gardens and great museum shop. I loved this museum.

Getting to know a genius closely. This is one of the very best museums of France. One feels that he is sharing Rodin's life, sometimes intimately. The location is convenient, the garden is extremely well kept. His work is just breathtaking. No visit to Paris can be complete without visiting this charming museum. Purchasing your ticket on the internet could save you half an hour. Important note: Rodin museum's ticket is also valid for the Musee D'Orsay.

Cosy Treat. I can imagine that Rodin loved his "little" white house and garden. We loved seeing all the sculpture in a less formal setting and this time I spent more time wandering around the grounds, which are lovely.

Bring the picnic lunch. This museum is in a wonderful part of the city it was sort of like a little adventure just trying to find it it's in the lovely parklike setting where people can just sit and stroll about the gardens and enjoy lots of sculptures that are out about the grounds.I particularly like the giant statue of the Thinker, it was fun to see him in a 360 rather than just the front on view that you always get in the photograph!Wonderful spot on the sunny afternoon.

City Estate houses Rodin Treasures. The Rodin collections is housed in an old estate, with the gardens showing off the works to great advantage. The Thinker is there of course, but the lesser known pieces are no less fascinating. I loved it.

Rodin, "Think about it". Purchase a "Paris Pass" which includes paid entrance to most popular museums. Plus you avoid long lines and you literally just walk in. Now, you have to love Rodin to visit. Shows pieces of Van Gogh, Rembrandt, da Vinci...owned by Rodin. The "Thinker" is there, plus many others..Gardens are beautiful. The museum was his home.
Gorgeous grounds and art. Wonderfully situated, with sculptures and paintings in the house. Beautiful gardens. A must see museum

Worth a stop. If you are a Rodin fan, you will love the museum as it has a lot of his works. If you are an average fan, the gardens are wonderful. So its definitely worth a visit. I'm not a huge Rodin fan but still appreciated it all. I would recommend going early and buying your ticket online. The line-up to get in when I was leaving was significantly longer than when I arrived which was approx. 15 min after opening.
Serene. A beautiful Museum holding works by Auguste Rodin and several other sculptors/artists held within the walls and gardens of the Hotel Biron. Immaculate gardens and a lovely cafe.

Beautiful garden. Just had time to do the garden and really saw some of Rodin's most know work. The Gates of Hell and the Thinker are right there in all of their glory. Well worth a visit if even just to stroll the garden and have a coffee.

Sitting in the sun in the sculpture garden. Really enjoyed lunch at this museum cafe. Very delicious basic lunch food and lovely pastries at a reasonable price and very well organised. Outdoor tables under the avenue of trees on one side of the garden looking at the house and sculptures. A lovely Paris experience.
few statues. this place was home of Rodin, is a beatiful place and have some statues, specially The Thinker, but few for be a museum of Rodin. You will see more statues of Rodin in M de Orsay

Beautiful old hotel turn into fantastic museum. If you are interested in sculpture this is a must. The old hotel has been converted into a museum and some of the works of art are breath taking. Lovely gardens, nice cafe and something just achingly cool about the whole place.
Such a neat place. Soi glad we decided to visit here....the gardens are wonderful, the Rodin sculptures are iconic and the Mapplethorpe exhibit was very cool!

Don't miss this wonderful museum. The Musee Rodin not only has a wonderful collection of Rodin's work but also a magnificent garden complete with restaurant. When you have had enough of the crowds in Le Louvre, come here instead and sit a while amongst the sculptures and the roses.
Lovely garden. A quite haven in a busy city. This is a lovely place just to sit and relax, the gardens also have a great view of other famous buildings in Paris.

Stunning!!!. We had to queue up to see the Museum, but it deserved it!!!The Museum is inside a wonderful hotel where Rodin used to live in his last days.The pieces are arranged in a chronological way, with good explanations of any single work of art.It is really exciting to see the studies for the sculptures and his sketches!I loved to see the works by Camille Claudel too...

tranquil and pleasant. We enjoyed viewing the statues in the garden (we didn't go into the mansion to view the other artworks) and had a really pleasant lunch in the cafe in the garden. It was a quiet break in a busy week. The first Sunday of the month the museum is free.
Worth a Visit!. Lovely house and gardens containing lots of Rodin's famous work. Very busy in peak season but facilities cope well. Gardens are a particular haven of peace and quiet.

Must see while in Paris !!!!. A beautiful peaceful place ... The garden is filled with works of Rodin and the mansion is a walk into the mind of this exceptional artist ! A definite must see while in Paris !

Great. Spare a couple of hours and go see it. Great gardens - very quiet and peaceful place in the heart of Paris. Lots to see and meditate on even if you are not an art connoisseur. Remember that the museum is self sustained do they appreciate donations. My favourite piece is "The Kiss" :). Enjoy

Wonderful garden to wander in. No need to explore his house just g o to the gardens and enjoy the many sculptures. There were many more statues than I expected. Did not think house really worth the time.

Check out the garden. This is my favorite musee in Paris. The second time and since I pay only to go into the garden and skip the musee. Take a picnic lunch and enjoy the quiet and outdoor sculptures and garden.

Thank you Mr.Rodin. Oh yes! Musee Rodin is the place worth visiting! I wanted to go there especially to see Hell's Gate and Citizens Calais. They are fabulous! When you see all the details you cannot imagine Rodin worked with cold cold not very "plastic" materials. Apart from the Rodin art - we were lucky to see temporary exhibition "Mapplethorpe-Rodin". Great surprise!

Beautiful gardens and sculptures. We incorporated a museum visit and lunch stop at the Rodin Museum. The beautiful gardens had lovely spots to stop and eat our picnic whilst enjoying the world famous sculptures. The gardens are relatively small as was the queue to get in. There is a very small fee for the gardens which houses most of the sculptures or for an extra fee you can attend the museum area. Highly recommended to recharge the batteries
OK. so I have always loved 'le penseur ' de Rodin . So if you like sculptures you know that this is a must see museum.
My favorite one. wouldn't miss it! amazing Rodin, amazing park, calming. loved it very much - was worth waiting in line for 30 minutes!
Rodin. Loved this museum. Beautiful garden with his great works through out. If you only have time to go to one museum go here. It won't take all day and you still have time to take in another site.

A chanced upon treat. We happened upon this museum as we walked around during our first day in Paris. In a classic building and with a beautiful garden, this is a large, impressive collection of works by a great and grand artist. The principal scultures are distributed throughout the gardens and the pieces are inspiring. I think this is a must visit
Very Imformative. A lovely setting for this interesting Museum, with beautiful gardens filled with Rodin sculptures. Gates of Hell were fascinating.
Really lovely and peaceful museum. Not long to queue, wonderful sculptures and there was also a Mapelthorpe photograph exhibition on - we went on a Sunday which is free admission.
A real gem. Not really into Rodin but decided to go as we were in the neighborhood. Pleasant surprise at how much I enjoyed the gardens. Not too big.

Tranquil garden setting and airy cafe combine for a perfect visit and quiet lunch. When you enter the Museum you see a special exhibition of Robert Mapplethorpe photographs. This was an added bonus to the sculptures in the garden and in the house. If you like Rodin this is a beautiful showcase for his work. There is another line to get into the house after the museum but it moves quickly. We had a pleasant lunch in the cafe before heading out to the more crowded museums.

Surpassed our expectations!. My husband is a Rodin fan, and despite being told Louvre is the place for art, we spent nearly an entire afternoon at the Musee Rodin. The house museum is immaculate and vast; curated in a way that tells a story about Rodin and his work. The gardens are breathtaking, and we LOVED the temporary concrete installations. As a bonus, there was no line to get in, even on a Sunday, and it wasn't crowded. You can get up close to admire these beautiful sculptures.
Roses and Sculpture. The park was beautiful and so relaxing. It was like a little hidden paradise. Loved the smell of the roses and the position of the statues. Overall a beautiful place

Just average. Saw a few masterpieces by Rodin, but feel the museum was somewhat lacking. The best part of the visit was the lunch we had at the cafe in the garden. The food was very good with nice indoor and outdoor dining!

Wonderful art, wonderful setting. wonderful setting for some inspiring sculpture. The grounds and house are perfect to display these fabulous works. A great way to spend a few hours...especially if you're lucky to be there in the sunshine. note, we happened to be there on a Sunday and it was free to enter...apparently this happens 1st Sunday of each month...ideal if travelling on a budget to see this great attraction.

RODIN MUSEUM IS ONE OF THE PRIME DESTINATIONS IN PARIS!. This is our second visit to the Rodin Museum. At the entry point to go inside you are ushered into a Robert Maplethorpe exhibit which we found only mildly interesting. One can find this part of the museum offensive or amusing. Your choice. We found it neither actually but sort of a non-event.The prime part of the Rodin museum occurs both indoors and outdoors. Indoors is where you find The Kiss and many other impressive Rodin creations. The outdoors however dominates with the most famous The Thinker and the statue of Balzac. The gardens outside are gentle to the mind while you stroll! And don't miss the Burghers of Calais out and about.The indoor of the Rodin is not to be missed. As I said The Kiss is there and so are many other famous Rodin creations, including other versions of The Thinker and a wonderful Evard Munch painting of The Thinker. Also there are some very interesting Impressionist paintings, Van Gogh, etc.Don't miss this prime destination! We easily combined this with a trip to Musee d'Orsay which is a not far away. We allocated 2/3's of our time to Orsay and 1/3 to Rodin, BIG TIP--you can get a combined admission ticket for both of these locations. But we chose to do this differently but getting a Paris Museum Pass which skipped us up to the front of the line for both museums.

Idyillic. This is a perfect way to spend an afternoon. The sculptures are wonderful, which came as no surprise. The surrounding house and rose gardens provided the perfect setting for the sculptures, resulting in a tranquil, inspirational oasis of calm.The museum is very close to the metro station, inexpensive, and not overcrowded. Highly recommended.

No thinking needed, you should see it. If you have any interest in sculptures, this is a can't miss museum. He is the master! Plus, seeing the large sculpture of the Thinker, live and in person, was a thrilling experience.

Wow, love spending time here. The gardens are so lovely and relaxing to just enjoy his works.
Line for the house can be a little long but worth it.
Pay 1 euro for the outdoor garden. We enjoyed walking around the garden of the museum. There were plenty of sculptures out there. I loved being up close to them outdoors.
A must see. Well located site and wonderful garden with Rodin sculputure, highlight for The Thinker. Check special exhibitions in the main building, always a good match.

Free Sunday and it's packed. With out any prior planning we visited here on the first Sunday of the month - when it's free ! The queue was long and it was hot . So we meandered around the beautiful gardens ,enjoying all the sculptures and generally soaked up the very peaceful
Atmosphere . Loved it

Don't miss this one. Finally made it there, after driving by on the tour bus many times. For only 2€ we went to the gardens only and the sculptures were amazing! In a very pretty park setting you can see these sculptures.

A great gardens and don't miss the museum. The gardens are fantastic with of course rodin's works including the Gates of Hell. The gardens also displays more contemporary works. The museum in addition to Rodin studies, house works of other sculptures as well as three vangoghs

Lovely exhibition not overrun with crowds. This was perhaps the most relaxing museum and garden I have ever been to. The staff were helpful in answering questions, and it was a pleasure to simply go from room to room enjoying the evolution of Rodin's art. One got a sense of who the artist was, the inspiration, and the impact of Paris on the art world. It was a very intimate setting and not to be missed.
A hidden gem of the city.. At 10 am in the morning there was almost no one there. Quiet, peaceful and beautiful place. Definitely worth visiting, even if just for a while.

One of My Favorites. The collection was well organized and not cluttered, and the grounds were just extremely well done with walls to give the illusion of not being in the city. The Thinker was outside by itself, and each sculpture had sufficient space around it. All in all, a very relaxing visit away from the hustle and bustle of Paris.
Musee Rodin. A must see for those who like the works of Rodin. So interesting to see the studies in the house and the finished pieces in the garden. Very beautiful.

The gardens are worth a short visit. For a "suggested donation" of 2 Euros each we were able to stroll around the gardens and see the Thinker and the Gates of Hell. We only spent about 30 minutes in the gardens, and were also able to take advantage of the bathrooms on our way to visit the Eiffel Tower. Great photos with the Thinker and beautiful grounds.

Gardens are great. The gardens were a wonderful respite from all the tourists in the other large museums. We did not buy the ticket for the interior exhibition, but the gardens were beautiful and a good value for seeing the beautiful art in a lovely outdoor setting

What a prolific artist and what a talent. Loved it. Great garden as well. Just very intimate museum dedicated to Rodin. I didn't realise there were so many "Thinkers" out there. I didn't even think of how sculptures were made until I cam here and saw all the different sculptures of the same thing. Great little musee.

So Peaceful. It was like walking in a sculpture paradise. Many are beautifully displayed in the setting of the gardens. The tranquility of the gardens provided a wonderful backdrop for the sculptures. There is also a very good collection of paintings by artists such as Renoir, Van Gogh and Munch. The most exciting moment in Paris for me was at this museum when I saw 'Pere Tanguy' by Van Gogh. I never imagined it to be so much better in real life than in print. Thank you for that special moment!

A haven of calm. The museum itself is a beautiful old house, and the gardens are balm for the soul. All most interesting, and the gardens are particularly lovely. The museum is just a few steps from the Varenne Metro station, which on a hot Paris day makes it doubly attractive!

A highlight of Paris. To see Rodin's work set in a beautiful garden is a delight. You can easily wander the gardens and simply enjoy his work without following an audio commentary. The commentary adds to the experience but there was something more contemplative and enjoyable to just sit and admire without engaging in too much art analysis. The gardens themselves are beautiful and it is hard to believe that a busy city lies outside. There are even lounge chairs in the back of the garden so you can stretch out and enjoy the sunshine. The coffee and pastry we purchased at the outdoor cafe were wonderful as well.

A little piece of heaven. Musee Rodin is a lovely little place to enjoy while in Paris. There is a great deal of art to admire as well as sculpures to observe. The gardens are breathtaking admist all the beautiful pieces of art including the "Thinker" piece. It's almost like a secret garden.
So beautiful!. It's a must see if you're in Paris. There're beautiful sculptures inside the museum and outside, with a great garden area.

An impressive sight. A great museum. Strolling around the gardens was the best part of the day. I really loved the statues as well as the interior of the house. It was a beautiful day and nice that they had so many benches around to sit and enjoy.

Rodin Statues in beautiful rose gardens. a favorite museum//gardens. We smuggle in picnic lunch and eat among fabulous sculptures. I am a potter and was inspired by some pieces Rodin made sculpting figures in the clay of the pieces he threw. So much here is breathtaking and the grounds and museum are the perfect showcase. Don't miss!

Rodin is fabulous!. Works of Rodin to be seen inside and outside. My only complaint is that outside there are not enough places to just sit and enjoy! Probably because so many other tourists were taking the available seats!

A kiss is not just a kiss. This is the place for romantics to enjoy the beautiful works of Rodin who capture the beauty of the human body and spirit and express them in his masterful sculptures. Stop and linger by the kiss in the outdoor garden

A must. Rodin was, of course, a genius of a sculptor and many of his most famous creations are beautifully displayed here. The audio commentary is excellent and makes a huge difference to understanding his work and its context as well as having interesting accounts of other famous French personalities.

One of my favorite spots in Paris. This museum, in a house with gardens, is perfect. It's great to follow the trajectory of Rodin's work and then stroll the gardens where some of his most famous pieces are. We were lucky to also see a Mapplethorpe exhibit; the photographs next to the Rodin sculptures were striking. Absolutely worth the trip.

garden is lovely, not crowded. This summer I traveled to Paris with sister and 21 year old niece. Neither was into seeing museums. We had an afternoon free and, after the obligatory tour of the Eiffel tower, decided to walk to the Rodin Museum and visit the gardens, which are much cheaper than seeing the museum itself. We passed by Invalides and the beautiful golden dome along the walk through safe neighborhoods with plenty of cafes. Once there, we enjoyed the lovely gardens, interesting sculptures, great photo ops, and seeing "the Thinker". Some of the modern sculptures are funny, including a toilet, where you may pose as "the Stinker" ala Will Ferrell. After battling the hordes at the Eiffel Tower and other tourist spots, we were pleasantly surprised by the relatively few and smaller tour groups here and the calmer quieter aspects. There are plenty of places to sit in sun or shade, a nice little cafe, and super clean free bathrooms. Should I visit Paris again, I would want to stop here again and peruse the museum as well. This museum is covered by a Paris Museum pass. There is no reason not to stop in for a few hours if you want to get away from the crowds.

Magical setting, great collection. Must visit if you really like arts and its history. The gardens are magical and to be in the same place where the artist lived and worked has an extra effect on the experience.
refreshment. after wandering around the stunning sculptures nothing is better than a delicious ice cream, in the shaded garden

Serene, spacious, and gorgeous!. Rodin Garden and Museum is a MUST SEE!! There is a long queue to get in, so I highly recommend getting your ticket online before you even get there. If you buy your ticket online, I also recommend lumping it together with the d'Orsay ticket so you can save some money. Even though the line is long, it is so spacious outside that it's hardly noticeable that there are a lot of people present. Take your time to stroll, sit, and just take it all in. Once inside, it gets more crowded. People flock around the Thinker, which is pretty sad - is that the only reason to go? Certainly not! There is so much to see and take it. I would recommend setting aside at least 2 hours (minimum) to enjoy all of the work of Rodin. There is a large cafe outside that you can get food and beverages at.

Stunning. While in Paris many times before I had never seen this museum...I'm sorry I didn't see it before. Rodin's sculptures as well as those of his mistress Camille Claudel are as impressive as the impressionist painters in Quai d'Orsay...in fact a few of Rodin's impressionist paintings are also featured in the museum...interesting.

A Hidden Gem Away from the Crowd. This was a fantastic museum, next to Musée de l'Armée. The work is displayed both indoors and outdoors, and the grounds are beautiful. In planning for my trip, this was not even on my radar, but a friend suggested it and it ended up being one of my favorite stops. The sculptures are amazing, and it was nice to be able to enjoy them without the huge crowds you face at some of the other museums.

✨✨✨It׳s a dream✨✨✨. It is impossible to describe in words ,just you can not visit in Paris and not see the Eiffel Tower.
Recommended at night and during the day.
No need for words❤️
I'm THINKING!!!. If you are going to be in Paris for more than two days, please set aside one to two hours to visit the Rodin. You will be glad that you did.
Rodin museum. located in a lovely garden - home is beautiful - rent the audio guide - great explanations - a must see
A favorite place. The interior of the original house was Rodin's studio and holds examples of his work. The sculpture in the garden is nicely sited, and there are special exhibits in a new building.

So romantique!. Museums are not usually romantic. But something about THIS one is. Is it the grounds? is it the sheer grandeur of the sculptures? Is it Paris? Cannot say. But can say it is a terrific stop that is a must. You can spend a lot of time there or a little but the enjoyment will be grand either way.
See The Thinker!. It is a cool museum. It takes about an hour to see everything, but it is near other cool museums, parks and cafes!

Rodin's creations & personal collections. This was a great experience, starting with the gardens and the art existing there and ending in the building where you can find various art pieces also...
For sure it worth a visit.

Small garden with beautiful sculpture.... If there is a list for "n sculptures you must see before you...", Rodin's "The Thinker" must be on that list. Therefore if you are visiting Paris and if you have more than a day, you must go and visit Musee Rodin. It is closed on Mondays. You can use the Varenne station on line 13 of the metro. There are also nice sculptures by Rodin inside the metro station. You will need less that 30 minutes for a quick tour, if you can stay longer, you can enjoy the beautiful garden.

A pleasent walk in the gardens. This museum is very nice to visit as you are outside as well as inside. Inside is warm but there is not a lot to see so you aren't in there very long. Outside makes up for it.
loved it. The garden and the musee are a lovely afternoon must see. We had a glass of wine and gateau in between a manicured garden. Was an all round perfect French afternoon
Beautiful. The building and gardens are worth a visit, the art is a bonus, particularly the sculptures in the gardens.

rodin. We have spent the 4hrs together with small children.
thanks to... they were not bored
nice sunday morning walk in the garden, watching the statues
Rodin Museum. Just wonderful. I was not aware of just how prolific Rodin was. Will return for a refresher. The palazzo and gardens are beautiful.
Beautiful. Go for the day, have lunch in the cafe and stroll the magnificent gardens and the chateau. Take time to soak it all up, one of my favourite Paris experiences.
Thinker. Lovely gardens and sculptures and a pleasure to walk around on a hot sunny day, well worth the visit

Fine sculptures. Rodin is a fascinating sculpteur. As you enter, in the garden the Thinker mesmerizes you. The Gates of Hell, the Kiss, each work is to be admired for the attention to details. The lawn outside with birds and rabbits is equally beautiful. You could see some of Rodin's sculptures exhibited in Museum of Orsay too.This museum as most of the Paris Museums, is free for the handicapped and the accompanying person. The French are truly considerate. Un Grand Merci.

Small Museum and wonderful gardens in Paris. I truly enjoyed the Musee Rodin with Rodin's lovely sculptures and lovely gardens. Worth the visit especially to see the famous sculpture Le Penseur! Also very nice for children's with the lovely gardens and inexpensive for families.
Lovely setting. It's a comprehensive collection of Rodin's work, including a number in the lovely gardens, where there is a good cafe

Showcase of a Prolific Artist.. Not only was the indoor museum full of initial and intermediate castings and finished masterpieces of Rodin's sculpture, all displayed to greatest effect, but the unexpected extensive gardens with swathes of verdant lawn, shrubberies , roses and a plethora of flowering annuals provided visitors with garden rooms in which to rest on benches and admire the many finished sculptures, including the magnificent "The Thinker", "The Kiss" and "The Burghers of Calais." Intermittent rain didn't seem to dampen the enthusiasm of the long queues, the constituents of which all, even the young children, all seemed to find something at which to gawk and admire. The outdoor refreshment area with its tables and chairs appropriately shaded by large umbrellas were well patronised.The museum is good value for money.
Loved the gardens!. I love the sculptures by Rodin, the building used to be his house but I love the gardens, so quiet right in the middle of the city!
Small Museum, worth the walk!. Loved seeing Rodin's classic sculpture and that it was a small museum, easy to get around in. Lovely gardens as well

Wonderful Garden Spot in Paris. I really enjoyed visiting the Musee Rodin in the mid morning on a weekday in summer. The grounds were nice, and it was very inexpensive compared to other attractions in Paris. The entrance is a short walk from the Varenne Metro station. My favorite sculptures were " Le Penseur" (The Thinker) which is very famous, and "The Gates of Hell" which is a depiction of Dante's Inferno which is incredibly detailed and interesting. This can be an excellent spot to photograph the chapel dome of Les Invalides, which is visible from the garden. The garden also has a nice cafe for lunch or a break, and this seems a bit silly to note, but they have well maintained restrooms, which can be hard to find when touristing around Paris. Overall, this is a nice place to visit which offers a respite from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Thinking Man. This beautiful museum and gardens should not be missed! Fantastic sculptures and gardens surround the museum. Great place for pictures. You will be able to find a thinking man here.

Gardens are the best!. Try to visit when the weather is nice, bring a snack and settle on a bench in the garden, it's lovely. The Thinker, the Gates of Hell and dozens of other terrific Rodin sculptures are there for the viewing. On our visit there was a Maplethorpe exhibition which was worthwhile and included in your entry. Included in Museum Pass, check your bag for easy walking around the museum itself.
beautiful surrounds. The gallery was a pleasure to walk through and it was wonderful to see Rodin's work in the gardens as well as in the gallery. A lovely change from the bigger museums.

Not Worth It. Although our visit was significantly hampered by rain (and the fact that the employees manning the door refused to allow anyone inside for 20 mins. even though more than 35 people left), the collection is quite underwhelming. The mansion itself is ordinary.The true attraction is the gardens with statutes, but you cannot enjoy them in the rain. So choose your day wisely.
The biggest artist for sculpture ever. Excellent place with a lot of sculptures . One of the biggest artist for ever. You will be impressed. There are unforgettable things...

Fantastic. Nothing compares to Rodin. Gardens well presented with statues placed so you absorb each one individually. One of the highlights of my visit to Paris.Go late morning to miss the tour busses. Have lunch in the gardens- excellent food.
Surprisingly enchanting. This is set in an old manor with beautiful gardens, and exploring the grounds and statues was a highlight.

Always a must-see. If you have a Museum Pass and you're visiting d'Orsay, you might as well take in the beautiful sculptures by Rodin. About a 15-min walk from d'Orsay pass government buildings. The property is beautiful as well; love the mansion. A small museum that won't exhaust your feet or your senses.

The gardens make it worthwhile. It was a bit of wait to get into the museum even with the museum pass, however the gardens make the wait worth it - even in April there were beautiful blooms and the gates of hell are fascinating to study.Inside the museum is easy to navigate and because they strictly control the numbers allowed in at any given time, not too crowded.Well worth the visit.
Lovely sculpture garden. My teenaged son went in free as in to the museum while I strolled around the sculpture garden, lovely place to sit under the tree on a bench.

Peace and Quiet... and art!. It was a very nice and pleasant visit after so much information you absorb at the d´Orsay. walk through the garden and find the Thinker. Then, go inside the house and find the Kiss, then upstairs, works of Van Gogh and the thinker by... Munch!! Then again relax in the garden. This was the highlight of my day. don´t miss this nice museum, with nice staff too!

A small and exceptional museum. Another fine Paris museum, this one devoted to the sculpture of Rodin. It's a fairly compact museum with some spectacular examples of Rodin's work, as well as some other artists, oncluding a Van Gogh portrait of Rodin. The gardens are beautiful, peaceful and also filled with some fine sculpture. Decent little cafe in the garden as well. Great museum that can be enjoyed in a couple of hours or less.

Beautiful gardens showcasing Rodin's work. Am really just a big fan of the Kiss which had a crowd of people photographing it but the gardens are very beautiful and full of Rodin's other sculptures. Was well worth the visit.

Pinch me. I bought a Museum Pass to enter the Musee Rodin as I had 4 days in Paris and a long list of places I wanted to visit. I got there at a little past 10.00am and had a very short wait to buy my pass. You walk from the ticket office and into the garden and one of the first things you see is The Thinker. I had waited a long time to see it and it was worth it. The gardens were beautiful with many other statues and glimpses of the golden dome of Les Invalides. Take your time to wander and marvel in the garden and the museum. There is also a cafe in the grounds.
Great museum. Nice museum, easy to navigate. Great displays inside and out. Small but attractive gardens. Recommend it!

Beautiful, peaceful location. Worth it.. Bring a book. Maybe something to eat. Take your time walking through the main building and the surrounding gardens. Great thing to do by yourself...or with a date!I had a teen and a toddler in tow and still had a great time. So I would watch the kids outside while my wife was inside and then we switched.Kids 18 and under are free.Take subway 13.Rodin was a genius.

Beautiful park and free for EU Jeunes (18-25). The line moves quite quickly and we were pleasantly surprised to be let in for free. Perfect for a relaxing stroll in the garden Rodin isn't too shabby either.

The Kiss, Thinker and Great Grounds. The grounds are unbelievable with a great lunch spot located to the side. With other sites constantly busy this one is often is less populated and has room to move around. A place to go after hitting one of the other hectic 'must sees' in Paris. Nice and plentiful bathrooms

Sculpture amazement. While Rodin's 'The Thinker' is very popular and recognizable, there are more of his works which will just amaze you. My favorite is 'Hands of God', that sculpture just leaves me in awe each time I see it. His sculpture with the hands are just amazing! Then there is 'The Kiss', this sensuous and moving work you can circle around in the musuem and just admire the detail he provides. Definitely check this out when you are in the 6th or 7th arrondisment. Also It is included in the Paris Museum Pass.
A must see. The highlight of our vacation with a beautiful museum and garden. Don't miss this gem of Paris. Right now there is a special exhibit with Robert Mapplethorpe's photography. A must see!
Don't miss!. Rodin's works are displayed in a beautiful building and garden. You can visit the house and garden or just the garden. There is also a delightful restaurant/café.

Beautiful oasis in Paris - major art works. We visited in June and the gardens were marvellous, enhanced by many works by this most important 20th century sculptor. Even then inside was warm so I wouldn't go on a hot (for Paris) day.The sculptures alone are of course worth the visit and they can be examined up close for detail.Not to be missed if you have any interest in this artist. However the place is also worth visiting as a refuge in a big busy city.
Beautiful Gardens. You don't need all day to make this stop. You can see the gardens in half hour so if you're on a tight schedule, try to work this trip in.

See 'The Thinker'. We visited this museum, solely to see The Thinker sculpture so we were pleased to find that I could get entrance to the garden only for 2 euros and my 15 yr old daughter was free as all museums are free to under 16's.Fab gardens with lots of Rodin's sculpture throughout. Quirky and interesting as well as peaceful and relaxing - absolute bargain at 2 euros.Also, I discovered that they sold 'parma violet' ice cream which made my day as parma violets are my all time fav sweets!Really glad we went!

Another Must-See Museum. Another iconic place to visit in Paris. The gardens are gorgeous and the art, of course, is wonderful. Try not to visit at the end of a hard day of touring. You will miss some of the great sights (as we did when our feet gave out).

Rodin Museum. It's a nice, smaller museum with a pretty garden. It was very dry, so the plants were looking water hungry. The museum is small and has a few Van Gogh pieces. It was hot and the building was even hotter. It's in a quaint part of Paris that we walked a ways to get to, but had some great side streets leading up to it.

Tranquility in the Middle of Paris. The Hotel Biron, or Musee de Rodin, is a peaceful jewel right in the middle of the city which we’ve enjoyed many times. The historic Hotel is under much needed renovation but remains open, at least half of it, until the completion in 2015. Being able to stroll admist many fine and interesting pieces of work in an atmopshere of where the great artist lived and worked sure beats the competition for human space found in many of the other great Paris museums. Do not miss touring the grounds, the works of art, Rodin’s workshops, and the lovely gardens provide another perspective. Combined with high walls and abundant trees, only the gold Invalide dome over Napoleon’s tomb reminds you that you are indeed in the middle of the city. If you stroll to the very end of the garden, pass through the arch in the middle of the hedge. A surprise awaits you. The Musee de Rodin is a place where you can return on each visit to Paris and enjoy as if it is your first visit.

Very Big Electricity Pylon!. What a great structure; what a great focal point; what a great end to a beautiful vista from the north side of the river; what a superb place to hang out and watch people!
Good surprise. I remembered this beautiful museum and was more than happy to discover that my 10 years old daughter found it interesting and was happy to explore the museum with me.
Beautiful museum. I love the fact that this gem has so few visitors vs. the louvre or musee d'Orsay, yet has works of equal beauty and importance

Our favorite Musee. Small, quaint and full of charm, this remodeled hotel and now Museum is a jewel. Its masterpieces, the Thinker, the Kiss, the Cathedral, Gates from Hell, Balzac's statue or les bourgeois du Calais are spectacular, but it is the setting, with its garden, and the history behind this location, that draws you in and transports you to the era when August Rodin lived there and used it as inspiration for some of his work. Allow yourself time to just stroll in the gardens and its peaceful surroundings. Do not rush this one.

Rodin's masterpieces and gardens. The works of Rodin are house in a beautiful 18th-century mansion with manicured gardens. The sculptures - The Thinker, Saint John the Baptist and The Kiss are some of the most famous on exhibit. Our family purchase the Paris Pass and it included entry into the Musee Rodin. You still need to wait on a line to enter the mansion.
Beautiful. Mostly an outside museum- but quite a bit inside as well- amazing sculptures and scenery. Def. worth a visit- just for the Thinker alone!
Great place to visit. If you like sculpture museums, this is the place for you. The setup is great, and the grounds are beautiful.
Inspiring. The gardens are very good and well kept. The statues are interesting with my favorite being the thinker. Worth the visit to the garden at least if you are short of time.

Loved tha garden with sculptures. This was recommended by a tourist we met at lunch earlier in the week. We loved the Rodin sculpture garden. However the house had an exhibit of Robert Maplethorpe's works. We are not prudes, but I was not impressed by his works and fail to see what wows everyone about his works. The sculptures by Rodin in the garden are definitely worth your time. There was no charge for the garden, just the house.

Our new favorite place. This is one of the lovliest places in Paris, with a real air of calm and an atmosphere that makes you want to stay all day. The house and gardens and beautiful in themselves but when you combine it with the striking works of Rodin it becomes something quite magical. We also caught the Robert Mapplethorpe exhibition which made the visit more special. The gardens have plenty of seating including loungers! There's a cafe/restaurant in the garden too. Don't miss this.

Loved the Rodin. Collection has its own museum, and is filled with creations from the thinker to,gates of hell. All laid out in a beautiful garden setting that adds to,the splendor of the exhibit. If you are a Rodin fan, or just appreciate sculpted art, this is a Paris must!

Loved the sculpture garden. We skipped the house and went straight to the sculpture garden. My boys enjoyed this museum as it was outdoors. Nice visit with Rue Cler, Napolean's tomb and Army museum nearby.

I appreciate this location more and more each time I visit. I hesitate to write a review at all, let alone the excellent review this location deserves. Why? Because I don't want the word to get out and for this location to be over-run with tourists.
By far one of my favorite sites in Paris.

My favorite Paris museum. If you like sculpture even a little you must go to this museum. The size of Rodin's work is impressive. The inside of the museum is fun but the jewel is the outside yard where his large sculptures are displayed. If you don't have a museum pass skip the main building and just visit the gardens, it's a nominal charge and by far the best part.
Another gem. I love the old mansion with the creaky floors. It's a great place to wander. The gardens are amazing. You can easily spend hours walking and taking in all the beautiful work of Rodin.

Great museum . Wow what a great museum! Been to Paris many times before but always overlooked this great little museum.The house is modest and you can get through it quickly. The gardens are excellent with plenty to look at and keep younger kids occupied. Keep walking past the pond beyond the hedges to find a quiet seating area with a large sandbox which was a great place to take a break with the kids.
delightful. Please do spend time in the garden...We spent so much time in the garden that we ran out of time when the rains came but we did not regret it!!
Lovely museum, grounds and house. Wonderful to see "The Thinker" and other Rodin greats. The gardens are stunning and the cafe outside is a wonderful place to sit and catch your breath.
