Outstanding Museum. We visited the Rodin in late Sunday morning and certainly picked the right time. By the time we left there was a long line waiting to get in. There were no crowds and it was easy to walk around the gardens and through the display rooms. Rodin's large pieces certainly need room for proper viewing and their placement in the gardens superbly highlighted them. One of Paris's best museums!

Small bit lovely. It's a small museum but it offers awesome sculptures and the museem itself is beautiful, I would't mind spending an hour here just relaxing. There aren't many sculptures but it's Rodin and that means great! Plus you got other things close by so after you browse this museum (in an hour) you can just go to napoleon's tomb and walk to eiffel tower

Tranquil, relaxing, very interesting. Visited as part of maximising my Museum Pass. I was very interested in seeing Rodin's works, yes especially the Thinker, & was truly appreciated the magnificence of his works. By no means am I an art person, but this museum must be seen.Set on a property with a large garden & a magnificent house, it is a very peaceful setting. Thankfully you are able to take photographs so as to show off the wonders to friends & families back home & make them incredibly jealous. The Thinker is out in the open on a high pedestal so you cant pose next to it.At the time of my visit, there was a secondary exhibition of Robert Mapplethorpe photographs showing his interpretation of certain Rodin works & Rodin inspired photos as only RM would & could.An amazing journey & not too far a walk from the larger Musee d'Orsay which is an absolute must!

best small museum in Paris!. A Robert Mapplethorpe photography exhibit perfectly complemented the marvelous sculptures and the garden is restful and lovely. If only people would stop posing for pics imitating "The Thinker" a million times a day in front of Rodin's masterpiece!

Nice place enjoyable. The museum is about 10 mins walk from the Alexandra the third bridge and it is about 20 mins walk to eiffel tower . it is not very big but has a lot of offer. You can stay both indoor and outdoor to enjoy the great arts that Rodin offers.
Outdoor treasures. This is a small museum with a spectacular sculpture garden. To see " The Thinker" surrounded by blooming roses was a beautiful experience.

Another must see museum. Features the Thinker and the Kiss, Rodin's most famous works. Explores the life of the artist with displays inside and outside. We started out tour with a lovely breakfast at the cafe in the garden. A wonderful visit!

one of the most beautiful places in Paris. This is a small but beautiful museum. The majority of the significant pieces are outside surrounding the main building in the gardens. Put this high on your list if it is a beautiful day as it is extraordinarily peaceful- even if you have your kids with you. There is a lot of space to move around so it is not as crowded as the other museums. It is on the museum pass (which I recommend because you bypass the line). There is a small cafe with gelato adjacent to the main garden area that makes it even more kid-friendly.

A must. Unique and different from other museums in Paris. If you do not love the works of Rodin, it is still worth a visit for the history and you might be surprised of all the different forms of art. Unlike the Louvre, you can get this one knocked out in a few hours.

One of the best stops in Paris. Our family loves the Musee Rodin. After visiting all the tourist spots with all the hoards of people, the Rodin is a lovely break with fabulous sculptures and peaceful gardens with resting benches. While there was a short queue, the museum and especially the gardens did not feel crowded. This is a place I am sure to get to each time I am in Paris. Rodin's work just speaks to me, and I love the peace and quiet of the gardens.

Plenty to see for 2€ in the garden. I spent a lovely time wandering around the garden, admiring the sculpture and eating lunch. Very few tourists make it here, so it is a nice break from the Louvre and Musee d'Orsay.

Fabulous gardens. We spent a couple of hours wondering around the house and beautiful gardens. There are lots of places in the garden to sit and admire the sculptures. The queue appeared to be very long but we only waited 30 minutes and it didn't feel crowded inside the house and gardens. If you are going to lots of museums the Paris Pass laws you to jump the queue.

Well worth the visit. This museum was well worth the visit - offering some of the best known sculpture in the world in a lovely garden setting and an historic home. In addition to the masterpieces themselves, the museum includes many of Rodin's "practice" pieces, enabling visitors to feel part of his creative process and to examine how he worked to perfect a piece before producing it in bronze. There's a nice cafe on premises from which to enjoy the garden.A nice flow is to visit here before Musee d'Orsey, which also contains some of Rodin's "practice" and final pieces.

Musee Ronin is not to be missed.. Brilliant! I love his work and would go back to this museum in a flash. There was a special exhibit of Robert Mapplethorpe's photography while we there there...brilliant!

You should visit this museum. I have visited the Musee Rodin twicein recent years and on both occassions liked it very much. My most recent visit was in July 2014. The only reason I wouldn't recommend a visit is a selfish one - so as too many people don't visit ans spoil the tranquility of the place. That said it does seem to have the capacity for quite a number of visitiors without feeling crowded.This is an excellent museum full to the brim of Rodin's important works (The Kiss, The Thinker, The Gates of Hell) - which even if you aren't particularily interested in art/sculpture you should be impressed by. The gardens are lovely and well maintained and a very peaceful place to wander. There is also a cafe where you can sit and relax and people watch! Facilities are very good with plenty of toilets (which were clean), a free locker room and a cafe and shop.

Garden visit. Only visited the garden but it was great. Entry just 2 euros and it was a classic French style formal garden, with The Thinker, The Gates of Hell and other Rodin sculptures. Like the Tuileries but with awesome art and no crowds! Best 2 euros we spent in Paris.

Great Museum - Great Sculpture in a Calm Oasis. We adored this museum- One other reviewer said it best "An oasis in Paris" as with the lovely gardens this truly is an calming stop (and even on a lightly raining day the gardens were lovely)- Great collection of sculpture - my art aficionado wife loved them all, but even with my less cultured taste I enjoyed it - and even recognized several works (The Thinker, Gates of Hell). - On the Paris Museum Pass so you can save money on admission- Short walk from Orangerie and Invalides so it is easy to visit this along with other great spots on the Left Bank

Well worth a visit. I adored this museum, with its beautiful gardens and wonderful collection of sculptures and paintings by Rodin. I liked it above many of its other, more flamboyant counterparts, as it was truly beautiful and relaxing to walk around in. To see The Thinker and The Kiss up close is fantastic, and the museum is situated in a elegant quartier.
Great Place!. This museum has a wonderful garden and grounds. The work in both the museum and grounds is continually amazing with every turn. One of the best you can visit in the city.

The Kiss. So i LOVE LOVE LOVE this artist so for me it was great! I loved the sculptures and the sweet cafe that was placed just on the grounds. it was a little hard to get to but was well worth the circles we walked in. there was a more modern artis displayed there too which was edgy and HOT! a must see!

Lovely garden. We visited the garden only, as we didn't have sufficient time to do the museum justice (so have decided to return to Paris on another occasion!). A lovely garden containing many beautiful sculptures including, of course, Le Penseur. Totally worth a visit!

Excellent museum , oasis of calm in centre of Paris. Really enjoyed our visit , the museum is set in beautiful Parisienne townhouse with amazing gardens . The sculptures are situated in the house and gardens . The cafe on site is superb , serving drinks and food a variety of fresh salads and sandwiches/ pastries .
Loved Musee Rodin. I was able to enjoy the fabulous art sculptures galleries in a very relaxed manner because it was a Wednesday.. I went back a few times

Peaceful break.. An incredibly beautiful and quiet break from the tourist hordes. We lured the museum first and then wondered around the gardens. In addition to the art, you learn about the history of Paris.

sweet place for a hot afternoon. the gardens are beautiful and the place is very welcoming.
the exhibition is very nice (i love rodin's work).
i believe an hour and a half are enough time for it, but if you want to chill in the gardens make sure you have a bit more time.

Brilliant sculptures in a tranquil garden. What an oasis on a hot Parisian day. Cool avenues featuring the most compelling sculpture.
The museum house gives a great view of life in a typical grand hotel.

My Favorite. We didn't have this museum on our list but decided to stop in when we saw how close it was to the Invalides and so happy that we did! The highlight is the gardens with so many of Rodin's works placed throughout and a nice view of the dome of the Invalides and the Eiffel Tower. My favorite museum in the entire city!

Great for the kids!. This is a great museum to visit with kids. They loved running around the gardens and stopping by the cafe. The sculptures are awesome and the house is a beautiful layout. Overall amazing!

Fun in the gardens with children . What a glorious spot on a hot summer's day. We all loved the garden and the sculptures - absolutely fabulous. A much better choice than pulling children round The Louvre. Would recommend it - we spent nearly two hours there with our 14 and 9 year old.
Very pretty. We only went to the garden part of the museum to see the sculptures. The gardens themselves were beautiful and there was some cafés to sit at too.

Not the huge places – the right size for enjoyment. For art lovers – a mile stone. For others a must see in ease. The art explain itself in here, a known sculptures and sketches and much more. The garden is beautiful, the house impressive and most people found something to adore.

Amazing Museum. This is one of the best museums I've ever been to, hands down. The gardens are beautiful, the sculptures phenomenal. It isn't a museum that will take a full day to go through and it would be better to go on a day with good weather (no rain.) Definitely a must see!

one of the best things in paris. I really enjoyed this museum and the photography exhibit. His sculptures are set in a beautiful estate that seems removed from the chaos in Paris. It was not as busy as the other museums.

Add This Museum to Your Itinerary. Small and extremely doable, this museum was one of my favorites in Paris. The beautiful gardens with Rodin's fabulous sculptures scattered throughout and the lovely small hotel-turned-home-turned museum is one I wouldn't miss. We even went back a second day for a short time to revisit some of my favorite pieces (Praying Hands), the Thinker, and Gates of Hell to name a few (FYI - we had a museum pass (highly recommended) so didn't have to pay twice)The gift shop is also lovely and isn't inside the museum so you can just go there if you'd like to pick up a souvenir or two (Museum gift stores are perfect souvenir stops for something a little more unique to remember your trip by or give to friends/family).

Excellent museum. Displays many masterpieces of Rodin. The environment was pleasant and the audio tour was excellent - gives a lot of information. loves many pieces of art of there ( I was relatively ignorant of Rodin's work apart from the the Thinker before I went ) in particular, the sculpture of Balzac and Gate of Hell.Like many sites in Paris, it is free for under 25s and a small donation was sought at the entrance, which I gladly gave.
Under Reconstruction. Worth visiting but will be better when the reconstruction in the gardens are completed. We loved seeing the thinker.

Beautiful masterpieces and gardens. Beautiful collection of this master's work, lush and gorgeous gardens. Well worth the visit. Get a pass that includes Rodin museum and Musee d'Orsay - don't have to wait in the long line at D'Orsay
A favorite. But.. the muesum grounds are under construction right now so may be best to wait until it is complete. The Mapplethorpe exhibit was wonderful.

Excellent view of work as artist intended. We loved this museum as the work is shown in the manner in which the artist intended. The gardens are absolutely beautiful, though more of the works need to be added to the audio tour. You don't need more than 90 minutes to tour this beautiful home and garden museum.

Beautiful romantic garden!. A happy accident that we stopped by on the first Sunday of the month and found the admission to be free, so we could not resist stepping inside to explore the open-air sculpture park. The private garden of the museum is loosely filled with Rodin's creations set among mature trees in a beautiful atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit - even if you pay full admission!
Sculptures, Gardens, The Thinker. Lovely quieter museum. Learnt a lot about Rodin and his works. Very informative and the garden experience was a nice touch.

It never gets old. It's Rodin, what more can I, must I say? If I must, for the new visitor, it has a lovely garden in the back which is well shaded in sections. Buy a sandwich at the cafe and enjoy respite on a busy hot summer day surrounded by works from one of the greatest sculptors to ever live. Save the Gates of Hell for last as it's his culminating piece.
Beautiful grounds!. The museum itself is okay, but the gardens are what make it worth the visit! You can get a combo ticket with Musee d'Orsay, but you'll need to visit both on the same day.

A must in Paris. If you are in Paris, this is a must. The museum's garden is not only a splendid open air museum, it is also just a nice place to stroll around. In the museum itself, you can find several master pieces and models that proceeded Rodin's masterpieces.

Even if you don't think you care about sculpture. This is a sweet place. The special exhibits are worth viewing, as well. I would not recommend trying to do this AND the musee d'orsay on the same day. That was an option offered this visit, but it would not allowed enough time to do them both properly. Take your time in the gardens. Take a lunch and sit in front of some fabulous piece. Remarkable guy, Rodin. Get to know him.

Beautiful. Each time , we visit the place I say to myself , it would be a beautiful house !!! Need some restoration ! Lovely park and of course a mythic place !! Don't miss cross the street "l'Arpege " with chef Alain Passard !! Absolutely THE BEST !!!
Don't miss this. This is a beautiful museum with rose garden grounds. Even if you think you know Rodin's work you will be blown away.

Kids and Adults will love it. Awesome is the word to describe this. Kids will love the expansive gardens, fountain and sculptures. Adults will love the masterpieces (Thinker, Kiss etc). and there is also a wonderful cafe in the gardens. What else is required for a nice sunny afternoon?
Gorgeous!. This museum is definitely worth a visit. Exquisite gardens, beautiful stone work. Had a fantastic time.

Great experience!. Musee Rodin was great. I walked in excited to see "The Thinker" and left thirsty for even more information about Rodin and his sculptures. "The Gates of Hell" is also a must see. No need to spend too much time at the Monet Museum or the Musee d'Orsay as Musee Rodin exhibits Rodin's personal art collection which includes works by both Monet and Van Gogh (not to say anything bad about those museums as I enjoyed those as well). Very cool gift shop with lots of books/history on Rodin's collections and works. Beautiful outside garden where most of the sculptures are housed so make sure it's a sunny day! There is also a small cafe/parlor located outside if you're hungry and want to pick up a snack. Overall a must see for anyone visiting the city.

A small but interesting museum. The Musée Rodin is small indoor-outdoor museum where the sculptures of Rodin are displayed in an appealing setting. The estate home is rather shabby but the art inside is nothing less than stunning. The larger pieces in the gardens are strategically placed so that you can enjoy them from several angles. The gardens themselves are very well kept and offer a refreshing pause from the hectic pace of the city.A Robert Maplethorpe exhibition is currently in the visitor building and is well worth the 20 minutes it takes to see this extraordinary collection of naked or near naked men and women.It takes about 2 hours to see the whole museum.
Beautiful Gardens and Sculpture. Since I love sculptures and gardens it would be no surprise that I really enjoyed this museum. It was also a nice small size.

Wonderful to see Rodin's works. We got immediate entry with our Paris Museum passes. The sculptures are artfully arranged. The gardens are lovely. It was interesting to learn about Rodin's life and see where he lived in Paris. Even though we were there at the height of tourist season there did not seem to be too many people. Ice cream was over priced. It took us only 1 to 1.5 hours to see everything. I love art so it was worth it to me. My husband and son were happy they saw it but 1 hour was enough for them.
great museum to walk thru. don't forget that there is more than just the gardens and the thinker. the cafe isn't great tho. the thinker is a great place for a pic
Splendor. These works of art were housed on the site of an erstwhile hotel. I really enjoyed the beauty of it all.

One pleasant museums. Amazing Museum. First of all the works of Rodin. Very impressive. The museum is not very big and you do not get tired of going there. No huge amounts of people who are driven to see a single image., And stunning garden and its statues. A rare experience. We tried to get to the foot of the Eiffel Tower. A very long way (on map looks very close). There is a metro station is really close. You should get there.
Unbelievable museum. The best sculptural museum in Paris, even the world. Truly exceptional pieces from Rodin, of course Le Penseur, les Bourgeois de Calais,..

Small Museum and Beautiful Garden with Sculptures. This museum was being renovated in October 2013, but there was lots to see, including in the garden. It has wonderful examples of Rodin's work that are displayed with care. It is possible to take photos so I took quite a few. I was amazed at the emotional tone of many sculptures. There is a very nice cafe for lunch in the garden area.

Magnificent. Amazing gardens and a beautiful setting for the outside sculptures. The museum is set in a beautiful chateau - it gives it all a quaint and personal experience. Absolutely loved it - fantastic sculptures.

Exceeded expectations. Our visit to the Musee Rodin was one of our favourite things of our trip to Paris! Lots of information (mainly in French) and all of the most famous sculptures as well as many unknown but astonishing pieces.

Rodin Museum Visit. Last time I was in Paris, I visited this wonderful museum and the memory stayed with me. This time I visited with my family and could not wait to show them the beautiful works of Rodin and sit in the lovely gardens with a cup of tea! We booked on line the day before in order to avoid the crowds lining up for tickets. All very well because we forgot to download the tickets onto the phone, only had the booking cost on the phone. Not enough for the miserable ticket inspectors at the museum. They would not believe us even though we showed that we had booked the tickets and they could easily check on the internet. They claimed they had no internet (?) and so we paid again with no chance of recouping our money already spent. Our fault, but a little leeway would have been appreciated, so beware other travellers - be smarter than us. The rudeness of the people at the museum did not end there! We had a child in a pram and went up the ramp to the disabled door expecting to be let in. The door was opened, we were told we were not disabled and a finger was pointed to the front door with many steps in front! We then heard the person say "bloody English!" We retorted that we were not English but Australian and were very surprised by this further rudeness. This was a ridiculous welcome to the museum! So, back we went and up the stairs carrying the stroller. A very bad start to the visit altogether. Wandered around the outside garden enjoying the beauty and the artwork, but a bad feeling stayed with us and we did not enjoy the visit at all. The museum is beautiful though and well worth a visit. It was incredibly disappointing that the staff were so badly trained and so rude.
If you have time, worth the visit.. Culturally enriching experience, but not as impressive as the Louvre or Musee d'Orsay. They were Must Do.

Awesome!!. Did not get enough of Roden at the Orsay, so followed up with a visit here. SOOOO happy we did! Beside the Rodin and Claudel sculpture (which would have been enough for us), there are some wonderful gardens, a few paintings (several from Van Gogh at Arles, a Munch of Le Pensier in the garden, a few others), a (temporary) exhibition of Robert Maplethorpe's photographs, and an additional sculpture exhibition (La Jeune Sculpture) in the garden. So much to see... to paraphrase from a well-known movie line: "You had me at Caryatid"!
Lovely remodeled museum. Lovely museum. Sculptures inside and out, so you can take a nice stroll through the park-like grounds to see many sculptures ( including The Thinker).

Lovely gardens; good respite from other crowded tourist attractions. Rodin museum was one of the last few museums I visited in Paris so was slightly museum weary by then. I only visited the gardens, which in itself is worth the visit to the museum. The gardens are well manicured and spread in front of the museum building. Strolling around the garden is really pleasant with various rose flower planted around and the walled borders well shaded with trees. The sculptures in the garden are not many but amazing pieces of work including the famous The Thinker and Gates of Hell. The garden setting only enhances the viewing experience of these sculptures. There were few sculptures of another artist on display when I visited the museum (don't remember the name) which really complemented the works of Rodin and had a modern aesthetic to it. Another plus of the museum is the cafe located in the gardens which have nice outdoor seating in a corner of the garden and very reasonably priced pastries. Would definitely recommend this museum if looking for a break from other more well known Paris attractions.

Be sure to check out the gardens. Really nice small museum. You can get an online discount ticket package for the d'Orsay and Rodin (must see both on the same day). Make sure you see all of the gardens. They are beautiful.
Nice place for foreigners. Take care of strong entrance fee - 9 euros mean disappointing experience while visiting on limited time

Rodin in rain.. The Musee Rodin is a place, what you must visit with or without the Paris Pass. Only our third attempt was successful (because of our carelessness). First we went on Sunday, what is a free visit day, so half of the city was queuing there. We left. After without checking first, we went on Monday. Bad choice again, the museum was closed .Being very stubborn, thankfully we went for the third time. We enjoyed it enormously despite the rain, what wasn’t a nice addition to our walk in the wonderful garden. Most importantly for me the Gates of Hell, what after years and years of struggle, was cast in bronze, but Rodin died before he could see the result. Now we can adore it, and scrutinize it in every details.There are many sculptures in the garden, but my other favorite was the Les Bourgeois de Calais. Especially, since I was able to walk around and examine closely every figure, every posture, and every face. It was a great experience.Pour flowers. They were so beautiful, but in this cold rainy weather I couldn't give enough attention to them.Inside the building there are more and more sculptures, some wonderful paintings, more than you can absorb during one visit.
Gardens!. You can visit the gardens for just a couple Euros, you don't even need to tour the house/museum. The Gardens are the highlight of this place, and well worth seeing!
Freeing the stone. Absolutely amazing productivity of marvelous artists. So much to view in wonder! Defies description.

The Gardens are the Highlight of this Museum. We had seen the gardens on a previous trip to Paris, but the museum housed in The Hotel Biron, an 18th century mansion was closed so we decided to go back. 9 Euro covers the Museum and the Gardens. Under 18 free. It is open Tuesday to Sunday 10 am - 5:45 pm. Wednesday until 8:45 pm. Free admission 1st Sunday of the month.Bus #69 stops 2 blocks away at the intersection of Rue Grenelle and Rue Belechasse. Bus #87 also stops nearby. You can take photos without a flash. A self-service cafe is in the gardens as is the WC.There was a special exhibit by Mapplethorpe when we were there. The Kiss by Rodin is there and so are 2 paintings by Van Gogh. The Thinker (1906) is in the garden, as is Balzac (1898), The Burghers of Calais (1889), The Gates of Hell (1880 - 1917), The Three Shades and more. The statues are in a beautiful setting in a well kept garden which enhances the striking sculptures. I am glad we returned. Nepoleon's Tomb is nearby. It is worth a visit if you have time.

My favorite museum in Paris. We happened upon the Musee Rodin and since we had the Paris Pass, we decided to go in. I'm so glad we did as it became my favorite museum of all. (and lest you be afraid to bring a child in, my 10 year-old enjoyed it as well)First, the grounds are gorgeous. The garden in interspersed with sculpture, including a copy of The Thinker (the original is apparently at his home and he and his wife are buried underneath). The Gates of Hell is amazing and the detail deserves an up close look. The gardens themselves are lovely- beautiful roses in the front and tall shady trees in the back. The formal grounds in the back were so green and lush. The museum itself is very nicely laid out. There's something to see in every room and they've curated it so that displays and room make sense. Starting from young Rodin, through his explorations in various media, you can see his progression as an artist.The best part of the museum is that unlike some others, you can take some time and not feel rushed by large crowds. We did not eat in the café but the gift shop was very nice- with things you actually might want to purchase that represent the artist and the museum.
The thinker. Great cost effective museum with a great cafe serving healthy items? The gardens are typicle of this French style

Best museum. Rodin earned my best museum view because he is my favorite artist. Beyond that we saw every piece of art there in one hour. The grounds show a typical French garden.
Note that the museum pass skips the line so be sure to ask for that area and walk right in the door.

Focus on Rodin. The Rodin Museum was lovely. Inside the museum you are able to visit many of Rodin's works in a very thoughtfully put together display. Venturing outside you are able to walk around peaceful gardens and admire more of Rodin's work. The size of this museum adds to it's allure, it is not as big as many of the other art museums in Paris so it contributes to the laid back atmosphere of the museum and you are able to focus on Rodin!

A Cultural oasis. The Musee Rodin is one of the lesser known museums in paris and it deserves better. Wonderful Rodin sculptures are dotted throughout the glorious gardens. The Hotel Biron where Rodin lived is also full of art both sculptures and paintings including a couple of Van Goghs. The cafe in the gardens serves great food as well as reasonable prices.

Really underestimated!. It was an oasis and a wonderful break from a very busy program all around Paris. Everyone suggested to visit it only if we have the museum card (which we did) and only if we were around! I'm really glad we had the card and we were around!! It is a very beautiful "museum", it's an amazing garden, very well preserved with almost all of Rodin's statues!!I would definately go back and definately suggest it!
Sculptures. The Thinker is here. And you learn who Rodin is and read about his life. How he has dedicated his art to the society. There are many sculptures here.
Enjoyed this museum. My second trip to Paris allowed us to visit this museum. Really enjoyed it, the right size & beautiful grounds. Plan to go back!

A must!. This is a gorgeous little museum with a beautiful garden, strewn with sculptures and little hideouts, you can sit there for hours after your visit and be inspired. There is a temporary exhibition added every few months and it was a great surprise addition (photographer Maplethorp) This museum is especially good for those who are overwhelmed by the big, daunting ones. It is also neighbor to the less touristy Army museum which is also quite beautiful and interesting. Varenne metro is right there and some buses go there as well. Loved it, and I am not necessarily a Rodinist, though am familiar with some of his work, which says a lot about the place. There is a convenient locker room and in general great informative service. Completely accessible for disabled visitors.

Rodin. The Rodin Museum is a hidden gem in the heart of Paris...a garden filled with his original bronze sculptures of massive impact and proportions. like THE THINKER..His GATES OF HELL based one Dante's Inferno are incredible....his home is filled with the delicate, fine marble sculptures that are so opposite in composition from the powerful outdoor pieces...

Beautiful house and garden filled with beauty. Booked tickets online and skipped the line. Great as it was hot. The photography of Mapplethorpe worked very well with Rodin's sculptures. Fascinating sculptures throughout, great curator. An absolute must visit when in Paris. The gardens are beautiful spent 4 hours there.
Beautiful works. Garden is well worth the price. Many pieces are fun to photograph, and you can even get a good shot of 'Le Penseur' with the ET in the background!

Well worth a visit. The Musee Rodin is in a beautiful building surrounded by gardens with many of Rodin's work. There is great history to the building and how the museum came about. If you are interested in this artist or sculptures in general well worth a visit.

Small but cute. This museum was harder to get to but interesting. It's not that big.
It is close to the Napoleon Tomb however so you can do them both at the same time.
Added bonus the museum was his home. Enjoyed this museum , not tremendous but that's ok, liked all of the sculptures, and the gardens are beautiful. It's included in the museum pass

Great Museum. I actually wanted to see some Camille Claudelle, which I did. Also, a special exhibit by Maplethorpe was being shown. He was influenced heavily by Rodin. An added bonus by an already wonderfull museum.

Great museum with a singular focus. It's hard to beat the sculpture gardens and the lovely layout inside the main exhibit hall. Although the works are almost exclusively Rodin there are a couple of beautiful Van Gogh paintings lurking upstairs. The museum could add a little more information about the sculptures and Rodins life.

Rodin's Wonderful Statues. Seeing Rodin's statues outdoors in a beautiful garden is how they were meant to be seen. His vision is more apparent and the statues are more meaningful than when seen in a museum.
Worth it to see The Thinker. Close to the Metro and good for an hour or so. I guess we should have purchased the audio tour because there isn't much explanation to the works otherwise.

A little less amazing than last year. We came back expecting to be awed. We were less awed this year. Rodin was a great sculpture. But there is of course his treatment of Camille Claudel. And there is no denying his work is a little repetitive. In fact, I think the Rodin museum in Philadelphia is better because there is more variety. A hint: you can skip the museum itself and just wander through the gardens where the bronzes live.

THINK about it! You got to go. You cannot miss seeing Rodin's greatest work of the thinker and the Kiss. Actually it is all of Rodin's work and all of his molds that were used to create his sculptures! amazing, well worth it! A must do. There is a beautiful garden which you can wander and see all these gorgeous sculptures through out your path.
Must See. This was my first visit to the Rodin Museum and I am so glad I stopped in. The house is beautiful but my favorite was the garden and the wonderful sculptures.

One of my Favorites. The gardens are beautiful, they provide a perfect setting for Rodin's sculptures. The works are breath taking, standing and looking at Hell's Gate was awe inspiring. Of course The Thinker is a center piece for the gardens. Worth. A morning visit!
My favorite Paris museum. Small and approachable. Wonderful content and works. Interesting, informative, and a beautiful garden.
very interesting.. Do a little homework before you come so you know what you are viewing. The 'modern' interpretations in the new gallery was unnecessary.

no lines just wonderful sculptures. Previously where Rodin lived, this wonderful house is just packed with his most famous sculptures! Of course You will see the Thinker-which is wonderful but also the Gates of Hell, The Kiss, Eve and many others you shouldn't miss. Truly a spectacular display of amazing sculptures. Many of the pieces are on display outside in the back of the museum, so be sure to see them all. This museum is small enough to see everything easily. In walking distance from both the Louvre and the Musée d'Orsay so it can easily be an art trifecta should you choose.
First introduction to Rodin and loved it. Absolutely loved this museum. I had not come across Rodin before and this was a lovely introduction to his work.

Secret Gem. Well, not to secret, I guess. Plenty of tourons here, too. But it's small and manageable, in a lovely home and garden setting. Bonus: 2 Monets and a Van Gosh. The most up close and personal you'll ever get to those two.
Favorite Museum. Outdoor and indoor sculptures and other Rodin works in a setting that is peaceful and reflective. The gardens are well-manicured and invite visitors to stroll.

Changes. I was so disappointed as I hadn't been here in 20 years and wanted to show my daughter. The house used to feel special but the left side upstairs and downstairs are closed off and the check your bags on the ground floor that has been added takes away from the experience of seeing the museum. It should be moved out at the entrance area, nice but not like it was and should be.

Hidden treasure. Wonderful house & gardens filled with beautiful sculptures & even a Monet & a Van Gogh! No queues, lovely tea house & ice cream stall. Stunning pieces - the thinker, the kiss, the cathedral, the gates of hell. Many more. All wonderful.
Don't "Think" just Go!. Loved this museum. Even in the rain the outdoor part was not to be missed. Not a long line to enter, close to the Louvre and not so crowded.

Pleasant. This is a nice quick trip, took us about an hour to see the most famous sculptures. Our museum pass allowed us to skip the line of about 30 minutes. The highlights are the thinker and the gates of hell, the thinker was especially crowded with photo takers throughout our entire visit.We enjoyed seeing some of the less famous sculptures in the garden which was more peaceful.

quick viewing. grumpy abrupt doorman showed me to the wrong line, and after a while I realised this and had to go to the back of the other line. after entering the gardens, it was really nice though. mostly tourists, all friendly. garden was well kept. the sculptures were incredible. gift store staff more friendly :)

Interesting, but be prepared for some graphic nude photos. The Museum Rodin features both work (mostly sculptures) of Rodin, and the photography of Robert Mapplethorpe. The Rodin stuff is not awfully controversial, but be forewarned that Mapplethorpe's work is heavily slanted (at least in this museum) toward the homoerotic, and that there are photos of erect penises, among other things. So if you are touring with children, bear this in mind.
Lovely garden. It's a small place, but there are some impressive pieces here. Best place is in the garden where the large sculptures are.

Beautiful Museum!. What a wonderful way to show off Rodin's works. This is a smaller museum, (use your Museum Pass) with wonderful gardens that house Rodin's sculptures. You aren't overwhelmed with the size of the museum, yet you get to see the Rodin masterpieces such as The Thinker, The Kiss, The Burghers of Calais, and so much more. Lovely gardens to sit and relax for a bit and it is very close to Invalides. A very nice way to spend the afternoon!

Beautiful gardens, did not see the museum. On the advise of someone who had been to Musee Rodin before, we do not go to the museum, but instead just went to the gardens. Most of Rodin's bronze sculptures are in the garden, as is "the thinker." The gardens are absolutely gorgeous with beautiful trees and art all around. It was perfectly peaceful, with a grove of trees providing excellent cover during an unexpected sun-shower. A must-see in Paris and I would definitely go again.

Camille Claudelle lives here. Breathtaking sculptures crated by the devine Camille Claudelle! See Làge a mur and listen to the history behind it. Rent audio casettes and really enjoy the stories of passion behind many of the scuptures, I have been countless times and still it`s not enough.
Awesome. This museum helps you understand how they do it, and also let's you appreciate how amazing Rodin was. Absolutely essential!

Tranquility in Paris. It's a wonderful way to experience sculptures as you stroll through the gardens. It also has a decent place to grab some lunch and relax but it's fairly pricey for what you get...Be warned if you pay for additional areas please remember to keep your ticket on you as the staff will be quite brutal about entering the other exhibits.... no ticket no entry... we managed to find the receipt from the tickets but they still carried on about it...There are lots of interesting paintings and sculptures from other famous artists that you can also see and there was a photography exhibit running when we visited.

Great collection from one of the great sculptors. All the major masterpieces by Rodin are on display, as well as several smaller and various earlier models of work in progress. All set in a beautiful garden. On my visit there was an exposition of photographer Mappelthorn showing the influence Rodin had on his photography. Extremely interesting. Short queue to the entrance made the visit even more enjoyable.

My favorite retreat. This is tops for me in Paris, honestly. I love sculpture, but the setting is so peaceful and I love that it was where he lived and wandered. You can take your time and sit and ponder on the benches under the trees right next to a masterpiece in the garden. Lovely...
Peace in Paris. What can you not like about Musee Rodin? This is one of my favorite museums in Paris. See how Rodin captures human emotion in the quaint garden oasis.

Let me "Think" about it.. Loved the layout of the Rodin museum. Sculptures were beautifully placed and the green spaces outstanding. My friends decided not to join me inside of the beautiful estate (their mistake). Although crowded with sculptures, it was all breathtaking. While I roamed the inside, my friends had a delicious lunch at the cafe on the grounds.

totally enchanting. this museum has the best setting ...beautiful gardens where you can see the famous sculpture "The Thinker" surrounded by greenery and rose gardens
Inside was a fascinating special exhibit which puts robert mapplethorpe's photos beside the works of Rodin...WOW!!

Beautiful gardens. We were passing it and decided to go in on a whim. We didn't go inside the buildings primarily went to see "The Thinker". That was good to see as were other works. As can happen, there is so much to see in Paris if you are only there a short time, you start to look quickly, take a photo and move on. These gardens were beautiful and the restaurant and cafe were surprisingly good and reasonably priced for lunch on aware day. Had we had more time, we could have looked at it further. The Paris Museum Pass allowed easy entry at a discounted price.
Interesting. The museum is inside and out which helped with accessibility. Statues are interesting. Would have helped to have signage that explained the works. There was little, not even in French.

Enjoyable Museum. I am a fan of Rodin and when I lived in California I went frequently to the Stanford Museum to see the Rodin Collection there. The morning when we saw this museum it was raining. We first saw the Mapplethorpe exhibition, which I enjoyed.We saw the main collection in the other building and I took photos of all the statues and paintings that I liked. I was surprised to see two Van Gogh paintings there. Later it stopped raining and I was able to see the beautiful gardens and take some photos of the large sculptures there. Our visit to this museum was very enjoyable.

Something of a gem. OK, a large part of your reaction to the Rodin is going to depend on whether you like Rodin's work, obviously. But, leaving that aside, this place gets the essentials of how to run a gallery about right. The house and gardens are beautiful, providing a great backdrop to the work. There is an excellent audio guide. It is great to see some of the larger works outside as well. It wasn't overrun or crowded when we visited in July, unlike just about everything else that week. Very much worth seeking out.
Loved it.. Gardens and house and sculptures fantastic. The house itself was beautiful even with the art- gardens a lovely place to stroll, sit and observe.

An unexpected surprise!. My husband and I are not big museum goers, so we were surprised at how much we liked the Rodin museum! It was a beautiful day to stroll through the gardens admiring the beautiful sculptures. This one and the musee d'orsay were our two favorite museums!

Don't miss out because it is not on your APP.. The Musee Rodin is one of my favorite museums in Paris, and although it was not on an APP I downloaded recently, I had to take my seven year old there. The museum has been renovated since my last visit, and it looks wonderful, although AC in the main house would be welcome. This was my daughter's second time in Paris, and I felt that she was old enough to appreciate the art the city had to offer, so we started with the outdoors and sculptures. We had a lovely time looking at the art and taking pictures. It was a nice educational visit, without the outward trimmings of learning, which some times put young people off museums. There were lines, something I had never experienced in all the times I've visited the museum, and for the 1st time I did not get the museum pass, but I highly recommend it, as it was hard to wait in the head with a child, and watch the smart people go right passed with the pass!

Rodin again.... I love the Gardens surrounding this museum as well as the displays in the building itself. How can you not love the emotions captured in each work. Returning home I enjoy looking up the stories behind the sculptures and am always amazed at what I find.

Thinker and so much more!. I liked the fact that I was able to pay for only the tour of the gardens with all the sculptures. The museum was donated to Rodin from an old Parisian estate. The grounds were amazing and I enjoyed the unique work of Rodin.
lovely. Beautiful little museum with large, magnificent gardens. could have spent hours in the gardens alone! Get the Museum Pass and skip the line!

We found the Musee Rodin near Invalides and it was worth the effort!. ùsThis Musee is unique in several ways! It is not huge but iincludes some surprises. The sculptures are numerous and very interesting. The Gardens are unique and enjoyable. The Van Gogh paintings are a special surprise and they are hung in the midst of the sculptures and this is a nice touch. We skipped the lineup at the entrance as we used our Paris Museum Pass to gain entry in a flash! We purchased a 4 day Pass and it is a great deal if you like to walk around Paris and enjoy the great museums found here.
A museum outside. Great to see works of art outside for a change. Rodin's bronzes in a garden setting make this museum more of a park than a "stuffy" museum.

Best Sculpture Museum. I believe this was the most enjoyable art museum I have ever been to. We arrived around lunch time with picnic lunch in hand. We paid our entry fee (by the way check out the special rates for students or residence Visa holders and if you are also going to the Musee d'Orsay by the combo ticket) and entered. We took our lunch and at it in the park area of the museum. The outdoor portion is a lovely rose garden interspersed with many Rodin sculptures, including the famous Thinker. You can take as many pictures as you like. I would say to try to go on a day with pleasant weather but the day we were there it rained off and on and we just went inside for a bit during the times it rained. Take at least 2 hours here.

Beautiful sculptures / under renovation. We went on a Sunday afternoon in June and were disappointed that there was a fairly long line (we waited for more than 30 minutes and it was hot!) and no specific entrances for Museum Pass, until we got to security at the front door. It was very busy with other tourists, so we had to stand in another queue to get into the house itself. Too packed, making it difficult to see the casts and other sculptures inside the house - also, quite a few of the rooms were closed as they are still under renovation. The gardens were lovely, but again, many sculptures were on temporary plinths. 'Thinker' was awesome but crowded with folks trying to get selfies - worth a visit but maybe go first thing in the morning to enjoy some space! PS: The Mapplethorpe exhibit is wonderful, especially pairing it with Rodin, but be aware if you are with little ones - some explicit photography :O
Beautiful gardens and art. Loved seeing all the sculptures and the gardens were beautiful to walk around. Loved "The Kiss", "The Gates of Hell", and "The Shades".

A hidden gem. This is one of my favorite museums in Paris. Not overloaded with art and easy to follow. In addition, at the end of the visit you can relax in the garden in front of it. The ticket also is reasonable enough.

My Favorite. It's been 15 years since I was here and I'm still longing to go back. Far and away my favorite museum in Paris, maybe all of Europe. I guess Rodin and the museum and the property it sits on just speaks to me. Don't leave it off your list when going to Paris.

Beautiful sculpture!. I did get a wow factor feeling here. The sizes of some of the sculpture and detail was amazing. The hands, feet and muscle tone in the some of the works was brilliant. Lovely gardens also.

Excellent Gardens. The whole experience was wonderful. Even on a very hot Sunday, we were able to see the sculptures in the gardens, take a break in the shade and have a cooling drink and ice cream while taking our time looking at all of the sculptures in the "back yard". Outside was The Thinker, in a beautiful setting and inside was The Kiss. A very worthwhile way to spend the afternoon.

Beautiful!. Paris certainly has the most beautiful gardens! Le musée Rodin is just breathtaking! Loved touring the outside gardens and seeing the amazing sculptures. Le Penseur has always been my favorite and I finally got to see the original. Took a break at "Le café du musée Rodin", raspberry milles-feuilles, heavenly! This museum is also covered with the museum pass.

Check its really open. On the third try we got in to see this. First we went on A Sunday when admission is free and one look at the lines made us go elsewhere. We went back the next day only to find police telling tourists the museum was closed for a fashion show. Its closed on Tuesdays although you should check that on the internet. We did finally get in and it was all worthwhile.I recommend seeing the gardens before the museum itself. Auguste Rodin is buried together with his long-time partner Rose underneath The Thinker near the entrance. On our visit they were doing a lot of renovations but the Gates of Hell and the Citizens of Calais were there along with a number of works I had not heard of. The museum is packed with a lot more (maybe 100).

A Gem hidden behind a tall wall. One of our favorite museums in Paris. Even if you end up visiting on a rainy day, there is something about the garden with its roses and its sculptures that makes this place magical. Of course, the displays inside the Hotel Biron are well worth wandering through as well. We found it by accident as we were walking back from Les Invalides and decided to pop in even though it was quite late in the day. We loved it so much we went back on a sunny day when we could spend some time chilling in the garden. Best part was that there were no crowds, a rare event at a Paris museum in July.

Best Deal In Paris. SO the price has doubled to 2 Euro but the gardens are still the best. World class sculpture in regal outdoor setting. The Thinker is magnificent itself and just invites mock poses. The pond and the arched arbors are achingly beautiful. I've visited the gardens now four times and always leave with a smile, reenergized and centered. A little vacation within a vacation.

delightful museum. such a lovely museum- and when you need a break, there are chairs at the way back of the property to lounge on and take a break (sight seeing is exhausting, great to know where to put your feet up and relax!)

Wonderful Museum. This is a gem. Rodin's work is magnificent and is displayed both indoors and outside, in the beautiful rose gardens. "The Thinker" sits alone with the Eiffel Tower behind, in the far distance. The Museum is small and intimate; the information on Rodin and his work is "just right". So glad we visited.

Great way to spend a sunny afternoon. We just did the garden visit, which is 2 euro per person (best value in Paris!). On a nice day it was just perfect. Not the boring over-crowded museums you experience in the rest of the city where you just shuffle down hallways. The sculptures are interesting but also not overwhelming. Glad we found this hidden gem!

Superb museum and quiet park in the heart of Paris. It is always moving to (almost) touch sculptures by one of the great artists of all times. Both the permanent collection and the temporary exhibitions are excellent.
And do not miss a walk in the park, before getting back to the streets of Paris.

Lovely museum to spend a sunny day in. This is one of the nicest museums I've been to. There's a giant sculpture & rose garden in the back, where plenty of people sat & relaxed in the sun. The actual museum building is lovely & the perfect size. It takes about 30-45 minutes to walk through at an average pace. Afterwards, you can go enjoy the gardens.

Worth for a visit. This is a lovely place right in the centre next to the hotel Invalides. If you go here, try to buy a online tickets for better price together with visiting museum Orsay. You will not to have to wait in the long queue, no matter which time you will come. The exposition of Rodins statues is just wonderfull and must-see in Paris!
A delight. A special artist who has his works displayed in a delightful setting of buildings and garden. Recommended.
Mapplethorpe and Rodin. The Rodin museum and gardens are a delight at any time. Right now there is an exhibit of photos by Robert Mapplethorpe paired with select works by Rodin. Wow!

Great museum for families. Gorgeous setting and the sculptures run from the lighthearted to the classic. The buildings are beautiful as are the gardens. You can actually see all the works without battling throngs of others!
Interesting.. This is a interesting museum that has different exhibits then the other museums. There are beautiful statues to see and enjoy.

Nice to be outside with great works. I had a museum pass but I could not find a fast track queue. I waited in the queue for 5 minutes then a guard came looking for people with a museum pass and fast tracked me, which I really appreciated.I went to the Musee Rodin towards the end of my trip and I had sore feet from wandering through galleries every day. It was nice to be outside and there were lots of places to sit down, admire the works and listen to the audioguide. The grounds are lovely and they have an outdoor cafe. I had bought my own lunch and it was nice to sit in the sun to eat. Inside there was a Robert Mapplethorpe exhibition, an American photographer. They had tried to link his works to Rodin's work, which I found a bit forced and silly but despite this I really enjoyed his photos. It is probably not one for the easily shocked as there were a few visible testicles etc.I enjoyed my visit. The large grounds made it feel less chaotic than many other galleries so it is a nice change of pace.
Beautiful and Calming. It is a small and gentle museum. Beautifully arranged - lovely gardens with sculptures. Cafe - very good.

Saw the Thinker. We got there about 15 minutes before it opened. I was surprised there was a line to be honest. We had the museum pass, so we were able to cut in front of the line. Went straight to the Thinker to get our picture before the crowds decscended. All of Rodin's sculptures are really neat, and I wasn't a big fan before visiting the museum. I was really only going for The Thinker, but the gardens were among the most beautiful we visited (better than Tuillery, Luxembourg and others). You don't need a lot of time, but if you have the Museum Pass make sure to pop into this one.

Such beautiful gardens. The mixture of sculpture and paintings that were exhibited in a complimentary way was both informative and beautiful. The gardens are impressive, but could do with a little trimming.

Lots to Think About :). Of course the big attraction here was The Thinker. Centered in a pretty rose garden it was quite impressive. Also outside were the infamous Gates of Hell. Massive to view. We toured Rodin's house and were treated to more of his works as well as others. Glad to see they included Camille Claudel's work there too. There was a special event going on so parts of the rest were closed to us. Great to see on a good weather day.

Rodin, Rodin. The "Thinker" is our favorite as one of the few produced is in our our city's museum. The mansion that the Rodin collection is housed in is spectacular and the Luxembourg Gardens are very close. Just a Paris Metro ride from anywhere!

Pleasant even if you are not a big fan. The museum is located on a charming piece of property, with attractive grounds that have Rodin sculptures scattered throughout, and an architecturally interesting house for displaying his works. The one problem I have with Rodin is that he tends to do the same work over and over, so there was not much that was new or exciting for me. As always, having the Paris Museum Pass saved time that would otherwise have been spent standing in line

Loved the garden. Visited Musee Rodin to see The Thinker and Hell of Gate. We also saw other beautiful pieces and love the way they display in the garden. So we didn't feel like we were inside a traditional museum at all. There was much fewer people compared to the bigger museums and we could admire the art work in peace without feeling rushed.We bought Musee d'Orsay - Musee Rodin pass online.This is good deal if one wants to visit both museums and with tickets in hand, can always skip the long queue. Note that with this pass,one must visit both museums on the same day.

This was our favourite!. There was a Robert Mapplethorpe exhibit that examines the influence Rodin had on his photography that was excellent. The grounds are beautiful, a great place to have lunch and it was refreshing to get away from the crowds that are Paris. The audio guide was well worth it at this place. I'm not an art person so I had no idea that some of his famous works were pieces for The Gates of Hell project. Awesome!Napoleons Tomb is right next door which is worth a peek.
Gorgeous Museum & Gardens. Very striking exhibits of Rodin and friends. Lovely garden setting. Lots of additional exhibits. Very helpful staff. EZ to find.

Rodin in a beautiful setting. The Rodin museum in Paris is a gem, especially if you have just tackled a larger collection as we had. The interaction between the settings, both the chateau in which it is housed and the gardens around the home, set off the genius of Rodin's sculptures.Having several versions of the same piece allows the viewer to watch the creative process as you see the original design and the finished product. An unexpected attraction are works by several of Rodin's contemporaries, including van Gogh, Monet and John Singer Sargent. The cafe in the garden is also enjoyable, with a lovely view of the gardens. Highly recommend it for anyone going to Paris. If you know ahead of time that you plan to go, would recommend reading up on the background for the creation of The Burghers of Calais as the impact will be even more meaningful.

Fantastic museum, beautiful garden!. Musee Rodin is a type of museum that allows you to enjoy and get closer to every single masterpiece displayed, since it's a smaller museum and what's even more important - it's not overcrowded despite the fact that it's always busy; As for the masterpieces - they are exquisite! Simply gaze and enjoy! Don't forget to have a little walk in the garden amongst all those beautiful roses and outdoor masterpieces!

Unexpectedly good. It is lovely place for an afternoon. The garden is beautiful, so are many of the sculptures. It is worth a visit. If you are looking for something quaint, not too big in scale, this will be ideal.

Extraordinary. Set in an exquisite part of paris full of old, stately and elegant buildings. The gardens were well set out, but what was extraordinary were the number of the most beautiful statues set thru the gardens, including "The Thinker", and others of tortured, muscular figures evoking the weight of the human condition. The statues and art works in Rodin's house were no less beautiful, especially "The Kiss" - 2 naked lovers in an embrace, almost as magical as the Mona Lisa - I found myself walking around it admiring its changing appearance from different angles. A visit is a must.

Nice, but could have better signage. Not to be missed are the impressive sculptures by Rodin. I would have liked to have seen more informational plaques for the artworks both in the garden and in the house.

Tranquil. Another amazing attraction on the Paris Museum Pass, we were lucky to be just a 10 minute walk to this gem.It was a drizzly rainy day and the crowds were dispersed. It was also open late that day which helped us squeeze the attraction in. This is one of those Museums that make you feel you in someone's home (B/C in this case you are) and the exhibits aren't cluttered and and there is no sensory overload.The garden was uncrowded and despite the rain me and my wife took our time to take in each sculpture. This can be a quick visit if you time it better.
Beautiful Grounds and Rodin. Wear your walking shoes and hike the grounds to see many fine sculptures in a gorgeous setting. Do not miss the indoor exhibits.
Go to the garden. The area has many statues and in a nicely walkabe garden, a nice day event for the family. There is a museum there, but did not go to it.
Rodin - it's Ok. Not as well run as the other museums visited. It was "ok", but I'd only give it a 5 or 6 out of 10...

Great Romantic Museum and Garden!. If your time is limited in Paris, and you have to choose between the Louvre and Rodin museum, definitely go to the Rodin. Its very peaceful, beautiful, and romantic! Also, you will not feel overwhelmed by its size as you will at the Louvre. Very enjoyable, and you will not be disappointed!

Thinking about Rodin. Our visit to Musée Rodin was not really planned and the Paris weather didn't help either. We had to rush inside just after seeing Le Penseur because of the rain. Not that it was a disappointment. I love the collection of his "Sleeper" works and the detail on some of his first and second drafts was just incredible when you see the final piece. As with all museums in Paris, there was a long line to get in but definitely worth the wait.
Master in the garden. Next to the invalid, it's a large garden with old buildings you can visit. Many Monumentals sculptures out and inside. You must book with Paris pass

Inspiring. Wonderful museum. all the classics that you've heard about and some you've not seen (at least for me), set in a park setting it is beautiful. Loved it. Hells Gates and The Thinker is a must see

A good surprise. I've got there with low expectations and i've got delighted to discover a small treasure among the giants. The gardens, the building and the collection were arranged to form one of the most beatifull site in Paris. Spare some time for the coffe and the millefeuille framboise!

Great Art Museum for Sculpture. If you are fan of the Kiss or the Thinker sculptures you need to stop by this smaller museum in Paris. Great place out of the way and without lots of crowds. If there is a crowd you can skip the ticket line and go right in with a Paris Museum pass. There are several shaded parts of this museum, which is good, since it is mostly outside.You can also go inside the Hôtel Biron, a part of the museum and on the grounds. It has several nice paintings and housing the Kiss sculpture.

A PEACEFUL (FREE) OASIS. What a lovely peaceful oasis in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. Come and relax and enjoy the masterpieces by Rodin, set out among beautiful landscaped gardens. Buy an ice-cream and relax. Free entry and right besides Les Invalides

Don't miss this museum!. It seems like the Louvre and Orsay get more attention, but the Rodin Museum and garden was my favorite art related stop! Maybe it was the walk through the beautiful sunlit garden, or the fact that there were fewer people around (unlike the Louvre and Orsay,) but my husband and I were most impressed with this spot!

Nice museum tucked away a bit off of the main drag. Was able to skip the ticket line with the Museum Pass (if you go to Paris, you REALLY need to get one of those). Beautiful day and a beautiful setting to enjoy many fantastic sculptures by a master. There is even a nice little cafe on the grounds behind the mansion. One of my favorite places.

Fantastic Double Exhibition. We were lucky to be at Musee Rodin when exhibition by Robert Mapplethorpe was on, it was a great comparison of Rodin's work and the photography of Mapplethorpe. An eye opening exhibition but explanations comparing the two artists made it all worth while to look closely at exhibits and try to understand the thinking of the each artist.Hotel Biron was interesting to walk through at our own pace, then the gardens were equally a joy. Sculptures mixed in with landscaped gardens. Bonus was the cafe in the garden where we had a lovely lunch.
Musée Rodin. This small Paris museum is a gem. Housed in a small manor house, the sculptures on display are great. This is a very manageable museum that can be visited in an hour or two.
Worth return visits. I love the Musee Rodin and make sure I return whenever I'm in Paris. Everything about a visit to this museum is lovely - the grounds, Rodin's work, the buildings. Love it.
Nice quiet stroll. After facing the crowds at Versailles and musee d orsay, this was a breath of fresh air. Lovely gardens, incredible sculptures and very inexpensive. Janis K.
Good museum and good cafe. It is a good museum with many of Rodin's works. Also has a relaxing café for lunch and a mid day break while touring Paris

Mapplethorpe Rodin. This exhibition was amazing, The contrast of photograph and sculpture was so good, I suspect that this exhibition allowed the Musee to show some hidden works. Some people may find the photos confronting but seeing past the subject to the beauty.

Think about it.. The visit to Musee Rodin was a wonderful experience. I am not what can be considered an art connoisseur and must admit that I felt a little intimidated at the thought of going to this museum. My fears were unfounded. It has a beautiful setting and the rose garden is a work of art in its own right. To see The Thinker with the most stunning backdrop of Les Invalides and the Eiffel Tower is amazing. I wandered around the garden and into the museum proper. I am richer for visiting.
Nice !. I have been visiting Musée Rodin over the yearsand I am always in awe facing Le Penseur ! The indoor sculptures are mostly erotic so small children are best left home !!!!

Not overwhelming like other Paris museums, but beautiful.. This museum is easy to enjoy. There were many informative pieces inside, which helped me understand Rodin as an artist. The real gem is the garden, both for the incredible important sculptures and the lovely oasis in the city. I would go back just for the garden. There's a small cafe near the back of the property, which started my afternoon glass of Rose habit. All in all, a Paris favorite.
Great sculpture garden. I will say if you are visiting museums the sculpture garden at the Roden is a must see. These works of art beautiful and worth the price of admission.

The Gardens Are the Best. The best part of the Rodin Museum is that you can get into the gardens for 2 Euros. I love sitting and reading a book and enjoying the artwork. It is a must-do on your travel visit!
All in one place. Fantastic sculptures in the garden. More sculptures and pictures inside. Easy to get round with many personal items of Rodin.
Very Interesting.. We enjoyed our walk around the gardens and the exhibits. Not so bothered about the photography of the chap Mappleton.
Beautiful, picturesque, wonderful. I loved the content: the works by Rodin. But I also loved the context in which they are displayed: the lovely manor house and its gorgeous grounds.

An Easy Visit. Compared to many of Paris' museums, the Rodin was not crowded. The huge garden makes for a relaxing visiit and the cafe is lovely. The sculptures are what you would expect and are well presented.

Hidden Gem : Museum and Parisienne Home. If your a tourist and hate the busy bustle of tourists this would be a good compromise. It is a lovely museum with many recognisable peices. At the same time the park and building are beautiful and represent a typical "hôtel particulier" which is still in tact and gives you a rare glimpse of how life used to be. The atmosphere is relaxed and I would definitely recommend a walk in the park and having a drink at the cafe.

Wonderful gardens filled with sculpture. We actually visited the Musee Rodin twice. The first time we explored the mansion. It was raining so hard we decided to come back to do the garden on a nice day....and I am so glad we did. Take time to study the Gates of Hell. And when looking at the sculptures of figures, look up into the faces. There is a nice restaurant in the garden-great for lunch. This is a do not miss while in Paris.
Very interesting exhibition. It was lovely looking at all the sculptures and walking in the garden. We were lucky with excellent weather which helped.
Very peaceful gardens. A lovely peaceful sanctuary but only so much to see. Great to be able to cover very quickly and move on to the next attraction.
Excellent collection. Another musee that is in a fabulous setting, has a very representative collection and is well curated.
Wow - fantastic and relaxing garden. I thought that this museum was the best of all. Just to sit in the garden and enjoy the sculptures. Wow.

A master of form. It baffles me that this artist spent his later years trying to give his impressive collection to the French Government. Perhaps it was the time, or his forward view of the human form. Maybe he just wanted a grand space to show off his works. However it came to be, you should not miss this gem.

Wonderful Art in a Beautiful Setting. My wife and enjoyed enjoyed the Musee Rodin for its art, its grounds, its architecture, and its story. You'll find sculptures inside the Hotel Biron and outside throughout the gardens in a serene setting. The intricacy of many of Rodin's works is amazing. I found his story and how he came to the Hotel Biron fascinating. Seeing "The Thinker" and "Gates of Hell" in person was a great experience. "The Gossips" is a sculpture inside the Hotel that is unique in its materials and style. There is a variety of other artwork inside including paintings, drawings, and ceramics that is interesting. The Mapplethorpe exhibit may offend some people, but it's certainly memorable and provocative which good art should be.

the thinker. The House of Rodin is a great story unto itself. This great sculptor was a prolific artist with an amazing personal life. The Museum gives a glimpse into his life & has a wonderful collection of his work. Not at all crowded, pleasant surroundings.

Good museum, nice grounds. This museum was universally recommended to us by friends. We liked the Rodin exhibit, yet found the artwork, documentation and organization to be lacking. The museum is undergoing constant renovation and we were warned that some things may be out of place. We were glad we visited, but by no means was this a Paris highlight. The museum grounds are lovely with a nice cafe, a great way to enjoy a beautiful Paris day.

Very Interesting, Great Sculpture. It is interesting to know the history of the Musee Rodin and some of the works on display are amazing. The "Gates of Hell" is indescribable. It is awe inspiring. And "The Thinker", one of his most famous works is wonderful. Then to go inside the building and see the studies and small models is great. This is a must see.

A hidden gem in Paris. Travellers would be doing themselves a great favour in adding this museum to their itinerary. The beautifully manicured and maintained gardens are a paradise in the middle of busy and bustling Paris where you can sit and relax around the lake or wander the gardens at your own pace. The statues are well worth the visit and everyone should see the real Thinker once in their life.
Disappointing. The museum is not taking care of the objects outside or the building. The art works are dirty and not maintained. The building is in need of repair. Very disappointing.

Beautiful. We loved our visit to Rodin museum. The indoor photo exhibit was interesting, lots of nude photos in creative positions. The star to me was the garden and outdoor statues. It was very peaceful. We ate lunch here and the food was great as well. They had a salad or sandwich, drink, and dessert option that was very good. After you leave here head to Napoleon's tomb, it's right around the corner.

For the Rodin Lover!. This exquisite house/museum is just perfect for the Rodin lover. If you are lucky you will be able to see "The Kiss" and "The Thinker" (originals--not the replicas) if they are not on loan. Beautiful garden and sculptures. Overall a very worthwhile experience.

Nice start to our time in Paris. We were jet lagged but wanted to do something different and not jam packed. This museum was perfect. Several pieces caught our eyes (besides The Thinker) including The Kiss, The Wave, Waltz. Glad I was finally able to find time to visit this smaller art museum.

Good on Rodin, terrible on painting collection. The Rodin Museum has an excellent temporary exhibition space which is located in his (Rodin's) old studio. But in the old building the paintings he collected, often real gems ( including those by Ribot or Carriere and Van Gogh) are not properly displayed or conserved. This borders on genuine issues of care. Why is this the case ? Worth a visit for Rodin, the gardens etc. but despite having great paintings close your eyes.

Very nice. The museum was good, but I really enjoyed the garden as well. Entry is covered under the Museum Pass. As we were walking to the museum a police escorted motorcade drove by on their way to the museum. We toured the museum with some Japanese dignitaries.

What a History Lesson. No matter how much you thought you knew of Rodin, visiting where he lived and worked is such a moving experience. The gardens are well done and the large house is more preserved than restored. If you have not seen the breadth of his talent, this tour will educate you.

Adored the gardens. One of the best deals in Paris. Admission to the gardens is only 1 euro and they are fabulous. Many of Rodin's most important pieces are here and are beautifully displayed. There is a nice outdoor cafe where one can have lunch and an ice cream cone under the trees while gazing at the mansion. A very pleasant and restful way to spend an afternoon.
Not Crowded. If you are looking for a less crowded museum this is the place. It was terrific! It is small and the gardens are nice to meander.

Great Place to spend a morning and lunch. The Rodin museum is a great pleasure. This 19th Century palatial home was used as a workshop - home by Rodin at the height of his career and given to the French Country at the time of his death. The gardens are spectacular and many of his most famous sculptures are strategically placed throughout. There is a very inexpensive informal but wonderful garden restaurant available and a very nice place to spend an al fresco lunch on a sunny day.
museum and garden. Both the museum and gardens are worth a visit. Temporary exhibit was free and worthwhile. Gardens are beautiful and have many works spread out among the greenery.

Love this museum!. This is such a great and easy museum to explore. There is art both indoors and out, and it's so intimate you don't feel like you are in a museum with guards looking over your shoulder. It feels like a visit to a very wealthy art patron's home. A must do when in Paris
Really worth a visit. I really enjoyed a relaxed visit to gardens and museum. Easy access from the metro. The audio guides are very informative.
Cool experience. This was the little gem of our trip. The house was really cool to see, the gardens beautiful, and the work awe- inspiring.
impressive. Sculpture gardens are superb with his best pieces displaced (many are recreated at Stanford University but these are the originals) Painting inside while few are excellent

More than expected so well worth a visit!. Enjoyed the gardens especially and it was a nice surprise to see the Mapplethorpe exhibit while there. Was disappointed that there was so much renovation going on and seemed like works were missing. Overall, very nice exhibits. Be sure to have lunch at the cafe in the garden. Good quality offerings and very pleasant atmosphere!
Don't miss this!. Be sure and take an audio tour. It is well worth the extra money!The beauty of Rodin's work is breathtaking to behold.

Nice Museum; A Good Way to Spend 2 Hours. If you love Rodin, you'll love this place. The entry is a little funky, requiring a patron to line up twice, with the second, surprising wait to enter into the main exhibit being a little annoying. Once inside, it's a wonderful tour of Rodin sculptures. I thoroughly enjoyed the fact that one can visit this place in two hours and get a good sense of Rodin's work. The gardens are pretty impressive, too, if not as "take care of" as Versailles. The Mapplethorpe exhibit is outstanding, and a must see if it's still on.

Got Something New. Musee Rodin was an amazing museum I have ever seen.
The beauty of garden and Scriptures are well maintained.
can be view the Eiffel tower from garden . Highly Recommend
this place to visit ........................
My kind of museum!. Beautiful house & magnificent gardens both filled with amazing sculptures. Wouldn't say no to living there but had to settle for a worth while visit!

Loved it. Even though there are renovations going on, there is still plenty to see in the main museum and the sculpture gallery. The current temporary exhibition (Rodin/Mapplethorpe) was fabulous. The only downside is the cafe, which has a limited selection (especially if you are vegetarian) and is very expensive.

Love! Total must see. This Museum is amazing! It was situated near the flat we were renting which helped.... but more importantly it is a friendly and approachable museum with interesting content. Musee Rodin features spectacular formal gardens where you are invited to sit on the grass, touch the sculptures etc. as well as an amazing interior showcase of Rodin's paintings and sculptures, his own art collection, as well as collected work of those in his circle. Visitors are offered insight into Rodin's world. He was a prolific artist and this museum shows not only finished work but the process, which is really engaging. The subjects of his work provide insight into French culture and values.Musee Rodin is a special oasis in the hear of Paris that is much less busy than many other museums we visited in Paris. Hands down it was my 10-year old daughter's favourite cultural attraction. She stuck her finger in Balzac's eye!Please buy your tickets online first to avoid the line. You can buy a discounted ticket with Musee d'Orsay if you plan to see both in the same day.Of course there is a gift shop but the goods are interesting and relevant. We did not buy food in the cafe so I can't comment on the quality.

Impressive.. We don't normally want to listen to the audio guides, but within minutes, we realized that the guide would be helpful in understanding Rodin's work. While I was impressed with his work on its own, the audio guide gave a rich understanding of Rodin's purpose and the effects he was trying to achieve. The museum is manageable in size and includes a wonderful collection. Try to make time to tour the garden as well. It is beautiful dotted with Rodin's sculptures. I recommend it highly.

I think this might be my favorite place in Paris. You can't go to Paris and not go to Musee Rodin - at least I can't. I always carve out an afternoon to spend in the museum and gardens when I am in Paris. Was there last week and rediscovered some of Rodin's works. The museum is currently under renovation, but they still seem to have everything displayed. There is also a special exhibition on Mapplethorpe which was also quite good.

Loved the garden. The Rodin museum and garden are beautiful ... intimate ... stop by the garden only for $2 per person! Lots of Rodin's sculptures and beautiful roses and sculpted cone trees. We even stopped and had a nice lunch in the garden - really good salads and sandwiches. Perfect on a sunny Paris afternoon.
