I wouldn't put it on my must-see list if you are only in Paris for a short while, and definitly skip it on a super hot day (we were there in 38 degree heat - too hot to be in the gardens without shade). Worth the time on a repeat visit or if you've already seen all the major sites.

A gem of a museum. This museum made me mad that I couldn't travel back in time. To see where such a wonderful artist lived and worked when it was happening would have been amazing. A quiet gem that I would love to see again and again.

just go to the garden/quick visit. The gardens were simple and nice, visited The Thinker of course and the other few sculptures out there. Not a very busy museum, walked right in and bought the tickets. If you like Rodin you might like it, if not, its a hit or miss.

Rodin. Very nice area of Paris "Les Invalides".Great site to see,the building and its beautiful outdoors gardens were fantastic.We didn't line up for admission or even to explore the collection which it was breath taking.Also

More than expected. Gardens are a beautiful setting for the statues, famous and less well-known. Inside are the clay and plaster models. Some very interesting pieces and well worth seeing. Can be a half-day, perhaps combined with Napoleons tomb in Des invalides just across the road.

Go for the gardens. The gardens and statuary throughout the outdoor areas are very beautiful. There are pretty views of the gilded dome of Palais des Invalides. I didn't find the collections kept indoors to be that impressive (as compared to the statues outside). You can go through this museum fairly quickly. I expect the gardens would be even more beautiful when the leaves are changing in the Fall.

Home of "The Thinker". Beautiful gardens to stroll but the sculptures inside are really worth seeing. The mansion they're exhibited in is very relaxing. It's a museum that is a joy to visit and won't take up your whole day.

Gardens Only. The museum itself was under renovation while we visited. However, the gardens had the highlights of Rodin's bronzes - the Thinker, Burghers of Calais, the Gates of Hell. Fantastic being able to finally view them closely.

Superb sculptor and his home inspiration. This is a small museum dedicated to the work of Rodin. It is wonderful -- the sculptures are fully displayed in the classic French chateau home as well as in the gardens.
Do not miss this -- a Paris gem!

glorious gardens. Musee Rodin was exceptional as all the sculptures were in place within the gardens and set off by this environment. The history of the place was fascinating too and brought Rodin to life as part of the experience.

Wonderfull Sculpture Garden. Apart from this being a place to see famous fabulous sculptures the building itself is very beautiful. The gardens where sculptures are also displayed are the highlight for me. If you have time, don't miss out.

One of the best art displays I have ever viewed!. This is one of my favourite art displays in the world- it really was fantastic, I would go again tomorrow if I could. The grounds are absolutely stunning, and some of the art works are breath taking... I won't give too much away because art is to be discovered!! Out of all of the art museums in Paris, if you would only visit one visit this one- it truly is a wonder. There is also the house grounds to look around, but I would say the true beauty lies outside.
Amazing museum. Amazing sculptures by Augustin Rodin. The outdoor exhibition for his art work in a wonderful landscape is breathtaking environment. On of the best museum experience in Paris

So different. I was not that keen on the idea of visiting this museum but was so surprised to find how much I actually enjoyed it. The outside settings are beautiful and it made the whole trip very memorable

He need new inspiration. If you want to see the same subjects repeated over and over in different sizes than this is the museum for you. The only things worth seeing here are the thinker and the beautiful roses surrounding it.
Fabulous way to view art. The gardens at this museum are the perfect way to look at sculpture and relax away from the bustle of the streets.

Wonderful museum and grounds filled with Rodin sculpture.. What a treat - the grounds are lovely, with Rodin sculpture scattered about - you must see The Thinker and Balzac! Tour the museum, which was a hotel, Rodin bought it and made it into studios for fellow artists, then left it in his will as a Museum. His smaller sculpture, especially busts of the famous and not so famous, are in the house. Also, some of his personal paintings that he bought from fellow artists. You won't regret spending a couple of hours here.

Nice but not enough to see. It's great to have a museum dedicated to one artist but there are few artworks to see. Visit this if you want to know more about the sculptor and visit his "home". Fortunately, there are other good sites nearby.
Wonderful gardens. The gardens were amazing. Beautifully laid out with stunning sculpture at every turn. Paid extra to see "the kiss". Totally worth it. Kids free.

I'm Thinking, I'm Thinking. Of all the Museums, thie one offers a great approach to offereing the modern day traveler a sense of completeness to what art, life, range of art work and ease of art appreciation can offer. Manicured gardens, openess, home well laid out and appropriate sized gift shop made this a must see.
Excellent museum. The Thinker. Finally seen the real thing. In the hustle and bustle of Paris is this excellent museum that seems so peaceful and has so many works of art

Perfect Paris. This little museum is a delight. Very economical, I believe only one or two euros to get in. Nice bathrooms, in Paris you quickly realize what a bonus that is ;). Pick a sunny day if possible since it is almost exclusively outdoors.
A nice serene place to reflect!. The thinker statue greets you outside and inside the sculptures are amazing! Would go back...it's been so long. Nice quick museum for a sunday :)
Quaint. We really liked this museum. The works of Rodin are beautiful and the setting is understated so you feel you can wander at the pace that suits you. Well worth a visit.
It makes you think!. Beautiful small Museum with a great overview of all the work of Rodin. Impressive what he made and the patina's are from a great quality.

Beautiful gardens!. We enjoyed strolling in the lovely and fragrant gardens, while admiring Rodin's many sculptures. It's a very secluded space and it doesn't feel like we're in the middle of the city. We were pleased to see The Thinker and other renowned works of arts. You get fast entry if you have a Paris Pass. Nice to do in combination with le Musée d'Orsay, given the proximity.

Beautiful location and very relaxing museum to visit. Loved Musee Rodin. No lineups like many of the other attractions in Paris and the exhibit was thoroughly enjoyable for those of us that love Rodin and want to learn more about his genius.

A quite contemplative museum. Rodin is an eaisly accessible artist. The works are understandable and competent. But the museum is a wonderful quiet space with a garden. Plan an after lunch visit so you can digest your meal from one of the near by bistros while digesting the art
Rodin Museum. Great collection of Rodin's sculptures through the years. Beautiful gardens where one can walk around and admire the sculptures throughout the grounds.

Wonderful Sculpture Garden. Highly recommend this small, Rodin exclusive museum. The gardens were the stand-out on a beautiful Spring day - each area feels like a new special place that invites you to linger on benches nestled within the trees. Less touristy and commercial feeling than the mega-attractions of Louvre and d'Orsay.
realy great art feel our body. look like real things just dont move nice the kiss the thinkink person the jand we wad at 2003 easy to find and get by train

Small but perfectly formed. A delightful compact museum. We used our Museum pass for free admission. Many fascinating exhibits inside 2 buildings and throughout the garden. Get up real close to "The Thinker" and "The Gates of Hell" in the garden and "The Kiss" indoors no photos in The Kiss gallery (check out the big toe on the guy - too big). Great little cafe too. Possibly my favourite of all places on this trip.
Time for a Breather!. After The Louvre and Notre Dame, it was great to leisurely stroll through this small, uncrowded museum and grounds. There's even a place in the garden that serves lunch!

An oasis in a sea of people. This was our very best experience as we were in Paris late June. Too many people and I would never return in summer. The only consolation to our trip was the rose garden was in full bloom, we could sit on a bench in the garden and actually relax.The sculptures are worth the trip, both inside and in the garden. My favourite Musee this trip.

Rodin is my favorite sculptor. I would go out of my way to see "The Kiss", and I spent a long time staring at it in marble from various angles once we finally got here. Unfortunately the gallery it was in, a temporary exhibit, was quite warm. The gardens are a pleasant walk with even more sculptures and we had ice cream at the cafe. Btw, there is "The Kiss" in bronze outside the Orangerie.
visit at least the garden. The entrance is 1 euro only, you can see many Rodin sculptures including also The Thinker, is not full of tourist and you can walk peacefully
loved it. Marvelous museum and grounds! The sculpture gardens are extensive and are filled with Rodin's work at every turn. So artfully displayed!

A wonderful museum, perfect size and well laid out. Visited Musee Rodin in July. I have come to appreciate smaller museums with a specific focus. This is a perfect example. The grounds and two buildings are laid out well and allow the work of this master sculptor to be viewed and appreciated in a variety of ways. Gardens are well kept. A very pleasant day. Allow a couple of hours if you are one that likes to linger and ponder your art.

Beautiful garden, great sculptures. Recently visited the garden and had a nice stroll. It is very quiet and peaceful and the sculptures scattered throughout are beautiful. Garden entry is only 1-euro, and it is worth it just to see the gates of hell, which my husband and i nearly missed! The garden entry allows visitors to see Rodin's arguably mot famous works, The Thinker, and The Gates of Hell. Plus. I is a great serene stroll. Well worth a visit.

Scuptures that bring a tears to your eyes.. Absolutely my favorite museum in the world. To see Rodin's work is such a pleasure. The first time I saw the Hands clasping I cried, it was so remarkable that a man could create such a masterpiece. I go every time I am in Paris and I would recommend Musee Rodin over all the others.
Rodin is just awesome. If you want to enjoy art, you gotta go to this museum, where you will find Rodin's wonderful masterpieces. My personal favorite: The Kiss!
Highlight of our Paris Visit. Musee Rodin was great. Be sure to visit if you can, and if you can, get a Museum Pass that allows you to bypass the line. You need to see his Porte de L'Enfer. Amazing!

Remarkable. The exhibit is remarkable and is located in a beautiful villa. But what I liked the most was the attention the staff paid to my elderly parents. My mother is wheel chair bound, my father a veteran of WW II - European Theatre. We were at first in a longline at the entrance but as soon as the staff saw my parents they walked us straight in, asking along the way if my Dad was a WWII vet. When he said yes they gave us a private our and fed us lunch. I was very touched

A lovely setting for amazing sculpture. The pieces in the indoor exhibits, both the "museum" part and the actual house, were incredible. You can't miss this if you like Rodin. But the gardens put this place as a must-see; beautiful sculpture placed on tree-lined paths in a park setting.

Rodin Gardens - the best euro you'll ever spend. 5 years since we last visited and the gardens are still only 1 euro to visit (and you get a fancy ticket!) At the moment they are open until 11pm on a Wednesday and it was so lovely to visit in the evening and appreciate the gardens as the lighting changed. The Erik Samakh installations and talking Yew trees were an unexpected delight. Best views? I can't decide whether it's standing in front of 'The Thinker' with Les Invalides and the Eiffel Tower in the background, or sitting at the far end of the gardens looking across the ponds to the museum. As for the sculptures themselves, they are just superb and make sure not to miss out on those in amongst the trees, in the shade.

Wonderful sculptures, strange pricing.. I loved all the sculptures, but I found the prices perplexing. It was €1 for just the gardens, and €9 to get in to the inside exhibits as well. However, there was a sign about a €10 price for families of 2 adults and any children under 18. My husband and I attempted to get the family price, but we were turned down. So we spent €18 and the family of 5 behind us spent only €10. It didn't seem to make sense.The only famous sculpture that you can't see in the garden is The Kiss. So if you're not a huge Rodin fan, I would think just the gardens would be good enough.
Well worth a visit. Lovely sculptures inside and out. Very hot day when w were there so wasn't able to spend a lot of TMR.

Good value if you just want to visit the Gardens.. Good value if you just want to visit the Gardens only. One Euro! Plenty of sculptures etc. Including the Thinker & 'The Gates of Hell'.
Music was being piped out of the small manicured trees was a bit strange, but added something to the visit.
Don't miss this small museum. Gem of a musuem. Good audio guide for the interior displays, excellent sculpture garden and nice outdoor cafe to soak it all in.

I loved seeing all of the sculptures in the garden. I loved seeing all of the sculptures in the gardens - it was so enjoyable wandering around. Inside the house was a totally different experience - the sculptures are displayed so differently between the inside and the outside - it is fun to see the groupings.

Gates of Hell was Amazing!!. I intially had no interest in the museum but went anyway. I was very glad I went. I had never heard of Rodin before but had definitely seen "the thinker" in pictures. Definitely worth a visit for art lovers and non art lovers alike.
Lovely gardens. Well worth going to walk around the gardens. We had a cup of tea etc.. In the cafe on site, good value.

Loved this museum. We really loved this museum. It is the perfect size, with lots to see. Very interesting. Café and gardens in the back were so relaxing and enjoyable. We did use the audio guides and learned so much more, than if we had just walked through. Love the Gates of Hell. Don't miss it!!!

Rodin's gift to us. This museum does not get on the main itineraries but truly is lovely. Rodin arranged to gift his home with his principal statues to the nation just prior to his death and we should be grateful that they were not sold off to private collectors. Now, they remain in his garden for our enjoyment for walks on beautiful sunny days. Of special interest is the Gates to Hell. Extreme detail so don't rush by!

Best Museum in Paris. This was my second time here - be warned if you go before 2014 (check their site!) The museum is under renovations and my experience this time was not the same experience as three years ago in 2010. Much of Rodin's work that was, and I believe is usually on display, was not. It was a bad copy of what the museum was and will hopefully be when renovations are done. Thant being said - it is still a great museum to see the works of one the (the best in my opinion) greatest sculptors. The museum was his house and workshop for the latter part of his life and there is a wall outside, in the gardens, documenting his life and that of the building.Seeing the house and walking the gardens can be done in an hour, 1 1/2 at most. Since most of the rooms and windows were shut the house was hot. Very hot - but, Paris was going through a mini-heat wave when I was there so that's that. Just something to keep in mind if it's a hot day when you visit.What I like the best about the museum is the ability to get real close to the work and see all the chisel marks, where Rodin formed things with his hands. There is a real human element to the museum if you let it come to you and if you are open to receive it. Of course, I am biased as I prefer sculpture over paintings, and Rodin is my favorite. In any event, no matter what you think of the museum itself, the gardens are worth a nice walk and in 2010 I brought some wine and cheese and meat and made a little picnic near the fountain. Not sure you want to carry around wine all day? No problem. There is a great little cafe in the gardens where you can purchase beer, wine, ice cream, sandwiches, salads, etc., to be enjoyed in a lovely shaded area for a break from the day.The Eiffel tower is a 15 minute walk away to the West, and the d'Orsay is about 12 minutes to the north. That's a nice day I think. d'Orsay, Rodin, Eiffel. Very relaxing and very french.
Oasis of peace. This was a lovely experience as there is a beautiful garden with lots of shady walks as well as the main museum. Well worth a visit.
Nice collection and garden. If you like sculptures in marble and bronz, this the place to be. It is not so big but it contains important works of Rodin. There is also a nice garden.

Wow! Breathtakingly beautiful experience.. If you want a sense of what it was like to be an artist in Paris at the turn of the last century, this is the musee for you! The grounds and home are an oasis in the city and give a real sense of how artists gathered together in communes to strengthen their craft. Rodin's work is spectacular, so spend some time reading about his life and craft prior to your visit. The Musee Rodin was the highlight of our 4-day tour.

Peaceful Change. A lovely change from the rat-race going on outside the garden walls. Sculptures in Rodin's house were interesting, with a beautiful view through a window to the gardens below. But the most enjoyable experience is wandering through the garden and viewing the sculptures for as long as you like, due to the fact it wasn't over-crowded. The cafe serves decent food too. Visit The Louvre first and you'll appreciate the serenity of Musee Rodin even more!

You'll tell your friends about Rodin. My husband and teenagers found the Rodin to be very interesting. My older daughter pencil sketched his statues for hours, while we meandered through his life's work. I highly recommend this experience. If you have a chance, look up some biography information on Rodin, we found that we were familiar with his work and didn't know it. We also visited the Rodin annex in Philadelphia- we highly recommend this too, especially right before or after you visit the Musee Rodin in Paris. Look for Rodin's work at the Musee d'Orsay too.
Beautiful. If you like to see sculptures, this is the museum to go to. Who does not know the thinker? Here you will see the original.
This is a Paris must do. The gardens alone, are worth the visit, and for only €1... It should be in the top 10 things to do.Many of his works are in the gardens.

Nice museum, not crowded. Nice museum and gardens. Great especially if you have the museum pass and can just stroll through here in an hour or two. Crowds were not bad at all and it's interesting how so many of the sculptures are just outside in the gardens. It's good to do in conjunction with Eiffel tower or napoleon's tomb.

Rodin - the highlight of Paris. This museum is the oasis in Paris! Once inside the museum you have a garden that is like a little piece of paradise - a place where you can escape Paris and relax. The sculptures are fantastic and you are transported not only through a space filled with great art, but an experience of how that art came about, the process that Rodin went through. The garden on a hot summer's day is a pleasure to walk through and displays the works of Rodin (and other sculpturers) in a most glorious setting. Make sure you allow adequate time to absorb the beauty of the art and gardens as this is the place that will make you fall in love with Paris. The museum is part of the Paris Museum Pass system, although when we went it was not that busy and the bypass the queue system did not provide significant advantages is time saving.

Nice Museum, wonderful garden. The Rodin Museum was nice & interesting, but for us the best part was the lovely sculpture garden. There's a nice café in the garden, and it was just very relaxing to wander around there.
The Thinker. Intimate garden and museum in the heart of Paris. Well worth checking out. It's unique, beautiful and not over crowded like so many other sites.

Think the thinker.... We enjoyed the outside works of art, the thinker was great. We made the mistake of showing up on a Monday (it's closed) so we went back on Tuesday. Try to visit this museum as a 2 hour add on when you visit Napoleon's tomb.

Great museum for families. This is a small and not too crowded museum. It is mostly outdoors and it is a great place to visit with younger kids. It allows grownups to admire Rodin and other sculptors' work in a relaxed atmosphere where the children can wonder freely. It has places to sit to rest, read, or have a bite.

Wonderful, manageable museum. This is one of my favorite museums, ever. I could look at Rodin sculptures all day, but what really sets this apart is the setting, with a converted, old hotel where Rodin actually stayed and beautiful, tranquil gardens where his sculptures are artfully displayed. The collection is rich, but manageable in 1-2 hours. I absolutely loved the contrast of Rodin's working models with the finished product. I came away with a vastly increased appreciation for the artist and the process of sculpting. The small garden cafe is also a treat, either for a snack or a light lunch.

Peaceful Garden Oasis and Lovely Mansion. When you need a break from crowds and heat this is the place to be. Regardless, it is worth a visit. Many famous sculptures are found throughout the lovely, carefully tended gardens where you will also find a café and restrooms. Inside the mansion (former hotel) there are two floors of artwork by Rodin and others. We went early and found the gardens cool and peaceful and the mansion not crowded. Included on Paris Museum Pass and near metro stop and open topped tour bus stop. Make a little time for this one

Oasis of Beauty. There is nothing to dislike about the Musée Rodin if you go early in the morning or in late afternoon. Mornings are best: stroll in the gardens, be amazed by the sculptures, visit the house( no more than one hour for this) and then have coffee or light lunch in the garden café. Admire the golden dome of Les Invalides as you ponder the huge outdoor statue of Le Penseur( The Thinker). before or after, see the film Camille Claudel with Juliette Binoche. It sums up very well the effects of a larger than life genius such as Auguste Rodin on a quieter, more fragile genius who loved him.
Renovations. This is one of my favorite museums in Paris. It has undergone renovations since my last time there, and the gardens are even more beautiful. I highly recommend a visit.

"Thinker" about it.... Small and very relaxing museum compare to others in Paris,Beutifull garden,evem if you are not Rodin fan totally work just to got this experience...the ambience is hard to put in words!!!!Always be back...

Love, love, love it!. A must see in Paris. Feast your eyes on the art, then take a leisurely stroll in the gardens. It's a great to sit and read or to have a snack at the café. Make sure you go on a sunny day! It will make your overall experience much more memorable!

Tranquil. I really wanted to visit this museum so dragged my family there! I wasn't disappointed. Many of the sculptures are displayed in the garden so try to visit in good weather. There is a lovely cafe in the garden which served tasty baguettes.

A great chill-out option. A wonderful museum in a quiet area of Paris. Somehow, the lack of crowds, lovely property (you can walk around the beautiful gardens), nice tea-room, and classic artwork add up to make this a calming excursion, and far different from the usual museum scrum.
Must See. If you haven't been here before go!! Beautiful gardens provide an exceptional setting for Rodin's sculptures.
Wonderful sculptures indoors and out. This museum should be better known than it is. There are great sculptures both inside and outside, with lovely gardens to house the exterior works.

The Thinker. I appreciated the works of Rodin much more having done some study of them before I toured the Musee. The setting is lovely and is part of a very touching story about the artist, his life, and the regard of the French people for him.

Must-see? Not so sure. The gardens are beautiful and provide great photo-opportunities with their many sculptures, hedges and The Thinker. Inside I felt disappointed......Galleria Borghese still my favourite.

Not to be missed...... A highlight of any visit to Paris.....such tranquillity in the garden setting amongst the exquisite sculptures.....a great place for lunch and relaxation. Rodin's talent is beautifully displayed in both the interior and exterior locations.
Revelation. I don't like sculpture - until now. A relaxing, stimulating and informative day in the building and gardens have prompted a real interest in this area of art.

The Thinker @ Musee Rodin. Directional signs to Musee Rodin is lacking as I emerged from the subway station. I had to ask passerbys with my limited French. It was a long hike in the summer heat.Eventually I stumbled into the gate Musee de l'Armee to get final directions from the guard. Simple but prominently posted signs would greatly help especially foreign visitors.Once there, I found the museum space cramped. So many pieces of work jostling for space. The lighting was harshfor marble sculptors. Visitors need room to step back and contemplate sometimes but you can't, you'll bump into another visitor's personal space.At the outdoors garden, visitors were jostling for their turns to pose under "The Thinker" They all mimic the same pose as "The Thinker". In some way it was amusing but I also cringe at the thought that they were posing on Rodin's tomb. How disrespectful!

Excellent Sculpture Garden. The best part of this museum experience is not the collection of Rodin statues, but the beautiful gardens surrounding his house. It is very peaceful and uncrowded even in July.

Calm, beautiful, good food!. Highly recommend stopping here! (it's right across from the Invalides/Napoleon)It's a smaller museum, which is nice when you're starting to overload on Paris museums. The gardens are nice to walk through and there was an eating area that sold ice cream, drinks, and food! Salads looked wonderful and many pastries! We had already eaten but I'd eat there next time for sure!! Free with the Paris Museum Pass!!Open late on Wednesday nights, I think.
Lovely gardens. Features The Thinker, The Kiss, etc and lovely floral gardens. Conveniently located near Napoleon's Tomb and army museum, which was very interesting on a rainy Parisian afternoon.

Rodin is well worth the stop. You can enter the Rodin garden and see The Thinker and some other pretty awesome sculptures for 1 euro. And you can use the bathrooms for free, unlike many other churches and attractions we went to in Europe. They have an overpriced cafe as well. Don't miss the Rodin Garden, but you can skip the museum unless you are a huge fan.

He's a master. Difficult to put in words my feelings about this museum. I love his work, especially the hidden sculptures, those not completely revealed. His own philosophy towards his and his pupils work is worth a study

Favorite of My Visit. A small museum with a lot to offer. Rodin's work honestly speaks for itself, and this charming little museum, located where Rodin lived in Paris, is the perfect setting. In the sculpture garden you see many locals taking in the sun and their lunches, and the museum itself is wonderful. I went on a day that had fewer people, and getting a chance to see this master's work in such a setting was the highlight of my day!

Great museum sculpture garden.. Another must in Paris. You are in a park, and there, before you is a wonderful museum. It is Rodin's sculpture garden in the middle of busy Paris. For a small fee you can see his magnificent sculptures up close. There is no hurry, the sculptures allow you to walk around them, seeing the curve of a figure, the tilt of a head, a hand cast just so. It is a remarkable affirmation of the artistic energy of Paris back in the day when art, sculpture, architecture, literature, music and so much more was making itself known in the world.

Rodin's residence with artwork inside his home and in the garden area.. I was at a Rodin Musee in San Francisco, Calif which was much nicer and with lot more sculptures. Garden area in the rear of the building could have been better maintained.

just love Rodin. I love Rodin's work and this museum shows a lot of it. He created many duplicates for each work but it is nice to see so much of them in one single place, allowing us to estimate his dramatic changes in sensitivity with age. Highly recommended !

Simply amazing. We had been to Paris on multiple occasions, and have not visited this museum until this last trip. What a pleasant surprise, definitely worth visiting. Rodin's work is simply amazing. I know we will return to this museum to further be mesmerized by his work.

Beautiful Museum. The museum itself is housed in a beautiful mansion that Rodin lived in towards the end of his life. It is very cool to see all of Rodin's sculptures and other art pieces that the museum holds. It is very pleasant to walk around the gardens as well!

LOVELY!. One of my favorite museums. You can do this museum in a few hours and still have time for a lovely meal. They have a little cafeteria in the back that has cappuccino. You can also picnic on the grounds if you bring something in!
easy kid friendly museum. fun little museum to go through without spending the entire day (gardens & inside took less than an hour)

Great Quick Museum for the Short Attention Span!. Just visited this museum with my husband and teenagers last week. Great short stop spot to see sculpture they recognize and lovely gardens. You can zoom through it in an hour if you have a group with "short attention spans..."
Go here on a sunny day!. Gorgeous outdoor sculpture gardens! Indoors even more in an amazing building with skylights! If you love art and or architecture you really CANNOT miss this!

30 years later, still amazing. My second visit, the first being in 1980. This is quite possible the nicest museum in Paris. Not crowded, even in June, grounds are impeccable maintained. The roses are as beautiful as any I've seen in the states. There is a small cafe that has healthy choices and a nice area to site outside. The bathrooms are CLEAN and there is no additional charge :) Now o to the sculpture: The Thinker, Balzac, The Burghers of Calais, Masterpieces AND history. Only ONE Euro to see the gardens. A very comfortable relaxed atmosphere combined with some of the most spectacular art in the world makes for a 5 star review.

Mostly outdoors. Great museum to do in the late morning and bring lunch so you can eat in the gardens. You can buy tickets for just the gardens or to include the museum building which is worth it because it contains casts used for various sculptures so you get an upclose view.

Simply beautiful!. The garden has beautiful plant arrangements, the statues in it are great, the Hôtel Biron has a few nice paintings from Van Gogh and Renoir, as well as lovely statues. The famous "Kiss" is lovely. It is a pity it is located on a part of the museum where you can't take any pictures (there is one version of it at the Hôtel Biron that you can photograph).

A Little Haven In the City. The Musee Rodin was a pleasant surprise. We used our museum pass (there was no fee for children). We walked through the museum with Rodin's work and then headed out to the lovely grounds. It was a breath of fresh air after walking through the busy city. It was great to see "The Thinker" and it was a great photo op. We also enjoyed gelato at their outdoor cafe.
My favorite museum in Paris. Best place to have a nice breakfast on Sunday when they normally have a chamber orchestra playing outside

Don't miss it!. Excellent! We used our Paris museum pass, our teenage children were free. We enjoyed the inside museum, and loved walking among the beautiful statues outside in the garden. It's very peaceful to wander among the statues outside, and easy to forget that it's in the middle of a city. Well worth seeing.

A little oasis. We loved the experience of wandering around this lovely garden with statues that you could spend time with and view from afar and close up without feeling of being pushed along by crowds.Inside the mansion, was also a lovely collection of statues and art. Although July and crowds were everywhere, there was not the hustle as at other attractions.A great, little interesting oasis .We didn't eat or drink here, but I thought it would be a great place to meet up with friends...to sit and chat in these lovely gardens and then to wander around

Near Invalides Dome. A museum located next to the Invalides Dome found, in the small street. It is worth a visit, even for those who do not have a favorite Roden. The area to park and expensive card only. Many statues are on display in the garden. 18year refer to both free of charge.

Perfect on a warm summer day. The Rodin museum is definitely worth a visit while in Paris. What we loved is that Rodin's sculptures were located in a garden behind the house in which he lived. We loved wondering around the garden and posing with the sculptures. The Thinker is a must-see, but there are many others that are just as amazing. Because the museum is smaller, it is great for families and for avoiding crowds at the larger museums.

So many works of art, but.... The sculptures were very impressive and they were certainly his best works. However, many of them only had signs in French and the place badly needed a refresh.The rose garden had many varieties of roses but many of them had sadly expired. Some sculptures needed a cleanup.Despite that the place is still worth a visit. Let's hope they will get the place freshened up soon!

Gardens are fantastic. The inside exhibits demonstrated his works in progress and rough drafts. The day was perfect for a leisurely stroll in the gardens where the real art is found. Again, museum pass helped jump the line.
Something to think about. Sculptures in the gardens were outstanding. Very relaxing way to spend time walking through the gardens and admiring not only the famous "Thinker" but other works as well.

Had to see The Thinker. We went to the Musee Rodin partly because it was included in the Paris Museum Pass, but mostly because I had to see The Thinker in person! There are many other works in the sculpture garden as well as lovely flowers. We did not take the time to go inside the mansion - just took in the garden. With the Pass, we were able to walk right in, no waiting. There are some pretty artistic photography opps with the Eiffel Tower looming behind The Thinker.

My favorite spot in Paris. This is just a beautiful spot inside and out. I know they have been doing renovations so check first. Rodin's work and the others exhibited are amazing and so is the setting!

Rodin Garden. We visited the garden where The Thinker and many other Rodin sculptures are located. Very enjoyable afternoon with teen-age grandsons. What awesome views for 1€! Next time I think we will include the indoor museum

Oasis of Refinement. If you want to get away from the fray pushy tourists who speak on cell-phones during their visit to a museum (to take up everyone else's public space); if you want to get away from those line-ups (ugh), if you want rather, to escape to a quiet oasis of wonder and contemplation, then the Rodin Museum and it's Hotel Biron is the best museum to see in Paris. The history of the Biron, the life of Rodin, and his work both indoors and the walk in the garden of his sculptures is breathtaking. Unlike perhaps the larger museums in Paris, the Rodin Museum is the right size to absorb the prolific works of art Rodin accomplished.

Wonderful venue and beautiful work. Having been prompted by the work in the Musee d'Orsay to visit here. With such a lovely building and gardens, we were a little disappointed at the lack of work really. Many pieces were contained within an apparently temporary exhibition (including The Kiss), which meant that once in the house itself, there was surprisingly little to see...The Gates of Hell was certainly worth the visit, as I love it, and the thing that the museum did make me realise, was quite how much of his work has been reused and recreated for it...seems if an idea worked, he kept with it.Lovely to stroll through the gardens too, and take in the pieces spread throughout, but did make me think it was style over substance sadly, as this doesn't reflect the artist in my opinion (Would have said 3/5 but The Gates of Hell makes it 4/5)
Peaceful. Very interesting to see all his sculptures, liked the ones that were set in the Garden, made for a peaceful evening. Go on the late nights on the wednesday, seem to be less crowds
Great spot in Paris. Very good museum. The gardens are delightful for a walk, and the terrace restaurant quite good for a self service.

Iconic. Pensive. French!. If you have the Museum Pass, there is ZERO reason to miss this. It is across the street from the Invalides (also a must see with the Pass). If you like to take cheesy photos than you can take a photo of you, The Thinker, the Invalides Dome, and the Eiffel Tower all in one photo. I know, cheesy buy fun! I enjoy Rodin's work so I really liked the setting and the layout of this property. (I still do not understand the music in the gardens, but it is now a part of my Rodin experience.)You can make this a long or short visit and either way you will leave with good memories of a great sculptor. Enjoy

Neat outdoor museum. I was pleasantly surprised by this museum. I didn't expect to see the statues outside in a garden setting, which really set them off, neat. I was also very jealous to see Parisian grade school student writing out a description of Le Penseur in their workbooks as they stood a foot away from the statue.

An oasis in summer-mad Paris. In a Paris that is fervid in 30 degrees and end-to-end traffic (cars and humans), head to Musee Rodin near the Invalides. Go early in the morning when the air is cool and traffic slight. Hug the shades in the side streets. Between 10 and noon, the garden is nearly empty. Walk around and listen to the faint music. Enjoy the white lilacs in bloom. Admire the outdoor sculpture. Take refreshments at the garden cafe before the crowd. Then tour the exhibition rooms inside the Hotel Biron and shop the boutique. This would prove the best part of the day and perhaps of your visit to Paris!

not what I thought it would be. I was really excited about this place. I love sculpture. To be fair, I think it was under renovation. But it was not a cheap museum, and it was not all that great, to me. Make it your top 20 but certainly not your top 10

Art History classes come to life. I studied Rodin extensively in college in my sculpture classes, so this was especially wonderful for me. The museum was an easy walk from the Les Invalides RER stop, since I was coming from Versailles. The grounds were lovely, and each sculpture had its own garden setting. It's a great place to wander on a hot day, as there are lots of cool shaded areas to sit and contemplate Rodin's genius. It's too bad most people seemed to care only about having their photo taken with "The Thinker".The entrance price was very reasonable, and there was the added bonus of a traveling show of Rodin's larger marble sculptures during my visit.I ate lunch at the cafe, which was very tasty and a far better value than eating anywhere else. The whole place was so tranquil that it was a pleasure to enjoy my sandwich and sip my coffee in such peace.

Just go to the garden. Pay 1 euro to see the garden, its all you need. there are many of Rodins sculptures in the garden along with the most famoreus of all, The thinker. The cafee is good, not cheap, but good

maybe not for really young kids.... The gardens here are beautiful and to see so many of his sculptures in one place is wonderful. They have landscaped the garden so that each sculpture is in its own little world. The house, or hotel, is a treat to see as well. This is a nice a break into a busy day. You’re not supposed to walk on the grass and keep your voice is down so this might not be the best place for young kids.

Sound, vision,smell. On a steamy hot day this is a beaut place to visit... After viewing the amazing carved marble indoors, a refreshing wander around a sound show in the rose garden( subtle and quite zen) and a cool amble picking out the many sculptures in the large gardens. Rodins hotel makes a great story. Lesser crowds than other places, tho still had to queue.
Wonderful museum. Small but very nice, inexpensive and a nice thing to check out. There was a cafe there as well as ice cream that was nice as well
Ahhh..... What a lovely place! There is some construction at the moment, but our experience was still wonderful -- serene gardens, great collection -- good lunch, too!

If you like Rodin you would enjoy. We had a tight schedule so we only visited the gardens and they were quite nice some of the most popular sculptures are displayed there.
I found the piped in meditation sounds a little disconcerting and out of place.
Nice courtyard and artpieces. If you get a sunny day, you should definitely visit this museum which has a very nice courtyard where some of the art pieces are placed. It is part of the Museum Pass.
Best euro spent!. For one euro for adults (free for children) you have access to an amazing sculpture garden. By far my favorite Paris museum - open space, not crowded and stunning scenery.

Great if you are a Rodin fan.. There is a good balance between the indoor and outdoor exhibitions. The main outdoor attraction is the Thinker while the Kiss statue is kept indoors. Lots of statues without explanations and since we were unfamiliar with Rodin's lesser works, we were not inspired to spend too much time here. I would recommend this attraction if you have the Paris pass and have already visited the Lourve and Orsay museums.Visited in July 2013.

Le Penseur. I know little about Rodin except his "Le Penseur" (The Thinker). It is next to the Military Museum and Napoleon's Tomb, so if you have time, you may consider visiting it, esp. if you have a Museum Pass.

Great for a picnic. Pack a picnic lunch and spend a few hours. Teachers also get in for free so don't forget your id. A nice follow up to the Orsay as you get to experience their Rodins in a different situation.
A must.. The Thinker and the Gates of Hell in an outdoor relaxed feeling. Sit under a tree and take in the works of a master.

What a wonderful Museum!. In all my travels to Paris this is the first time I have been here. I will definitely return. It's gorgeous, well put together, and the grounds are fantastic. Lunch is good here as well.

Loved it.. This is worth a trip here. Very personal and very up close look at his work. You meaner through the garden looking at his famous works...almost unbelievable. This is one of my favorite places in Paris. Nice little place in garden for lunch, too.

Yes Another Museum, but this is a Must.. There are lots of museums in Paris. But if you like sculptures or just want to walk a beautiful home and grounds go to this museum. It also houses the famous "Thinker" and that alone is a reason to go.
Great small museum. Great place for some piece and quite. The museum is great and the gardens worth spending time appreciating. Don´t miss it!
A special place. This museum and garden is one of a kind in Paris. You can get up close to some of Rodin's most famous masterpieces. So awe inspiring, a do not miss while in Paris.

Do not miss it f you like great sculptures.. It was the perfect museum for a rainy day. We enjoyed it very much. There is a good variety of Rodin's pieces. you can also enjoy the yard and gardens and try to find out what The Thinker
had in mind. The museum is not far from the Eiffel Tower, so you can enjoy two sites inone day.

Now my favorite museum. Very small, and its a nice mix of garden exhibits and indoor exhibits. Pay attention to the street lamp poles outside the museum. Sort of a graffiti homage to the museum. You'll understand once you read one of the hundreds of stickers.

A sweet jewel of a museum. A smaller, more manageable, but still breathtaking place, which you enjoy both indoors and outdoors. Only disappointment: "The Kiss" is not given a front and center spot any more. It's my favorite, even more than the Thinker, and I would like to see it displayed prominently.
However, still about my favorite museum in Paris.

Beautiful gardens. I only visited the museum gardens and not the museum itself, but I HIGHLY recommend the gardens as a lovely place to visit - whether you are an art connoisseur or merely a lover of beautiful gardens. I visited in June when the roses were in full bloom and it was heavenly! The entrance fee for the gardens only is one euro...it couldn't be better spent! Very close and convenient to Napoleon's Tomb and the Eiffel Tower but it feels a world away! Very serene and peaceful.
Wonderful place!. Preferred the outside sculptures to those within the house/museum. Powerful shapes surrounded by garden, including the well knwn "Thinker".

no comment. I visited the museum on a blessed summer day, a sunday when all the entrances in Paris museums were free. It`s an incredible beautiful place, especially the garden, where sculptures marry perfectly with sunlight filtered by the green foliage of trees. It`s really like a fairytale..

Best Museum in Paris!. This is the only Museum in Paris dedicated to only one Artist. It's a great way to spend the morning before the crowds arrive and I recommend getting the audio tour! We stopped for a creme and a treat halfway through the gardens. Fabulous Cafe!

Eye-opening. An excellent museum. Rodin tended to rework the same few subjects over and over, which makes for an interestingly focused museum. The story of the creation of his most famous work is fascinating, and not what you expect.

A diamond amongst paris museums. Musee Rodin is a must see for anyone who loves the works of Auguste Rodin or wants to be introduced to one of the world's most important artists. This underrated museum is located in an 18th century mansion (where I believe he worked and lived), set behind a private garden away from the busyness of the city. Beautifully manicured rose gardens surround the outdoor sculptures. It is here that you are greeted by the most famous sculpture,The Thinker, which sits upon a pedestal watching over the garden. Most people do not know what the Thinker is gazing upon. The famous Gates of Hell, as well as other less well-known sculptures, also grace the garden area. Inside the mansion, Rodin's sketches and paintings are equally as mesmerizing as his sculptures. Don't leave Paris without spending time here.

Beautiful. I think this was the museum I enjoyed most in Paris - once inside, you can see the garden, throughout which the statues are places, making for a beautiful combination with the green gardens.The inner museum is also nice and shows many works as they were in progress, but it's the outside gardens which left the best impression on me.

Sweet and Mighty Museum. I have long been a fan of Rodin and visiting this museum was an inspiration. The sculpture garden is phenomenal. The weather was perfectly cool and we lingered awhile and then had a cup of tea at the cafe. Great spot to preserve the memory and work of an amazing man.
an outstanding oasis of calm. Just the best place to get a quiet moment in Paris - from the garden you can see the Eiffel Tower and The Thinker at the same time. The roses right now are gorgeous.

excellent displays. All the Rodin pieces were well laid out and very enjoyable to see. We were never overwhelmed by the amount of stuff. The gardens are a delight and the bronzes in the garden are beautifully surrounded by trees/shrubs. The "Thinker" was beautifully displayed by its location and surrounding greenery. THe exhibit was actually in 2 buildings. One had mostly marbles and plaster preps. THe gardens had the big ronses and a swecond house for the paintings and small bronses. THe size is perfect for a morning museum visit.

Wonderful surprise...loved the gardens.. We chose the addition of Musee Rodin to the d'Orsay tickets we purchased and could not be more surprised how much we enjoyed our visit. It was a bit confusing to walk from the d'Orsay to the Rodin but we found it with a map. It was enjoyable to see the sculptures inside since I had particularly wanted to see "The Kiss". But we were completely unprepared for the experience of seeing the bronzes in the garden outside. We also enjoyed the beauty of the gardens with so many roses in bloom.

Beautiful rose garden, enjoyable visit. This site includes lovely grounds to be savored with artwork and plantings to be savored. There is also a indoor museum with an interesting history. Definitely worth a visit.You can buy a ticket at this site which includes admittance to Musee Rodin as well as the Musee D'Orsay and avoid the long lines there.
Most beautiful chapel. Evening concert, peaceful and relaxing. Beautiful setting. Best to sign up for music to avoid the lines.
Don't miss Balzac. Take your time and enjoy the gardens. Nice cafeteria on the side in the garden to grab lunch with a glass of wine.
Fabulous gardens and statues. We really enjoyed seeing the Rodin statues and the gardens were beautiful. We went on a Friday afternoon (6/28) and the weren't any crowds.

The Thinker. "Le Penseur" as it's called is available and many other Rodin bronzes are as well outside and for only about 5Euros per person. It was 12 Euros for the full museum tour which we didn't do. The Thinker was what I wanted to see the most.

Amazing collection in a beautiful garden. This collection is amazing - as is the decaying mansion many preparatory works are housed in. The gardens are beautiful & it is a wonderful context for Rodin's work to be viewed. I hope restoration work moves quickly on the building - it is a shame to see how much deterioration & decay needs to be restored. However according to the supplied information this collection and gallery including the building garden and museum is totally self funded. This was a wonderful museum to visit in Paris.
My favorite Museum. This quiet little museum is like an oasis in the city. The grounds and gardens or beautiful and hold some great works of art. there is a cute little cafe to grab a bite and relax.
Closed Mondays. Have visited the sculpture gardens several times. You never get tired of them. Recommended.But I always forget it's closed Mondays and make an unnecessary journey.
Rodin's garden. This is far and away the best value in Paris.It cost just 1euro to gain access to the garden.The garden and its statues are awe inspiring.

Beautiful Gardens. My favorite part was wandering through the gardens looking at the sculptures and flowers. There were plenty of benches to sit and rest, which was great on a warm summer day.The two inside displays were nice but after a while I became overwhelmed by the sheer quantity of pieces and headed back outside.There is also an outdoor cafe but unless you are very hungry or thirsty, I would go elsewhere as it is very expensive.

Incredible sculpture. My favorite museum in Paris. There is such passion and sensuality in Rodin's work that really comes to life when you see his sculptures up close. I've seen pictures and copies of The Thinking Man but nothing compares to seeing the details and the expressive of the sculpture up close. I've been to this museum several times and each time I discover something new about Rodin and his work. The museum is in an old beautiful house with a lovely garden in the back. There's also a wonderful cafe where you can stop for a leisurely bite before you continue on your journey.

Great Outdoor Stop. This is one of my favorite single-artist museums in the world and a worthy stop that can take fro one to two hours. Anyone with a Museum Pass should plan on visiting. The museum's been upgraded inside and out over the years, the gardens are beautiful, and when the weather in Paris is nice, it's a very peaceful and romantic setting. Worth it just for the rose gardens in May and June...

Great stop to relax and enjoy sculptures in garden setting. On a nice day, this museum is worth a visit, even if you have just one hours. There is a priority line for Museum Pass holders - no wait to get in when when we went there in the afternoon. Many of the interesting sculptures are outdoors. You can have a pleasant and relaxing stroll, take pictures, stop for coffee at the outdoor cafe, enjoy the sun and walk amidst the garden.

Another tired monument in need of a makeover!. This latest trip to Paris has been a real eye opener. During the course of escorting first-time Paris visitors around key sites, we have been really disappointed at how badly neglected many of these sites are. It is really unforgivable on the part of the responsible authorities. It is not as if they don't make enough off tourists and visitors to cry poor! They earn billions from entry fees charged.Musée Rodin is yet another example of a national monument seriously neglected. The actual main building really needs a good spruce up: paintwork is in terrible condition generally and the plastering in places has come away and there are major cracks indicating separation in the structure. The parquet floors also need attention. While the actual experience of Rodin and his sculptures, drawings and paintings is still great (the sculptures are amazing to see in the different settings, especially the rose garden and forest settings) it shows a serious lack of respect to his talent and major donations to French cultural heritage that all is so poorly presented.

Glorious and a manageable size; what a sculpture garden!. Make sure you get the audio tour and linger to listen to all the details. Rodin, and this museum, are magnificent. Plan to spend an hour inside and an hour in the garden. The garden is peaceful and full of flowers. Be sure to walk all the way around each statue as each view is unique and wonderful. Wow!

Best museum in Paris on my trip. We went to several museums on our trip (Louvre, Orsay, Cluny, etc.) and I found this one the most engaging and beautiful. I do prefer sculpture over canvas and these sculptures were the best. I must admit I'm not really into art and wasn't excited about the trip, but this place changed my mind. You can feel the emotions coming from Rodin's work. And the beautiful garden setting was perfect.Go for a relaxing, less crowded afternoon of great art and a beautiful garden. Then go down the street to my 2nd favorite place, Napoleon's Tomb.

Quite a small collection.. We did enjoy visiting here but we had expected the collection to be more extensive. The gardens were nice, and we enjoyed the cafe.The old hotel housing some of the collection looked lovely on the outside but inside was a different story. It is badly in need of a major make over. We felt it was very neglected with paint peeling off the ceilings etc.

Loved it!!!. If you plan to view a number of Museums in Paris you should think about getting a Paris Museum Pass - it helps you avoid line-ups and allows you to think about going back to your favorite museums several times in your stay. The sculptures in the Museum are amazing - many are in the block of marble so you get much more of an idea of the 'raw' matter he started from. The house on the grounds has a number of pieces of art Rodin donated from his personal collections. The grounds are beautifully maintained with the most stunning roses of every colour.
Never managed to stop by here before. We loved seeing the maquettes alongside the sculptures. Fascinating glimpse at process. Such gorgeous roses in the garden, too, with strange, beguiling music.

Construction on 2013. This museum is under renovations for 2013 Rodin's artwork can be seen although don't follow the map because it won't make sense. I guess they had to move things around for the renovations. The gardens are beautiful.

Turned out to be our favorite museum in Paris. I wouldn’t have thought to hit this museum, but with a Museum Pass you tend to try some new ones. As it turned out, my family liked this one over the Louvre and D’Orsay. It’s in a quiet part of Paris (near Napoleon’s Tomb and the Military Museum). The gardens are pleasant. The place seemed much more intimate than the other larger museums. I now understand what “The Thinker” is all about. As with all of Paris’ museums, be sure to check the days that the museum is closed and what day(s) it is open late.

Rodin in his own home. This is a great, often overlooked museum showcasing Rodin's work in his/its own home. The history behind this wonderful museum is in itself fascinating and the wonderful collection of Rodin's pieces in their own home is a fantastic combination of art and history. The grounds themselves are beautiful. Take the time to walk the property, admiring the views. Treat yourself to a glass of wine at the café - this is one of the most relaxing spots in all of Paris.

My favorite museum in Paris. Embassy neighborhood. The combination of the outdoor gardens and the backdrop of the Hotel Biron make this the perfect setting for Rodin's work. There were literally people dozing in quiet corners of the garden. Have a glass of wine at the garden cafe and the power of Rodin's work takes care of the rest. Don't miss it.

One of the best!. The Rodin museum is one of my favourites museums in Paris: beautiful gardens , easy information about the esculptures, its just beside the Les invalides, in a wonderful house with a good location! If you buy a museum pass, you have free entry!
The Thinker! The Kiss!. Classic sculptures that we all know. Le Penseur is outside of the building. It's a small museum so nice to pop by if you have a heavy scheduled day already planned.

Rodin and Roses!. Musee Rodin has been a favorite of mine for many years. Although time was tight, we wanted to see it. We found that we could buy an admission to the gardens only for 1 euro each! Since we only had about an hour left, this was a perfect option. It was a beautiful sunny day and the gardens were in full bloom. What a perfect setting for the sculptures! In particular, the Thinker is surrounded by flowers. It would have been nice to have had a bit more time available to tour the full museum (in a lovely mansion) but this was a perfect compromise. Be sure to pick up the brochure with the map of the garden.

5 stars outside, 4 stars inside. You can see all of Rodin's sculptures right here and that's a great feast. It's a small museum and the outside grounds are easily walkable in less than an hour. The sculptures are well-placed and surrounded by graceful flowerbeds. You can get close to each work--really see the wonderful relief sculptures on the Gates of Hell. But this museum used to be even better because now they no longer use the beautiful mansion at the opposite end of the garden. The indoor sculptures are all crowded into a new, modern building, one on top of the other. No way to get any distance on them. You are forced to follow a walkway of ramps to view the closely packed sculptures. Maybe this is temporary. Wheelchairs are available.

Charming Side Museum. Musee Rodin was the perfect way to start the day because a stroll through the garden on a nice day while viewing Rodin's larger bronze sculptures is unparalleled. The Thinker is amazing when viewed from afar from various angles. While the sculptures inside the museum do tend to become repetitive, the museum layout is well done, allowing space between pieces. The hotel, which houses the museum, is in need of some repair, but you can sense that it was once magnificent. This is a must see museum for any art lover.

Lovely gardens and museum. I cannot think of a museum that is more beautiful. Sculpture, mainly by Rodin (Thinker, Gates of Hell, busts of Balzac and others), the old mansion that houses more, gardens with lots of flowers and vegetation and fountains, and a peaceful feeling. Even the little cafe is nice. You can even see Napoleon's tomb in the distance. Many of the statues are outside in the gardens besides those that are inside.It is a pleasure to be at this museum since it really does have a calming feel to go with it. It's included on the Paris Museum pass too. If you like sculpture then go and enjoy.

So peaceful. This turned out to be our favorite museum. It was well organized and the the grounds were wonderful. It was an amazing experience to stand on the the porch and look over his sculptures.Also the the little cafe had one of the best lunched we had.
Nice Museum and Gardens. Nice collection of Rodin's sculptures such as the Thinker and Gates of Hell in a museum, house, and gardens.

Huge disappointment. There are three reasons to go - the gounds are very nice, the largest size copy of the Thinker is there, the Doors to Hell are there, and one of the full size Burghers of Calais is there. The building (Hotel) is a disaster inside. Wait for it to be renovated! There are a few interesting sculptures inside, but so little of Rodin they had to display his really small collection of art from his contemporaries, which has only a copule of good items. Nice cafeteria, disgusting bathrooms.
Amazing place. It was wonderful to see the sculptures that I have seen in books. The gardens are very interesting, but the cafe was rather dreary

Amazing garden!. It is a very small museum compared to some others in Paris but full of wonderful scuptures by Rodin and some of his students. My favorite part of the museum was definitely the garden. Just beautiful!

Rodin sculptures in the garden as he planned. Spring time in the garden with the great Rodin works spaced around the periphery among the trees and flowers is a very pleasant way to spend a couple of hours. There is a cafe in the garden if you haven't eaten.

Beautiful garden!. We loved the rose garden and sculpture garden - very beautiful and peaceful. It is a very different world in there from the hustle and bustle of Paris streets. We really could have spent the whole afternoon just hanging out there enjoying it if we had had more time.

My favorite place. The gardens in Musee Rodin (actually the Hotel Biron) are exquisite, and one of my favorite places to go. The are doing a renovation right now, but most of the sculptures are still available in a temporary exhibition, and the gardens remain as they always have been. A must see!
Always wonderful to visit!. Took my kids, 11 and 14 for the first time and the museum immediately became a favorite. So many familiar pieces even to younger children

Old house, great garden. I think the best feature of musee Rodin is its garden. The museum is a bit oldie (the building lacks a bit of maintenance), and many many tourists at some moments.
But the garden... just speechless! Grab an ice cream in their cafeteria and get on a chaise longue!

Must see museum. Hand down the most beautiful museum in Paris. Never crowded, always friendly. The rose gardens are unparalleled and when put together with Rodin's masterpieces you have the perfect combination. They have a nice cafe, very clean restrooms and a beautiful gift shop. Only one Euro to tour the gardens!

beautiful garden. The museum itself is not much considering the amount of work it around the Louvre, D'Orzay and Metropolitan (NY), but worth the beautiful garden
O museu em si nem é grande coisa considerando a quantidade de obras dele espalhadas pelo Louvre, D'Orzay e Metropolitan (NY), mas vale pelo belíssimo jardim

Well worth visiting. This museum is set in an old picturesque former hotel. The gardens are quite beautiful and there are many of Rodin's original sculptures in the gardens - including The Thinker. Would recommend a visit as very worthwhile.
Smaller than most. This is smaller Musuem than most but is full of quality. You will not be disapointed easy to visit in just a couple of hours

Beautiful Garden. While staying in Paris we visited this museum and loved the wonderful sculptures especially in the garden. Actually some of his most famous works are in the garden which is also a work of art! The roses were all in bloom along with some beautiful hedges and paths to each sculpture. Even if you are not a big fan of museums you will enjoy the garden which can be purchased separately for about one euro. This garden is a lovely and peaceful spot to enjoy Rodin's work.

Loved this smaller musee in Paris. Our family really enjoyed this smaller musee in Paris. During our visit it was still undergoing renovations, but the gardens were blooming and the sculptures by Rodin were just lovely placed throughout. One of our favorite experiences while we have been here and recommend all visitors make a point to visit this musee as well.

Beautiful sculpture garden!. The sculpture garden at the Rodin Museum are amazing - beautiful roses and other flowers, lovely ponds and green trees. So serene. Plus the sculptures are positioned amongst all of the natural beauty. Inside the museum are more of Rodin's work to admire.

Must See. The museum is pretty small because it's almost exclusively all art by Rodin, with a few paintings by other artists like Van Gogh. The world famous sculptures Rodin created, including The Kiss and The Thinker are here at this museum. Several are inside Rodin's old house. Don't forget to visit the gardens behind the house.

Easy to see, always my first stop.. After checking into my hotel, I always head here first. Why? Great sculpture in a small museum that doesn't wear me out while I'm suffering from jet lag. Not to be missed in my opinion.

Do Not Miss It. The Rodin is one of the most unique museums in Paris and it would be a shame to pass it by. Some of the artist's most important pieces are located outdoors, amid stunning rose gardens and beautifully manicured greenery. In addition to works by Rodin, you will see outstanding pieces from his many apprentices, including his lover Claudette. The building is a work of art in and of itself. Add this one to your "must see" list!
museum in a garden. View the beautiful sculptures by Rodin as you stroll through this lovely garden. The smell of roses is almost overwhelming. Not too crowded.
Beautiful. A must. Go on a nice day and have lunch in the gatdens, that is the icing on the cake. Stunning diosplay and lovely grounds.

Lovely gardens. We went to Musee Rodin on a very clear, sunny and perfect Paris day. The gardens were full of rose blossoms and although for some reason expected the grounds to be bigger then they were I was taken a back by the view of the Thinker. If you step back you can see the Eiffel tower behind it - just lovely.
Lovely Garden. Very unusual sized garden in the center of Paris. Was a former nunery taken over by artists, then by Rodin.

Not for me. What I like about visiting galleries is gaining an insight into a history of a person or people, or learning something more about the destination visited. Musée Rodin just didn't do it for me. It was pleasant. Gardens were lovely - just not my thing.
Arty retreat from the maddening tourist crowd. Beautiful gardens where you can enjoy a picnic and gaze at amazing sculptures. It is really in the outdoors that you see the beauty of the sculptures.

Off the beaten path. Great history behind the Rodin Musee. In fact, before it was a museum, it was the hotel where Rodin stayed when he was an unknown sculptor. It is filled with great sculptures, including "The Kiss," located outside in the garden. This museum is small and packed with lots of interesting stories about his life and loves. The gardens are beautiful and full of his sculptures.

My favourite museum in Paris. Each time I visit Paris I always find time to send a couple of hours at the musee Rodin. Its such a precious little gem in a city overflowing with magnificent jewels. On a sunny day in May i strolled the grounds admiring the sculptures and breathing in the air filled with the perfume of magnificent tree peonies and roses. Children ran freely through the grounds exploring the statues and playing hide and seek.The most exquisite piece of work is 'The Kiss', it sends shivers through my spine each time I see it, for me it is innocence beauty and love. Of course there are many more incredible works including 'The Gates of Hell and probably the best known 'The Thinker'

The Gardens are amazing.. We never made it into the house, but the gardens...oh, la, la, it was amazing. The Thinker meets you first in the rose gardens and it just gets better and better. A must see for art lovers.

Gardens and Sculpture. My last visit to Musee Rodin was in winter which was a totally different experience. Springtime at Musee Rodin is the best. The gardens are filled with beautiful flowers, fountains and perfect lawns. There is always something being renovated here and this time it was the house so you could only go into part of it. The gardens with the sculptures are really why this is special.

Quite a detailed museum to understand the life of Rodin.. I really liked the collection in this museum, which is both numerous and varied. I'd definitely recommend the audio-guide, which, along with explanations on specific pieces, gives an overall picture of the life and times of Rodin. I feel like I've really understood the artist, the angst and the joys of his life : ).

Rodin museum on a glorious spring day in Paris !. Spring weather in Europe this year has been a great disappointmet ,but on this day in early June ,the sun shone !The roses were in bloom and the air was filled with their perfume .We have visited the sculpture gardens and house ,many times .This time ,due to renovations ,many sculptures were in one room and that made it easy to enjoy ..We had a lovely lunch in the open air restaurant .Such an experience !
great garden!. Go for the garden when it is sunny, excellent coffee place and you can also visit it apart from the main museum, for only one euro

Musee Rodin - Amazing Sculpture. The Musee Rodin is a special place...the works of Auguste Rodin and others situated in and around the house and the gardens where he lived are truly amazing. As you stand before The Gates of Hell (inspired by Dante's Inferno) you are in awe of Rodin's ability to create such a work of art. Along with the Gates of Hell, The Trois Ombres, The Thinker, the Creation of Adam and my favorite The Kiss are some of the true treasures in the art world. A unique aspect of the garden area where the Gates of Hell is located is the sound of wind moving through the trees which is a recording made specifcally for the site. And one of the roses in the garden had the most fantastic aroma I ever experienced. The Musee Rodin is one of my favorite museums in Paris.

Disappointing. This museum looks, to begin with, like it's going to be a beautiful marvel, with it's huge wonderful sculptures in the garden. Unfortunately, after the initial 'wow' factor, it all becomes very bland and a bit boring. Parts of the garden need attention. It could have been so much better.
Beautiful. Currently undergoing badly needed renovation, but still stunning. The setting of the statues in the garden is perfect

A peaceful place- lovely!. It was the first place me and my friend went to after the flight from london at 5 in the morning- we arrive there around 1 ish. Straight in with museum pass- bang! lovely place though, was a hotel once but rodin changed it into the museum. The gardens are so peaceful. The sculptures are amazing- just excellent. A place to be when you get a bit sick of the buzzing paris centre ( especially the crazy cars!)
An absolute must!. Not on most tourists map but one of the loveliest and mostintesting museums in Paris in a fab setting

Small but lovely. I choose to buy a 6 day Museum pass and Museum Rodin is included. The museum is small but it is a great opoortuinity to see some very famous pieces. Some of them at the garden in open air.

our Paris trip would not have been complete without a trip to this Mster's lair.. I've always been a fan, but this first visit was mind-blowing. Touching a work of art is as important to me as the visual. Seeing the complexity and details of the Gates of Hell brought me to another dimension. Merci, Monsieur Rodin!

Museum worth visiting. Rodin was a brilliant artist with a vast variety of work. I enjoyed having an outside area for viewing Rodin's bigger pieces such as the Gates of Hell and the Thinker. A manageable museum that only takes a half day. The outside cafe was average. Our lunch was disappointing so you may want to wait for lunch after the museum.

A most relaxing small piece of classic Paris. Musée Rodin has the essence of classic Paris rolled up in a manageable & inspiring setting. Art, architecture, gardens, and even a small, unpretentious food spot with good food - hidden away on the side garden. Strolling, relaxing & absorbing some of the best of it's ti,r - it's easy to see how Rodin could thrive in such an atmosphere.

Learn where The Thinker came from. After you've seen the Louvre & the Eiffel Tower, I recommend visiting Museé Rodin, a wonderful collection of Rodin's sculptures in a cool mansion and gardens. If you aren't an art history buff, you have definitely seen The Thinker or The Kiss. This is your chance to see the original and many more of Rodin's beautiful creations. Not your normal museum… a treat for anyone, children included.

lovely museum. I LOVED this museum. the outdoor display of all the scultpures was very well done. The cafe has a variety of sandwiches and drinks to chose from. I loved this musuem and the ambience and would go visit again and again

Heavenly. Great art. The museum itself is a work of art with ornate moldings and the like. There is a breathtaking garden with a place to have lunch and delicious pastries . One of my favorite places in Paris.

A lot of Rodin's in a beautiful setting. In April 2013 they were doing renovations to the museum and it was not completely open. However, what you can see is very nice. This museum was an estate at one time. The gardens have many Rodin statues. It's a lovely place to visit. As long as the line doesn't extend beyond the corner of the block that it is one, it is worth it to wait to get it.

A must for anyone who likes the sculpture art form. Rodin was not modest. He planned this museum himself! His most famous sculptures are in a bright rose garden. Take time to go inside and see the other sculptures and a particularly good Van Gogh.

Nice gardens, good exhibition of sculptures. The gardens are simple but a very nice way to show some of Rodins works. The exhibitions in the inside are very complete adnd interesting. Do take your time and enjoy a nice walk of all the garden.
Masterpieces .... Place to enjoy the incredible artwork of a master of his time. You are able to discover some secrets and the tour takes less than 3 hours.

Lovely place to visit. I visited this Museum already as I was young student. It was really "must" during those days. And it is still "must" with my family. Lovely statues and lovely garden. Don't forget also to visit in the old Mainbuilding, especially on the second floor...

Beautiful gardens!. I visited the Rodin Museum on a beautiful day and decided to spend some time in the gardens instead of going inside the museum. I paid €1 and enjoyed walking around the beautiful estate and admiring the impressive hôtel particulier. There were beautiful views of the dome of the Invalides and the Eiffel Tower. Unfortunately there were more tourists there than I had anticipated, which did slightly ruin the experience. I would highly recommend!

Rodin!. For those who don't know, Rodin was one France greatest and most innovative sculptors. The museum is a bit small so it doesn't do full justice to his works.However the garden at the back offers several more pieces and is very pleasant to visit.

Not A Fan Of Sculpture, But This Is Worth Seeing. The collection of Rodin's sculpture is set in both a gallery and a very beautiful, peaceful garden. The Musée was opened in 1919, dedicated to the works of the French sculptor Auguste Rodin. The Musée contains some of Rodin's significant creations, including The Thinker, The Kiss, The Three Shadows, and The Gates of Hell. The gardens around the museum building contain many of the famous sculptures in natural settings. Behind the museum building is a small lake and casual restaurant.This museum should be a must see for the particular sculptures that are displayed as well as the gardens.
Beautiful gardens.. Loved walking the beautiful gardens where Rodin's most famous sculptures can be found, including the Gates of Hell and The Thinker.

Beautiful museum. Loved this little spot. Bought the ticket for the garden and the house, but if I went back, I would just by the ticket for the garden. It's way cheaper (only 1 euro!) and the house is nice, but nothing amazing. The really amazing art is in the garden. Plus, you can have tea (or wine) in the little cafe - a great pitstop for a busy day.

Came for the Museum, Stayed for the Gardens. The line was too long, and price of the museum was too much. We paid a lower price, and stuck to just the gardens, where Rodin's most famous sculpture "The Thinker" is located. It was a beautiful day, so we didn't mind staying outside. It was a good way to spend 45 minutes or so.

This is a must!. The collection of scupture is breathtaking and set in both a gallery and very beautiful, peaceful gardens. It's a quiet retreat from the bustling city. Rodin's greates pieces: The Thinker, Gates of Hell, and Three shadows are displayed to great effect in the gardens.

wonderful if you love Rodin!. if you love Rodin's work, this will be heaven for you. if you don't, it's still a lovely place and you can sit and relax in the garden whilst your art-loving friend wonders at the sculptures! worth a visit.
Wonderful gardens and exhibition. Remains wonderful especially in the gardens but house needs lots of work. Remember it is shut on a Monday!

So much to see!. We went quite early in the day and the queue was at a minimum, 5 minutes perhaps?Then there is such a lot to see in the house and gardens, we were there all morning and stayed for lunch in the café situated in the gardens.The gardens are beautifully maintained and it does not look odd to have Rodin's sculptures dotted around. There was a "soundtrack" around one area of the garden that can only be described as weird - I suppose it was there to invoke a particular mood and I'm sure it would work with some people but I found it a little off putting at times.Apart from that I enjoyed the visit and it was worth the effort and the expenditure, I would recommend it.
