Amazing Statues. Had such a great time strolling around Rodin garden and don't miss on the ''The thinker'' statue one of Rodin famous statues.. great one for pics to remember.. also there is a nice cafe where you can enjoy your drink and the lovely garden.. also.. go see the famous kiss statue of rodin.

beautiful museum. This was the one attraction that my traveling companion said we had to visit while in Paris. I would recommend visiting on a nice day because wandering the gardens are a major part of the experience. I loved seeing all of the sculptures in the gardens - it was so enjoyable wandering around. Inside the house was a totally different experience - the sculptures are displayed so differently between the inside and the outside - it is fun to see the groupings. I didn't realize this - but you can get a combo ticket with the D'Orsay - it saves a few euros. We didn't have a line when visiting and it was a lot less crowded than other tourist attractions - also a benefit.

Surrounded by Rodin. I loved this Museum. It is quite small and intimate and you get very close to the sculpture. You are able to take photos freely without and hassle that gets a big thumbs up from me.

Something to see!. Although the actual museum is and should be under renovation it is a must see and is right down the street from the Military Museum. This museum should be a must see for the particular sculptures that are displayed as well as the gardens.
Peaceful Garden and amazing bronzes. Liked the fact it was not too big so you don't get overwhelmed and museum fatigue halfway through. The garden is lovey if you get it on a nice day.
A real Jewel of Paris!. A favorite! Well situated near Napoleon's Tomb. The best gardens & Alexander III bridge. Lovely neighborhood, wonderful value and artwork extraordinaire!

A peaceful and relaxing museum. This is a small museum set in a beautiful garden, the roses in full blossom today when we visited. It's one where you can take your time, enjoying Roden's prodigious body of work, as well as his personal art collection. There is a wonderful cafe - you can eat at tables in the garden - or simply relax and enjoy the plantings and sculpture.It's a short walk from the Eiffel Tower, so consider doing these together. Les Invalides is just opposite and its golden dome, along with the Eiffel Tower, are visible from the museum garden. A tranquil spot and great refuge from the city noise.

Intense and moving collection. Of all the museums that I went to in Paris, this was by far my very favorite. I loved walking around the gardens and admiring the sculptures up close. The audio guide provides extensive commentary on several of the pieces. I spent a whole day the museum so I had a chance to eat at the delightful cafe in the gardens.

Worth a stop. We visited the gardens after checking out the Invalides. The two museums are very close by each other, if you have the museum pass, I would recommend combining these two on your itinerary. We enjoyed strolling through the gardens which are not overwhelmingly big but very pleasant. Even if you are not very familiar with all of Rodin's work it is worth a visit.

What a Beautiful Place!. The Rodin Museum is in Rodin's beautiful home and gardens. The sculptures are spectacular and are displayed both in the lovely gardens as well as the house. This was one of the more relaxing museums to visit - well worthwhile.

Quiet gem. What a lovely museum where you can focus on one artist and enjoy the delightful garden setting. Unlike the major museums, this one was relatively uncrowded and it was possible to get very close to the art. Inside the museum you can see how Rodin matured, and also see some of the art that he collected. Outside in the garden, which costs only one euro to visit, you can contemplate his massive masterpieces in a tranquil setting. There is a small cafe that makes a nice spot for lunch or coffee.
A must see!. The day we visited it was very hot inside the museum, but the grounds are lovely to stroll. So many of Rodin's finest works are here
Fantastic. displayed superbly inside with English explanations. The gardens are beautiful to wander around with music played from speakers in the bushes to create an ambience. Highly recommended.

A must visit. This is a smaller museum, but a must see. I loved the outdoor area with he manicured grounds that incorporated the art. The area inside had many nice pieces as well. They need to do a better job of the upkeep of the building though, peeling paint and several maintaince isseus throughout the building. Spruce it up a bit and it would make a difference in the overall presentation.

Small museum with great exibits. The best thing about this museum is the garden, which is beautiful in itself with the bonus of Rodin's bronze sculptues in any corner. The museum cafe was a nice surprise - great food and very reasonably priced.
Rodin and Camille Claudel. Start off in the gardens (if the weather is nice) then head inside to the statues. Give yourself 3 hours. His collection of Camille Claudel's is pretty impressive
Sculptures. Very nice, but small place which only took us half an hour to go round. They also had a small garden with more in but we did not go into it as there was some work being done.

Only if you want to see Rodin's The Thinker. My uncles favorite museum so we had to go. It was much smaller than expected. Enjoyable. We mainly were there to see "The Thinker". It's outside. It was raining so we had a quick moment under an umbrella for a photo. The gardens would have been nice if a better day.

Great sculptor Rodin. Nice, not too big museum and beautiful garden. The ticket is covered with a museum pass and there is no waiting at the entrance.
There you can see the real masterpieces of this amazing sculptor, but is not crowded as, for example, in the Louvre or Versailles.
I truly enjoyed and recommend.

Lovely garden. The Musee Rodin comprises a very big garden with a lot of the master's sculptures, a place for temporary exhibitions and the permanent collection housed in a mansion, the former Hôtel Biron. It is a place to visit with time, to walk around the garden and appreciate the fabulous statues and sculptures, including a version of Le Penseur and of La porte de L'enfer in bronze. Inside, do not miss the Balzac head and the beautiful Fugit Amor, as well as some works by Camille Claudel.

3rd visit and will go again. Anyone with an appreciation of sculpture will love this museum. Some truly wonderful Rodin sculptures inside the museum. Also take time to stroll around the beautiful grounds, also containing some memorable sculptures .Lovers of sculpture will return again and again if able
Rodin. Lovely setting with indoor and outdoor exhibits. Lovely, quiet, outdoor exhibits with The Thinker, and Gates of Hell. Some renovation ongoing indoors.

Wedding at the Museum - Some good, some bad. We booked the museum on a Sunday evening for our wedding. We were mostly happy with the grounds except for a large, modern looking stage 'thing' set up in front of the hotel that required us to change where the seats were for the wedding to avoid it being in all the pictures. When you book a place like this you don't want a random stage set up in the garden. We also had some issues with the staff, they refused to let the bride inside, causing all of the guests to see her before the big reveal, I finally had to just shove past the guards with her to get her inside so she could use the restroom. The rest of the grounds were beautiful, but when you pay $4000+ to stand in a garden, you don't want rude staff members making you wait outside after the time you were told to arrive and you don't want a garish modern outbuilding constructed in a 19th century hotel and garden.

impressive. For the 7th time I visited this museum in a very old mansion in the heart of Paris. The first time I went as a 15 year old and was impressed by art for the very first time. This time I went with my 22 year old daughter and she was very much impressed as well. What beauty has this man created!. We were planning to go to the Musee d'Orsay first, but went to Rodin because of the long waiting time to get in. In the Rodin Museum we were able to buy a combination ticket for both musea! No more waiting at the d'Orsay. But a shame and a joy that there are no waiting time for this Rodin palace.

Small museum. This museum was one of my favourites because of how small it was. Few people know about it or look for it, so it's not crowded and it's not overwhelming. It tells you about Rodin as well as showcases all his work. Would definitely recommend

Love the garden. I only had time to visit the garden and it was beautiful. A peaceful oasis in the middle of Paris. Made me feel like i was in the countryside. The best part is the garden admission is free.

Great little museum!. I personally loved the Musee Rodin. I came here after a long day at the Musee d'Orsay and Musee de 'Armee. Musee Rodin was by far my favorite. The style is fantastic and I although I am not a huge art geek, I prefer sculpture to paintings. The featured exhibit was The Flesh, The Marble and I was very impressed. Although it is a small museum and exhibit, you really get to appreciate the artwork more because you are not overwhelmed. 'The Kiss' was there and it was definitely my favorite. I kept coming back to it. The gardens were beautiful and the only downside was that they were setting up the grounds for an event and you couldn't get a night picture of the back of the museum. If you are in Paris for a short amount of time, I suggest visiting Musee Rodin on a sunny day. And if you are in Paris for a longer period of time, then there's no reason why you should miss it!

Greatest since Michelangelo?. Sir Kenneth Clark, the brilliant British art historian, said Rodin was the greatest sculptor since Michelangelo. This can be substantiated with a visit to the Rodin Museum. "The Burghers of Calais" and "Balzac" will always be venerated - probably even more so than "The Thinker" and "The Kiss" which are also on display.

Relaxing and peaceful place to visit.. Rodin is boring and ubiquitous. But the setting of this museum makes up for all that. The grounds are beautiful and relaxing, and you get just enough of a sampling of his work to make it palatable.

Not impressed. I saw Rodin sculptures in other opportunities, so I was not impressed with the Musee Rodin. The house is nice, has some interesting things to see but if you have a short time in Paris for sure there is things much more good to see and do. The gardens are nice too, but it was not for sure one of the best exhibits in my visit to Paris. It is a "being there, done that" kind of thing for me.
nice sculptures. its nice but i wouldn't go again unless you are really into sculptures ......... and have to be sunny so you can enjoy the garden too

Beautiful, peaceful garden and museum.. Rodin's house and garden's are beautiful and peaceful One of the Gates of Hell is on display in the garden as well as the Thinker. Inside, is the famous Kiss as well as other renowned pieces.
Quiet and relaxing. Small, and do-able in less than 1.5hrs. Tranquil gardens with loungers to nap in the sun or shade. Garden sculptures more enjoyable than the inside museum.

Not quite as I remembered. First visited 24 years ago, and thought it charming and atmospheric. Was horrified this time by the cold clinical exhibit as you entered, but the house itself is still lovely, if not as informal. The garden seemed too tidy, and the humming trees are a dreadful innovation - who thinks of these things?

Lovely.. Sculptures look lovely set in the beautiful gardens, though I found the " soothing sounds" playing in the hedges by " The Thinker" a wee bit irritating. I think this may only be a temporary thing, rather than a permanent feature. Coffee shop is fine, and not too expensive.

Gorgeous Garden. If you have any interest in Rodin or sculpture in general, of course come here. But if you are into gardening or landscape at all you definitely must come. I was blown away by how beautiful the outside of Rodin's house and the grounds were. It would be a lovely place for a wedding although I have no idea if they allow that. If I lived at a place like that I would never leave, and apparently he didn't since he's buried on the grounds. This has to be one of the prettiest places in Paris. Both the museum and gardens were covered with our Museum Pass.

Nice Small Museum. I enjoy visiting the Musee Rodin. It is very peaceful and has an excellent little restaurant. This year, however there is some reconstruction being done which takes a little away from the experience.
Rodin musee well worth the time. Gardens were well worth a several hour visit. Such an amazing collection. Metro stops nearby and also on the HOHO bus line

Spectacular marble. I can't sculpt but have great admiration for those that can -- Rodin can! Most of the impressive stuff is in the main part, there's a few items outside and models in a second building.I wish they allowed pictures....<sigh>

Please visit. I missed this on my first visit. I am glad I made it this trip. A beautiful place to spend a couple of hours in Paris. You will not be disappointed. The art, the gardens may be the most well presented in all of Paris. Be sure to listen to the sounds while near the thinker. Figure it out - now that's an unexpected treat.

If you have time. Its laid out in a very quiet park and it felt like a sanctuary from the chaos of Paris. It doesn't take too long to walk around it so if you feel like you need a little quiet for abit and your in the area it will refresh you and you get to see some of the worlds most priceless art.
Lovely. Well worth the time..his works are fabulous, but the gardens on a beautiful day were peaceful and filled with his art..cafe allows for a nice break as well.
Boring displays. The garden is attractive, but has relatively few sculptures. Most are in the rather faded museum and displayed without much thought.

Rodin Garden and Cafe. Of all the green spaces in Paris, the Rodin garden is the most lovely and peaceful. And there is a cafe for added pleasure. Only one euro to enter and worth every cent and then some. Do not miss this glorious paradise.

Worth seeing the Rodin. Unreal to see "the Thinker" just sitting out in the garden---it is on the Museum Pass-- a must if you want to visit museums in Paris or you will be waiting in line forever-don't waste you precious time. Great museum. Also on the hop on hop off bus route. It is much better to get around on hop on hop off bus then the subway--great to enjoy the view from the bus of Paris and less tiring then the subway with all its stairs.
Very lovely setting for the sculptures. Peaceful lovely setting for rodin's works. Worth the visit for a nice walk around the gardens. Next to Les INvalides

Well worth seeing. This is a small museum, easy to see compared to the better known options in Paris, but with a great collection of art. We were able to see all in about two hours. We particularly loved the grounds and the somewhat eerie music that added to the experience.
Excellent Museum. I loved going to this Musee. It is a wonderful museum to spend 45 minutes walking around the gardens and buildings viewing the "Thinker" and other works of art.

A great experience. We only visited the gardens but they're wonderful. Plenty of Rodin's works are on display around corners, under trees, behind hedges; many lovely, peaceful places just to sit and relax or to sketch and photograph. Brought a picnic lunch and could have stayed the whole day.

A hidden gem. A museum featuring a vast amount of Rodin's work - beautifully displayed in both the grand old house he had once lived in and also in the immaculate gardens. I enjoyed the gardens most with some of his best known pieces, The Thinker, the Burghers of Calais and the incredible Gates of Hell. It is peaceful, beautiful and tucked away in the heart of the city.

Great!. We went on a Sunday afternoon - walked around the gardens for a couple hours and took some great photos. It was fully free admission, but I would have glady paid the ?1 (!!) to get into the gardens any other time. Worth the afternoon for sure.

One of my favorite museums in Paris. I prefer museums that are dedicated to one artist than huge museums like the Louvre. Unlike most museums, don't leave this for a rainy day: there are beautiful gardens with many sculptures.

Musee Rodin Sculpture Garden. We didn't have the time/patience for the entire Musee Rodin, but the sculpture garden was perfect (and the low low price just as good). You can browse the whole garden in about an hour, so it really is a lovely quick sight.

One of the more beautiful places in Paris. The place is awesome. The gardens are beatiful and one of the best places in paris to take nice pictures in my opinion (imagine a beautiful garden full of jaw dropping sculptures of Rodin). Go there and check out. The sculptures are impressive. Dont miss it.

A hidden gem!. I have visited this walled old hotel for many decades to enjoy its gardens and see the rotating collection of Rhodin's inside and outside the old hotel.Since my last visit 7 years ago, they have embarked on a major renovation of the buildings. The new (at least for me) side-by-side presentation of Rhodin's early studies and the finished work were superb.

Don't miss it!. This is the one I keep returning to.
The gardens always bring me peace and a sense of something wonderful that's difficult to put into words. You have to feel it.
I love it in the winter, when the crowds are less, the sun is shining, a bench is waiting.
For me, this is luxury.

Magnificence of Rodin in one small museum. I have always wanted to visit the Rodin Museum and this was the first museum my wife and I visited during our long week end in Paris.The museum Rodin is not the place where Rodin actually lived and worked. It is the place which was built so that all his sculptures could be shown for the world to see. Rodin himself agreed to leave all his pieces for free in exchange of a museum being built for him.Most of the pieces are sculptures which is what Rodin is known for. However, you will find a lot of paintings, drawings and other pieces from the master. In the middle of Hotel Biron, a room is dedicated to Camille Claudel who is one of Rodin student (also love interest)… A must see absolutely fantastic!We could not have access at the garden as it is used for concert and other exhibition so we only had access to the museum itself.If you like Rodin, if you like sculpture then Musee Rodin is a must see. Be warned, so many magnificent pieces that you will be blown away by the artistry of a French master.

Wonderful sculpture museum and gardens. If you have only seen The Thinker, The Kiss and The Burghers of Calais in books, visit this museum and its gardens. The history of Rodin's struggle to establish the museum is amazing in and of itself. Plus you get to see how he studied and modeled his subjects before undertaking the final sculpture. The rose and other gardens are lovely. Rodin produced an amazing amount of work -- take your time and enjoy.

Gaardens at ?1 a good option. Opted just for the ?1 Gardens only entry and were not disappointed. Great photo opportunities inside and out! The gardens are great, with many of the famous works on display such as 'The Thinker' and 'The Meditation'. If you are short on time the gardens represent a good option at low cost.

If you like Rodin . . .. . . . this little museum with a sculpture park is right up your alley. They have a refreshment stand/snack bar. But don't try to get a glass of wine even though it's on the menu. If you're not a Rodin lover, there's no good reason to go there.

One of the best romantic strolling opportunity in Paris. There are the Rodin works but the best piece is to stroll in the garden which are so romantic when the weather is sunny in Paris. Woody Allen filmed there in his movie "Midnight in Paris". A must go for a couple of hours if you like the arts and if you want to escape the rush of the city.

Beautiful... Definitely recommend checking this out. This museum was not originally on my hit list, but we had time for it and so got to visit. I am so glad we did, as so far, it has been my favorite museum...Held in the grounds where Rodin lived and worked (an old hotel they are currently restoring/renovating), it was absolutely beautiful both because of the artwork and impeccable gardens. I found the information (all presented very nicely in English as well as French) very interesting and I look forward to learning more about Rodin in the future. If I were Parisian, this would be the museum I attended frequently... To just enjoy the grounds and perhaps get a snack at the lovely cafe.
Beautiful, magical. What a lovely surprise to step through the doorway on a side street into this magical park with fountains, beautiful trees and shrubs and of course, the sculpture.

Great outdoor sculpture. The interior of the buildings at the Musee Rodin and the exhibitions therein are interesting but not exciting. The walk about the grounds and garden filled with Rodin sculpture is well worth the visit.

My favorite museum in Paris. Even though they are working on part of the big house (which means certain pieces are not available for viewing - including my favorite "the kiss") this place is still the best.It is perfect because there are masterpieces in the garden (Thinker, Gates of Hell, and more), and the house. Because of the renovations, there was an extra exhibit set up which showed a lot of model pieces and you could see the evolution of the sculpture.Love this place.

Visit the gardens!. The Rodin Museum has a lovely collection of Rodin sculptures in a beautiful mansion. Don't miss visiting the gardens! There are several great sculptures sited in the gardens. The singing trees are an etherial experience.

Gardens are Fantastic. I preferred the gardens over the actual museum...although it was a nice surprise to see a few Van Goghs. Definitely try to go on a sunny day...it was raining for us and the gardens were a bit muddy.
Rodin's Home and Gardens. Gives you great insite into the Artists live, Works and wealth. Bring a picnic lunch and enjoy the Gardens.

GOOD VALUE TO VISIT THE GARDENS. Only one euro to visit the gardens. Good value as one can see many of the sculptors major works in bronze. Probably not worth paying the higher price to enter the building to see the macquettes.

See the works of a Master. Even those who know nothing of Rodin will be moved by his stunning sculptures. Both inside and in the garden, the famous sculptures will dazzle you - the thinker, the burghers of Calais, the gates of hell, Balzac, the Shades. For anyone remotely interested in sculpture this is a must.
Great Afternoon. This is a wonderful afternoon both inside the museum and outside strolling through the garden. If you are going in the summer or early fall, the rose garden is really nice.

Beautiful setting. This is set in an old palace that was so rundown in the 19th C that artists were using it as workrooms. Eventually Rodin bought it and fixed it up and it's interesting to see it as a HOUSE, as well as a museum. They have a lot of models made by Rodin and his colleagues, and outside are the bronze casts.
One you should not miss. Paris is big, lots and lots to see and enjoy. Don't try to do all in one trip...unless your writing a tour book! But Rodin you must see.
Don't go to hell. One needs to understand how this wonderful museum came to be to fully appreciate what Rodin has achieved The gates of hell alone are worth the entrance fee.

An Excellent Collection. I've been to the Philadelphia Rodin Museum many a time, and this "mother" museum did not disappoint. The building and grounds are wonderful, and the pieces are a vast display of his mind and talent.
Loved the Gardens. Lovely morning to walk around the gardens and admire all of the Rodin sculpture. We did not go into the museum itself. Great value for 1 Euro!

Tiny Treasure. We loved the Musee Rodin in spite of visiting on a rainy cold day. The gardens are beautiful and the fantastic Rodin sculptures are exquisite. We luckily arrived when there was no line but there can be crowds there (even on a rainy day). The admission is on 1 euro each so why not have a visit? Not very many places to eat extremely nearby, but a nice neighborhood to walk around and super convenient to the Varenne Metro. We did this as a "day ender" and it was one of our favority Paris experiences.

The Rodin museum. Just come back from paris and cycling in Province and Italy. What a great way to spend a holiday. Cycling until approx. 3.00 and then sight seeing. Paris was superb. Ambled in the streets, went to many art galleries and Montmarte, saw the Rodin exhibition and van Gogh paintings - too beautiful.Then cycled for 2 weeks. First in Province from Avignon, beautiful countryside and quaint old villages. Off to Italy and cycled from Venice to Florence. Through countryside and the Po delta. Venice and Florence too much to see, but saw all we could in the time. Never stopped for a minute. Highly recommended holiday.

Shabby Chic museum with amazing content and gardens. This is a great place to visit when in Paris. Rodin was the David Bailey of his era, sculpting rather than photographing the most beautiful girls and important people of the day.On a clear day it is lovely to wander around the gardens at your leisure contemplating the sculptures and history of the place and Rodin. It's not so great if raining.Make sure you see the Gates of Hell, which is in the Garden.
Interesting and enjoyable. It was sunny when I visited which was a pleasant change. Loved the 3 sections of Musee Rodin but some of the gardens were closed. Really interesting and well worth a visit.
Beautiful statues. Beautiful exhibition of marble statues, and nice garden with bronze statues. Museumshop has nice products.

It's all about the garden. We had just visited the recently renovated Rodin Museum in Philadelphia and I must confess that the Philadelphia museum is more comprehensive of his masterpieces and certainly better presented. Having said that, however, this museum is still a must see. This special exhibit of his works in marble was enough to satisfy. And the story of his time in the house gives a special context to his life (and success!) But the real surprise was the outstanding sculpture garden. We did not expect this oasis and deeply regretted not bringing our lunches to picnic, particularly since we had just wasted a bunch of time and euros at an overpriced bistro en route from the d’ Orsay to the Rodin museum. I highly recommend that you use part of this visit for peaceful repose and relaxation and a wonderful setting.
One of the best attractions in Paris. An entire museum filled with Rodin sculptures. Enough said.(And it wasn't overflowing with tourists, either!)

Beautiful garden!. I found the gardens to be so peaceful and relaxing. The Rodin sculptures were amazing - when you visit the Thinker, take a picture in front of the bronze statue and put your fist under your chin like the Thinker. Makes for a cute photo!
Lovely gardens.. The museum and the sculptures are excellent. The gardens are equally worth the admission fee. Especially on a nice day. The absolute epitome of serenity!

Oh wow!. Missed this on our first visit to Paris. Saw it today on what suspect passes for a beautiful day in early Spring day.....sunny, 60s, no wind. The park with the sculptures is just starting to show colors with spring flowers. Fantastic to see the masterpieces. Gates of Hell with the weird music was really something! Add it to your bucket list....and you can go to Napoleon's tomb and the military museum next door. Both are on the Paris Museaum Pass.

Museum In And Out. Ever been to a museum where there are both exterior and interior exhibits? No? Then the Musee Rodin is for you! You can enjoy various sculptures and statues made by Rodin himself, paraded throughout the museum. Although, I would say, the ones outside (The Thinker, The Gates of Hell, etc) are much more interesting than the ones inside. But to each his own.The interior museum could be a little crowded if it's a rainy day, or when there are tourists, so just skip it and take a tour outside, you can always come back and visit it after a tour of the gardens.

Good but small collection. It's a nice place to go; of course you'll see some great sculptures from this great artist, and the famous "thinker" (actualy is one of the 9 copies spread around the world), and it's all exposed in an open air garden, so it's a nice place to walk... but the collection itself is small; I wouldn't spend more then one hour there...go if you have the time!
Rodin Museum. The best in Paris, small and intiment, you can get right up up to the bronzes. Don't miss it, it has beautiful gardens and interior.

Our favorite museum!. Just GORGEOUS! Surrounded by beauty, everywhere you turn. Must see! Touring the gardens was my favorite part. Seeing The Thinker and The Gates of Hell, in person, just amazing. The walk to and from the Musee Rodin also is awesome. Pass right by Napoleon's tomb.
Great. Definitely worth a visit to see the Thinker and the Gateway to Hell! Sculptures EVERYWHERE on his property.

Quiet, contemplative and great sculpture. A beautiful experience in the gardens and house ( old hotel). It is worth finding out why this site holds Rodin's sculptures ( too much to write here). Sculptures and gardens are wonderful and the cafe offers good value for lunch. The gardens very close to Napoleon's tomb and the Military Museum (exceptional) so you can go to the one area and do 3 good excursions.

Makes you wonder!. Lovely small garden. It was great to see some of the greats, Kiss, Thinker, Gates of Hell, and many more. I've seen a lot of Rodin, here you will see a lot of studies and marble. I know where the bronzes are for a lot of the studies but lots I did not would have liked to know. If you are new to Rodin this is good stop. Not a large group of visitors so you can take this one later in the day. Skip the Cafe.

The real thing. Well - you hear about The Thinker and The Gates of Hell, and you see photos of them and then you get to SEE them. And you can't find the words to adequately describe how you feel when you are standing in front of them in the amazing city of Paris. Go to this museum. It is a treasure. Go outside and see the many works of art set in a garden. (they have umbrellas)

sculpture, Palace and Garden. The Rodin Museum is a must see. A real delight because you see a major body of work plus the Biron Hotel, where he lived. The huge garden is the setting for some of the work and an outdoor cafe. Some work being done but not a problem. Museum pass valid. Just east of Napoleon's tomb.
Intimate. Lovely gardens and beautiful setting, uncrowded and peaceful. Managed to get in the tour of the house quickly before closing, would have liked to have spent more time there.

Skip if it is raining. I really enjoyed this museum. A good majority of it is outside in the garden, and as such there is not a lot of option if it is really rainy. When it did rain, everyone headed inside the small buildings, which were way too small for the amount of people there. Still outside is a best viewing place for the pieces. In the garden, being summer, there was quite a number of clouds of small insects to negotiate, but it wasn't truly problematic. It was somewhere between fun and irritating to watch the visitors set-up near the bronzes in the same poses as the figures.Between the gardens and the buildings, there is plenty to see and yet I never found it to be too much Rodin.
Go if you have time. If you live in a big city or travel a lot you have seen many Rodin's. So, if you have time, see this pleasant museum. If you are short of time, skip it.

Beautiful sculptures inside and out. We were on the L'Open hop on hop off bus and walked to the museum at their closest stop. We used our Paris Museum pass to enter. There is an exhibition of plaster models in the entrance area. Head outside to see "The Thinker" and other familiar pieces. The gardens are beautiful and many of Rodin's works are along the pathways. There is a small paper guide at the entrance - pick one up since there isn't much information at each sculpture. We enjoyed the feeling of how it must have been to live in Paris so many years ago

Beautiful way to spend a Sunday. Gardens are wonderful with lots of scuptures, and beautiful spots to sit and relax. Museum is small but has some beautiful pieces. Upstairs display is only available by stairs.

not to be missed.. The gardens alone are worth it. Take a book and relax at the norm. Stroll and fund the hidden sculptures. See how the Thinker relates to the Gates of Hell. There is a lot here to see if you take your time.

Well worth the visit. We would not have even thought of going unless we had the museum pass. But after visiting realized this was one of my favorites. It was so much more that I expected, especially the garden and vies of the Effiel tower in some places made some great photo ops.

Maybe a little pedestrian?. Unless you're really into Rodin, this could be one to miss. The only thing that really transported me was the gates of hell, and you can see some of that stuff in the Musee d'Orsay. The building itself is lovely, and it does have a nice garden.

Most beautiful park. A wonderful park filled with fine sculptures. Also 2 exhibitions, especially the one near the entrance added a lot to understand Rodin's work. The main house exhibition were less impressive.

Worth the trip.. We went to the Musee Rodin after visiting the Eiffel tower. The walk was about 15 minutes. The gardens are beautiful. The two buildings which house many of Rodin's work are easy to navigate and well lit. It was not crowded when we were there- perhaps it's a bit off the path for the tour buses.

Amazing collection. An amazing place to visit. Come early or with a Paris pass to avoid the queues as gets busy. The major works are spread around the estate and make for a wonderful visit. Io would have liked more background about the pieces but it was great to see so many major pieces in one place.
Amazing setting for amazing sculptures.. The sculptures are amazing and they are set in the most beautiful setting! The gardens and the mansion is stunning! Font miss this museum.

Wonderful. One of my favorite museums in Paris, I took my 5 year old here, and she loved it! I had made a scavenger hunt with pictures from the Internet, and she couldn't wait to locate "the thinker." such a memorable spot. The gardens are lovely and peaceful, and it is easy to see the entire museum in an hour or two, unlike the Louvre!
Allows a flexible visit. You can visit just the gardens (1Eu) with some of Rodin's famous statues scattered throughout or go for the whole tour of the museum itself.

Gardens alone are worth a visit. Amazing sculptures inside and out. Brilliant gardens to just wander around and think...Bit surreal to see some of the pieces that you "know" so well and then all of a sudden you're touching distance from them.

Lovely peaceful. It took us a little bit to locate the museum, we were walking. The gardens and walks were fabulous and dotted with sculptures. The museum was being remodeled in areas, there were stairs to a second floor. I don't remember seeing an elevator. We needed to leave our back pack (checked) in the lobby. We used a self guided tour audio, that wasn't working very wellbut we toured at a leisurely pace , enjoying all the sculptures.
Rodin and his garden. Want to feel like a sculptor?There you have to go!Rodin, is a master . . And there you can enjoy many of his!

Lovely Museum. I really like this museum, though it is on a much smaller scale compared to Lourve. The gardens & sculptures were lovely & I enjoyed strolling throught the place, taking a breather & enjoyiny myself.There wasn't any huge jostling crowd which added to the serenity of the place. After visitng the museum, it was a treat buying some icecream & sitting down in the garden enjoying my dessert.

A lovely tranquil museum/gardens in central Paris. A friend recommended this museum to us and we are really glad we visited. It was so nice to visit an outdoor museum on a sunny spring day in Paris. The gardens were really nice, well worth the visit. The museum cafe also had a delicious vegetable soup and a lovely outdoor setting.

Off the beaten path but worth the trip. A bit more off the beaten path but well worth the trip but you got to love Rodin for it to be worth the trip for you. I personally thought it was extraordinary and the sculpture garden is quite and tranquil and makes you forget what century you are really living in.

Relaxing museum. This museum had a beautiful setting, you wouldn't even know that the city of Paris surrounded it. There is an indoor museum and the outdoor sculptures are amazing. It has beautiful gardens, fountain, outdoor cafe and even outdoor lounge chairs! We walked from the Eiffel Tower to the museum.
Beautiful mansion and gardens. Filled with sculpture. The most famous pieces are The Kiss and The Hand of God. A lovely way to spent an afternoon.
Nice but small Camille Claudel collection. The best modern art museum concept I've seen so far in Paris. However the Camille Claudel collection is not as big as I expected. The gardens are amazing.

An insight into who Rodin was. I really enjoyed this visit, especially using the audio system made the whole experience come alive. The gardens were beautiful and even the cafe was a nice place to have a coffee. Enjoyed it very much.
A gem. The Rodin is one of the best little museums in Paris. It is a beautiful setting with an amazing collection of Rodin's sculptures. Highly recommend.

Beautiful gardens and statues. Wonderful quick museum stop. Nice walk through the gardens. See the Thinker and more. We went on a nice sunny day and it was a great place to take pictures and just relax. Away from crowds which was a plus.

Great gardens. The garden at Musee Rodin is a terrific place to relax and enjoy both Rodin's sculptures and the beautiful grounds, especially on a sunny day. And at a cost of just one Euro, it's one of the best bargains in all of Paris.

One of my favourite Paris museums. One of my two favourite museums in Paris, it is also good for lunch. The sculptures are well positioned in the house as well as in the lovely gardens. When I visited this year on our way out we came upon what I hope is a permanent exhibit of sculpture showing the process, with works at different stages. Unfortunately we arrived just about 30 minutes before closing - we could have easily passed another hour. The space is magical -rows of white sculptures in a greyish/blue room. Everyone wandering around seemed to be similarly enchanted.

Great value for money. The museum offers quite a lot for just 9 euros. The current exposition of marbles is very nice although the room can be crowded and no pictures are allowed. The garden is like other reviewers mentioned: wonderful serene place with lots of the well known statues. The main house is 'authentic' in both senses of the word: on the one hand it is very refreshing not to be in a tight design place, on the other it really needs restauration (which will take place between now and 2014).
little haven`. Alittle haven for gardeners and art lovers alike, serene place and the original house is old and a perfect backdrop for the artwork, well worth searching out

A Must See. This museum offers a terrific look into Rodin's work in marble and bronze. The Exhibit is well laid out and the outdoor gardens are a pleasure. The staff is abrupt but there is little need to rely on them.

One of our favorites. We have been there a few times over the years and enjoyed it each time. Rodin lived there and it has a feel about it. The Burghers of Calais is very powerful still. Undergoing renovations at the moment but still worth a visit.
Just go there seriously. Do not hesitate to offer this nice museum to your culture , if you like sculpture and appreciate this kind of art, it is a must to see before leaving town. Have fun :)

The Thinker. The garden was impressive and the focal points were the bronze sculptures including the Thinker, The Kiss and the Burghers is Calais. The Gates of Hell was an awesome piece of sculpture too.

EXTRAORDINARY!!. Been to lots of Museums but this is a gem! Works both inside and out in the amazing gardens that can be further enjoyed with both Rodin's famous Thinker and a unique contemporary chant coming from speakers hidden in the trees. Big surprise was to find one of the best soups in Paris from the cafeteria that could be enjoyed in the garden.

Impressive garden sculptures. The inside sculptures were impressive also but there were so many people inside that it was refreshing to go outside and wander through the gardens and look at many more sculptures that were just as great. Rodin was able to capture the emotions of the people in his sculptures. We stopped at the museum cafe and my granddaughter said they had the best hot chocolate in Paris.
One of my favorites. This is one of my favorite small museums, enjoy the gardens and the temp exhibits. Do this when you see Invalides since they are right by each other.

A gorgeous day and perfect visit. The gardens are so beautiful I could hardly stand it. Lunch at the cafe was fantastic. Inside the Hotel Biron are some terrific paintings (Van Gogh, Munch and more) besides of course the wonderful sculpture. Once I'd seen the studies and maquettes I had to go back again and view the marbles in the chapel and the bronzes in the garden. I learned so much during my visit!

Not to be missed!. Whether or not you know the sculptor's work you must visit this museum and spend time there. THis collection of the master's works is unbelievable. To see the progression of his work and have the thrill of seeing and touching it is almost spiritual.

You can visit inside exhibits or garden only. We didn't have a lot of time to spend here, so we opted for only the garden exhibits and we were pleased with the variety of sculptures outside, including the Thinker. It was only one euro for the garden, too.

Very Nice. After the crowds at some Museums this one is a welcome respite from the rush and bustle. I can't say I was particularly taken by the weird moaning sounds that I presume are meant to provide 'atmosphere' in the gardens by the Thinker and the Gates of Hell statues, but these two two alone are worth the visit. The gardens are very peaceful, the cafe serves delicious ice cream and the whole place has a very pleasant atmosphere.

Rodin's own museum. A lesser known among the many great art museums in Paris. Located in a park and villa where Rodin lived and worked during the last years of his live and where he was hoping to establish a museum for some of his major works. The museum is currently undergoing some renovations.

Gorgeous art, gorgeous garden. A quiet oasis away from the chaos of the other museums around about. With three children in tow, this was welcome relief. They were able to spread out and enjoy the gardens freely. We were able to wander along behind admiring the sculpture and greenery. A very famous piece here "The Thinker" was a highlight. free entry on the first Sunday of the month, and no queue at all. Just a gorgeous idyllic place to visit. Gave the kids an insight in to French gardens and palaces.

Great Museum Experience. This small manor house holds a great story now readily known about Rodin. He actually lived here and the gardens inspired some of his greatest works that are still there. Don't miss this one.

An oasis of calm in a busy city. You have probably seen the "Thinker" dozens of times in photographs, posters and cartoons; but if you get the chance go and see it at the Rodin Museum in its garden setting and photograph it yourself with or without pigeons. In three dimensions it is a revelation of the complexity of the human figure; but it is only one of a host of beautiful bronzes that walk the gardens of the Museum and culminate with the equally famous "Burghers of Calais" and many others that are less well known but equally strong characterisations of humanity in all its forms. After walking past a larger-than-life Balzac, you want to go and read his stories and find the strength that you see in metal reproduced in literature. There is an indoor portion of the museum, but it is the outside gardens that are a revelation. There is a café in the grounds which is good for enjoying a coffee or a sandwich, and watch the many children visiting the museum reaching out to touch the solid brass figures, to hold one of those gigantic hands or to run a finger along the contour of a muscle. The tactile nature of the work is palpable to all.

A treat!. This is a beautiful little museum and is not crowded compared to the other museums in Paris. The gardens are beautiful and a nice quiet way to sit and spend a few hours on a warm day. Presently there is some remodeling, but does not take away from the experience,
See where he lived and worked.. A lovely courtyard, large home and lots of Rodins sculptures make this a nice lace to spend some time with a garden to wander through.
Worth a visit. Not very much in this gallery but did see his famous Bougoises de Calais and The Thinker so worth it for that.
nice. I just visited the garden because I was advised to. It really is very nice. The garden is not big but very cosy with sculptures harmonized with trees and plants.

Well worth a visit. Very well presented and maintained. The day we were there was not crowded and it was easy to get around the house and stroll through the gardens. The outdoor cafe had good fare at reasonable prices. We went having done battle with the Louvre the day before...what a contrast!
Musee Rodin. This is a must-see for anyone. Period. End of story. If you don't see this, you have missed a major contributor to French art & history!
Sun yourself on the stone benches. Laying in the park on the stone benches is a relaxing activity in this quiet green space in the middle of Paris. It's an oasis away from everything.
A must-see in Paris. Includes a truly marvelous collection of Rodin's later marble work. Definitely drool-worthy. And the story of Camille Claudel fascinates me.

A pleasant surprise . The Museum was a big surprise in that it wasn't crowded like most places in Paris. I was also amazed at how many of his works were included. The gardens were immaculate and the restaurant was another hidden gem. If you are looking to escape the masses, this is a great place to spend an afternoon.

Prolific genius. Even though he had an entourage of assistants Rodin was a masterful artist. See the way he makes marble come alive and wonder. Well laid out museum and little in the way of queues to get in - a nice surprise in queue mad Paris!

Rodin's Home. This was Rodin's home and now a museum of his greatest works. Ponder "The Thinker", try to figure out his "Gates of Hell" juxtaposed against his elegant "Young Girl with Flowers in her Hair".
Marbles and bronzes and plasters, oh my!. The collection of finished marbles here is shocking in their beauty, and the gardens are absolutely stunning in the spring.

Excellent Collection of Rodin's Work!. This is THE best exhibit of Rodin's work. The Thinker is the most famous but the others were outstanding as well. Don't miss the indoor display. Wonderful works by Rodin.
The gardens are wonderful. Actually spent time just in the gardens viewing The Thinker and other statues. Quiet, beautiful, nice pond area that also had a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower.

Love the Rodin sculptures. We visited on an overcast chilly day in early April. The gardens had not bloomed yet, except for the forsythia, yet it was still spectacular. I imagine in full bloom it is hard to beat. To be able to get so up and personal with his work was amazing. You can look right in the faces of the life-like anquished sculptures, you can knock on the gates of hell and ponder alongside the thinker. Inside the Rodin I found it interesting to see the molds showing how the life takes shape. You can practically feel the mad sweeps of plaster the were living in mind only and needed to be put in form before the thought was lost. We had the museum pass and were able to fit this, d'Orsay and de l'Orangerie in the same day. However, we did spend an evening in d'Orsay by itself because it is a bigger museum with lots to see and take in.

Lovely respite. Besides the sculptures and the art, the garden was fresh and pretty and restful. The house was amazing, but it needs so much work! We really enjoyed the Rodin Museum and I hope they can do some restoring on the house. It was fabulous.

Not to be missed. The Rodin Museum was beautiful! The installation in the Museum area was innovative with rough wood bases for the silky, smooth marble figures. The audiotape is a must. The gardens were breathtaking with the first days of Spring. We ate at the cafe which was casual and delicious in a beautiful setting. The House was fascinating and contained very interesting art work and information. Highly recommend.

Sculpture in a garden--a bit of heaven on earth.. Even if you don't appreciate the Kiss or the Thinker, the garden is lovely and the view from it of the Eiffel Tower makes it even better. Stop at the cafe for lunch and call it a perfect day.
Worth a visit. If you enjoy sculpture you must visit. Easy to visit in an hour or a little more. Beautiful garden with "The Thinker" and good place to rest awhile.

Must see if you are a Rodin fan.. Excellent museum located in a quite part of Paris. Beautiful grounds to wander on a sunny day. Some of his best and most popular works are located here in a beautiful setting.
Excellent!!!. It was my third time and it's always a surprise to me on how the museum can excite me :-)Definitely worth visiting!

Awe Inspiring. I've been to the Rodin Museum in Philadelphia, but this is the real deal! Impeccably maintained grounds with the beautiful Rodin sculptures. Highlight of the visit was the "Gates of Hell" sculpture. Definetly worth the visit!

A very interesting and fascinating find. A good friend of mine recommended a visit to this museum. My city pass did not allow me access to the exhibit "du jour" but I still enjoyed the gardens. A marvelous time.....
great morning out. Was not overly impressed with the marble statues in the museum, but the bronzes in the gardens were great. The gardens were wonderful. Had a drink and delicious cake at the cafe
Great way to spend an hour. Beautiful grounds,beautiful art. Very close to a Metro stop and plenty of other things to do nearby. If you have a Musee Pass, it will be free.

Much to see. Using our pass, again, we toured the exhibits, gardens and house on the property and are amazed at the amount of work this top of the top sculpture was able to accomplish! Well worth the walk over and a place to again ponder the magnificent beauty that man can create. We loved all aspects of this and the outdoor sculpture garden includes some gates that we can figure out how they were made -- so intricate with their figures.

A garden filled with art and inspiration!. A must see for anyone who visits Paris. The museum is in a setting surrounded by a beautiful garden that contains many of Rodin's sculptures. We had the good fortune to visit on a sunny spring day that allowed us to leisurely stroll around and admire the works of art. To one side of the garden there is a structure that contains a lot of information about Rodin and how he came to inhabit the house which today is his museum. This museum is definitely worth an afternoon of your time in Paris.

Think with the Thinker at Rodin!. You can think with The Thinker and ponder how talented Rodin was to create such works of art and Sculpture featured in the Museum and Gardens. The Thinker is actually placed on Rodin's tomb as he and his companion, Rose are buried there. Don't miss the Gates of Hell also in the Gardens, along with Balzac and The Whistler. Nice little outdoor cafe on the grounds with soups (try the vegetable), salads, sandwiches, pastries and dessert. Don't miss this fine Museum, it is also close to the Invalides, take them both in!

A gem of a museum and my favourite in Paris. Musee Rodin is my favourite museum in Paris, just slightly ahead of Musee D'Orsay. It has changed a bit from my first visit 20+ years ago when I was living in Paris but I love Rodin's sculptures and the gardens there. This small gem of a museum is manageable in a few hours if youlinger over the exhibition and gardens but even if you could only go for an hour, it is worth the trip.Dante's Inferno is in the gardens again. I saw it at Royal Academy of Art in London a few years ago and thought it was a beautiful piece of work.

A must see just for the gardens alone!. A good display of works helps one understand the work and life of Rodin. He was successful beyond the norm for his time - few artists achieved his good fortune. The villa gardens would be lovely in the warmer weather I imagine. Expensive €9 but Museum receives no Government support so your ticket keeps it going!
Beautiful Gardens. A beautiful indoor and outdoor museum! Viewing Rodin's sculptures in the midst of the gardens is such a unique way to enjoy his art. Beautiful landscape and fountains!

Time to think. A really nice collection of Rodin's work, and a nice garden. It's the sort of place you could squeeze in after Les Invalides as it is just over the road. The garden is host to many statues including "The thinker", The "Merchants" and "the gates of hell" to name three, There's a lot to see here if you're a fan of Rodin. We enjoyed it, but our legs failed us before we could do the main indoor collection. We will be back to do the rest one day

Another gem in the crown of jewels which is Paris. This is a wonderful little museum for anyone interested in this great man's work. We enjoyed a sunny afternoon in the house and garden where he lived and worked the last years of his life.
Timeless splendor. Now I understand why the Americans are so crazy about Rodin. This place is out of this world! Not only the art but the house and the gardens...Simply a gem!
Very Nice! ; ). The garden is gorgeous!! I didn't enter inside the museum... but just walking in the garden is amazing!!! The thinker is breathtaking!!I recommend this tour!

Garden Visit. We decided on the abbreviated garden tour at the Rodin Museum. There are many works outside, including the Thinker, in the garden or are accessible in the garden. It is less crowded plus the museum is refurbishing some of the inside galleries. It did not disappoint. There are some quirky but fascinating pieces. We have a 16-year old and 13-year old and both enjoyed the garden tour.
A lovely museum. A beautiful buidling with a huge number of the artist's sculptures, small enough to see them all plus a lovely sculpture garden with a fine cafe for outdoor dining.

A wonderful museum stop!. Get a Paris Museum Pass!We visited Musee Rodin immediately after a morning at the Hotel Invalides. We had free entry with our Paris Museum Pass and immediately went about enjoying the beautiful gardens filled with new flowers in bloom, as wel as outstanding sculptures. A great picture is to be had with The Thinker in the foreground, flanked by Eiffel's Tower and the golden dome over Napoleon's tomb. The viewing area for the Gates of Hell, with the Three Shades opposite, was well thought out and very aesthetic.A good visit, and depending on your appreciation one can spend 30 minutes or 4 hours on the grounds!
Worth a visit. It's only one euro to get into the garden, full of lovely sculptures and a very good cafe.Your system isn't working property - please check

The Two Thinkers visit Thee THINKER.. The gardens are so peaceful, I could have stayed all day. A beautiful garden to have lunch. The house is outstanding. Free for students who live in the EU. The shop had some lovely gifts to take home.

Europe Trip 2013. Got there late and decided to just do the free tour of the gardens. This was wonderful for our grandkids who loved running around and watching the rabbits. Got a good taste for Rodin and his life without paying anything!!
This is the place to be on a sunny day.. What a great combination, wonderful sculpture and a lovely garden. This is a place to relax. I did want to reach out and touch some of the sculpture.

The Thinker, The Kiss.... This is another gem of a museum within Paris. They are closed on Mondays. If you are looking for Rodin's "Thinker" the original/smaller statue is located inside the museum. The larger statue is located outside. "The Kiss" is stunning and a must see!k

Spectacular Sculptures. My husband and I had the pleasure of visiting the Musee Rodin during our recent visit to Paris. While the marble sculptures within the temporary exhibit at the museum are breathtaking, the bronze sculptures in the museum's garden best reflect Rodin's genius . From The Thinker, to Balzac, and the Gates of Hell, his mastery of the medium as well as his astonishing talent are on display for all to enjoy. I strongly recommend taking the time to visit this small museum. You won't regret it.

Excellent cafe!. Very quiet little museum and garden with a big punch. The sculptures were beautiful and the cafe was a wonderful surprise. The food was great and it was on the edge of the gardens with a wonderful view of the estate. We were pleasantly surprised.

Closed inside for renovation. We went to Musee Rodin our first day of our trip, and we found it closed inside. We thought it was because it was late in the day -- we got there about an hour before closing -- but someone on a Paris discussion board said that it's closed inside for renovation. Not sure when it will re-open. Our favorite part is the garden anyway, and since we were traveling with our 6 year old granddaughter, she enjoyed being outside. This year it wasn't as warm as in previous years, so the roses weren't blooming, but we still loved walking in the garden. For those who don't realize it, one can walk in the garden without going inside for a mere 1 Euro. It's an amazing museum, with a lovely garden, that we return to each time we go to Paris.

The Thinker is here. This is the only self funded museums in France. Rodin actually created his art here. The museum was a hotel that Rodin frequented then bought. The garden is beautiful. Worth seeing!!

Repetitive. I had the Paris musee pass, so took a little detour to visit Rodin. Because the weather was cold, we didn't spend too much time outdoor and the flowers haven't bloom yet. Some of the famous statutes were repeated inside the museum in a smaller version. Smaller collection of art, but wasn't too impressed from the other museums.
The Thinker. Lovely museum but if its a picture of The Thinker you are after just pay the two euros to go into the garden only

Nice 'stocking-filler'. You're not going to spend the whole day here - a couple of hours will probably be enough. The museum itself is OK but the real experience comes from walking around the gardens and viewing some of Rodin's many famous statues. I would imagine the gardens are even lovelier in summer when the flowers are in bloom.Overall, the Rodin museum makes a nice end of the day combination with something else. We spent the day in Montmatre and did the Rodin Museum on the way back home.

Australian School Group visit. Our visit to the Musee Rodin was a relaxing experience. The gardens and sculptures throughout made it possible to take our time and explore at our leisure. The students enjoyed the experience.

Unique Museum. Really enjoyed this museum. The gardens and statues were delightful and also enjoyed the indoor exhibit. We purchased a two day museum pass for a large group of museums in Paris and did not have to wait in line...a real benefit!

Beautiful spot. We much prefer smaller, focused museums like this one where you get to see the work of one artist rather than be overwhelmed with many. The gardens are stunning, and would be even more so in full bloom (we came a little too early). We also appreciated the symmetry in the gardens on the hole.

Beautiful Setting. This is a great museum and the gardens look lovely - it was a terrible snowy day when I went but still enjoyed the garden and the museum itself was filled with beautiful sculptures that should not be missed.

Excellent. The Rodin Museum is made up of three distinct areas - the museum, hotel, and museum grounds - all providing a different look at Rodin's work. Don't miss the Hotel since it was Rodin's home for many years and now houses many of his important pieces and personal art collection.
Paris. What a lovely treat this place was small but if you like his sculptures (and I do) it is a must. It isn't that large so it won't take much more than an hour

It only it had been Spring. Never had been here before and it's a gorgeous gem. In full bloom it must be even more exquisite. The collection is impressive and made me appreciate the brilliance of Rodin. I didn't know how much sculpting he did in marble. Stunning
High expectations. Was expecting a more impressive museum. The annex house is kind of run down. There were also many similar pieces at the musse d'orsay.

The brilliance of Rodin up close. There are museums and then there are MUSEUMS that stimulate the senses both outside and inside the museum. This is one of those special places. We went on a cold March day expecting queues but there were none. Once past the ticket security, we walked out into a picturesque and large garden estate in bright sunshine and melting snow. Rodin's sculptures strategically placed to both highlight and co-exist with nature. The maison itself is the main museum and walking up the grand staircase, one can't help wonder who had trodden the same stairs before and after Rodin lived there. Rodin's art is infectious and his works show his genius and artistic evolution whether its painting or sculpting with a variety of materials. The there is "The Thinker" (this was a smaller version but none the less wonderful and wonderous). A great way to spend a few hours or more!
Beautiful. Splendid museum in the heart of Paris, in a beautiful building. The garden is wonderful on a sunny day.

Absolutely breathtaking.. Rodin's sculpture - Le Baiser - magnificent. I could have stayed all day and looked at this wonderful work. Do not miss going outside to see The Thinker and The Gates of Hell. Absolutely wonderful.

Museum Rodin. The gardens are beautiful and well kept the sculptures are too. It was under renovation whilst we were there and I think that this should result in a reduce admission. There is also no student discount unlike most other paris venues worth thinking about to get more people in!

Don't skip this.... It's within walking distance from Les Invalides - Musée de l'armée and you won't regret it.We only had to queue for 15 min. The statues inside are as impressing as the ones in the lovely garden. A good place to have your picknick in the sun!Family tickets available!

a little gem. The house and gardens are not to big and the cafe served very good coffee.It would be a nice place to visit with a picnic on a hot summers day.Good mixture of external statues and a very interesting history of the building and how it was named after Rodin.He appears to have been a very determined person.

Oasis of calm in a busy city. Such beautiful sculptures both in a lovely garden setting and also in a grand old house (albeit in need of a little TLC). It really is a calm and peaceful oasis amongst a bustling city. The cafe in the garden serves good food in a lovely setting with outside seating.My only complaint is that there was a lack of explanation about the sculptures - take my advice and get a brochure at the entrance and book in advance to skip the queues.

Fabulous-dont Miss. A place of stunning beauty in heart of Paris.
the sculptures are beautiful,gardens not to be missed-
the outdoors works set in lovely gardens

Interesting museum. I went there in order to see the famous sculpture "Le Penseur". I was so lucky that there was a special exhibition with sculptures in marble. I am not that interested in sculptures, but I was honestly impressed by these ones.Then there is the sculpture "Le Penseur" in the garden and also the "normal" exhibition of sculptures which was quite good.Last but not least, there is a very nice garden/park, and I would assume it would nice to take a walk there in the spring or summer (I went there in March 2013 where it was rather cold and there were no flowers).

A nice break from the hustle and bustle of Paris. The Rodin museum is located in a beautiful building and surrounding gardens in central Paris. Rodin's sculptures area beautifully displayed both inside the building and in the gardens. There are currently some upgrades being made to the gardens but they didn't have a major effect on the displays. It is a museum that is well worth a visit

A Favorite. After the hustle and bustle of the Louvre, it was so wonderful to wander through the quiet gardens of the Musee Rodin and to see these lovely works of art surrounded by flowers and trees and water. We could walk leisurely and at our own pace, and there were lots of places to sit and relax and enjoy the wonderful art and the scenery of the garden. Lovely, simply lovely. We will return here for sure.
Amazing statues. Incredible gardens and beautiful works of art from Rodin. Get there before 5:10 pm though as that's the last call for ticket sales.
Great Visit. Beautiful gardens and art from Rodin. Enjoyed seeing his original masterpieces, especially the ones in the gardens

I like the gardens better than the galleries. The museum is very interesting, but the collection is a bit overwhelming. I preferred seeing the sculptures outdoors among the beautiful gardens, where there was plenty of breathing room and a lovely surrounding.

My Favorite Place in Paris!. On my second trip to Paris, this was the one place I re-visited, and I will probably go back every time I travel to Paris in the future!Although it is possible to see Rodin's sculptures all over the world (we have several near my home in Northern California), it's a different experience to see them at the artist's former home. The garden is so well laid out and perfect for enjoying the sculptures. It's hard not to be inspired as you stroll the grounds.One of my favorite aspects of this museum is how they have displayed the sculptures in relation to the surroundings. For example, if you stand in the right spot, you can get a great photo of The Three Shades with the Eiffel Tower in the background. The Thinker is positioned perfectly with Les Invalides over his shoulder. Here's a tip, for only 1 euro, you can get access to the garden only. It's a perfect spot to stroll on a nice day. Plan to eat lunch or get coffee at the cafe, then stroll the grounds. The main house is seeing at least once, but probably not necessary for subsequent trips.
best ever. can spend there whole of the day, computer wants more then 50 characters, so, can spend there whole of the day

Museum of graden. WHat ever you decide to view in this amazing space you will be mesmerized. Walk through the gardens and admire sculptures, super landscaping . . . a tour guide will even give you stories about each plant. And the museum of course has wonderful pieces of art.Like all in Paris fees are quite reasonable.

Different to other galleries. Rodin is a smaller museum and so you don't need as much time for queuing or walking around. A lot of the pieces, including The Thinker (the key attraction), are located outside in the beautiful gardens, which makes a nice difference to other art galleries that can get stuffy. Some interesting pieces, worth a visit.

Great value garden visit. If you would like to browse in comfort until the upgrade has been completed in 2014, the garden only visit is a must. For just one euro you get access to the extensive grounds which are peppered with various pieces, including the Thinker. The inside exhibition space looked interesting but maybe not the most enjoyable of experiences if you'd like to avoid being jostled for space from one work to another.

Stunning. Worth visiting Paris just to see it. You should get the audio guide as it really adds to the visit.A real surprise is the collection of fine art on the first floor gifted tp Rodin by his mates!

Outstanding museum and gardens. First class Rodin museum. The gardens are wonderful and very peaceful. The Gates of Hell is something to see as is The Thinker. Close to Metro stop and Les Invalides. Can easily see everything in 60-90 mins.

interesting, but overrated. If you consider the Louvre as a main course, than the Rodin Museum is like a light starter. Allow 30-40 minutes at the most. I would advice going to Rodin Museum before Musee d'Orsay which is located nearby. Get your museum pass to beat the lines.
The best of Rodin. The Rodin is a great small museum. It showcases the best of Rodin. The sculptures and the garden are beautiful. Worth a visit.
Must see. My husband has an art background and he loved this musuem. We both enjoy Rodin's work. The gardens are nice also. We met several nice people there. It was an easy walk from Rue de Cler.

Rodin's greatest hits. This small museum (compared to others in Paris) is a great place to spend an hour or two. In addition to a special exhibit of the progression of the master's style and items for his own collection, many of Rodin's greatest works are one view. These include the Thinker, The Burghers of Calais and the Gates of Hell, which are scattered around a lovely garden area. The museum is in desperate need of renovations and part of it Is closed because of it.
Lovely garden. Everyone gathers around the thinker, but go and enjoy the garden, the lake, the coffee shop, and the oasis of calm in central Paris. And of course, you can't miss The Kiss ...

All Rodin, all the time. With all due respect to the many other museums in Paris, this one is my favorite. It's my first stop anytime I visit Paris. All the famous Rodin works are there: The Thinker, The Kiss, The Gates of Hell, etc., but there's so much more, including a terra cotta sculpture of a young woman that had me rooted to the floor in front of it. I get the feeling Rodin was in love with her when he sculpted this one. The building itself was Rodin's home, so we know he was a very successful artist. The beautiful gardens surrounding the home are worth a look too, since some of his most famous works are located there. The museum is a little out of the way, but it's worth the bit of searching it takes to find it. You won't be disappointed. Also, buy a museum pass here that gets you into the other museums in Paris and avoid standing in long lines elsewhere, especially at The Louvre.

Very well laid out!. If you like Rodin, this is a place you must visit. Nicely laid out, lots of sculptures and drawings by the master. And the outdoor gardens (with the Thinker and the Burghers) is a very pleasant place to spend some time.

Beautiful museum and gardens. One of Paris' hidden gems. The collection is excellent and includes 'The Kiss' and 'The Thinker'. Beautifully curated, the collection is a must as are the stunning grounds and gardens.

Favorite Museum Stop. Not only are the scupltures amazing works of art, but this museum is so incredibly situated, with the beautiful gardens to walk around and enjoy. My husband and I took the most gorgeous picture of our whole trip here... in front of "The Thinker" in the gardens, with Les Invalides on the left, the Eiffel Tower on the right, and the thinker right behind us. Its such a nice, calm museum, we really enjoyed it and are glad we went.Just make sure you check out the hours of operation (as with everything in Paris) because I believe its only open on the weekends in the afternoon.

Excellent museum, lovely park and great little restaurant. This is a lovely place to visit, with or without kids (under 18s are free, as are a number of other people following a campaign by local residents). Many of Rodin's famous works are dotted around the garden, and you can also go into the house to see more.There is also a lovely little restaurant that does great lunches with outside tables on a nice day. All in all a great place to take a break from the instanity of tourist Paris. Be warned that sometimes you have to queue - but it really is worth it.
Beautiful gardens, great value at 1Euro. Love the gardens. Good representation of Rodin sculptures. Probably the best value in Paris for 1 Euro.

Musee Rodin. I was a total cheapskate this day and we only paid for the trip through the gardens at the Musee Rodin.3 Euros for a family of five (children under 18 are free) allowed us to wander around the garden and see some of his most famous works including the Thinker, the Gates of Hell and the Three Shades were all on display. Truly a bargain to be able to get so close to the works of a master for so little money. I actually enjoyed this trip more than my trip to the Louvre.

Don't miss this gem. Not to be missed, fantastic sculptures and his most famous works - Thinker. Kiss and Gates of Hell in the garden. Strolling round garden and house in the sunshine is a great experience.One of the best attractions in PAris
Beautiful. Avery nice display of sculptures. It was nice to see pictures he collected from other artists as well. The grounds and the buildins were fantastic. This is really worth seeing.

A master and treated as such. The tactile sensation here is like none other. A true master and a great way to see his work, process, natural surroundings and the city. Not to be missed. I want to eat the sculptures (I know thats very strange but they are some of the best in the history of the world) Bronze at its best and stone so supple.

Don't miss The Thinker. Repair as the Thinker's right hand is on his left leg. This sure is his most famous sculpture. In this museum you can also see one of his Gates of Hell. There's another one in the Musee D'Orsay, but nothing as good as seeing one in Rodin's garden.
House and Grounds. Great statuary in a lovely setting, as the photo indicates. Strolling around the grounds is a wonderful bonus to going through the house.

Totally worth a visit. The tag line for Musee Rodin is "The flesh, the marble" and indeed when you see how Rodin can transform slabs of stone to look like real, supple flesh, it is....awe-inspiring.The first building is small, but holds some of the most magnificent pieces of work. And then you step outside and realize how much more there is to see, it's totally worth it. What we thought would be just a quick stop before Napoleon's tomb, turned into a much longer visit.You can easily spend an hour or two here, so plan accordingly. Easy to get to by metro.

Gardens. I think this museum would be beautiful in the spring/summer. Unfortunately, it snowed the day we visited, so I don't think it was the best time for a visit. I could tell that the gardens would be beautiful if the weather was a bit warmer though! Moreover, there is an extensive collection of Rodin's work which is of course beautiful and captivating to look at.

I love Camille Claudel. The gardens of this museum almost trump the indoors. Every sculpture inspires. Studying about Camille Claudel and her often unrecognized contributions to Rodin's work make the museum even more poignant.
Unique and Beautiful. Nowhere else like it in the world. If you like Rodin an absolute must see. Fabulous house and gardens.

Favorite museum in Paris!. I never knew much of Rodin before visiting this museum. Since then, I have come twice. One of my favorite museums worldwide! Sculptures are amazing-- breathless. But the best part is the museum is housed in his old mansion-- complete with rose garden. You could spend an entire afternoon here
The flesh the marble. this exhibition at the Rodin museum is a must if in Paris. The detail is unbelievable. The rest of the museum was winner too. Available to get in on the Paris Pass

Surprises from Rodin. Everyone knows about Rodin's The Thinker, and his other sculptures are in so many places, but not many are aware of his life story. This museum tells that tale, including the why of this building. Charming gardens and surprise displays are here. An oasis of calm and discovery! Plus you can't beat the view of Napoleon's Tomb.

Nice place to visit...the mansion and the gardens. Love everything about this Museum...especially knowing the story of Rodin and Camille Claudette...the history and the gardens with the roses that are just so huge and healthy is truly a step back in time

amazing sculptures and lovely coffee and macaroons. Rodin's sculptures just have to be seen but all the walking around Paris is very tiring ... come here for a lovely garden (despite the current renovations) and really great coffee and macaroons, enjoyed outside with the birdsong - and the awesome Gates of Hell too, of course!

nice visit. I have always loved Rodin, such a great artist. Being in this museum is surreal, it is located in beautiful gardens. When I was there, it snowed, made it so special...!! For a moment, i thought about Camille...

Nice, pretty, simple, reflective... I enjoyed this museum very much and was glad we went. We were allowed to picnic in the gardens. It is so lovely, and ironic :) , to pig out on French pastries while gazing upon Rodin's "Gates of Hell"...he he! I disagree with some people's complaints about the house being a bit run down and that it takes away from the attraction. The creaking floor and peeling paint added to the character and appreciating the age of the structure and therefore the era. Sometimes viewing pristine palaces behind a velvet rope just seems so unreal. To see "The Kiss" up close is just beautiful. A bit of a warning though, they are moving things around, I guess. When we were there the entire back garden was tore up and they were building a pavilion type structure. This might disappoint some. Also, I agree with the other reviewer that many of the sculptures are all together in the gift shop area...so really not prime time to experience if that kind of stuff bothers you.

Underrated. It is surreal to walk among the gardens surrounded by Rodin's statues. The outside of the museum is non-descript but once you get inside it is a marvel to see. Well worth the time spent there.
A garden filled with sunshine. I had a lovely rest gazing at the Thinker and reading an art book. A great place to re charge e batteries as well as discovering more about this amazing artist.
What an artist. The museum was great, depicting the works of Rodin. The staff were friendly and always available to answer questions and explain anything to you. Absolutely amazing

One of my favorite places in Paris. The Musee Rodin is one of my favorite places in Paris. Unlike the Musee d'Orsay and the Louvre, the Musee Rodin is a bit more off the tourist track. The smaller crowds make the experience of wandering around this small museum so enjoyable. All of Rodin's great works are here displayed in a beautiful setting. If you are there in the spring, the gardens are fantastic.
