Wonderful gardens. For a mere €1 you can spend hours in a beatiful garden in the heart of Paris. The gardens are ornated with Rodin's sculptures, and offer numerous options to sit and rest. At the very end pf the garden there is a picnic area with benches and sunlougers. A very nice cafeteria offers sandwiches, salads, pastries and ice cream.

my favourite museum. Rodin was my favourite museum of all that we visted in Paris. Rodin's art is phenomenal and I loved the charming location of the museum; an old house. The creaky floors and cracked walls seemed like the perfect home for all this art. I loved the character of it, and the grounds (even in the rain) were gorgeous!
Smaller less crowded museum and gardens.. Fewer people. More personal. Well managed. Enjoyed the sculpture gardens immensely.
Gem in the middle of city!. This museum and grounds were a wonderful respite and very interesting gem in the middle of the city.

Lovely grounds! Amazing sculptures!. When you first walk into the grounds, you are confronted by Le Penseur, you walk a little further and you come across the sculpture of Balzac! The sculptures in the garden are incredible and then ou get to the Gates of Hell--the detail is unlike anything I had ever seen before! Do not miss this gem!

What a gem!!!. Not on our original itinerary, we made time for it and WOW! So thankful we did. To be able to see SO MUCH up close was a treat. The "Kiss" was the perfect backdrop for a memorable picture...a must see!

Beautiful house and gardens.. Really enjoyed looking at the wonderful statues scattered about the gardens. The house was also full of excellent work, was however, disappointed that his drawings and watercolours were not on display there, but in fact 45 mins outside Paris !

Lovely. The scuptures indoors are quite nice, and the Thinker and Gates of Hell and a number of others outdoors are even better, but best of all is the gardens themselves - fragrant, lush, not crowded, with benches and water fountains. A perfect place to bring a book and spend a lazy afternoon.

Musee Rodin. Another place NOT to be missed in Paris...we got there just before closing time and the guard ALMOST didn't let us in, but we told him 15 minutes were better than nothing - a convincing argument and absolutely true...
Enjoyed. Enjoyed seeing his artwork and wandering around the grounds.

Great Little Museum for sculpture. The Musee Rodin is a small museum with an outdoor sculpture garden that is perfect for kids. The indoor sections of the museum are likewise small so that you don't have to drag the kids through a large museum before they lose interest.
Very lovely ,but under construction. Beautiful gardens and art displayed in a grand mansion .

Even Under Renovation, One of Best Museums in Paris. Twenty-five years ago I remember this being one of my best experiences in Paris. Well, that hasn't changed although I was disappointed to discover the museum is undergoing extensive renovations. Luckily they are being smart about it and only fixing one half of Rodin's house at a time. They are using a special exhibit area in the Museum entrance to show some of the statues that you would otherwise miss. So although you won't be seeing the usual number of exhibits, there certainly are plenty of statues on display to make the visit worthwhile. And once you see the state of the house, you'll understand why they had to renovate. There is a very interesting panel in the garden which details in English Rodin's life in the house and his difficulties in turning it into a museum for his work (something that wasn't finally accomplished until after his death). We visited on a Sunday morning and arrived 10 minutes before it opened. There was a line of about 10 people, and we had an easy time buying our tickets (10 Euros for a family--what a great price!) and touring the museum. We stayed a little over two hours and the museum never got crowded. We did not rent the audio and still enjoyed ourselves, but there were minimal explanations on the statues so if you really want to learn about Rodin, I would buy the audio tour.We started with the temporary exhibit. Be sure if you bring a backpack to carry it in front of you (so that you don't accidentally bump it into a statue. If this makes you feel like you're pregnant, you can check your backpack in the main house). Although it's incredibly tempting--don't touch the statues (yes, people did this while we were there and were politely chastised by the museum personnel)--we all want these masterpieces to remain pristine for future generations. You cannot take pictures in the temporary exhibit, but you can in the main house and the gardens (no flash). After the temporary exhibit, we toured the gardens. The restroom in the gardens was closed, so be sure to use the one in the entrance building if you need to. There is a restaurant in the garden with plenty of seating, and although we didn't eat here, it seemed like a great place to sit and enjoy the beauty of the place.After the gardens we toured the half of the main house that was open. One room is dedicated to Camille Claudel, and be sure to notice the paintings on the wall by a variety of artists. The VanGogh portrait was a wonderful surprise and seeing those paintings hanging haphazardly on the walls of an old house instead of a big, modern museum was an odd experience--certainly more intimate.Overall, you'll love your trip to this museum. I highly recommend it for families, even those with young children. They may not notice the sculptures but they will enjoy exploring the gardens.Here are links to my Tout page where you can see 15 second video clips of some of the statues:http://www.tout.com/m/2zr1fdhttp://www.tout.com/m/z8qq64http://www.tout.com/m/rraxhzhttp://www.tout.com/m/uub8vg

One of my favorite Paris museums. It is a delightful little museum & garden with Rodin's work integrated throughout. The size makes it perfect to fit into day of other sight seeing. I loved how they have Rodin's collection of his contemporaries, especially his protege, Camille Claudel, integrated into the museum.

GREAT PLACE. The sculptures are wonderful and the museum is just the right size. Just about the time you're ready to leave, you've completed a full tour. It's just the "right bite" - not too overwhelming, but full of wonderful art.

Fun museum to stop in. I'll preface by saying I am not usually a huge fan of art museums. It was incredibly busy as we walked in, but we had a museum pass so we could skip the lines. It was interesting to walk through the actual house with the sculptures inside. That being said, if I did not have the museum pass I would likely not have gone in, the wait outside was not worth the walk through. It was also raining when we went so we could not walk through the gardens which I glimpsed.
Rodin is Rodin!. A museum that will surprise you... prepare your camera and take a lot of pics of The Thinker Man!
Beautiful Garden!!. Only one euro to visit the garden and see the Rodin Thinker statue. Definitely worth it!!

Rodin museum visit. An impressive display of works by Rodin and other artists, shown in a building that looks like it was a residence previously. The thinker sculpture is in the garden, which is a surprise as to how such a well known piece is left outside and perhaps vulnerable to thieves. In fact, it was stolen recently and recovered. A must stop while in Paris.

A place to wander & enjoy. A lovely museum with some awesome sculptures. You can see how Rodin did lots of different versions of his statues until he did the final one, which is facinating. There are a few other artists work there too including Van Gogh. You can get really close to the art and this feels like a very intimate museum. If the weather is good you can wander round the lovely gardens. I had a lovely afternoon just wandering around and soaking up the atmosphere. Wonderful.

After Michelangelo, it's Rodin.. Rodin is considered by many to be the greatest sculptor after Michelangelo. Rodin's greatest works are all on display at this museum. From The Burghers of Calais, The Lovers, and The Thinker to wonderful less known works, they are all there.

Visit to Musee Rodin. I was in Paris for a week in June, and finally on the last day (Saturday 6/10) the sun came out. I walked over to the Musee Rodin and bought a ticket for both the Musee and the garden. The grounds were beautiful and well maintained. The audio tour was a great way to stroll through the Musee and learn about Rodin. Wonderul visit with beautiful artwork and sculpture.
Sculpture only. I was surprised that there really wasn't that much to see here. I liked the Orsee and the Louve much better.

When in Paris, pose like the Thinker. I think a lot of people miss this museum because they don't realize that it houses one of the most famous statues in the world and a bunch of other famous statues by Rodin. They are all in the gardens and going there is totally worth it because access to the garden is only 1E and even if you don't care for Rodin, the garden is pretty. It is right outside Napoleon's Tomb too, so the location is convenient.

lovely place. it's not just a museum. it's a beautiful and peaceful place to enjoy art and a nice day in rodin's garden. definitely a must-see in paris. this area in the lef bank is one of the best in paris to ride a bike. enjoy a day with a velib and visit the rodin museum, the invalides, the eiffel tower and even the trocadero.

Lovely to spend a cultural afternoon outside. The Rodin is perfect, if a little busy, for afternoons when the weather is nice. The art itself is great, and it's very relaxing to wander around outside looking at the statues.
Worth the visit. Loved both the indoor and outdoor displays. Not a great place to go in the rain, as much of the really cool stuff is in the gardens.

Beyond Expectations. As one of the lesser museums in Paris, it is not as crowded as the others. The collection is incredible with many of the sculptures outside in the beautiful gardens. The main building (Hotel Biron) was partially closed for renovations, but the displays in the museum and on the grounds are still very accessible.

Gardens are a must, could go either way on the house until renovations are complete. Gardens 5 stars, house 3 stars. Somehow I was confused and thought the renovations of the house were done, so I was a little disappointed to find that this is not the case. However, the gardens are beautiful and extensive. You can be up close and personal with many of Rodin's famous works. Even in July at mid-day, it was no oppressively crowded. People were very considerate when taking photos around the sculptures (except one family who clogged the Thinker while taking about 5 minutes to pose their children)I think if I had been more awake on the renovation situation, I would have just done the gardens for 1 euro, but we paid for the house as well (9 euros total). From what I could gather, the museum has pulled a representation of Rodin's most important pieces from the different time periods of his career as well as works of art from some of his friends (a couple of Van Goh paintings and one Monet, etc) and put these on display in a few rooms of the mansion. You walk around on what feels like a temporary floor so there is a lot of noise. I knock a star because the interior rooms get a little tight with people, cameras, bags, etc with these open works of art just there like they could be knocked over (I am sure they are secured, but still) I was surprised that the museum allowed backpacks and large bags. Their only requirement seemed to be that people had to wear their backpacks on the front of their bodies...
a must. Best small museum in Paris. Intimate and wonderful opportunity to understand Rodin's works.

Wonderful venue .... We were recently in Paris and this was our first visit to the Musee Rodin. Beautiful gardens! To be able to observe and take in the sculpture within the garden was a wonderful way to experience Rodin.
Great strolling. The garden museum is such a delight even on a hot day

Beautiful!. My husband and I visited this museum on a beautiful Sunday recently on our first trip to Paris. The outdoor sculptures, the grounds, the flowers, all so beautiful. It is crowded, of course, by the more famous sculptures, but there is plenty of room to roam around and just take it all in. I highly recommend this museum.

Go to the garden. I didn't see the main exhibition, I just strolled around the garden where a lot of the sculptures are situated. (only 1 euro for the garden.) Even if you are not interested in Rodin, the garden is a wonderful place to relax. There is a small cafeteria to get an ice cream or a drink to enjoy on one of the deck chairs on the lawn.
Very Impressive. This was recommended to us and it did not disappoint. We just walked around outside and viewed the many statues- very creative.

Under Renovation. Still worth the visit, the works are magnificent, but things are a bit of a jumble. The audio tours were not in synch with where the works are now placed... But this may have been corrected. Dont miss the 2 Van Gogh paintings! You never get to see VG works of art as up close as this, and on the morning of our visit virtually ignored by the crowds! We were there soon after it reopened. Our second visit and we will return again once the renovations are completed!

Highly recommended place to escape the crowds. We only visited the gardens but there was plenty to see in the garden. Beautiful and a nice place to escape the crowds. We didn't have to queue and it was very peaceful. Great place to take the kids. Highly recommended for 1 euro!

a do not miss. This little gem is a do not miss. We were there at opening with the dew on the roses and the gardens quiet and hushed. The sculpture (The Thinker and Hell's gate) amazing along with all the sculpture and paintings in the house. do not miss.

A unique way to experience a masterpiece. Many have said that Rodin was a master at capturing human expression. The Musee Rodin offers a unique way to eerience the life works of Rodin. Walk right up to The Thinker and The Gates of Hell while wandering through a peaceful garden. Seeing these works in a natural setting puts them in a new perspective, a unique experience I would encourage all to enjoy. If you can, avoid the crowds and enter an hour or 2 before closing.
Great Garden. Musee Rodin has a wonderful garden. There is a building in garden and sculptures,marbles are here on display.

Musee Rodin is a Paris Must-See.. This mid-sized museum not far from the Invalides is Rodin's former home turned into a museum. The gardens is filled with much of his most important work. Indeed one can visit the gardens alone for the price of a single euro. The garden includes the Burghers of Calais, the Thinker and, the unfinished, Gates of Hell. For people who like sculpture in smaller doses this is the best deal in Paris.The museum itself has works from his entire career including some of his paintings and drawings. There is also work by his former model, muse, lover and eventual rival Camille Claudel.I was emotionally exhausted by the end of the visit. Whether it is his finish or unfinished works, they pack an emotional punch. I particularly loved his bust of an orphan Alsatian girl, a smaller work to be sure but beautiful.

Rodin, Renoir and van Gough. A gem of a museum. A wonderful collection of art and sculpture and do not forget the gardens. The only problem is the few who spend hours trying to emulate the pose of the Thinker for a photo. Combine this museum with the Eifel Tower and Les Invalides. Use your Paris museum pass to bypass the queue.
loved this museum. little jewel in the 7th. the garden by it self is worth a visit but the museum is also great
Memorable. Cramped seating conditions - expensive - but all in all thoroughly fabulous show - a must do whilst in Paris celebrating.

Our favorite museum. We can say in all honesty that the Rodin Museum was our favorite Paris museum. Inside the museum, you can see all the fabulous works of art. And also house there are van Gogh and Renoir paintings that Auguste Rodin had acquired.But the best part of the museum are the grounds and gardens surrounding the main building. Of course, a main garden exhibit is The Thinker. But beyond that, you can get up close to many other sculptures. Walk through the shade of the trees and you eventually reach the far end of the garden. The view back toward the museum building is magnificent! And so peaceful on a quiet day. Take your time out here. Take in all the beauty of nature surrounding you.

Worth a stroll. We had the museum pass so when we happened upon this across from the Army museum we couldn't pass up an opportunity to cut the queue and stroll through the infamous sculptures. It was lovely to take a break and get some shade and the landscaping as well as the mansion was marvelous.
Amazing display of sculptures. Huge display of Rodin sculptures and bronzes. Often not too crowded , worth a visit!

Two Great Museums - See with D'Orsay. We started first at Rodin after a nice heavy breakfast on the corner overlooking Invalides, the on to D'Orsay. Rodin is surprisingly nice with both the house and the gardens and views. After D'Orsay we took the bike taxi to Ches Les Anges for a nice lunch.
Art at its best. I love this place. It's never over-crowded. You can wander around in the garden and contemplate these magnificent works of art. Go in late morning and stay for lunch in the garden.

Another great museum in a great city!. What we liked were touring the beautiful gardens and mansion where Rodin lived and worked. The sculptures were amazing, especially the Gates of Hell which I'd never even heard of before my visit (unfortunately my art background is minimal and most people only associate The Kiss or The Thinker when they hear Rodin). Try to get close and really look at everything that's going on on those Gates--the details are fascinating. We enjoyed the audioguides even though these were the most annoying in their detail (always telling you where the artwork was first displayed and then were it was displayed next, etc.). Like most places worth seeing in Paris there was a queue but it wasn't so terribly long and seeing Rodin's work was well worth the wait. (I only give it 4 stars because the audioguides were so annoying in their detail. I want to hear about the art, not the history of where and how it was first displayed, but maybe that's just me.)
Don't miss this collection. Outside and in, great works from the master. Fun to enjoy the gardens and take in the atmosphere.

Still one of my favorite museums. The number of Rodin sculptures at the Rodin museum is so impressive. Although they are refurbishing the museum and it has a relatively new entrance that takes away from the charm that this former home of Rodin once had, the collection is excellent. The gates of hell, the Thinker, the Kiss, and the history behind these masterpieces is very interesting. I recommend the audio guide which is very user friendly. The cafe has decent food too.

Disappointing. The museum is run down and poorly managed. The gardens, which are the venue for displaying many of Rodin's works are in a sad state. The docents and teachers made no effort to rein in the behavior of out-of-control French primary students or American teenagers which ruined the peacefulness of the setting and the ability to appreciate the art.

our favorite museum in paris. At the present time part of the biding is closed for reconstruction. But you can still see all of the museum collection presented both in the main building and the new additional one.The collection is magnificent. We especially love the room with the work of Camile Clodette.The garden is charming and you can enjoy the flours and have a rest under the gardens trees.Besides there is a nice and not very expensive restaurant in the garden. Have a nice rest!

Wonderful Museum. I LOVED three things about this museum. One, the museum is in a traditional home, with the parquet floors, etc. Two, there are many of Rodin's studies, trials, sketches and "draft" castings of his works so I got to see him "works in progress". Fascinating. And last, the museum has paintings and other artwork of artists whom he knew and liked -- including a favorite Van Gogh.

Love this museum. This museum is a must both inside and out. The sculptures are beautiful and the building is interesting. After visiting the inside, it's very pleasant to view the statues outside in the garden or just sit on one of the benches to admire th,e works,
An oasis in the city. There is a park area with a small number of reclining couches. If you can snag one, take your shoes off and enjoy the surroundings.Take time to look at the sculpures.
A Treasure!. Beautiful sculptures and paintings by a master! The gardens are beautiful. A much smaller and more intimate museum.
Magic. If you only have time for a couple of museums while in Paris, this one must be on your list. Not too big. Wonderful, peaceful setting. Oh, and filled with Rodin! What else?

Extraordinary. The intricacies of the sculptures are revealed when one see them from up close. I was amazed at two aspects: Rodin's multi-dimentinality as an artist and his doggedness about creation of the Museum.

Sculptures in a garden. It was great to see these magnificent Rodin sculptures in amongst the roses and trees. A very peaceful place to rest your tired feet and have a picnic lunch and take a break from the museum circuit.
fantastic. I loved sitting outside and eating an arugula and craw fish sandwich and cappuccino. I think I may have had a desert too. I really enjoyed it. It was a great price and very tasty.

beautiful small museum. This is a very manageable sized museum, with enough Rodin to satisfy anyone. The garden is astoundingly beautiful and wonderful to stroll through. I highly recommend the audio guide.

Small but interesting. This is a fairly small museum tucked away on a side street. We only found it because we were looking for it, doesn't seem like a place that you would stumble on. Even so, we felt it was worth the visit. Very interesting artwork inside and if you have the time and the weather is nice it's great to walk around the grounds and see his other sculptures. If you've ever had an interest in Rodin, this is worth the visit.

Powerful. The sculpture garden is a wonderful place to wander and gaze in wonder at the powerful, often tortured, sculptures of the great master. If you sketch, be sure to bring a sketchbook and claim a spot on a bench and exercise your artists muscles by trying to tame one of these massive bulging figures on your page.The Mansion that houses most of the indoor exhibit is in sore need of renovation, but its somewhat rustic state does also have a certain charm.

Lovely Gardens. We had access to this museum through our paris museum pass, and it ended up being one of my favourite in Paris. While the other main museums are absolutely teeming with people, this one was so quiet and relaxed. The gardens were the best bit, just wandering through the trees admiring fantastic sculptures, and the view back to the main building was fabulous. Not to mention the roses in full bloom!

Definitely should be on your itinerary. If you're at all interested in art and sculpture, the Rodin museum in Paris is worth a visit. Don't forget that there are actually TWO Rodin museums in Paris - this one, and Rodin's house in Meudon in the suburbs of Paris and both are worth visiting.

Short and Sweet. I'm not much for museums or art, as my attention span is short. Though this place was amazing. Great sculptures, and not too overwhelming. You can get through the main room in about 15 minutes and still be wow'd.

Enjoy the Gardens. The best value in Paris! Unless you are a serious fan of Rodin, just pay the 1 Euro to access the gardens, where "The Thinker" is located. The gardens are a great place to enjoy a picnic lunch or to let your kids unwind.

Thinking Man's Museum. To see the sculptures in person is very moving. We see so many pictures of these types of art pieces but seeing in person just highlights that pictures don't do justice to the real thing. The rose garden is just lovely.

Great garden, pity about the sculpture. Astonishingly spacious house and garden right next to Les Invalides in central Paris. The garden is a real delight, with a good-value cafe. A great place to relax and take the weight off your feet, and only 1 euro admission if you don't visit the museum and house. Didn't much take to Rodin's sculpture. He seems to have been a good self-publicist.

The best Museum experience in Paris. This was the most relaxed and informative museum experience in Paris. Not only you get to see the work of an artistic genius, but experience it in piece and tranquility of a beautiful garden.

A respite from the fray among beautiful works. It's worth the search. Honest. You'll see pieces you recognize, others you may not know about, all presented in a wonderful setting you won't want to leave.

Musee Rodin. We really enjoyed our visit to Musee Rodin, the works were of course the main attraction for us however the beautiful rose gardens, landscaping and buildings were a highlight too. We enjoyed our lunch in the cafe and this swiftly followed by a relaxing afternoon nap in one of the garden areas.Tranquil, peaceful and thoroughly enjoyable!

A Gem. This is a museum you must add to your "list" ... It is small and splendid and I particularly love to walk amongst Rodin's wonderful works in the garden.How fortunate are we to see these sculptural masterpieces in such a relaxed setting.Walk right to the end of the garden and take a pretty photo looking back at Rodin's former home.

My favourite. My favourite museum in Paris. A lovely garden, wonderful sculptures and no entrance line. On a sunny day walking through and sitting in the garden is a delight. There's a small cafe for refreshments. The stop for the hop on hop off bus is nearby, or catch the metro. Catching a glimpse of the the thinker sculpture from beyond the garden is exceptional, and weaving throughout the plants to view lesser known sculptures is a treat.

My favourite. This was definitely my favorite museum. The gardens are just beautiful and you could sit here all day. The museum is being renovated but there is still a great range of sculptures and art on display. The thinker and gates of hell is worth the look. You can just go sit in the garden all day if you want for only one euro!

A favorite of mine. The kids will enjoy seeing the Thinking Man in the garden, the home and collection is great. (Part of it is under renovation.) The gardens are wonderful with a nice little cafe. It is a great place to relax and enjoy some beautiful works of art. A must see.

Rodin House. A very worthwhile museum with fantastic gardens...rodin's works are inside and outside...you don't hear much about this museum--but it's a great alternative to long lines and crowds at more well known sites.....

Rodin Again and Again. A lazy afternoon at the Musee Rodin is one of the nicest ways to enjoy a sunny Paris afternoon. After a wildly exciting lunch at Le Tirmbre we needed movement, so strolling through the excellent gardens with their restful fountains was a great tonic. In the very back of the property is a cool green glad where lounges, benches, chairs, and a sandbox for little children are thoughtfully provided. Just the spot for overstuffed travelers. Oh, and the art is, as always, exciting and provocative.
Rest & Relax. Terrific long rest at lakeside. Strole up the hill on Blvd. St. Michel for less than a mile to the beautiful park. Quite safe, family oriented.
Under construction. Even with much of the museum closed for renovations the ground are beautiful with many sculpture out doors.

A Special Oasis in Busy Paris Tourist Destinations. The Musee Rodin was a delightful "find"! I wasn't sure about visiting, but was so glad that I had made the effort. The house and gardens are beautifully presented and a sunny day is the perfect time to visit. If you are not wild about sculptures, you can immerse yourself in the beautiful gardens, and if gardens are not your thing, you can meander from one superb sculpture to another. And that is all before you enter the house to experience a wealth of wonderful works by Rodin and other brilliant artists like Van Gogh, Renoir, Camille Claudel etc The essence of the house and gardens is one of light and colour, something I found really refreshing are the darkness of other interesting sites such as the Musee Jacquemart-Andre and Victor Hugo Museum. I thought it was one of the best value for money museums that I visited in Paris.

Excellent Museum. this was my must see on my 2nd visit to Paris. As we were on a short break and our time was precious, this museum was perfect. Short walk from museum D'Orsay and more importantly - NO QUEUES!! €9 to get in but lots to see and lovely grounds and seating area. There was alot of work being done to the gardens and some areas where unaccessable but still really enjoyed it.
Nice way to spend the afternoon. Great collection in one of the best settings in town.

Interesting. If you like your sculpture displayed "artfully" then the inside is for you. Marbles on wooden blocks - certainly different !! Worth a visit for the classics " the Kiss" and the Thinker " , pleasant in the sunshine and peace of Sunday morning.

Beautiful gardens. The rose gardens were in full bloom during our visit. The interior of the house could use some work, but it's nice to walk around to see the artwork and there are some beautiful views from the second level. There is a very nice explanation of the museum on a wall in the gardens, but you have to look for it.

Good value & plenty to see. At first I though 9 euro pp was a bit steep but there is a museum, & fantastic gardens too walk around with picnic / seating areas. It houses the "Thinker" & the "Gates of Hell". There is a shop & an exhibition hall too. Overall it was a good way to spend a couple of hours even if you aren't a great art lover like ourselves. Intresting & informative. There was english speaking signs below all exhibits.Worth a visit

Don't miss the sculpture garden. Even though the main building was undergoing renovation during our visit, the museum was one of Paris highlights. Most impressive, was the incredible garden, replete with lush landscaping, a pond, and numerous sculptures, many with parts of famous Paris skyline (e.g., Eiffel Tower) in the background. A leisurely stroll around the garden, along with a coffee or light lunch at the garden's cafe is well worth the time and effort.

Art junkies, must go . It's very interesting and the garden is just beautiful. Though I think it's not as well taken care as it should.
A wonderful place to be in for hours if you enjoy Rodin's work
Lacking. I love Rodin and while the exhibits offered studies and striking busts but I had hoped to see more romantic pieces similar to the ones I have seen at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in NYC.
Oh Rodin. Wonderful Museum and all in fabulous setting. Some of the sculptures are recreated more than life size in the garden, which in June is filled with gorgeous roses. Another must do.

lovely gardens. I'm not a huge Rodin fan, but I enjoyed the museum's exhibits. I especially enjoyed the gardens, with an area of cool woods at the end, a serene and quiet spot to relax in the middle of Paris.
Love Rodin. Favorite museum in Paris! All his sculptures on the grounds were amazing. The inside museum was also good. Only thing that could have made it even better was a docent.

Beautiful Setting for Many Rodin Statues. Of course, the Thinker is awesome. But there are many more, done in Rodin's style that you start to recognize. For those who have been to Oslo, Norwayand visited the spectacular Vigelund Park there, you can compare and contrast. Rodin is awesome, but he has competition.
Must see. This is one of the top class museums in Paris (right after Louvre and Musee De Orsay). Beautiful garden that features the sculptures of Rodin and audio guides were available.

Beautiful visit and gorgoeus gardens !. This is where I discovered Rodin - you'll appreciate a number of his most famous works together with some less well known sculptures and a handful of Monet's and Van Gogh's.

Great Musee!. A must see in Paris! Most of Rodin's best work is in this beautiful garden. The Musee also has many historical benchmarks around, explaining many elements of Rodin's incredible life in Paris.
A tick on my list. This was on my list of must-dos and I wasn't disappointed. The gardens are beautiful and all Rodin's works are on show.

I enjoyed his work even when I didn't understand some of it.. Rodin's work is displayed in the main museum, another building across the plaza, and throughout the extensive gardens. In my ignorance, I was surprised to find The Thinker outdoors! Not a huge museum, but plan to go slowly and spend a couple of hours. There is a cafe and ice cream in the back garden.

Certainly worth a visit. We didn't have much time to add an extra museum tour into our trip so we opted for the €1 garden option at this lovely museum. It was fabulous and we got close up to The Thinker which is sited in the grounds.There is a lovely cafe to stop at and enjoy the beautiful gardens.I'd strongly recommend a visit, even just for the gardens as there are so many important Rodin sculptures to appreciate in that setting.

For those who think like Rodin.. The highlight of this facility is the tranquil garden setting where The Thinker is displayed amidst an explosion of rose bushes. While the statues by Rodin are breath-taking, you should also take time to admire the beautiful flowers. It's a delight for art lovers and horticulturalists alike!

Garden is beautiful. I only saw the garden, I haven't gone inside the actual museum (yet!). But the gardens are beautiful! And you can see many of Rodin's works in the gardens themselves. Go on a sunny day and enjoy the roses!
Don't miss it!. Plan on spending a relaxing morning or afternoon, and bring or buy a lunch to enjoy on the beautiful grounds. Sculptures are everywhere!

The Thinker!. Our second visit here. The sculptures are as alive as they must have been when Rodin first created them. The gardens are also quite nice with pieces displayed outside. The only negative is that there is no ventilation and both times it was hot inside the museum. Made us go out to the gardens quickly!
Lovely gardens. To be honest, we're not that arty so it was probably wasted on us, but the gardens were gorgous! Lots of rose bushes, places to sit and statues like The Thinker

Visit the garden and skip the museum. Admission to the garden is only 1 euro and well worth it as this is where Le Penseur (i.e., the Thinker) is kept. There are many more sculptures scattered around as well as beautiful gardens where you could possibly enjoy a picnic on the grass.Inside, more of the same so we didn't feel the additional 5 euros for the museum were really worth it.

Stroll the gardens in awe. Our timing was perfect for this "museum" and heritage house: the flowers had just bloomed! The gardens hold many of Rodin's famous sculptures, but you won't want to miss what's held inside the studio as well. Plus the fountain and gardens out back are worth the visit -- it's such a gorgeous space.
wonderful garden. This museum was a surprise for me. The sculptures were amazing and the garden beautiful. Don't miss it.
A hidden gem. The thinker is just one of the highlights of this wonderful corner of Paris. The gardens are a real treat. The museum is well worth a few hours to relax and enjoy.

Interesting but only for devout fans. Musee Rodin would be of most interest to those very knowledgeable of art and of Rodin. For the uninformed such as me, the Rodin on display at the Musee d"Orsay was more satisfying.
Get the audio guide. The audio guide helped orient me toward Rodin's sculptures and life works. The museum is well-sized for an morning of viewing followed by a picnic lunch in the garden.

The thinker. My husband dragged me to the place. I really was hesitant to go not that I didn't want to but for the lack of time. Museums have long lines! But after a lot of convincing, I went with him. He "only" went to see "The thinker" which has a replica in Rome. There are 20 other casts made scattered perhaps around the world but this- This is the real thing , the first ever cast made by the sculptor Auguste Rodin, found in Paris. And for us, that was worth it:) Need I say more?
Just exactly the same as in "Midnight in Paris". spend a lovely sunny afternoon walking around , a prefect place to go if you are intersted in Rodin.

Excellent Museum. It's not big in size like d'Orsay, but great place to spend a few hours inside. I especially love the back garden where you can just sit down and enjoy some lovely sunshine, truly an oasis in the city centre.
Exquisite. A well-planned museum featuring Rodin's pieces.Beautiful, charming and tranquil gardensDo not miss the Gates of Hell
Spring and summer must do.... Charming oasis...not to be missed. The gardens are beautiful with majestic views of other important city monuments.

Gorgeous grounds, go on a sunny day. The gardens are really impressive, I'd suggest savings this place for nice weather so you can enjoy it. Unlike the ridiculously packed Lourve, there is enough room here that you can walk around without being swamped by crowds of people. Excellent Paris art experience.
Had to see "The Thinker". It was very inexpensive to visit the gardens which is where the thinker statue is found. So glad we popped in for a very brief visit.

I love this museum and its gardens!. I have visited this museum on the beautiful rue Varenne many times. It is large enough to house many works of art but small enough not to be exhausting. And the gardens comprise an outdoor museum. Indeed, The Thinker is outside as is The Gates of Hell.

Even during remodeling, the gardens are worth the visit.. Though the main museum was closed for remodeling, we were very happy that we decided to spend an hour walking the grounds and visiting The Thinker, The Burden, The Gates of Hell, Balzac with Les Invalides in the background...and many more impressive works by Rodin. The Kiss is on display at l'Orangerie, if you are disappointed that it's not on the grounds at Musee Rodin.

small, beautiful gardens, mansion all great. housed in the mansion that he lived in - a small well focused collection. If you love the story of Rodin and Camille - then go.. you can see her sculptures as well.
Interesting. OK, I love Rodin, from the Stanford University Rodin Garden to the Musee Rodin in Paris, Truly Amazing!!! The rose gardens were in bloom and almost out did the ART!
Favorite Museum. This is my favorite museum in Paris. It is off the beaten path and the outside grounds/sculptures are fabulous

Up close and personal. It was so amazing to walk amongst the original Rodin statues and even have the ability to touch them (it's forbidden of course!). Surprisingly uncrowded (although it was winter when we were there) but even during the rest of the year there should be room to enjoy all the Rodin pieces in the gorgeous garden outside. A real education!

Gates of Hell. If you're a fan of Rodin, come to this museum; it has the best cast of the Gates of Hell I've ever seen, and has a wonderful garden. It was under construction while we were there so we didn't get the full effect, but still lovely.

The best of Rodin. This museum is housed in the building where Rodin lived and worked. It's very close to the Varenne Metro, so convenient to reach, near Napoleon's tomb. Many of his best works are on display, and the garden contains some of his masterpieces, such as the Thinker, the Burghers of Calais, and the Gates of Hell. You can take photos (no flash) both indoors and outside. I think it's one of the best museums in Paris, but then I think Rodin was one of the world's great sculpters. You'll discover that he also worked in other mediums.

Great to Have a Park Plus a Museum. What's unique about this museum is that it is a park plus a museum in one. The grounds are beautifully manicured, and there is also interesting famous artwork on-site. In that way, it appeals to people who like museums as well as people who prefer parks. Interesting place to walk around and check out. And fun to recognize some famous pieces!
The Thinker. Worth a quick visit, but the Thinker is the most well know of the sculptures here. Would not give up another attraction for this one.
The Thinker. What can be more fun than touring thru Rodin's home and gardens, surrounded by his fabulous art. Incredible few hours in the heart of Paris.

Excellent small museum without the crowds. Delightful contrast to the usual Paris tourist site. The gardens and grounds were beautiful in early spring, and the collection was easily viewed within an hour or so. It is certainly a bonus to have much of the collection housed in an authentic period structure, and emphasis on Rodin's relation to other artists was a special feature. Additionally, there is very easy access to the Metro.
ONE OF MY FAVE MUSEUMS IN PARIS. Loved loved loved the sculptures, both inside the museum and in the gardens. Don't miss this easy to find and easy to tour museum. So much loveliness.

visit to musee Rodin. Visited here in May, weather warm and sunny, so walked around garden first - lots of things to see here too. The museum is small and so takes less time to go round than Musee d'Orsay but with fabulours sculptures such as The Kiss and The Thinker, for me it was just as good and with the added attraction of the garden
A great experience. The walk through the gardens is wonderful and there is so much to see.

A secret delight. The Rodin museum and garden is tucked behind a wall giving no hint of its interesting interior. The museum is easy to walk around to see the exhibits and the garden is delightul. It was lovely to walk the garden paths to enjoy the plants and the many scuptures including The Thinker.

Lovely and a managable size. I loved Musee Rodin. The gardens are incredibly beautiful, the sculpture its self is obviously amazing, and the building that it is in is charming and not too overwhelmingly large. A perfect museum that you can see all of in one visit.

Highlight of the trip!. This is one of the highlights of our trip to Paris! We did not actually even go in the museum. For 1 euro you get access to the gardens and they are spectacular! You could spend hours walking around the gardens and sculptures and even have lunch at the cafe. This is absolutely not to be missed!

Suprisingly Rude. I had other titles in mind but tried to tame it down. The Gardens were everything I expected, so Paris and sculptures with such amazing facial expressions. Then we waited in line for inside the museum and were suprised by the interesting positions naked girls were posed in his drawings.The first couple I thought, hmmm that's creative, artistic but after walls and walls covered with upside girls with hands on and in their "Pudendra" (so the works were titled). I'd never heard of the word before. Funny, I had to rush my tween boys through especially when it got to girls with girls in pictures. My husband and I have been laughing about some of the Titles we came up with for this review, you can imagine! How come no-one else has mentioned this???

Better than Expected. I didn't expect a whole lot from this museum, other than seeing the Thinker, but I was pleasantly surprised. The grounds are excellent, well maintained and laid out, and there are so many flowers! The Thinker itself can be viewed and photographed from a variety of angles and you can incorporate Les Invalides or the Eiffel Tower in the background. The outdoor and indoor displays are both excellent and there is a nice cafe on site. I would put it high on the list of "places to see in Paris".
Blissful garden. Amazing sculptures set in a fabulous garden, a must see!
Worth the visit. Beautiful artwork, especially The Thinker! We enjoyed walking around the grounds of this historic place.
Museum pass works here. Right across the street from Nepolian's tomb, this gem is worth the visit and the macorons at the cafe were grand
Excellent!!. Please visit this place, Rodin was a big artist and I had enjoyed very much

Wonderful to visit. We went on Sunday, since it was free, and, although crowded, had a great time viewing Rodin's work. I wish we'd gotten the tour headphones! There were great explanations in the booklet you received, but we didn't know what we were looking at in the gardens, which was disappointing. Caught a nice lunch in the cafe, which is in the garden. Don't miss this opportunity to see Rodins' famous works!
Interesting sculptures and nice/tasty cafeteria. The museum contains both inside and outside sculptures. We stopped at their restaurant and it was a nice surprise.

Go for the Garden. Let me start by saying that I really don't like stuffy museums. For 1 euro you can spend as much time as you want in the garden of this museum. It's filled with statues, including "The Thinker", and you can get a good taste for his work and style without having to go through the whole museum, which I understand is amazing, but not for me. The gardens in May are adorned with roses and there are quiet and shady spots to sit and contemplate.

one place aside from the louve you should not miss. forget the louve and go straight to this place......it a life and death situation as the gates of hell is waiting for you. Its a small museum but the impact to the mind is a wonder you will never forget. The sculpture is superb, the presentation quaint, the garden, beautiful......the gates of hell....worth seeing.....!!!!!!!

Rodin and the gardens. I love the roses blooming at the front of the house and the park-like feeling of the sculpture gardens. Wandering outside is probably my favorite part. They have added seating toward the back so a person can truly relax while enjoying the surroundings. You can also grab a snack or light lunch at the garden pavillion cafe. The sculptures are varied and enticing and there's a room dedicated to my favorite sculptor: Camille Claudel. I find her sculptures absolutely enchanting. She worked with Rodin and learned from him.
Sculpture at its best. Rodin is a superb sculptor and his mistress Camille Claudel is also outstanding. Their work never ceases to amaze me.

A joyous day combining the best of Paris art with the best garden in Paris. You must not miss this option - you can spend a whole day here picnic-ing in the most bueatiful garden with the best garden sculpture you can imagine plus blow your socks off with the most wonderful museam building chock full of incredible exhibits - just heaven.
LOVE the grounds. I visited on a rainy day and had most of the outside grounds to myself. The water really made the details of the sculptures come alive.
Average Musee. Nothing special but the garden was wonderful.. Its on the Invalides boulevard, if you go there may be you can go...

Under Construction but still was worth the time. When we visited, there was a lot of renovations taking place, and areas that were closed off, but the gardens were open. In addition to the gardens, they had a temporary exhibit of Rodin's sketch work with an emphasis on nudes, that was amazing. The artwork in the gardens was impressive, but the centerpiece, the Thinker, was set a ways back from the temporary renovation barricades, so we couldn't get as close to it as we'd have liked, but it was still a very enjoyable and enlightening 90 minutes.

Don't go now. Under construction.. Although the essential work is still there, the museum is under construction. The gardens are lovely and the food at the small cafe is above par. In the museum, however, the pieces are too close together to really appreciate them. Everything should be up and running in 2014.
Amazing museum. Great combination of not-too-large museum with an excellent exposition and a great garden
The Master. Definitely check it out. Can see everything in about 2 hours. Relaxing garden. Incredible, visionary, unique sculptures.

Fantastic museum. Verdant parklike grounds. Enjoy.. Of course you will expect to see great and massive sculpture. You will not be disappointed. But you will also see paintings and other Rodin artworks. Take time to roam the grounds which have lovely seating areas, walks for strolling, and lovely flowering gardens. Excellent.

My favorite Museum in Paris. This lovely museum offers a personal look at Rodin's work and his life. The indoor collection, housed in the building in which he once lived, is organized by the phases of his life and you can see his progression as well as pieces that reflect his life at the time. There were even pieces by his mistress/girlfriend depicting their relationship, which we found very interesting. The sculpture is beautiful and it is displayed in a way that makes you feel like you are getting a peek at Rodin's life. The gardens are amazingly beautiful and offer a little retreat right in the middle of Paris. There are beautiful flowers, water fountains, and of course, sculptures, all throughout the garden. I could sit there for hours. But, if you are short on time, this is a Museum that you can see and thoroughly enjoy in 1-2 hours. It is included in the Paris Museum Pass and is located right next to Napolean's Tomb. The Varenne metro stop is the closest to the Museum.
Interesting museum. A little too crowded but it was a Sunday. The gardens are beautiful.
Fabulous museum. We found the size of the museum delightful and the lack of organised tours while we visited a real plus. The Rodin works are outstanding and the garden was a real highlight.
Very nice museum. Place of the impressive Le Penser and "The Gates of Hell" outside on the grounds.

The gardens!. This inexpensive museum has a fantastic collection of Rodin, Camille Claudel, and related works. The gardens are especially beautiful with their lush rose gardens, large sculptures, and calming fountains and greenery. A must-see!
very nice secluded museum. in a quiet house, great garden, very romantic museum, souvenir shop not too good.

Great way to spend hours in an outdoor museum. The first work you see as you enter the garden is his Le Penseur, his most well known piece. The others are as impressive laid out in a garden setting. What a way to spend hours outside on a sunny day. We had lunch at the self serve restaurant which offered a good choice of well prepared salads, not surprising for Paris. It"s also just next to Les Invalides so you can do both on the same day.
Awe inspiring. One of the best museums in Paris. Beautiful gardens and amazing Rodin's collection.

A secluded garden oasis in the city. My wife and I visited the Musee Rodin on our last day in Paris. By this time we were weary from walking and wanted a good place to relax a bit. We spent time mainly in the garden rather than the museum. The garden is beautiful, lined with trees and roses, and houses the Thinker and Gates of Hell statues along with many others. There is also a small cafe located in the shade. This was one of our favorite places during the trip.

MY favorite of Paris!!. The most surprising thing for me was the fact that I had visited over 15 museums in 10 days and this by far was my most favorite. Absolutely beautiful, the collection is small compared to the bigger museums obviously but what a great way to spend the morning/afternoon!

Great museum. Not only do you get to see a good selection of Rodin's work as a sculpture but also his paintings along with several of Van Gogh's paintings. After a leisure visit through the museum we visited the gardens which are beautifully landscaped especially with the roses in full bloom. The giant sculptures of "The Thinker", "Balzac" and "The Gates of Hell" among others are situated around the gardens with plenty of seating to just sit and contemplate.A cool respite in the center of the bustling city.

My Personal Favorite!. The layout of this museum is fabulous and must be seen in the warmer months preferably in the spring or early summer to fully appreciate the property. The sculptures are located within the gardens and it makes for an incredible experience, visit the cafe have a beer, a baguette and feed the birds. You will thoroughly enjoy yourself here. You need 1/2 a day to appreciate the museum.

Excellent museum. This museum incorporates both indoor and outdoor exhibits located in a hotel that Rodin once lived in. The indoor traces his artistic career with excellent examples of his work. An English brochure gives a detailed description of the tour. The outdoors has many of his famous bronze statues including The Thinker in a park-like setting. A great museum worthy of a visit.

Rodin's Masterpieces. The line up was very small as we went early in the day. Very easy to find. The exhibits were great, we saw The Gates of Hell, The Thinker, The Hands, Burghers of Calais and other pieces out in the garden. There was a little restaurant there with a beautiful landscaped garden. We took our time and really enjoyed it and we were there for maybe 2 hours......you could do this museum with the L'Orangerie easily in one day.

I've seen gates of hell and it was beautiful.. Amazing how to see a great artist like Rodin, on his journey to mastery. Amazing collections, amazing garden.Must see: The thinker, The kiss, The gates of hell.
Will be great when it's finished. But still breathtaking. Pretty good audio guide. Jardin is very fine, with a good cafe

Wonderful venue for Rodin's collection. Unlike the Louvre, which is overwhelming, Musee Rodin is a manageable and lovely museum exhibiting Rodin's own collection. There are gardens and wonderful works of art, including some art by Van Gogh. Highly recommended.

Gardens at the Rodin - Fabulous. Touring the garden of the Musee Rodin is a lovely respite from the hoards at the Louvre and the Orsay. The sculpture is phenomenal, the gardens beautiful, and the atmosphere tranquil. The museum itself can be skipped.

Favourite place in Paris. This is my absolute favourite museum in Paris. The selection of art is, predictably, fantastic, but the rose garden is the best part. On a sunny, quiet weekday afternoon, there is no better place to be. I would recommend going alone so that you can take your time if you're a garden person. It's so calm that it might be lost on you if you go with a chatty companion.
The Thinker. This is worth it just to go and see the Thinker if nothing else
Nice museum. If you are under 26 is free ;) Make sure you are from the EU though.

See the Gardens. If you want a quiet, lush place to hang out for an hour, you have to visit the Gardens at the Rodin Museum. The price is only about one Euro and you can see The Thinker and many other pieces of artwork. The fountain area is especially beautiful. If you want to spend more time and money, visit the Chateau.

How did he do it?. Visiting this museum gives you a sensation of awe. How can someone acheive such perfection?If, as Edison said, genius is 10 % inspiration and 90 % perspiration I rate Auguste Rodin at 200 % because I could certainly build the sweat but never the genius. Artists are certainly Humanity's gift to itself...they renew your values of beauty and well being.
Rodin's gardens. Really enjoyed strolling around the beautiful gardens and viewing the great works of Rodin - especially "The Thinker" - amazing.
Probably one of my favorites!. The museum is under renovation so all works are not available for viewing but what I saw was fantastic!

a must for art and garden lovers. One of my favorite sites. Museum undergoing renovation so "hotel" partially open in April. Magic is outside, much bigger than I expected. pack a picnic lunch and relax and enjoy the gardens. Most of statues you are familiar with are outside in the garden. Excellent info about origins of museum and history of Rodin also outside.

The perfect place for a snack.... We were so pleased to find such a charming and peaceful little cafe in the beautiful gardens of Musee Rodin. Do not usually enjoy museum cafes, due to their institutional atmosphere, but this one was simply perfect for a light lunch in the lovely gardens.

Surprising gem. Stumbled across this museum. Had no plan to visit it but was very pleasantly surprised. The garden is gorgeous and well maintained. Restaurant in garden great variety for mall place. Competitive prices
Beautiful home and garden. Already a fan, this was on the can't miss list. Great comprehensive collection, and garden.
Well worth a visit. Beautiful museum full of Rodin's work, made even more interesting in that it's his old home too. Defnitely worth visiting.

A wonderful setting for such magical works of art. A beautiful and typical old home with magnificent gardens serve as the setting for the majestic works of Rodin. From the Thinker, pondering in the garden, to the many other sculptures of Rodin which are placed in a very natural setting, you will enjoy the work of this great master in the manner in which they were expected. It is quite easy to get to in the heart of Paris and is a quiet setting as well to enjoy a good book or simply to stroll the gardens.
Don't get the hype around this. Not sure why you'd want to pay money to see the same thing over and over again. Also, I'm sure I've seen some of those sculptures in other galleries around the world.
MMMmmmm. Like the house, love the garden, admire the sculptor and realy adore the whole of it all. A great athmosphere overall. Want to touch it all.

Exceptional grounds. I must admit, we didn't even make it inside. We were enjoying the grounds far too much to go indoors. The exterior of the building is beautiful. The sculptures in the gardens are lovely and peaceful.
I can only imagine the inside is just as good.

Very romantic gardens. I went here as part of our honey moon trip. The gardens are gorgeous and very romantic. Rodin is an extraordinary artist. We had such a peaceful, romantic stroll through the garden.
Peaceful, not crowded. No lines, no school children, excellent food, lovely garden, excellent collection. Highly recommended.

Wonderful display of Sculpture. This museum may be out of the way but it is not to crowded and provides a good display of Rodin's work. The indoor sculptures are in a temporary setting but still easy to view. The outside gardens are nicely out with trees, flowers and hedges and the sculptures are nicely placed.
A DELIGHT. Rodin was prolific in his work--many are in this building--quite impressive--when there go across the street and visit Napoleon's Tomb at the Les Invalides--the sculptures fo together

A must. We arrived early just as the museum opened at 10am which meant that it wasn't too crowded. The gardens are a special feature (indeed if you haven't much time you can simply go into the garden for 1eu) and it is wonderful to see the iconic The Thinker with the golden dome of Les Invalides behind. Inside the well-labelled works are arranged chronologically and of course it's a thrill to see the famous ones as well as others (and Rodin's paintings) that weren't familiar to us.

a museum in a garden. Walking through this garden and observing Rodin's sculpture is an experience. Get the audioguide and listen to the stories behind his works---the Burghers of Calais---gets you thinking about our politicians today---Have a glass of wine in the garden. Well worth the 1 euro for admission.

His work is magnificent, the true heir of Michelangelo. If you don't respond to Rodin's art, you are dead. And to experience in his very own home, with all his roses blooming their hearts out, well, it don't get a lot better than this. Even with a few rain drops. The only downer were the three million school children crowding most of us others out. Still, a stunner of a museum.

The Rodin gardens and museum.. We spent quite a while at the Rodin museum. It was raining the day we went, so we spent a long time seeing all the sculptures by Rodin. The Kiss and the Burghers of Calais are my favorites! We walked around the gardens (Woody Allen's Midnight in Paris), which were beautiful even in the rain!

Breathtaking. Never mind the house itself, put aside an afternoon to wander the beautifully kept gardens and stand in front of genuine masterpieces. The Thinker (La Pensee) is a highlight, but for me, the 'Gates' had me standing mesmerised for a long time.

Under construction while we were there. The gardens were open but the inside portion of the museum was closed for construction. The gardens were nice and we enjoyed seeing the sculptures. There is a excellent place to take a picture of the sculptures with the Eiffel tower in the background.
Worth the visit.. The gardens are a Bo us when you visit this museum. The sculptures are surrounded by natural beauty to enhance. the thinker is truly a site to see.

Wonderful. Certainly my favourite art museum in Paris, and one of my favourite in the world.
You of course need to appreciate the work of Rodin, but the stunning gardens and mansion-turned-museum are best visited on a beautiful sunny day. (Have you ever felt conflicted about visiting a museum but missing the sunshine? Here's your answer.)

Nice, but no lift.. One of the lifts was out of order, and from what I heard its been like that for a while. The lines were crazy long, even the lines that you have to walk up 700 steps, to get to the lift were long.
We still enjoyed seeing it from below, and from the great lawn.
Favorite museum in Paris. What a little bit of heaven. Small, mostly a sculpture park, but magnificent.
Just the gardens. Lovely place to visit on a sunny day. Beautiful sculpture and setting.
Good but a bit repetitive. Loved the pieces and how they are arranged but my husband got bored after a few rooms and tugged on me to finish up.
Beautiful gardens, fountains, and outdoor sculpture.. Inside is a marvel or beauty. Enjoyed this museum very much. Was here on a previous visit.

If you are short on time. This is a great little museum that is not a huge drain on your time. We were with our teenage daughter and even she enjoyed the gardens and sculptures and the fact that we didn't have to spend hours visiting.
Love of Roses. The roe garden here is one of the prettiest in Paris. the statues are awsum.

A beautiful combination of museum and gardens.. This little musuem captures the essence of Rodin's work a in a beautiful setting. The interior is presently undergoing renovations but that does not interfere with the enjoyment. The gardens and statuary are very impressive and should not be missed.

just beautiful. This museum is a must see. We were enthralled with the outdoor gardens, pristine and in bloom, with the awesome sculptures in and around, including The Thinker. Inside the lovely museum, once called home to Rodin, holds the inspiring The Kiss....what an moment when you behold this beautiful piece! We were able to enjoy this museum with their audio tour in several hours. As well, it is around the corner from Invalides, which can be seen on the same day. Don't miss these places!

Le Penseur warms my heart!. I first saw Le Penseur in 1969 and have seen this wonderful sculpture a couple of times since. The gallery has character and style and the works of Rodin warm the heart. Moses and Le Pieta two wonderful examples........ A left bank gem!!!! PoittyaboutParis Sydney

Rodin in the Garden. The statues in the garden setting really allow one to fully see these great works of art. Rodin is more than just The Thinker. This museum gardens are beautiful and serene, which really helps one to spend time studying and reflecting on the statues. The house has paintings and the small study statues that came before the large works that are displayed elsewhere. A good place to really understand this great artist.Purchase a museum pass, which is good at most of the major museums. It will save you time as passholders bypass all lines.

Beauty and and a tortured artist. The Rodin Museum is spectacular with regard to how many pieces they display. All truly amazing, intricate, loaded with passion. The Camille Claudel rooms almost made me cry. The grounds are also worth the price of admission. Roses! Fountains! Delight!!
Best of the best. Great parks and the best Rodin sculptures, including the "door of the Hell" and many sketches for very famous sculptures
great art, wonderfully exhibited. The museum and the garden are stunningly beautiful. It allows that the art of the great sculptor captivates you.
Incredible. To see so many masterpieces all together was so good...and it's not a huge place to wander around, so you can take the time to enjoy each piece
More than the thinker!. A wonderfully relaxinG place to wander in it he centre of Paris on a sunny afternoon for fans of Rodin and his marvelous works.

More to this than the famous pose. I really enjoyed Mussee Rodin and was amazed of how little
i knew of him and his work, its a delightfull place full of magnificent
sculptural work, this is a must visit and more intimate than
Louvre,and has a nice garden too
Clive Dublin
special unique experience. special energy in the place, bought tea and a bun and sat in the gardens just soaking it all up. lovely retreat from the city
Fun. Great place to quickly stop by and see the great work of Rodin.
beautiful!. The garden is gorgeous, and the Thinker is well worth the visit itself!
Stop thinking about it and go. GREAT sculpture garden. A must see. Clerks in the gift shop are "witchy".

Favorite gardens. If you have the Museum pass the Rodin is of course included, but even if you don't, just go and stroll through the gardens, where many of the sculptures are presented in large form. This museum is a treasure. If you are in Paris for romance these sculptures are like foreplay!
The gardens or the Muse'. If you only want to see the gardens, the price is only a few Euro's. A wonderful little cafe' in the garden on the west side. Decent prices also.
Beautiful gardens, beautiful sculptures. Wonderful museum. Amazing art work. Try to visit in nice weather so you can fully appreciate the gardens.

Beautiful, peaceful gardens and a lovely, small museum. If you have spent time in the Louvre, the Musee d'Orsay, and other large museums, you'll be glad to come to this small and manageable collection housed in a former home, surrounded by beautiful gardens filled with sculptures. The Rodin collection is large and mostly donated by his family, but since the museum is dedicated almost solely to one artist (along with a few pieces by his apprentice) it is manageable to see in an hour or two. Relaxing in the gorgeous gardens afterward, and strolling around to see the many sculptures displayed outdoors makes for an enjoyable afternoon or (on Wednesdays only) evening. This museum was featured in the movie "Midnight in Paris" with then first lady Carla Bruni acting as museum guide to Owen Wilson and Rachel McAdams and friends.Only 6 euro for admission.

Fabulous surprise. It's right next to the Invalides. It's very reasonable to get in and you can pay just 1 euro to only go to the gardens. Those gardens are gorgeous and very peaceful with beautiful sculptures.
Fantastic. Such a relaxing place. Rodin's work is my absolute favourite, the mansion and gardens are the perfect place to showcase his masterpieces. The Thinker is beautiful beyond description.
Small but powerful.. It's a quiet, respite, this small special museum fled with Rodin. Take your time and relax there.
The Thinker. Lots of Rodin's work. The Thinker and The Kiss are prime.

never too late. After a few trips to Paris, I decided to go to Rodin museum, it was magnificent, I went early in the morning, opens at 9;30 am, and had the hold place almost to myself, and what a place, Situated next to the Invalids, the museum is a mansion with many of Rodin best sculptures placed in the garden including The Thinker, inside the mansion there are many other sculptures of smaller size and a few paintings of famous painters including Van Gogh and Renoir.It is a very relaxing experience and you can sit down on a bench at the garden, and just admired your favorite sculptures at you leisure.Do not miss it.
lovely gardens. a great afternoon to stroll around some amazing art pieces

Must See. The Musee Rodin is a gem. You don't want to miss the gardens or the contents of the large house. I think that every major work by Rodin is present. My personal favorite was the "Gates of Hell" wall. If you go you should go the small restaurant within the garden. It was the most relaxing lunch my wife and I enjoyed while in Paris and it was very quiet and serene. The salad and sandwich was excellent as well. I highly recommend it.

The Thinker.. Worth it for the Thinker. One of the most recognizable peices of artwork. We had the museum pass which I would highly recommend as you can skip many of the ques. The Thinker was the main thing for us there and worth seeing.
The Gardens are Spectacular. For just a couple dollars you can spend the afternoon with Rodin's sculptures in a magnificent garden in Paris.
Using the Museum Pass. The art, house and gardens are all worthwhile. There is only one small entrance, but you can just go to the head of the line if you have a Museum Pass.
Love, love, love!!. Amazing, and so beautiful! One of my favorite museums. Easy layout and incredibly beautiful gardens.
Worth a visit. A worthwhile place to visit. Interesting works in a natural setting.

Crazy about Rodin. Have been here before - this time it was different as smoe changes are in progress. The rooms were by date/phase of this life, and even included Van Gogh paintings and other non-Rodin work. I liked the sculpture gardens better than the interiors, though the house itself is quite interesting. I missed the workshop items from my last prior visit - not there any more?: hands and feet - hundreds of these - all kinds of bits and pieces from works in progress. Too bad workshop items are no longer on display
Beautiful sculptors! Don't miss it!. Beautiful sculptors! just go there to see the beautiful gardens including the famous thinking man! do not miss this place in Paris!!!

No need to think about it, just do it. An outstanding museum to visit as there is so much to see about this great man's work. Obviously everyone goes to see his Thinker but the rest of his work is also superb. The actual property is beautiful and the gardens alone are worth a visit
GREAT!. This was by far my favorite museum! What a wonderful setting for such beautiful sculptures. This is a must see while in Paris!

What a great little place!. This is a visit well worth your time if you enjoy Rodin's work. There are wonderful pieces of art inside the small building, an excellent, tasteful selection of items available for purchase in the shoppe, and the gardens outside house the famous Burgers of Calais and The Thinker, among others. Inexpensive at only six euros, and so worth it.
Wonderful museum. You can't go here and not visit the Rodin. Several years later, I visited the campus of Stamford University that has a Rodin garden.

A must see, even if you don't like sculpture. This visit we paid for the headsets and gained much more out of the visit than we did 10 years earlier. Make sure you visit all the garden too. Don't rush round, but the museum is small and compact so it won't take up much time but you won't be disappointed....if you invested in the headsets....otherwise you won't get the most out of his works

Great to see the Thinker. We went on the first Sunday and it was a little busy but well worth the wait to see some of the most well know sculptures. Great walks around the garden and also to see "the kiss" in the exhibition. Building is being renovated but well done.
A GREAT MUSEUM. To walk through the gardens and see Rodin's great works such as The Thinker and the Gates of Hell is truely impressive.

A must, even if just for the free gardens and sculptures. Rodin is the preeminent scluptor of modern times and the museum is a definite must. If you're on a budget and can't afford one more entrance fee, stroll through the free gardens, which has many sculptures, including on of The Thinker's and The Gates of Hell (by the rose garden). (Or better yet, buy either the Paris Museum Pass or the Paris Museum Pass and Travelcard combo. http://parispass.com/how-it-works/compare-paris-pass.html?aid=25&gclid=CPjdvPW57K8CFaUZQgodK3mZ0Q

Visitor beware. the "hotel" is under currently under renovation and only half in use so you won't see what's described in many guide books. the 1 e ticket for the gardens, however, is a steal. the setting is lovely and contains the big draws.

A.k.a. the Secret Garden. This is a fantastic museum set in a lovely garden, near Les Invalides, with tons of sculpture works by the great Rodin. Makes you feel as if you are in the Secret Garden with all the pathways, trees, and beautiful flowers. Definitely go here!

Simply beautiful. The gardens of the Musée Rodin are definitely the highlight of the museum. If you're looking for The Kiss (Le Baiser), it isn't here -- you'll have to visit Musée L'Orangerie for that one. The Thinker is here and is massive! The indoor museum was less appealing to us but you can go through it quickly.

Art at it's most Beautiful.. I have been to the Rodin museum 3 times by now. Every visit has been breathtaking.The museum is filled with sculptures, paintings, sketches. The highlight for everyone seemed to be 'The Kiss' but I got more awed by 'The Eternal Idol' and 'The Gates of Hell' in the garden. The house is majestic, old and gorgeous, like only European houses can be. It houses an impressive staircase and has huge windows that let the light shine in on the art. From one room you slide into the other, continued to be amazed by such beauty surrounding you. We didn't take the guided tour, prefer to explore by ourselves. The garden is very well kept, filled with plenty of art (including 'The Thinker'), overgrown walls, sitting chairs and benches and a big pond. We were lucky to have been there on a sunny day. You may use your camera in the museum, so be sure to bring it along, you'll want to shoot. You can't use your flash and some of the works can't be photographed. None the less, i had a field trip with my camera. Pre-booking is a must, especially in season. It gets quite busy!Another plus, located in a great area next to Les Invalides.

Worth a visit.. We went to the museum just because it was close to our hotel. We were a bit awed to find "The Thinker" sitting out in front for us to look at as long as we wanted to (we enjoyed seeing it in Woody Allen's movie) The museum is a very attractive house with sculptures , a lage pond and sculptures in the pretty back garden. We actually knew very little about Rodin except his most famous sculptures, so it was enjoyable to learn more about him and his life and work. I'n not positive about the "attractons" below--too busy looking to notice.

UGG!! Bad part of Town!. We started there for a walking tour of the artists hangouts. Not a nice part of town. If I had not been with my husband, don't think I would have stayed. A real tourist trap. Cheesy to say the least!

I loved it!. It is not crowded (at least at 10:30), it is a beautiful house with a beautiful garden full of sculptures and paintings. I had a guided tour in german, which I enjoyed very much and I was able to understand Rodin's most popular works (like the kiss, the thinker, the civilians of Calais, the cathedral and the secret...). For me a must see, in a beautiful area, next to Les Invalides, Pont Alexandre III...
spring holiday. Lovely house and gardens, with an amzing range of different statues, many duplicate of different works. Good to pre-book

Peaceful reflection. So many lovely sculptures to find and appreciate amongst the lovely gardens. Try and visit here on a sunny day (we were unfortunately there on a rainy day not expecting most of the exhibits to be outdoors).

Great Garden Museum. While the indoors part of this museum is OK the outside garden is beautiful and makes for a wonderful exhibition of Rodin's work. The sheer size of the sculptures in the outdoor setting makes for a very different and inspiring experience.
Must see. In my opinion more important than waiting in line to go up to the 2nd level of the Eiffel Tower.

Better when it's warm. It was cold and rainy when we visited Musee Rodin which certainly curtailed the outdoor portion. The museum itself was okay but things were a bit forced in their presentation. We probably wouldn't have visited if we didn't have a museum pass (highly recommended). I am admittedly not a huge Rodin fan but the museum lacked the ambiance and care that some of the more well known museums have. You could tell the outdoor gardens will be beautiful when it warms up but the rain kept us out.

Not to be missed. This mansion was built for a WIG MAKER in 1730...do you believe? In 1919 it became a museum. Sculptures that Rodin left to the nation are abundant. You will enjoy seeing The Kiss and The Thinker, busts of Mahler and Victor Hugo and works by Renoir, Monet and Van Gogh. You will even get to see Rodin's furniture and antiques. Do not miss the exceptional gardens and enjoy the cafe for a real treat.
Nice Museum. The garden is wonderful. It wasn't crowded at all and made the viewing of the sculptures that much better. You could really get up close.
Dont miss the house. get a guide to explain the garden and when and why the bronzes were done..BUT do not miss the interior of the house..

Right across the street from Invalides. My husband wanted to tour the military museum at the Invalides a second time, so my daughter and I went to the Rodin museum across the street. She was free. I had a Museum Pass. What I enjoyed most was seeing the different versions of a sculpture Rodin tried before settling on a final pose. A nice place to sit outside too. Great view of the dome of the Invalides.

do not miss the garden. this museum has just reopened and is still working on the kinks but has great narrative in each room to illuminate Rodin's life and works. The garden is not to be missed and the little cafe there is a nice respite for your feet
Nice works, and not too busy. Well worth a visit, and the nice garden and cafe are a haven away from the crowds.

A Gem in the City Center. Well worth the wait in line on the Rue Varenne. The line might seem long, but it moves very quickly. The museum also happens to be right across the street from Les Invalides. Inside are the treasures of Rodin's contribution to Art: "The Gates of Hell", "The Thinker", and "Eternal Idol" to name just a few. Camille Claudel is hidden amongst Rodin's works, so be on the lookout. There is usually a more contemporary exhibit as well. There is a lot too appreciate inside and outside the museum.The artwork is not all. This "hôtel particulier" on the Rue Varenne is fantastically preserved—imagine being driven up to the front doors in a carriage—the splendour of the ancien régime. The 18th century French garden is a delight in which to stroll. And, afterwards, why not have lunch at the café in the gardens?
A must see in Paris. Gorgeous museum and easily done in 1-2 hours combined with D'Orsay or Invalides. Great audio tour and fascinating sculpture in gorgeous setting
