Peaceful Gardens. This was one of the best musuems we visited. We were unlucky that we visited Paris during a one day Museum workers strike (made for an interesting day!) If we had not had our museum pass we would have waited in line for HOURS. Luckily they lifted the strike and we bypassed the line. This was one of my favorite museums we visited. It was a really chilly day but the gardens we so beautiful and serene. It was not on the top of my list of places to visit but I would return for sure if we visited Paris again.
Beautiful gardens. Truly incredible. The gardens are so beautiful in spring. I have seen many Rodin pieces in past but seeing so many all in one place is a whole different experience. Don't miss it.

Little gem hidden away.. The gardens where beautiful the meuseum quite intersting in a lovely building.However what let this museum down where the staff. They didn't care a fig about the visitors. The lady who took our tickets jsut sat on her chair ripped the ticket and pushed it back into my hand. The lady behind the desk was quite rude to a visitor when she asked to leave her bag. We wanted to know about the history of the house, but had to wait while she and a colleague had a joke and a laugh before telling me she was to busy to go into the history of the building and suggested I buy a book! Then immediately went back to her conversation with her colleague. Two or three people around me found it quite surprising with me. Frankly I was disgusted. But didn't let it put me off this lovely museum.
You should visit it. If you heard about " Thinker" and would like to see the beautifull and romantic garden in the middle of the city......I know the way...Musee Rodin!

a must. one of the most impressive exhibitions of sculpture I've ever experienced. You could check out http://www.musee-rodin.fr/ before you go, or else just go and be amazed. I will resist turning this review into a poor attempt at an art lesson - but the Burghers of Calais demonstrate emotion beyond dispair. There are works outside in the gardens and in the main building.In the main building there are works by Camille Claudel as well as Rodin - and maybe this is the opportunity to discover just how important Camille Claudel really is/was.A great day out

Worth the trip to see the Thinker if you have the Museum Pass. We went to the Musee Rodin specifically to see the Thinker. There is a great photo op to get a shot of the Thinker with the Eiffel Tower and the Hotel de Invalides in the background. The rest of the museum was just OK. I was more impressed by the building that housed the sculptures than the sculptures themselves. There was a nice garden area with a pretty fountain to walk around.

Peaceful Museum. We visited this place on the first sunny afternoon in Paris and the gardens were just lovely and felt good to sit with the sun on your face. The only down side was a man walking in the Museum and laughing uncontrollably and approaching tourists and the staff did not seem to care.

Go on a sunny day and enjoy the garden. A charming small museum in a beautiful old house, if you like Rodin a must. One of special things is the garden which has statues by Rodin as you would expect but also benches and shade and is a lovely quiet retreat if you are visiting in the summer

museum boredom!!. how cool would an outside museum be after walking in hours of disney/tourist lines???!!!??? check out the rodin for the thinker with the tower in the background, but closely examine the gates of hell, because your cousin is in there. nice!!!

Beautiful Sculpture, Tranquil Setting. Two sorts of visitors will find the Museum of Rodin's sculptures worth a visit. In the first category are those who love art and who love sculpture. But the museum is set in the most beautiful gardens, a repose of tranquility amid the noise and bustle of Paris, complete with arching trees, a lake, places to sit and a small but good cafe. At the front door you can buy tickets for either the gardens only, or the gardens and the museum, so take your pick. Either way you won't regret it.

This facility needs an upgrade. Lots of works by the famous sculptor. Yes, you can see The Thinker, The Kiss and Gates of Hell displayed within the museum and garden. The museum is in bad need of renovation, especially evidenced by pieces of plywood screwed to the floor to cover defects (but create trip hazards), cracking plaster and stonework, etc.
Beautiful place. Do go - the gardens are so beautiful - it is an amazing place and well worth a visit
Take time to absorb.. This is packed full of beautiful work! Bring a journal or sketchbook and linger. . .especially in the garden. You must go on a beautiful day or your visit will be disappointing!
Museum closed for renos but the garden open to all. Rodin sculptures were fabulous and nice to be in the open air and to next take ones time...next visit will be open I am sure

Gardens are the Best!. The "Thinker" just sitting there in the gardens (where I'm sure everything is in bloom by now) is a favorite of mine. Most of the exhibit was closed when we were there in March, but there was a special showing of Rodin's drawings ...all of women as I recall. It was interesting and quite provocative...yep, and they were only drawings! A great place to visit on the way to or from the Eiffel Tower.
Beautiful place!. We decided to have breakfast there...so we went biking!!The gardens with the scuptures are beautiful!! you must go on a sunny day!!!
Amazing sight!. Must see! If not for the sight itself, for the most amazing traffic roundabout ever.

Gorgeous tribute. I don't know how to tell you where to start: either go to the breathtaking garden and gaze at the sculptures and then into the house or vice versa. The house is arranged by eras of his life and the progressions of his work. It kind of tells you where his head was at and the background info before you see the gardens can be helpful (along with some preliminary sketches and models of the final sculptures). It also includes some works by other artists that he either collected or were in his era or style. It is an enjoyable time and the gardens are lovely.Pictures are allowed (no flash) and just to see the famous sculpture The Thinker is amazing. We used the Paris Museum Pass.
It's Rodin. A magnificent mansion with Rodin and his mistress' work on display. She's as good as him. It is well worth the time.

What a collection!. A garden with the le Penseur & so much more. Beautiful & peaceful gardens with more than a dozen statues by Rodin, including the Gates of Hell & the Thinker.
There were plenty of places around the grounds to sit & enjoy.

One of our favorites. When travel with our children, each one gets to pick out and plan a day/museum - our 8-year old chose the Musee Rodin because of his infatuation with The Thinker. It was one of our favorite places in Paris. A museum that you can experience in a few hours and the family admissions rate is wonderful. Our entire family soaked up the culture, art, sculptures and gorgeous experience. Thank you for making this a highlight of our trip and for inspiring our children.
Garden. If you're not a great museum lover, just enjoy the outside area.

More than just a museum.... This is the kind of place where you should probably not go to during official holidays. The place is usually packed then, and you don’t feel the history around it. I am not exactly an expert on the subject, but I know that this Hôtel particulier was built when there were only fields surrounding it… That is a first thing that should keep you thinking. Sitting in the gardens is most enjoying, if there aren’t too many people and that the sun is shining. Inside the sculptures are absolutely beautiful. They come at all sorts of stages and of all sorts of material and their set-up is fine ; and the museum is pretty large ! What is wonderful is when you realize how many people are represented here ; what a rich society it must have been ! In some lost corner, for some strange reason, you can see a film of Victor Hugo’s funeral. That is probably one good enough reason to go (the TV set should be inclosed in some trivial looking wooden box)The film Camille Claudel is probably a nice one to view before going. You will then also want to go to the place where she lives, in the movie. In reality, what is supposed to be her front door, leads to some sort of a broom closet. We are here talking about the Hôtel de Beauvais (metro St. Paul- Le Marais ; 68, rue François Miron), almost across from the photography museum where are exhibited pictures from renown people such as Henri Cartier-Bresson.If you are looking for more “smell” of Rodin, you might also be happy to visit his workshop in Meudon (take train at St. Lazare station, I think)

Brilliant Rodin!. To visit this museum is a must if you are interested in some of the best sculpture in Paris. The sculptures in the garden (including The Thinker and Gates of Hell) are exciting, but more awaits within the museum building. The crowds are not too large and this is a museums that you can revisit when ever in Paris.

Beautiful gardens, nice way to refresh after a couple of days in museums.. The gardens were really peaceful and not crowded, perhaps because the weather was threatening rain. Roses just about to bloom, beautiful bed of peony roses in full bloom. House is still under renovation and statutes are all displayed in a limited area. Keep your eye out for some three great paintings by Renoir and van Gough. Most people missed these I think.

Pretty Garden. Musee Rodin is a very cute little museum and just a 5 minute walk from La Musee de l'Armee and Napoleon's tomb, though I was told the original Penseur is in his house in Meudon. My favorite part was the garden surrounding the museum, filled with flowers and sculptures.However, if staying in Paris for only a couple days, I'd say the Musee d'Orsay just about sums up Rodin and frees up time to see other things. If you do decide to visit his house, take note that it is only open Friday, Saturday and Sunday. My friend and I made the mistake of not checking before we made the 40 minute metro ride and a 15 minute hike up a long hill only to find it closed.
Don't miss Rodin's Garden. We were surprised at the size of the garden and the number of statues! Don't miss it, even if you don't have time to take in the whole museum.

Look for Camille Claudel. Rodin's mistress was also an artist. Camille went mad when Rodin left her - she was institutionalized and died in the institution, probably broken-hearted. The original "Thinker" is inside the Hotel Biron (the museum) and is approx 30 inches. The reproductions of Rodin nude sketches+watercolours are beautiful in the museum shop and reasonably priced to take home.

Don't miss the gardens.. If you haven't tired of all the art museums and only have an hour or so that you want to spend in yet another one, consider visiting the Musee Rodin. The gardens are perfect to walk around and see replicas of many of Rodin's most well known sculptures. You get up very close and can touch them. Who isn't aware of his most famous piece, "The Thinker"? . Don't miss "Burgher of Calais" or "Gates of Hell". You can save money and just tour the gardens where many of his sculptures are reproduced using the same molds as the originals.
Garden Setting. Plan to visit on a nice day. Incredible works of Rodin. 1~2 hours required at most. Plan to see Invalides and Domed Church at the same time.
The Thinker. The Thinker and Dante's Gate are worth seeing. Great views of the Army Museum and the Eiffel Tower from the garden.
Love this -- inside and out. Go early in the day before the crowds. Beautiful grounds. Great gift shop.
Well worth a visit. Nice and compact museum and gardens, and well worth a visit. Iconic statutes worth seeing

The remodeled museum has re-opened!. We went to see the newly re-opened museum on its re-opening day (April 3, 2012). What a delight! Rodin's work is breathtaking, the formal garden is a delight to stroll and see more of Rodin's life-size masterpieces! Lunch at the outdoor cafe was reasonable and delicious. Those French Macaroons are addictive, especially when sitting outdoors in the formal garden sipping excellent Café au Lait.
Lovely Museum. Lovely gardens with many of the artists works of arts and a great view of the inside of the artists home
beautiful. Very beautiful garden, and the sculptures in the garden make the place more special, and Rodin was a genius!!!
impressionist dream. the gardens are like a impressionist dream! the ideal complement to the sculptures.

Small, Comprehensive, Gorgeous. Worth it. Totally worth it. The gardens were just stunning and the sculptures were delightful. Imitate The Thinker for the ultimate tourist photo. Mansion was closed for our visit but the exhibition of line drawings was a happy replacement. Very, Very good.
LIttle Treasure. The gardens, the statues, a few Impressionist paintings. Better than the Louvre. Worth a visit.
Simple, straight forward. A pleasant walk through the sculptures garden (worth it). The indoor museum just so so.
Musee Rodin. The musee contents and the house/garden , all are worth a visit

Must see. Both museum and garden were brilliant. Some of the areas in the garden were still under construction but when all the work is complete, it would be one of my most to-be-visited places in Paris over and over again.

I learned a lot about Rodin. This museum is housed in a wonderful building, that is now undergoing a much-needed renovation. The exhibits have been re-arranged in the parts of the building that are still open, and are very intelligently laid out in a way that enables one to learn a lot about Rodin in a short visit. The pleasant gardens contain larger sculptures, but these are poorly labelled, and one really needs to have seen the indoor display first to appreciate them fully. Sadly we did not do this because of the rather poor organisation of the museum. The ticket clerk warned us that there was a 40-minute wait to get into the house, but not that this meant 40 minutes standing in the rain. We decided that if we were going to get wet anyway we might as well do it while we toured the garden, in the (justified) hope that by the time we had done this, and had a cup of tea in the very ordinary museum cafe, the queue would have shortened. Even with renovation works in progress it would not be too difficult to provide shelter for the queue, and/or provide better information. Nonetheless, to see such iconic works as The Thinker, The Kiss and The Gates of Hell at close quarters in a sympathetic environment was well worth a little hassle. But if you can, avoid going when it is raining!
Must see.... if you like Rodin or sculpture in general. The garden area is also really nice.

It is being remodeled, but still worth the visit.. They are opening only some areas of the museum during renovation. But even if you only get to see the sculptures in the garden, it is a beautiful and powerful place.
A hidden gem. Another lovely respite from the stimulation of Paris. Truly a beautiful garden and museum that is worth every minute.
Moving place. The audio guide is well worth the money. We thoroughly enjoyed these great sculptures.
romantic. is only 1€ to enter the garden, not the museum that is 9€, but is highly recommended because is really nice

Very Nice small Museum. We added this as a small side trip to Napoleons tomb. Glad we did. If you like Rodin, or even just like nice sculptures you will be impressed. Lots of school children there on the day we stopped. I wish our children visted these kinds of places at home. Covered by the Museum Pass. We enjoyed a very nice couple of hours.

A treasure in Paris. We love the smaller museums in a park setting. Wonderful collection and a great way to spend the afternoon on a beautiful day. Actually even atmospheric on an overcast day. Good cafe in the park for a light meal or snack.
Sculpture park and chateau worth visiting. Even if you just get to do the garden area it is worth it. We did all of it and were mesmerised by the beauty of both the art and location.

A very favorite. Beautiful outdoor gardens with the "thinker " and "The Burghers of Calais " . relaxing gardens to stroll and then wait on line for Museum interior to see other works such as "The Kiss " and "The Cathedral " , adefinite must see

must see. Spend time in the gardens. Or, take a short detour (it only takes one hour, and is right next door to Hotel Les Invalides). A good museum/gallery. Not too expensive. If you get there late in the day there could be line ups.
Great Find. This was a surprise, we really enjoyed this museum and it is worth the time if you enjoy sculptures. We spent about 1 1/2 hours touring the museum and grounds.

one of the best attractions in Paris. Even though the main museum was closed for refurbishment on our visit, the gardens were still open and an exhibition of drawings was on display. The gardens are just stunning and contain "The Thinker", "The Three Friends" and "The Gates of Hell". There are chaises to relax, a lovely cafe, and sparrows that eat out of your hand.
Insights to Rodin. Beautiful gardens, chateau, sculptures and location -- easy to get to and in close proximity to the Dome (Napolion's Tomb).
love rodin. cool sculpture garden, the house gives a nice retrospective too, but go when nice weather and after renovations are done...

Pretty rose garden. Small museum exhibiting works by sculptor, Rodin, including The Thinker smacked right in the mddile of a very pretty rose garden.
A must visit for fans of Rodin.

loved this one. Rodin is pretty fascinating. We saw an exhibit of his drawings of naked women and they were pretty graphic, which I sort of loved. There is also a really pretty garden to walk in where his statues are, including the famous "Thinker". Enjoy!

Currently under a lot of renovation. The Rodin Museum is always nice to see, for the lovely gardens and because it's a manageable size, but there is currently a lot of construction going on, which is something of a distraction. Still worth the trip, however.

skill. WOW. . .to think one man can have so much talent, patience and skill. He sure was a THINKER. Although, I must say I really enjoyed the first floor of the inside of the museum all the statues looked like they were ivory and real. Not into art but LOVED this place and the talent Rodin had

The garden is wonderful!. I love to pop into the garden off the Rodin Museum. It is a secret haven in the heart of Paris. To wonder around this lovely space, filled with masterpieces, is such a treat.

Beautiful gardens. Quiet, uncrowded museum dedicated to Rodin's works. Sculpture garden is the highlight. Museum undergoing renovations so interior gallery space currently in a temporary configuration.
Don't bother with full price ticket. Just pay 1 euro to see the best stuff in the garden. Unless you love bronze heads of bearded men don't bother with the house!

Visit in spring or summer when the gardens are beautiful. Magnificent collection of Rodin sculptures and other works both inside and outside. Very reasonable admission, and no queue to speak of even on a bank holiday weekend. The gardens are particularly lovely, with great views of the dome of Hotel des Invalides and the Eiffel Tower through the trees, and plenty of benchesa and quiet little spots to sit and muse or even have a picnic lunch.

if you like sculptures!. if you are into art / sculptures you like the Rodin Museum. While there just walk over to nepoleon's Tomb and the Army Musuem. The Army museum has to be one of the best military museum's in Europe.

Garden of Musee Rodin is great. The Musee Rodin house is currently being remodeled with some exhibits in temporary space. But the garden with its wonderful scupltures is open and very inexpensive to visit.
So Pleasant. The Musee Rodin isn't very large, but its garden, with scattered sculptures, makes it a Paris must-do. Their restaurant serves delicious food, and with a beautiful garden view.

undergoing remodeling April. Open outdoor gardens lovely and display a selection of Rodin's works. The "Hotel" which is really the house is closed for remodeling until someetime in late April. A look through the dusty window makes me think more like May. A dissapointment since this was on top of our list for this trip. Still woth the visit if you have the museum pass.
Best way to experience Rodin. Plan to spend some time in the gardens as well as the house. All of the Rodin favorites are here and with the refurb, well displayed.
Musee Rodin. Visit hear thencross Blvd to Les Invalides both highly recommended
Next to Les Invalides. Pretty nice garden and museum, but a little crowded when we visited.

Brief visit. All of the guide books we had said it opened at 9:30 a.m., but it does not open until 10:00 a.m. The staff was not very helpful. Go straight to the gardens and view the sculptures and you can be out in 30 minutes. It is right next to Napoleon's Tomb so take time to go there as well.
Gorgeous. I loved this museum and the presentation of Rodin's masterpieces in such a lovely setting. The house and gardens are gorgeous!

Where is the Kiss statue?!!. Good idea to place the sculptures in the blooming garden....... with a lot of banches for relax...... but quite a bit of crazy tourists and the most famouse statue Kiss not exposed at the moment

Very Pleasant Place. The Rodin Museum has inside exhibits and an outside park. Unfortunately, when we visited the inside museum was closed for renovations, but we enjoyed the outside area very much. Rodin's sculptures are located throughout a beautifully landscaped park that was full of flowers when we visited in late March. It was very peaceful and had benches for sitting and enjoying the view, the sculptures, and the nice weather. The cost to get in was very reasonable, I think only 2 Euro.
Beautiful afternoin. The gardens are manicured to perfection. They have a cafe that is very good and not too pricey

Nice gardens. The gardens aren't free, as the guide books said, but it was only one Euro and worth it to see the many bronze sculptures in the garden. It was a good side trip after walking through Invalides.

Favorite museum in Paris !. Very personal and peaceful experience . No jostling or massive crowds. The gardens allowed me and our kids time to admire and talk about the art. People who come here love art,and not because they have a list to rush through. So much nicer than the larger museums. Go on the evenings when there are extended hours. Less crowded and the lighting is beautiful.

The Thinker. You may remember this museum from "Midnight in Paris." It is a small museum with a lovely statue/hedge garden and showcases a hefty number of Rodin's original works. See "The Thinker" (not as big as you'd expect) and "The Kiss."
Excellent and peaceful. I love the Rodin museum because it is so much less crowded than the other museums in Paris. The garden is peaceful and serene. Highly recommend it.
Closed until 3 April. Travel sites to include the Paris Tourism Office did not alert anyone--tours and people with Paris Museum passes were disappointed.

A little worn, but worth the visit. Lines were not long, and Paris Pass helped. House itself was in need of some funding for updates. We enjoyed the sculptures outside and the gardens more than the smaller works in the house. Gardens are lovely, and the small cafe and gelato stand are reasonable for prices and good food.
Great display, wonderful works. Liked all of it! Wonderful collection, great space, outside collection is superb.

Lovely gardens !!. The main house was being renovated, but will reopen in April 2012. But the gardens are so peaceful and sculptures are wonderful. A little cafe offers food and drinks and you can just sit on benches or on great wooden lawn chairs. A respite in a busy and crowded city.
great little museum. This is a great little surprise. There was a nice temporary exhibit of drawings, and then the many sculptures. Make time to see this museum!

enjoyable garden walk. had looked forward to going here on Paris trip but the museum is being renovated and only the garden and a small exhibition are opne. The garden is a nice place to stroll around is a relatively quiet Paris location n- a chance to get away from the crowds and at only 1 euro entry to the gardens good value. there are a number of statues in the garden including "the Thinker" I would recommend the cafe in the garden as a place to eat, this was the cheapest lunch we had on our visit and the quietest place we ate - food was of a good standard and seemed to be used by local workers as a lunch spot. A lot of outside seating but also indoors is light and airy.
special museum and garden. Its a special place to go .you have the spetacular Rodins sulpetures in the museum and in the garden . you can take specials photos there
A Must See For Rodin Lovers. A fabulous collection of Rodin's works. And what a beautiful garden setting for many of his works.
Beautiful. Make a trip here for the gardens if anything... they are so charming.

Museum Being Renovated But Gardens Still Open. We were at first disappointed to hear of the museum closure but glad that the gardens were open with access to the Thinker and Burghers of Calais. My son just wanted to see the Thinker so mission accomplished.
Under renovation. Since it was under renovation, it was free!! Unfortunately, the Thinker was off limits. Only saw it from afar. Went to the gardens only. It was nice but probably wouldn't go back.

Worth finding.. A bit off the beaten track... but worthwhile if only for the marble statue 'The Kiss', indoors, ... Stunning and meaningful for Romantics .. while outdoors there's 'Le Penseur'. You cannot view this statue and not empathise. Then there'the 'Gates of Hell' - copied in le Musee d'Orsay!

Lots of statues.. Worth visiting - a beautifully laid-out area with many many excellent Rodin works dotting the landscape!
Many, many were male statues - females a little under-represented!

Rodin's Statues.. One of a kind. Wow, these statues you only recall seeing in books.. They are pretty amazing to view in person. I enjoyed the thinking man and door the best. The garden and open space was so relaxing. I will go back with a good book and spend more time in the garden next time.
Best place to spend a sunny afternoon. I loved just sitting in the gardens and admiring the works. Especially since the renovations its one of the top places to visit in Paris.

The Best. Rodin had the best of all worlds - living in a city like Paris and strolling from his house to his workshop minutes away. The collection represented was not overwhelming which gave you time to enjoy the gardens.

The Age of Bronze. If you have ever studied the famous scultptor this place is a must-see. It was his house, and the way the curator has the works set up you feel as if Rodin would walk in, pick up his tools, and start working.

Definitely worth seeing!. When you go to see this museum, you get two great experiences: the museum and the gardens - both are wonderful. In fact, it is possible to go, just see the gardens, and not pay to see the museum. I wouldn't skip the museum, though - it's one of the better ones.
Best museum to be with your partner. For a sunny day its the best choice for a museum. The art is spetacular, stunning. Go to invalides first and after it, go to rodin. It's close.
Wonderful. Calm, relaxing garden with an entry fee of only one Euro !
Wonderful garden. The hotel/museum itself was closed for renovations so we paid just one euro to visit the beautiful garden.This is a must see for any gardener, or Rodin fan.

A nice break from the crowds. This was a good location for us to stop in and pick up our museum pass. The pass allows you to enter the member tourist stops more quickly and, in some cases, jump to the head of the line (not at Notre-Dame, sadly). It is close to hotel des Invalides so we hopped of the tour bus to grab our passes and give it a quick tour. Who can resist haveing a photo with "the Thinker"? It was a more relaxed destination than some of the more popular stops. We weren't there long but enjoyed the self guided tour through the building and grounds and wee happy to have saved ourselves time at the next stops because we already had purchased our passes.

Guarden nice but Musee under renovations. The deal of the trip was one euro for entry to the gardens. Nicely laid out , nice selection of sculptures but once again parents letting their children run a muck. Why would anyone think it was ok to let children climb over sculptures and bang on them with rocks?It was not only tourist who were doing this but what looked like a pre-school group or daycare who had at least 20 3-4 year old's who were being encouraged to climb on the art work. Not a security person in sight.Disappointing.

Open Paris air garden.. With the eiffel tower and hotel des invalides in the background. it is wonderful expierence the statues and garden is a fun walk, the museum inside doesn't take very long. Great souvenirs. Lots of fun picture taking spots.Get the museum pass. Relaxing with lots of open space and not that crowded.
Not only Mid Night in Paris. Select a beautiful sunny day, allocate 3 to 4 hours here and enjoy an amazing exhibition , strol in the garden aand appreciate the statues.

worth a stroll. This museum is closed for renovations in 2012, but the gardens are open and are free.. There are lots of statues to see throughout, and the displays of different stages of the sculptures are interesting.The statues and gardens are gorgeous and definitely worth a stroll....

remodeling in 2012. They are currently remodeling the main gallery, and access was limited. I really wanted to see the sculpture garden where the Gates of hell and the Thinker live. Make sure you use your museum pass and skip the line to get right in. Gardens are very plesant with lots of benches to sit and admire sculptures. The thinker was covered in scaffolding so that was a bit dissapointing. Also the gates of hell has a copy in the Musee D'Orsay so you may be able to skip this museum all togther till the reconstruction is done next year.
Rodin fans - must see!!. If you are a fan of Rodin, this is a "must see" museum.
Thinker. if you think of Rodins art is important in any way-a must see!
Wonderful gardens and amazing sculptures. The "old thinker" and Rodin hands never cease to amaze. Statues are scattered throughout the beautiful gardens and this museum is well worth a visit.
It's Rodin, what more do I need to say?. This is just a fabulous museum in a city loaded with fantastic museums. A must see when you are in Paris.
Modern, open, inviting way to enjoy art. Interior museum was closed in our early January visit. On a cold, but clear day we sauntered about the spacious gardens, worth the effort and price.

Call Ahead and inquire about hours!. We saved this well-recommended museum and gardens for a raining afternoon - only to find that the museum as closed and some of the gardens were roped off - both for restoration. The museum is scheduled to re-open the first week in April - but check ahead to verfiy days and hours. The Gardens are beautiful and we did see several of Rodin's most famous bronzes. There is a lovely coffee house in the Garden too, where we could have eaten lunch.

a museum ideal for the spring and summer. Apart from the great art the museum offers a very nice garden with some sculptures. The calm and serenity of this place will make you think you are outside of Paris. It is great with kids as well.
Wonderful little oasis. Spent an hour pottering in the garden( the indoor bit was closed when we went). Delightful!
Not much to see. Rodins house was closed for renovations, as well as the gardens. Not much to see except for the thinker and the gates of hell.

I have stared at the Gates of Hell. My wife and I visited the Rodin gardens in March 2012 on a lovely Parisian sunday morning and it was a delight. The main building was shut for renovation so the kiss was behind closed doors but the other iconic sculptures were all on view in the garden including the Thinker, THe Burghers of Calais and The Gates of Hell which is a tribute to Dante's Inferno. For only 7 euro's this is just great value and we spent two hours wandering in this lovely space

Excellent collection and beautiful grounds. A beautiful and peaceful spot for appreciating sculpture. The architectural details of Rodin's home are also lovely. There are many opportunities for unique photographs in the house and gardens. We were running late, but with our Paris Passes we were able to skip the ticket line and the helpful attendant at the door let us right in! We couldn't find any restaurants in the area though (at least where we were walking) and the cafe across the street was packed, so I would recommend picking a spot to eat elsewhere before (or after) traveling to that area of town. If we have time, we will probably go to the museum again on our next trip to Paris.
One of my favorite museums in Paris. What's not to love about Rodin? The house turned museum is wonderful. The grounds lovely. My family and I enjoyed several hours here.
One of our favorite museums in Paris. We went for Rodin and then discovered the house and grounds, too.

ONE OF THE LOVELIEST MUSEUMS IN PARIS!. Everything about this museum is perfect! The art of Rodin, inside an old hotel particulier (private home), a lovely garden (where you can bring a picnic) and all of it seen in just over an hour!
Exquisite. Was here in 2009. A small, but breathtaking collection of Rodin's legendary sculptures displayed in a gorgeous setting. Spend a quiet 90 mins here away from noise of central Paris.

Great Works of Art - Mediocre interpretation. Seeing Rodin's wonderful works of art in the gardens of the museum is wonderful. The lack of thoughtful interpretation of the dramatic stories behind his work is a shame. The museum was closed for renovation other than an exhibit of drawings and we did not stand in line for that. The sculptures were our interest. It is still worth a visit if you get to Paris.
Short visit. Short visit and got to go inside and out to look at the art adult only.
The Thinker. This is worth visiting just to see The Thinker. All the other pieces are just icing on the cake!
Garden Experience. Do walk the garden. We have gone there just for that at other times.

A quiet, garden museum. This museum is wonderful. It's small and restful. Rodin's works are best viewed outdoors, and they are beautifully displayed here; it's a walk through a lovely garden with unbelievable sculpture all around. Indoors, you can view some of the less durable art works.

Indoor portion closed without any notice. The gardens were open, but the actual museum portion was closed. There wasn't a sign or notice to let visitor know this fact. Since the museum is included as part of the Paris Museum Pass and Rodin's major works are displayed in the garden, it wasn't as big a deal as it could have been.

An exquisite museum, grounds and buildings alike.. Rodin is the greatest French sculptor, and the museum devoted to him has a satisfyingly comprehensive collection of his major works. What I like most about it is that many of these - including the Thinker, and his extraordinary expressionist statue of the novelist Balzac - are found in the beautiful grounds surrounding the main building. And it is worth walking slowly through the grounds, since many little beauties reveal themselves just round an unexpected corner.We have been there several times, and were drawn there this time because of an extraordinary special exhibition devoted to hundreds of the sculptor's preliminary drawings of the female nude. Most were done quickly, mainly with pencil, and the majority had some elements of colour added to at his leisure, without the model. Still others were cut up and reassembled as collages. But it is the basic sketches, done in the heat of the moment which get the blood racing.

A country house in the city. This wonderful house on its fairly large plot of land is not only filled with Rodin's work, but has a wonderful garden with Rodin's sculptures, a little garden cafe, and the quiet of a country parc. Do, do visit.
Great little museum. This museum was a pleasant little surprise. Lovely grounds and close to our hotel.

Beautiful. This is my favourite small museum in Paris. The gardens are beautiful with the sun shining this is a must visit. Recommended my mother-in-law visit this museum on her last visit and it was also her most enjoyable musuem. Not so well known as the other major museums but to see The Thinker with Las Invalides in the background is just stunning! A lovely relaxing couple of hours.
Wonderful. The food at the museums and parks is really great! Don't be afraid to try it.

Just spend your time in the gardens. Unless you are a die hard fan of Rodin, you could probably just pay to spend time in the gardens where the best statues are exhibited like The Thinker and the Gates of Hell.

The premier home of Rodin's Art.. This is the premier museum of Rodin's sculptures. The second best is the Rodin Museum in Philadelphia. Both museums have copies of the same works: The Thinker, The Gates of Hell, Balzac, Victor Hugo, and so many more. In Paris there is a room of sculpture created by Camille Claudel, Rodin's fiery mistress, who was a very talented sculptor in her own right. She modeled for most of the female images in Rodin's more famous works. The grounds are impressive and many pieces are set outside to be enjoyed in the idyllic gardens.A masterpiece museum for a Master Sculptor's works!

The Most Interactive Museum in Paris.. Yes, it is a museum for having fun. Try getting your travel companions to pose like Rodin's sculptures and getting pictures of them side by side. It is impossible not to act out the poses of Rodin's masterpieces!

Hidden gem!. Small, in and outside museum. Buriel monumnet in garden.The place has lovely outside gardens that unfortunately needs attention and care.....many many sculptures, in a quiet area of Paris, kind of hidden, and as you walk thru old doors to garden and the museum, you are transported to another era and unbeliveable art. The thinker is here! Small admission fee. You can get up and close to the outside sculptures which surprised us!

This little museum is my favorite in Paris. This is a wonderful museum to visit if you want to go somewhere and think. Don't miss the Cathedral and, of course, The Kiss. Bring a book (maybe about Rodin?) and spend some time in the lovely garden.

Under renovation....await end of works. This museum is in a bit of an up-heaval at present while the main house is being done up. The up side of this is that you can visit the gardens for free while this happens and see most of the more famous works such as the Thinker, The Gates of Hell in the grounds and also see some original marble works housed in a small glass fronted building. The gardens themselves were still in their winter hibernation mode so it would be difficult to make any comment about them. The coffee shop though looked very stylish indeed. Suggested date for re-opening is the 19th of March 2012

Closed for renovation until April 3rd 2012!. After long walk I was really disappointed to realize, that for 7 euro I can only enter the carden and see only few masterpieces of Rodin! But ok, I could see The Thinker!
Great day. Loved the lay out and the presenation. Went through when it was under construction but it was nice in that they still presented well

Everything is beatiful even with rain. The museum is located in a beautiful mansion where Rodin lived, the gardens are wonderful and together with the artist's work is a must.Everything is beatiful even with rain

Do not miss!. We enjoyed the museum because it contains a lot of Rodin's works indoor and outdoor. There is a wonderful garden at the back where it is nice to relax. There is also a cafeteria in the garden.

Fully open in April 2012, but great gardens !. Museum currently undergoing refurbishment, so unable to do full visit. Scupture garden is fabulous however, and well worth visiting just to see this. Visited as part of Paris Museum Pass and thoroughly enjoyed.
Remember College?. Fewer sculptures than expected. However, to see in real time what I studied in college 43 years ago gave me goose bumps. Like a personal time warp. Well worth seeing.
What a surprise.... A small, unassuming little museum that turned out to be a very pleasant surprise.
Closed to public. Most of the museum was closed to the public but the garden was free. Luckily the garden includes Le Penseur. Not even a penny for his thoughts
Great Museum trip. Was a great trip. The collected works of Rodin were excellent to see en masse. Would recommend going on a sunny day.
Fantastic!. The inside is closed for renovation until April 2012, so in the meantime the gardens are free and are totally worth a visit. Just come and sit and rest amongts these amazing statues!
Best value in Paris. Skip the gallery, do the garden walk and see Rodin's best sculptures for just one euro!

Must see in Paris. Like: The garden and even the gift shop
Dislike: the crowd at the gift shop
The best sculpture museum in Paris!. Do NOT miss this gorgeous Museum & the beautiful grounds!!!

Rodin on a cold winter day. We visited the Museum in February right after a duting of snow. The sculpture garden was amazing and getting to see Rodin's Le Penseur was a special treat. Much of the interior of the Museum was closed during our visit, but there was a large display of Rodin's drawings.

My favorite Museum. This has got to be my favorite museum in Paris. It is a unique gem. For some reason not many people visit this museum so lines are short. The museum is full of outdoor and indoor sculptures, the gardens are beautiful and it has a pretty food area. It is the type of museum that you can buy ice cream and sit on a bench or steps.It also holds some original sculptures that you can only see replicas of in the orsay

For Sculpture lovers this is the place.. Extensive collection of the works of Rodin in a beautiful rococo house, the Hotel de Biron. There is also a beautiful garden with the very large works displayed therein. It is all very well done.

A respite to sit and think.. Just the right place to relax away from the larger and more famous Parisian attractions. Sculptures and reproductions of sculptures galore inside and in the gardens of the villa. FYI, the gift shop at the entrance is way bigger than the actual villa so don't be expecting to see a palace inside.
Don't Miss It. If you are a Rodin fan, you gotta see this. Nice lunch spots nearby, too.

Rodin at his best. Nothing much to say - you get Rodin, his residence, interesting temporary exhibitions, the opportunity to see the creative process in stages and walk through the gardens on a sunny day.
don't miss this one!. wonderful museum with quiet atmosphere. try to aoid schoolclasses

Peace and quiet in the centre of Paris giving you space to think. The museum is easy to find with many signposts in the vicinity of the Invalides - there is a Metro Station at Varenne within a five minutes walk.The museum is set in a large garden it hosts a shop and a garden cafe. The museum is presently closed for renovation however for the princely cost of one euro you can explore the gardens and see many statues including the Thinker plus the Gates of Hell.There is a pavilion of plaster casts and lots of space for some reflection.The cafe is worth a visit lots of fresh food at a reasonable priceThe shop is full of all things Rodin.

Mecca for a Rodin fan. If you are an admirer of Rodin, this is the place for you. Many of his sculptures, including the famous "Le Penseur" are displayed outdoors in the pleasant gardens. Due to a lack of energy at the end of a busy day, we only toured the outside exhibits. A quiet retreat from the bustle of the more famous Parisian museums.
Gardens was all we saw.... But it was well worth the time and the trip. Spend an hour just strolling through the gardens and enjoying Rodin's masterpieces.
Classic Grandeur. The utmost in modern sculpture. You cannot go to Paris and not visit this absolute monument of European culture.

Makes you think!. Get the museum pass - lets you skip the lines. A great view into the mind of a wonderful artist. See the process of his work and the finished pieces. I'm going back for a second look!
Small in size, great in importants.. Be sure you walk the gardens, they are half the fun, they are shaded and cool.
Small but worth it. Located in an amazing mansion with terrific gardens, this place is never full of turists. Many of the visitors are parisienes scaping from crowds os other museums!
For the garden. If you want to have a "peace moment" in Paris, try the garden. There are even some deckchair and a cafeteria (not very good but you can have simple foods). Take a book and rest
"Think about it". It was closed for remodel. The gardens were open. Its a bargain and you get to see the Thinker and Hell's Gate.

Beautiful little museum. You can go to the Louvre to see thousands of priceless art works, or you can go to The Rodin Museum, see the whole place in two hours, and feel like you truly understand this wonderful sculptor. To appreciate the artist, see the collection inside, to enjoy your day, see the sculpture garden outside.
I didn't know I liked Rodin till I came here.. Located very close to the Invalides is this amazing museum and garden. It is a Paris Museum Pass site.

A unique and intimate museum that shows off the brilliance and beauty of Rodin. This is a wonderful museum, romantic and lovely. Because the museum is dedicated to the artistic endeavors of one artist, one is not overwhelmed and can appreciate Rodin's work. I strongly recommend it. The staff was very friendly, and really, how many other places in the world can you walk in a beautifully appointed garden and see masterworks of sculpture?

Behold The Thinker and Absorb The Kiss. The Rodin Museum is a two-storied building with an outdoor shallow garden pool and fountain and other portions that were under construction during my visit. The major highlights are The Thinker just outside the main building and The Kiss on the second floor rear of the building. Rodin was indeed a master sculptor who embodied both the intellectual and sensual in his works. A must-see in Paris!
Suprisingly romantic museum. Beautiful mansion and lovely extensive gardens with Rodin scultures throughout. Some scultures are surprising erotic in nature and make for a romantic afternoon.
Great garden!. THis is the perfect museum to go with kids, they won't break anything, they will be impressed and they will love it as us all!
Awe Inspiring. His scuptures are amazing in a wonderful garden setting.
Lovely. Wonderful garden with Rodin sculptures everywhere. Hurry, the building appears to be falling down. Not to be missed.

Museum closed until April 2012, but the Gardens are nice!. I was disappointed when I got to the Rodin only find the museum was closed for renovations. The gardens were open, at only one euro, a great bargain. There are several wonderful castings in the gardens – the Thinker of course, the Burghers of Calias (reflecting the feelings of six city fathers waiting their execution), Ugolino & Sons (a father that was so hungry he ate the corpses of his children) and of course the Gates of Hell. I’m sure that the museum is wonderful, but it is worth the visit even if only the gardens are open.

Visit his home..... I loved going here and walking through his home and the massive gardens, mostly behind the home. Amazing that it is right in the center of Paris. Beautiful sculptures of course throughout. And the home is large and beautifully decorated. You can imagine yourself there back in the day.....The Kiss, The Gates of Hell, The thinker, and so much more.....
One of my favourite museums in Paris. The charm of the sculptures and art is wonderful! Loved that it is in the home he lived in!
Artist in Residence. Fabulous to see the sculptures throughout the garden. If you like this, then check out Barbara Hepworth's studio in St. Ives, UK.

Nice works in a quaint environment. This lesser of the Parisian museums is worth a stop if you are in town for more than a few days. I would recommend combining it with the Military Museum and nearby Napoleon’s Tomb to kill three birds with one stone. Other than that, it is about an hour of your time. The outside gardens are the main attraction with some of Rodin’s most famous works. There are also nice flora to roam around and pretty decently priced snacks to enjoy al fresco.
Unfortunately closed for rennovation. One of my favorite. This man was a genius. You may still see the gardens and a lot of sculpture, but ypu will have to wait awhile to go imside.

Little gem - make time to see this one. A lot of people don't get to see this museum on the few days they have in Paris. It is well worth the trip to this unassuming house, tucked away in Paris. Wander the gardens and enjoy Rodin's works.
The Thinker. We had not planned to see the Musee Rodin, but glad we did.

no longer a romantic treasure. but still amazing works are showcased in a stunning little mansion. having not visited for a few years, i was disappointed to see how the museum has expanded and added a big, modern entrance building. the little gem of a museum now seems commercialized and a bit less special...
Lovely afternoon out. Especially on a nice sunny spring day it's lovely to visit this mansion. Everything you allways wanted to know about Rodin, beautiful art and a lovely garden.

an experience to savour. This museum is small enough to immerse yourself in Rodin's art without feeling overwhelmed. It combines a house with a garden and there is sculpture in both places. The cafe offers a range of overpriced food but you can combine a drink with your own picnic or just sit elsewhere in the garden to eat, drink and savour this artist, his work and Paris.

Do you like "The Thinker"?. First visit I didn't like Rodin's sculptures, but second visit I enjoyed the garden very much, more than the museum itself. It's a lot cheaper to just go into the garden. Somebody recommended us to have breakfast at the garden cafe : total rip off!

The Best Small Museum in the World. Make a hasty beeline for this hidden gem. Full of treasure and wonder, I promise you will never look at sculpture the same way again. Genius amongst gorgeous gardens - always a highlight!

For Rodin Lovers. If you want to immerse yourself in Rodin's work you should definitely visit the Musee. The main sculptures are in the garden, so good weather is advisable, although there is plenty to see in the house as well.

Wonderful. Such a beautiful, serene place. It's only €1 to go into the gardens, where The Thinker is as well. The garden in itself boasts a lot fo very impressive works by Rodin and it's a beautiful quiet place right in the center of Paris to stroll around, sit down and relax for a bit.Don't leave this one of your Paris Museum list.

if you like Rodin, you must go here. Amazing rodin collection as well as beautiful setting and gardens. Some other great works are here as well. A VERY nice place to visit and a very relaxing building and garden.

Rodin garden well worth the time and money. Why look at his sketches inside the building when his sculptures are out in the garden. Some people pay the 1 Euro, yes on e Euro to get into the garden, to come into the garden to read. It is so peaceful and the sculptures are well displayed.
Wonderful Museum. I particularly liked the gardens of the museum and plan to return again for that very reason.
Musee Rodin. Museum closed for renovation but exhibition of drawings in the chapel. Garden and sculptures therein excellent as was small restaurant serving snacks in the grounds.

a wonderful beautiful overlooked museum. great museum.Beautiful sculptures and beautiful grounds. You can visit it quickly but it truly is a great little museum that gets lost with all of the excitement over the Louvre and Orsay

Very different than why we expected. If you like Rodin drawings or want to see the thinker, this museum is for you. There were Lots of his drawings and several sculptures in the garden, including the Thinker. The emphasis was on the drawings though, and Ipersonlly idn't care for them as much as the sculptures.
a Perfect Museum Visit. The best museum in Paris. Hands down. Get lost in the garden.

MUST see expecially for A. Bruno's extension. this is a post for architects ..... the museum is great in reason of A. Bruno (architect) renovation.
If you prefere concentrating on sculpture don't go in the week end !
just an advice
Moulin Rouge terrible food!. entertainment was average/good but the food was very poor when for 2 persons it cost £250...
Stunning gardens. , if you would love to see "the thinker" up close this is the place for you. We took a pinic and sat in the stunning Gardens, a beautiful way to spend a afternoon.

Strength and erotica from a Master. The Museum is closed until April 2012, but on our visit last February it was awe inspiring. The man was a sensual and avid observer as well as a fine artist. So many works take your breath away-both the renowned and the newly found. Go there with an open mind and let the works in the garden do their magic.

Super museum. Loved this museum dedicated to Rodin! So much to see & in such a quaint setting. I am a Rodin fan, so to see his works in this setting was a real treat! The garden in the rear is superb!
Great!!. Full of amazing paintings!! There are some sculptures too!
Small, but a nice little visit. Go when the weather is nice to enjoy the gardens. The classic sculptures are there (The Thinker).

Fabulous. Our museum pass enabled us to bypass the queue and enjoy the beautiful house and stunning gardens. This museum is privately funded so we were happy to spend our money in the cafe and gift shop to contribute to maintaining the exhibition. The gardens and artwork in particular are quite beautiful

Great garden, great art... This is perhaps not the most popullar of the Paris museums, but it's interesting and has a number of gret pieces of art on display, and even a painting by Munch. You are recommended to walk the tour around the house and then enjoy the nice garden with many more sculptures displayed there. There is even a small outdoor cafe and it's not very far from either the musee D'orsay or the Hotel des invalides and Napoleon's last resting place.

Amazing. This museum is a bit off of the beaten path, but it is a fascinating choice from the usual art venues. We suggest looking up a bit of history on Rodin, if you are not familiar with his works, before you visit.

wonderful, intimate museum. a very intimate museum, with a terrific collection. There is something to be said for seeing the collected masterpieces of a genius like Rodin all in one place, in a lovely setting.
And nowhere near the crowds of the bigger museums.

Well the garden was great. The Rodin Museum is closed now for remodeling so we didn't get to see the inside but the gardens were open and totally worth the time because several of Rodin's greatest works - including The Thinker are there.
Sensual.. Rodin sculpted the human form. Many bronzes and marble. The Thinker, Gates of Hell, The Kiss and many more.
thinker the only reason to visit. found some of his work disturbing The Thinker in the Garden was the highlight of museum

Worth visiting even with indoor collection closed. Rodin is not for everyone. The collection of his sketches suggest evolution over several decades around a vicarious theme of young women displaying their intimate regions. His sculpture demonstrates more masculine themes and the gardens and cafe are very nice even in Winter. The surrounding skyline including Invalides is a highlight. You can bring a picnic in the Summer - that would be worthwhile.

A very popular museum with really good collection!. Even if you are not Rodin's expert - this museum worth to be visited. It has a beautiful garden with a fee admission of only 1 euro! All the famous sculptures are here, in this park and you don't need to go inside. The souvenir shop has very good assortment of gifts.

A beautifi; haven in the city. This is one of my favourite museums in Paris. To see the beauty of Rodins work in his garden in fabulous and it is a lovely shaded quiet place to relax for a while. When you are there is is hard to beleive you are in the centre of Paris.

A slice of heaven in the heart of Paris!. If I lived in Paris, I'd buy a season's pass so that I could spend time in the garden on a regular basis. Loved the sculptures, especially the two hands of a man and a woman.
Rodin Gardens. if you go to one garden visit here...the cafe is fabulous with tasty fresh food .....the sculptures are lovely and romantic

One of my favourite spots in Paris. If you have fallen in love with Rodin's works scattered around in museums around the world, this place will be heaven! The museum is situated in the house that Rodin used as his workshop. Rilke lived here temporarily as his secretary.It is full of amazing works (both in the house and in the gardens). Not to be missed if you love his work or art in general.

A hidden gem amongst the many museums of Paris. Paris has some of the most famous museums in the world, and everyone knows the big names like the Louvre and Musee D'Orsay...but honestly this museum is one of my favorites. It is down a quiet street and doesn't look like much from the outside and you could miss it completely if you weren't paying attention! The reason is because the museum is a house! Rodin's house. There is a lovely yard around the house with sculptures and the inside of the house contains many smaller works. It is less crowded than the other museums and the atmosphere is so peaceful, perfect for enjoying fine art. They have nice cafe by the pond as well. If you are in Paris for more than 3 days and have time to see something other than the big Paris tourist spots, I recommend this pleasant little museum if you have a couple hours to spend.

Favorite Art Museum in Paris. I've always been a fan of sculpture over painting - and Rodin is my favorite sculpter. One of the things that I like best about this museum is that it was his residence, there are pieces outside as well as inside and there are still some drawings and paintings to accompany the great sculptures. It's a nice neat package - not overwhelming - it's just right. See the Thinker and the Gates of Hell outside in the gardens - my highlights of the site.
Amazing. You see a Rodin here or there, and you think he is great. You see all the Rodins in his studio, and you are completely blown away.

Musee Rodin is a must-see. On a recent visit, we found that the main collection was closed (until mid-April 2012) for renovations. However the gardens contain some of Rodin's masterworks including the Burghers of Calais and The Thinker. Covered by the Paris museum pass, we found ourselves taking almost two hours to appreciate the sculptures in the garden; there is teashop on the west edge of the garden. Judging from experience of friends, access to the inside collection would be highly valuable--so wait until the renovations are complete.

Wow-experience @Musee Rodin. Quite extended overview of Rodin's work. Seeing sculptures in real life gives a special (3rd...) dimension that triggers my emotion. Rodin definitely has that quality. Located near Hotel des Invalides & walking distance to both Quartier Latin and the Eiffeltower, so perfect place to plan for a day on the other side of the river Seine.

Favorite museum in Paris. This museum feels like a private home with gardens. Rodin's sculptures are placed so they can best be seen in the natural light through the large windows in this beautiful building. Located across the street from Invalides and Napoleon's tomb, don't leave the area without visiting the Musee Rodin.
Lovely art & gardens. Musée Rodin is off the beaten path compared to the other grand museums. It houses beautiful sculptures, drawings and paintings and the gardens should also not be missed.

A must see with kids. We traveled with our two young children and the visit to the Musee Rodin was one of the highlights of our trip. In December, the garden was tranquil and beautiful. The kids loved running around the garden and the statues were breathtaking.

My All-time Favorite Museum in the City of Lights. This beautiful gem of a home/museum is exquisite in every way. If you like sculpture and gardens, this place is a must-see in Paris. Rodin lived onsite for a period of time while it was a hotel and then later he purchased the property to work in and to enjoy the pieces he created. Many favorite pieces are there: The Thinker, The Gates of Hell and The Kiss. Take a picnic and enjoy the gardens at your leisure. There is a cafe onsite that is a bit over-priced, but worthwhile for coffee, pastry and ice cream.

Gorgeous grounds, interesting architecture and so many sculptures.. This was a last-minute, time-killing visit and I am so glad we went.Architecture was the main attraction for me here, followed by the gardens and of course the sculpture.The former residence is now a museum showcasing many of the artists' works, both finished and precursors.If you have time, bring your lunch and eat it in the large gardens. Tall trees screen out the main noise and views of the city so despite being a large area, it feels peaceful.
Great exhibition of Rodin's drawings. The current exhibition of Rodin's drawings is excellent and the gardens are wonderful.

Charming museum. The Rodin is a gem and was located close to our hotel near Rue Cler. The sculptures inside the house are much more accessible that the ones outside simply because they are eye level. But it's still a thrill to see the Thinker and The Gates of Hell.

Great artwork. Well, we're really not art people. But for some reason, I love the Rodin Museum. Seeing pieces I studied in art history made this place come alive. Loved The Thinker and the hands (I think they are called The Cathedral). Overall, this place is amazing

A special Museum.. This is a must see, look it up on the web first then go.
See Rodin Drawings and sculptures.

Fast museum, and a good place to buy Paris Museum Pass. This was a nice little Rodin museum. I've seen other collections of his work that I thought were better, but this one is still good. Two minutes to buy tickets and we got our Paris Museum Passes here so we didn't have to wait at the Louvre and elsewhere. A great place to work our way into all the art in Paris!
Just go and see the Master's work. There us absolutely nothing to dislike. If you want to avoid the crowds go early in the morning or an hour before closing time.

THE HIDDEN GEM. The Musee Rodin provides a great respite from the crowds elsewhere. While the majority of exhibits are the work of Rodin, you will also see art from his wide group of friends. The Sculpture and Rose Garden is an oasis, with a very reasonable Cafe.

For those who like it. If you like Rodin's and Camille's work there's no way you'll miss it. Walk around the garden, admire his work, go inside and have a bit more of his work and some of Camille's best sculptures.
Stroll in the gardens. Wonderful pieces and history on grounds that are well cared for . A great place to have a glass of wine and read a book in the garden cafe.

Musee Rodin: Great Works by Rodin and His Lover Camille. In a beautiful house close to the Invalides, you will find the incredible sculptures of Auguste Rodin and Camille Claudel. They fill the house and the surrounding gardens. You can see how they were done in one exhibit. Surprisingly there are paintings by Van Gogh and other equally important painters on the walls. The house is in poor repair, however, and is about to be closed for a complete (4 month) renovation. If they follow the example of the Musee d'Orsey, the scuptures will probably travel around the world during that time. Don't miss them.

Fun to see, not a must-see. This museum was interesting. We only paid for the gardens, maybe that was mistake number 1. I don't know. The original thinker statue is located here as well as Rodin's Hell's Gates which is impressive. The building in which it is located is nice. The gardens were only 1 euro to walk around in so it's not that bad and it was a quick trip. It is located very near Invalides or the Museum of the Army. Very nice place, if you are in Paris and Rodin interests you maybe its a must see. If you are in Paris and want to see the original thinker it only costs 1 euro and you can be in and out in about 15 minutes if that is what you choose to do.

Worthwhile.... The Rodin musuem is of a manageable scale and nowhere near as busy as the Louvre or other more popular attractions. The famous "Thinker" is the highlight, but there are some other interesting works as well. Did not care much for the other artists exhibits that were on show when we visited. As is usually the case, the audio-guide is highly recommended.

Great Indoor/ outdoor gardens to see Rodin's sculptures. Musee Rodin has a perfect setting to display his sculptures. I particularly liked the outdoor area. Seeing the "Gates of Hell" outdoors in incredible! One of my favorite Paris Museums!
Too fine to miss. User friendly museum and a great sculpture green combine for a look at a world class collection of a master.Do save time to enjoy the garden. It is special.

My favorite museum. However, the word seems to have gotten out so the queue was quite long. A Museum Pass in indispensable because it allows you to go to the head of the line. The house, grounds and artwork especially are just beautiful.

A Must See for any Paris trip. The Rodin sculpture garden is a must see. I visited in March 2004 for my birthday (chilly weather) with my then boyfriend (now husband). I was not an active reviewer but am now adding some of my past trips.

So glad I went. I have been to Paris many times and never took the time to stop here -- glad I corrected that mistake. The personal works of Rodin, coupled with his personal collection from other renouned artist of his time, plus seeing the home and gardens was very special. Buy your lunch here and sit in the garden. Enjoy
very nice garden. There is a restaurant available. You could pay for visiting the garden only or the museum.
Beautiful gardens and sculptures. The sculptures and gardens are a must see to anyone who visits Paris and if you luck out, do this on a day when the weather is good to explore the entire gardens.

Good things come in small packages. This museum is small and doesn't take long too see. A wonderful collection. We visited it in winter and can only imagine that the sculptures in the gardens are more aesthetic in spring.
See these in California. Museum is in a decrepit condition. The sculptures are widely reproduced. A good value, but not the most important museum in a city full of them.
Nice little museum. Good collection, and even some nice paintings, even by Van Gogh.

Beautiful and cozy.. It's a small house, copy of a big house which is located outside Paris. Museum is very interesting and lovely, peaceful, no noise from outside. Best time to visit is spring-summer, they have enough place in the garden to just join good weather and chill.
Everything must to know Rodin. If you like art never leave to go Musee Rodin with your best works in marbre the represents all capacity of the human been gender.

better when in bloom. Having been to the Rodin in May and September our visit in November was a bit underwhelming. If it is your first visit to paris the Rodin is a must but you understand what i saying.
great exhibit. exhibit and permanent collections...excellent and enlightening

Fantastic place for lunch on a nice day. This is one of the best bargains in Paris. Unless you are really a serious lover of Rodin, you can skip the museum and pay just one euro to tour the garden--absolutely beautiful, plenty of benches to sit and view. Many of his most famous works are in the garden and the setting is perfect. There is also a cafe that serves great soups, salads, and sandwiches.
The best Musee garden and work art. The works are outstanding and located in one of the most beautiful gardens you have seen. The work location is highlighting its energy and flow.

Put this at the top of the list.. Whether you are in to Art, sculpture or history, this will satisfy your pallet. The grounds are amazing and the sculptures are incredible. I made multiple trips and never got bored.
Fabulous. The Musee Rodin in a must visit in Paris with its lovely gardens and sculptures. Make sure you get a Museum Pass if visiting museums - good value and entry into museums.

Go if you know you like Rodin. Sculptures. Excellent sculptures. The grounds are nice, but the art is what makes it worthwhile. They don't have a huge number of works, but since it's the output of one man that's not surprising. It's not cheap if you don't have a pass, so I would only recommend this gallery/museum if you already know you like Rodin's works.
My favorite Paris museum.. Rodin was a brilliant sculptor who had a huge impact on the art world in his day. Many of his pieces are not for the inhibited.
Wonderful Museum. Loved the outdoor and indoor collection, don't go too in the late afternoon because the garden closes before the main museum.
Beautiful setting.. I was studying Rodin in art history, and loved seeing his beautiful sculptors up close, the house and gardens are very serene with a lot of information provided.
Love the garden. The garden is my favorite part. It's romantic and inspiring. The whole museum is really inspiring. To think what one man can do!
Manageable. I love this museum because it is easily toured on a day stop. Nice gardens as well.

THE sculpturer. Rodin is one of the most important sculpturers of France. The museum resides in a mansion where he lived for many years, and display most of his important works, part of them in the magnificent gardens.
Beautiful. Great gardens and the thinker in the middle makes for it to be very romantic and peaceful. Worth a stop.
Beautiful. A truly great museum. The gardens are even better than the inside. Make sure to visit on a sunny day ideally.

Indoors and outdoors combination for a lovely afternoon. Thsi is a really manageable museum. The combination of the garden and the house give it a relaxing atmosphere. The audio guide is really useful adn worth the €4. The weather was not good teh day we visited but the garden setting really enhanced the experience. While ther were people around it was not overcrowded and access was easy. Rodin's oconic sculptures are recognisable and the garden must be wonderful on a sunny Spring day. thid museum prvides an unusually peaceful atmosphere to enjoy the wonerful art.Well worth a visit for respite and reflection There was no fee on the day we visited.
Lovely. Lovely museum surrounded by peaceful garden. Hidden gem in the Saint-Germain district.

Worth seeing.. I liked the outside garden (which is free) a lot more than the inside, so if money is tight, just stroll the gardens. They are worth the stop by themselves.
The Thinker is outside and is the highlight
I am Thinking. A most peaceful oasis behind the wall,the works are entrancing,the cafe provides a quiet place to take a break from the splendor of Napoleon's Tomb.

So much more than 'The Thinker' - not to be missed. Plan on spending more time here than you think you will. The sculpture gardens don't disappoint, with The Gates of Hell and The Thinker, among others.It's the inside of the museum that surprises, with a treasure trove of bronze and marble pieces, including various incarnations of The Kiss. What I found most fascinating, though, were the displays that show the multi-step process of creating a bronze sculpture, from crude clay model to the final cast.There are also works by Monet, Renoir, Van Gogh, and Camille Claudel.This is not a museum to rush through. Take your time. Be amazed. Wonder at the profusion of works that would be considered shocking by today's standards.

My very favorite Paris museum. Although the Musee Rodin is small in size compared to The Louvre, it was my favorite museum. The garden area where "The Thinker" is displayed is beautiful. Take time to explore the rest of the gardens, too. Gorgeous! I have visited this museum twice, and I'll go back again if I ever return to Paris. Rodin's work is impressive.

More than sculpture. A lovely stroll among the Rodin sculptures set in the formal garden amongst topiary trees made me think of how we are all part of nature. Without the setting of the garden the sculptures would have had less of an impact. It would have been just like the sculptures in the Louvre or in the Bargello. I believe that the spatial design of the gardens with Rodin's sculptures is the tour de force of this musuem. In addition to the sculptures, Rodin was extremely prolific with his drawings, which were on exhibit when we visited, and I found them to be completely enlighting of the man behind the sculptor.

Best space in Paris. It is a wonderful museum with a vast collection of Rodin's works and, also, where he lived. I can not say enough about the gardens. I always go and sit there despite the season. It is my Parisian essential every time I'm there despite my length of stay.

Fabulous statues. Rodin is a genius. His statues show real emotions. Visiting the garden is really worth doing while in Paris. And it is not overly expensive either. I think the gardens and the house are giving a fair representation of his works and Art. Only disappointment were the badly maintained toilets.
again. I have been before & will go again if possible. Their booklet has his work in chronilogical order. Very iluminating, my artist friend was facinated
One of the best spots in Paris. An amazing museum built around an exquisite garden. Must see. Great for kids. Excellent cafe.
Closed!. The museum was supposed to be open but they closed it for a fashion show and we had purchased tickets over the internet in advance!

Well woth the visit especially in the summertime.. The gardens are beautiful. The building itself is amazing in it history and construction. Don't pass it up if you have the time. There is also a garden cafe which was quite nice.
Great place for lunch. Pick up a bagette and a Perrrier and sit in this beautiful museum garden for lunch. Just lovely.

Second tier but worth a short visit. In the grand scheme of things, the Rodin is a nice museum. We have had eight days to see the sights and we dropped into the Musee Rodin on a rainy afternoon. It is a good display of the works of this famous sculptor. Unless you are really interested in the artist or sculpting, it is only worth a short visit on a longer stay in Paris. If you are only here for 3 or 4 days, I would skip it unless you are looking for something to do after visiting the Army Museum/Napoleon's Tomb. The grounds looked like a nice place to visit but we were here on a rainy day.I did brave the rain to see 'The Thinker." It's raised quite a bit and makes it difficult to see well especially in the rain. I can say I saw it although Dobie Gillis was nowhere around.

Fantastic Gardens!. Though my husband and I didn't have time to visit the museum, we paid the 1 euro each to tour the gardens, It was the best two euros we spent! The gardens are beautiful and full of artwork itself. The "Thinker" as well as "Hell's Gate" can be found outside. You can easily spend a good hour walking around enjoying the views and art. I would strongly suggest a visit!
Great collection. Being a great fan of Rodin's work, this museum has everything.
Interesting..... A well set up museum, with great examples of Rodin's work (obviously). Some lovely sculptures etc, set in a nice building and grounds. I was a bit over it though by the end.

Undergoing renovations in the gardens. I have fond memories of this museum but this time the gardens were undergoing major renovations. If you like sculpture and Rodin's work then this museum is a "must see" - "The Thinker", "The Gates of Hell", "The Kiss" and many more stunning works.
I'm Thinking. Excellent small museum with excellent sculptures, including The Thinker
Exquisite. You'll want to feast on Rodin's brilliance and Luxembourg Gardens during the best weather of your trip, and so plan everything else around that.
Magincal gardens. A little out of the way, but beautiful gardens. Loved Rodin's sculptures.The gardens are far superior to the little museum.

Great for sculpture lovers. I didn't know much about Rodin beyond the thinker, so I picked up the audioguide here. I learned a lot and i think it made my visit more enjoyable. The grounds outside were lovely, and the inside was jam packed with sculptures. This was probably my second favorite museum only to the Orangerie. It's also very near Napoleon's Tomb if you're going there. If you have the Museum Pass it is certainly worth a visit. Because it was sculpture it was also a nice change from some of the other art museums we visited (louvre, orsay, etc)

A collection of masterpieces. Rodin's sculptures are world-class and are well displayed in a half-chateau, half-studio environment. The building and surrounding gardens are worth a visit in themselves, although the building has suffered from the number of visitors and is due to be restored shortly (the floors are uneven because of temporary repairs)

An intimate "user friendly" museum. Set in Rodin's home, all of his most famous works were displayed so you could practically breathe on them - no velvet ropes or reprimands. Not only was his private mansion in wonderful condition, the gardens surrounding the house were full of his major sculptures. You really got a sense of the man.

Just Lovely. The gardens of this museum are one of my very favorite places in Paris. I visited this year the first week of November on a blustery day with magnificent storm clouds blowing across the sky. The drama of the sky was a perfect backdrop to the powerful Rodin sculptures and the beautiful garden. Just lovely! I highly recommend this museum. And for only 1 euro! (For the garden only.)

Lovely respite from the crowds!. Well, if you go in November, this will be true. I went early in the day and the only thing I had to avoid were the groups of school children. Otherwise, I felt like I had so much space to enjoy the beautiful sculpture and gardens. I had visited before - but many years ago, so this was a planned "must do" for my week in Paris. I was not disappointed.

A lovely garden, an interesting museum and a beautiful home. This stately home, set in lovely grounds is the perfect showcase for Rodin's work. Both the gardens and house have many works of art and sculptures, and it is a pleasure to stroll around both to view this brilliant man's creations. Everyone knows his famous works (The Thinker & The Lovers) but wait until you see the rest! Well worth a few hours on your Paris itinerary.
Best museum in Paris. This is my favorite museum in Paris. The statues and sculptures are perfect placed both inside and outside. The light hits the sculptures and makes them come alive.

Great Museum. I liked that this museum was partially outside, and also inside as well. It had a great gift shop as well with very reasonably priced items. I bought a very unique necklace and watch there.
